doc.title: Excellent food, service, view
doc.review: My husband and I enjoy trying different fine dining establishments for our date nights. The steak here was phenomenal, as was the asparagus and the potatoes. Definitely one of the best steaks we have had. Of course the restaurant is a little pricey, but worth every penny. The atmosphere was great, we were able to get in without a reservation with only about 15 minutes of waiting at the bar. We loved the view - I would recommend making a reservation to ensure you can have a table by the window. The service was also extremely good, once again some of the best service we have had. We will definitely come here again!

doc.title: Great restaurant and lovely meal
doc.review: We had a great meal here, we ordered the tasting menu and every course was lovely, great flavours and nice sized portions so you weren't over faced and could enjoy them all. Lots of wine choices too.

doc.title: Great view but average food
doc.review: The view was amazing but the food was average at best. 5 star view, 2 star meal. The steak was over cooked and tough. The asparagus was chewy and the bill was over $200 with just one glass of wine for two.

doc.title: Magnifique!
doc.review: My wife and I dined here as part of our honeymoon trip and weren't disappointed. As a lover of French cuisine I was curious as to how this would compare and I was delighted. The service from start to finish was exemplary and the food was sublime. My wife has the individual Beef Wellington and was blown away by it. My frogs legs and filet mignon were delicious too. My wife loved the fact that the waiters look like door bouncers and ours was highly attentive and knowledgable of both the menu and wine list. It's a busy place and I can see why. As an avid "fine-diner" I was thoroughly impressed and will recommend this restaurant to all. Parfait!

doc.title: One of the best event venues all around (in Vegas)
doc.review: I held a corporate event here this week - cocktail reception with drinks and hors d'oeuvres. I have worked with many venues around the country - including others in Vegas - and I can say this was one of the best I've worked with all around. They pleasantly surpassed all expectations. The Left Bank Room had a great view of the Strip and Bellagio fountains below and fit approximately 100 guests comfortably., The management and staff was more than professional/helpful, they did not nickel and dime us as other Vegas venues do, and the food was delicious - great compliments from all attendees on the hors d'oeuvres and service. I give it a triple thumbs up!

doc.title: Eh...I have had better
doc.review: While it was nice to look over the Bellagio fountains and the atmosphere is fun and swanky, the food is nothing to get too excited about. Don't get me wrong, it is good, just not fantastic. For the cost of food there I was hoping for a more memorable meal. I'm am glad I went once, but next trip to Vegas I will not return here.

doc.title: Un-american subtility in tastes
doc.review: Wonderfull restaurant with a great view on the Strip, including the foutains at the Bellagio, especially at night. The food has an unamerican quality. The tastes are subtile and delicate, unlike most restaurants in the US where dishes have a certain blandness. The Soprano's-like waiters provide a contrast with the overall high quality of the restaurant. They should definitely learn to blend in with the surroundings like their Euorpean collegues in top class restaurants like these do.

doc.title: Excellent view and restaurant
doc.review: Very nice restaurant. The food is well presented and delicately cooked. The staff were polite and not in your face. The portions are also normal and not crazy size!!!!! Drinks were very well presented and my wife tried one of the wines befor ordering and they had no problem with that. I had a GandT it came with the tonic already in it and I thought it may have been too weak, but not at all. About the only thing I can say is wrong is the service stations too close to some of the window tables and you could have a lot of noise going on behind you. We were offered one of these tables and when we asked to move it was no problem at allI know some people say things are no problem for the staff but this really is true. There were no rolling of eyes or thinning of lips :-)Well worth a visit

doc.title: Magical!
doc.review: My husband I and got married in Vegas and had our wedding dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. I had made the reservation about two months beforehand and requested a table with a view. They advised that the only way to secure a table with a view was to make a reservation for 5:45 p.m. We didn't want to eat that early, so I made the reservation for 6:45 p.m. I explained that it was going to be our wedding night dinner and that we really wanted a table with a view. They said that they would do what they could but it wasn't guaranteed. The night of our wedding we headed over to the restaurant. We went in our wedding attire and couldn't be happier with the service! They got us in right away and were even able to accommodate our request for a table with a view. We had a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains from our table. In addition to our amazing meal the Chef even sent us a few different samples of food to try. It was a great place for a special occasion dinner! We loved every minute of it!

doc.title: Wonderful!
doc.review: We went up to the Eiffel Tower for our special night out during our short stay in Las Vegas. We wonderfully surprised! We had the Beef Wellington which is a dish on select restaurants serve, as well as the chocolate souffle - both of which came out perfect.Make sure you request a table overlooking the Bellagio fountain show!

doc.title: Fabulous Service, Food, and View
doc.review: My sister and I dined at The Eiffel Tower Restaurant for her birthday, a few days before Easter. We asked for a seat by the windows facing the Bellagio (so we could watch the fountains), and we were told that the 5:00 and 5:15 seatings are guaranteed a window seat. We were given a table with a lovely view. Our waiter, Gary, went out of his way to make us feel welcome; in fact, the whole staff "spoiled" us! I ordered the salmon, and my sister ordered a filet. We asked if we could share our entrees, and Gary personally halved our orders and arranged them on our plates. We both had souffle for dessert - pistachio for me (scrumptious!) and chocolate for my sister. Yes, the dinner was expensive, but we enjoyed ourselves immensely. Isn't that what treating ourselves is all about?

doc.title: Great View Of The Fountains At The Bellagio!
doc.review: The food is very good, not great, but the view of the fountains is incredible.Ask for a window seat.

doc.title: Do the pairings
doc.review: The location is great. Wait staff is very nice. All the food we had was great but the last time we did the pairing menu which is really what this place is about. Very memorable.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Hotel.
doc.review: This is a must for us when we visit Vegas...we ask for a corner table with the view of Bellagio fountains. Always super food and service! We always have to get 2 souffle's for dessert, as we can't decide on just one flavor!

doc.title: Excellent service and excellent view
doc.review: I did not remember the last time I had a cocktail for lunch. But the enthusiasm of the waitress describing how the cocktail is made changed my mind. I ordered one for $18 and it was excellent. She was equally enthusiastic and pleasant in recommending other dishes. My wife and I ordered Foie Gras pate ($19) and I have lobster with caviar ($26) and she ordered just an onion soup. the pate was the best I had. The lobster and caviar were also very good even though I dont like caviar that much.We had a window seat with an excellent view of the Bellagio fountain. I would definitely try their dinner next time with a view of the fountain show.All in all, a great lunch and a great value.

doc.title: Highly recommended
doc.review: My husband and I had booked a table in advance - and noted, that we would appreciate a table with "strip view" - and that's exactly what we got! Overlooking the Bellagio and the fountains added an element to a great dinner experience. We ordered the tasting menu with wine pairing - and the menu was very tasteful. I am allergic to Shell fish and had forgotten to inform of this in advance - but no problem at all. They just served an alternative course to me instead of the course containing crab. Being a tasting menu, we did not expect large portions - but this is US, so the courses were what you would categorize as "normal size" in Europe. And both my husband or I had to "surrender" and not finish all courses - even though they tasted great! Nice atmosphere and great service. We would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant!

doc.title: I love Paris in the Spring time even its in Vegas
doc.review: I love the Eiffel tower restaurant it is a good replicas of of the original in France. I love french food and their's was not disappointing . To not to say enough about the gone with the wind fabulous view.

doc.title: Must Visit in Vegas
doc.review: I ended up here for lunch after being told that the wait time for a seat on the patio at Mon Ami Gabi was going to be around 30-40 minutes. I was glad I ended up at Eiffel Tower Restaurant.Pricing for lunch is quite competitive and much cheaper than dinner. Views were great and was able to watch the fountains at Bellagio with an unobstructed view. Food was spiced and cooked perfectly. Of particular note was the coffee, and while a little pricey, was some of the best coffee I had ever had.If you are in Vegas, you need to try the restaurant here at least once. You won't be disappointed.

doc.title: Simply the Best in Town
doc.review: My wife and I travel to Vegas 3-4 times a year and never miss Chef Joho's tasting menu and wine pairings. Always creative and fabulous; lamb chop Friday was the best we've ever had anywhere. The management, service staff and kitchen are a wonderful, efficient team and always excel. It's pricey, but never fails to please. Don't miss this exceptional spot. Spring for the photo, it is always a wonderful memento.

doc.title: Don't miss this restaurant
doc.review: My wife and I, on the spare of the moment, decided to have brunch here. It was Easter Sunday and my wife's birthday. It was one of the best choices we made in Vegas. The service was beyond excellent. The attention to our table was extraordinary considering that the room was filled. Our table overlooked the Bellagio Fountain. So we were able to watch the show during our meal. Go and enjoy.

doc.title: Top class!
doc.review: Me and my son 14 year old and a real steak lover went to the Eiffel tower restaurant for dinner. My son has eaten a lot of steaks in fancy restaurants in his life but this was a new steak experience that bet everything. He had the aged new york steak and I had the lamb rack. Service was perfect and from our window table we could watch the Bellagio fountain show! It was amazing!

doc.title: Outstanding!
doc.review: Easily the best dining experience we had in four days in Las Vegas. We were seated promptly, we had a nice table on the second tier but with a good view of the Bellagio. Patrons should not fret about obtaining a table next to the windows, as I think the view of the fountains is going to be reasonably good from most tables. Pleasant atmosphere, not quiet, but neither is it noisy. One can easily converse at normal voice levels. Good wine list, well-prepared cocktails. This place gets a gold star for having two, not just one, foie gras appetizers on the menu. Excellent! Salads and main courses were all delightful. Our dessert souffles were good, although perhaps a half-step below what one can obtain in France. Service was pleasant and professional, appropriate to the atmosphere. Fortunately, it appeared everyone was dressed appropriately, according to the dress code, which is essentially business casual. Highly recommended - not inexpensive, however.

doc.title: VERY, VERY Disappointed!
doc.review: What was supposed to be a beautiful celebration of my husband's birthday, became a very sad and disappointing evening. Had a nice table by the window, but COLD air blew from the a/c system along the window. Waiters comment was YES, IT BLOWS UP THE WINDOW ON AN OFF. I had brought along a blazer, was shivering, so were gals and tables on either side of us. One commented that maybe the staff were comfortable, but the restaurant should be more concerned about the comfort of the guests. My husband reached for his drink and poked his hand on a knife (they are positioned on their side with point up?), bled on his shirt, tablecloth, no assistance in sight, finally went to the restroom to clean up what he could. My husband's appetizer was wrong, waiter noticed (someone else delivered it), long wait for replacement, I was done with mine by then. My husband asked to order wine with dinner, waiter did not come by. I ordered venison, came extremely rare, returned, long wait, still so rare I was nauseated, Long wait, host came by and offered to make another meal, by then my husband was finished with his dinner. No acknowledgement of my husband's birthday. Check was $169, without my dinner...left hungry, cold, frustrated and sad that our special evening had been so miserable. Waiter seemed unconcerned and almost irritated.

doc.title: Go for the view
doc.review: This is a great place for a romantic dinner. Food was good but very "fancy". I really dont care for this but cannot say anything bad. Ask for a seat by the window as thw view is the best part of the experience.

doc.title: Excellent food but poor, unapologetic service!!
doc.review: 1. Reservation was lost although we were seated fairly promptly in spite of them not being prepared for a table of 4. 2. 10mins passed before being greeted with "you don't have a server, so I will take care of you..." by what we assumed was a floor manager, service did NOT improve. 3. 4 top, 3 course dinner lasted 2.5 hours and we did NOT ask for slow pace. We actually had to CANCEL our plans for a late show. 4. At no point was our opinion of "the experience" solicited. Just "Thanks for joining us, etc..." not once were we asked how things were.. Rather than embarrass our guests we chose to suffer the poor experience and leave (paying a full tab of course-we don't want free stuff, just good value and service for the expensive meal) 5. Positives: food quality, view, secondary service staff (Guillermo), menu/wine list. As food service professionals, we understand that issues occur. However, at this level it's reasonable to expect management to be more aware (2.5hours!?) and at least acknowledge mistakes or challenges. ** The food deserved good service but the service demanded an apology.

doc.title: Room with a view
doc.review: Food excellent, staff very knowledgable and try and get a table with a view of the fountains to make the overall experience exceptional. Not cheap but hey, this is Vegas and quality costs.

doc.title: Best place for a drink on The Strip
doc.review: We wanted a nice glass of wine after an afternoon of wandering around and happened upon this restaurant. Although we weren't dressed up, we were happily greeted and encouraged to enjoy the bar. There is one row of tall seats that face The Strip and that is where our group of 6 parked itself for an hour or two. We watched the street gelow, the water show at the Bellagio across the street, and the staff set up for dinner. The service was excellent -- funny, friendly, and attentive without being intrusive. The wine by the glass selection was a little thin -- we expected more French options -- but the pours were generous and we enjoyed what we ordered. If you want a wonderful respite from the crowds and noise and drinks in plastic containers the height of toddlers, the bar at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a perfect escape!

doc.title: Not worth it :(
doc.review: We went here as a post wedding treat from my friend to my daughter, so they could have a wedding cake. The cake was absolutely beautiful, and tasted wonderful, however, it was really HOT inside the restaurant-does Vegas not use air-conditioning before April? The groom, all decked out in his tux, just wanted to cut and eat the cake, and get the heck out of there!!! The least expensive drink was $18.00. It was very crowded and LOUD, NOT a wonderful experience. Way over priced for what they offer. Our wait person had an attitude and one of the managers w/his ear piece and all, had a fine time looking over his glasses and down his nose at us. Couldn't wait to leave. I will NEVER visit again. :(

doc.title: Must Go while in Vegas!!
doc.review: The best place to eat and view of the strip while in Vegas! Go for lunch to save a little $$ but definitely worth every penny. Don't miss it!!

doc.title: lovely lunch at the Eiffel Tower
doc.review: My husband and I had lunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant earlier this month. We did not have reservations for a Saturday lunch but were lucky enough to get the last table at the window which overlooked the strip and the Bellagio Fountains. It was a treat to watch the fountains while we ate. We had a tasty "little gift" from the chef of a mousseline which was very good. I ordered the aged parmesan crusted chicken which was pounded thin and very crispy- very good. my husband ordered the lamb burger and he thought it was delicious. The staff was friendly without being intrusive and the atmosphere was fun. There was a newly married couple and a small bridal party having a celebration which was fun to watch. We were pleasantly surprised by our lunch and would probably eat there again- maybe for dinner next time so we could enjoy a nighttime setting.

doc.title: excellent food
doc.review: it is a great restaurant, high class, high service and high prices but it worth it. The food was excellent, the suggestion for the wine was a good one. It is a event that I will remember.

doc.title: view,view,view
doc.review: it is breath takeing,who cares about the good food when it a great place to say you've been to Las Vegas

doc.title: Highlight of trip
doc.review: When my wife and I visited Las Vegas, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant has to rank at the top of the highlight list. We visited late afternoon, before it got busy. No reservation. From the moment we arrived we were treated like visiting Royalty. Our waitress was attentive and very helpful, but not hovering, if you know what I mean. In a word, the service we received was impeccable. For starters, we had the Main Lobster Salad (see pic). We told the waitress that it was too beautiful to eat, but we did and it was delicious. My main course was the Char Broiled Filet Mignon, Lemon Parsley Butter. It was perfection. My wife had the Slow Roasted Filet of Pacific Salmon, Pinot Noir Sauce. She was equally pleased. We both washed the meal down with one of their delicious cocktails. For desert, we both had their Creme Brulee. Again, it was perfect. And I had to tell the waitress that we loved their American-sized portions. This was not our first French restaurant, and the others would serve you this tiny portion surrounded by plate, but we were quite full and satisfied when our meal was finished at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. I recommend it heartily. You will not be disappointed. We plan to dine their a few more times on our next Vegas visit.

doc.title: It was ok
doc.review: Went here our first night in vegas. Got a table by the window, the view was amazing. We got the tasting menu which was a ton of food. Some dishes were great, others just ok. It wasn't quite as nice as I had hoped. Yes, there is a dress code, and all men must wear a collared shirt. So my boyfriend in his cashmere sweater had to wear his coat the entire meal, which wasn't horrible, but just wish we'd known earlier. There were plenty of men less nicely dressed than he was but with collars, so whatever.If you're a foodie, I'd try somewhere else, however, the view can't be beat and I don't regret going.

doc.title: Fantastic
doc.review: 6 of us visited for my parents 40th Anniversary. Simply fantastic. Lyle arranged everything to perfection. The food was perfect (The Surf and Turf is a must), with an extensive Wine list. The staff were very attentive and the service was simply first class. We all agreed that this was easily one of the best meals we had ever eaten, combined with the amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. A MUST for anyone going to Vegas. Just a shame that is has taken us 8 vists to finally visit.

doc.title: Rushed
doc.review: Four of us had dinner on 12/3/13 for our wedding meal. We hadn't booked but we immediately shown to our table at 9.15. We wasn't told they close at 10.15 and was rushed through the whole meal. We had tried a few other restaurants before arriving here who had told us they were closing soon so when they never mentioning closing soon we assumed. The courses came on top of each other and we was presented with our bill at 10.15 without asking for it. The scallop starters were under cooked. The lamb chops which I requested medium were still breathing because they were so under cooked. All in all very dissapointed. This is my unbiased opinion

doc.title: Delicious
doc.review: We ate lunch here. It was excellant. I had the Parmesan Crusted Chicken ~ so yummy :) and a Cosmo. My boyfriend had the lamb burger. He really enjoyed it. Great Food. Great Service. Great View. Great!!

doc.title: What a view!
doc.review: I loved this restaurant! BE AWARE...THERE IS A DRESS CODEThe food is great, the service is great, it is expensive but worth it. After dinner you can take an elevator to the observation deck, watch the light show at the Bellagio! It is nice to go out to an expensive meal and everyone in the restaurant is "dressed," a throwback to Paris! The wine list is suitable for everyone and the food...I cant say enough how great it is.

doc.title: Birthday treat
doc.review: We visited here for my birthday 14th March would deffinatley visit this place again food was great and the view was out standing especially if its only two people dinning as these are sittuated by the window great view of the belagio fountains, be prepared to spend a few dollars at this place but i must say it's well worth it try the beef wellington out of this world beef cooked to perfection. The only problem i had was when booking this restaurant they did ask if i were celebrating anything to which i said yes it's my birthday and i did see on here that they did a little celebrarion plate with a small desert nothing to major just acknowledging your particular celebration what ever it may be but this did not turn up or any of the staff wish you a happy bitrthday i know its busy but why ask when booking if its not noted on your reservation so apart from that the evening was fab.

doc.title: Fabulous food, fabulous view
doc.review: From the lift up the Eiffel Tower, then the warm welcome to the fantastic table ideally placed for the famous Bellagio fountains - the whole experience was amazing. So we are in Vegas, it's not Paris but it's trying to be - who cares just go with it !The staff were engaging, they knew the food and the wine and were only too happy to help. Great recommendations at every course. The food was really good - the wine on par. Taste and presentation both fantastic.Obviously a great spot for a romantic meal, but we were on a business trip with a mixed crowd and had a great time. Treat yourself to the creme brulee - but share, you have been warned

doc.title: The MOST ROMANTIC dinner ever!
doc.review: This will be one of your most expensive meals in Vegas....but GO! Save your money. Make a reservation ahead of time. Oh my what an excellent view of the city as well as menu. The mood and atmosphere was very romantic and cozy. Even though we were in a space with lots of other folks, we felt like we were the only ones there. The service was outstanding! W were catered to for every part of the meal! We will return!

doc.title: Go for brunch
doc.review: Enjoyed brunch here and would suggest it for someone who wants to visit this place without going for the full dinner experience. Food and service were excellent as expected. This was our first visit. The meal was not as expensive as I expected based on what I had read. Also found the dress code to be more than relaxed at brunch -- there were plenty of shorts and casual wear found among the diners. We went late -- 1 pm on a Sunday. Although we had a reservation there would have no problem getting a table. Nice view of the Bellagio fountains across the strip -- which run every 15 minutes during Sunday brunch. We were staying in a casino on the north end of the strip -- and the only inconvenience was finding the entrance to this place. We wandered in by way of the bridge from Bally's and the directional signage really needs help. Stop and ask to save yourself some walking.

doc.title: Couldn't resist going back - and glad we didn't
doc.review: Here several years ago for an anniversary, we swore we'd eat somewhere different but went back to the Tower (Paris, France was our honeymoon destination). You can get just about any wine you request. The food is exquisitely prepared, but you can go up just for drinks and still have the same night view of Vegas and the Bellagio fountains. Chef Joho's Eiffel Tower Restaurant Cookbook is a great Vegas souvenirs.

doc.title: A evening in Paris
doc.review: We had the good fortune to having dinner at the Eiffel tower Restaurant in Las vegas and it was just Excellent, we had Tom M as our waiter and he helped make the evening so memorable for us. We also had a seat that over looked the Bellagio fountains. The food and service were the best that we had at a restaurant in vegas, I would rate the whole experience a 5 star event. It is not inexpensive but diffidently worth the price, We had the 5 course meal which i might recommend,as this is what the chef has prepared for the evening and I don,t think one would go wrong with this. This is a dining experience, the way dining and service should be.

doc.title: Try it once
doc.review: I went with my husband for dinner. My husband had steak and I had the sea bass. The service was good. I didn't think the food was amazing. I still am glad we went though because I loved watching the fountains, and wanted the incredible ambiance and views. It is among the best dining views we've ever had. It was expensive too, but we knew it would be.

doc.title: OUTSTANDING, once again!
doc.review: Last October we dined at ETR and were disappointed after 5 or 6 previous visits to the restaurant that were simply superb. I wrote a TripAdvisor review titled "Overall A Disappointment"; unbeknownst to me a restaurant employee monitors these reviews and Mr. Lyle Tolhurst, Restaurant Supervisor, answered my review in a very concerned and considerate manner. So we again dined at ETR Sunday, March 17th. and enjoyed what probably was the very best ever experience in the restaurant. We were seated promptly at a prime window table with views toward Caesar's and Mirage in one direction, the outlandish monstrosity City Center in another, and directly across Bellagio and the beautiful fountains. My partner enjoyed the escargot and foie gras appetizer, Caesar salad and pheasant all of which he said were exceptional. I had the cold smoked salmon, Caesar salad and filet mignon; the salmon and filet just melted in my mouth and the salad was quite flavorful. Of course, I also ended the meal with the plate of wonderful chocolates and chocolate ice cream. Our table was delightfully and expertly attended by Carmen Darie, Restaurant Captain, who treated us with great friendliness and humor and added so much to our dining experience. You bet we will return again and again! Mahalo to all the ETR staff!

doc.title: Great view, Excellent meal
doc.review: My wife and I made a reservation on a whim and were pleasently supprised by the quality of the meal. The meal had traditional French textures and clean flavors. The nontraditional Ceaser salad and the sufflet were stars of the meal with the main course following right behind. Now for a bit of a warning, the price is steep, so get ready to drop some coin on a dinner for 2.

doc.title: Best View in Town
doc.review: Frankly it's all about the ambience. It may very well be the most romantic view of Vegas, but it's gonna cost you. Surprisingly it's not too bad considering, I'd say get ready to shell out about $70pp that's one drink and one a la carte. The service is impeccable, great wait staff but the photo opp isn't worth it. For $24 they offer to take your pic but its poor quality and crappy background. I prefer it when they photoshop the fake backgrounds. Nonetheless you only live once, i say do it!

doc.title: You must eat here...
doc.review: This restaurant i guess is often forgotten because is inside the fake Eiffel tower and that's seems a bit tacky... but the experience it is not like that at all, you will be greeted at the door and escorted on the elevator, try to get a table by the window, the food is bistro like, the prices not too bad for Vegas but you MUST try the house cocktail a berry infused vodka mixed with champagne. Fantastic! don't miss it, also don't miss the cheese bread and enjoy the great view of the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: great brunch
doc.review: great french toast that i have never had before and would love to have again. the service is outstanding, that of fine dining, with them there to meet your every need. A nice place to relax, enjoy the view, get away from the craziness of Las Vegas Blvd., and have a nice brundh.

doc.title: Good view, overpriced food.
doc.review: Pretty restaurant with great service, a nice wine selection, and a beautiful view of the strip (or the Bellagio fountains, depending on where you sit), but the food is overpriced. For the price of the steak I got (which was average), I could have gotten something amazing from Wolfgang Puck or Gordon Ramsay instead (I wish I had). We did get a nice dessert, compliments of the chef, because it was our birthdays, but I wouldn't eat here again simply because of the pricing.

doc.title: Amazing lamb chops!
doc.review: We arrived early evening for our stay at the Paris Hotel. Around 7:30, we began wandering around for a place to eat. Everything on the perimeter of the casino was packed, so we took a flyer as a walk-in at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. While we would only have had a 30 min wait for a table, we were lucky to find a couple of seats at the bar. The service was fast, but attentive. The food came out of the kitchen quickly. The frenched lamb chops my husband ordered were magnificent. Cooked to a med- rare perfection, coated with a wonderful rub and a delightful tomato confit/eggplant side. My mushroom soup and lobster/kale salad were both delicious. We were impressed with the consistency of the kitchen and we found the prices of food and wine to be fairly priced for a high end restaurant. Of course the view of the Bellagio fountains didn't hurt the atmosphere. We would return again and recommend to others.

doc.title: Amazing dining experience
doc.review: Fantastic - definitely one of the best in Vegas. Beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountain show, our server was great. I highly recommend the pre-fix menu, 5 courses, good variety and all were delicious. The food is pricey, but worth it in our opinion. This restaurant is perfect for an anniversary or bday. Great for couples.

doc.title: Fantastic experience
doc.review: Paris hotel on the strip is definitely not one of the more updated hotels. Don't get me wrong the outside of the hotel and a lot of the details very much take you back to actual Paris but there is just a little dated factor about the hotel and also that it is really small as compared to say Bellagio or Ceasars.Well this review is not for the hotel and more for the restaurant anyways but just wanted to paint a picture leading towards the restaurant. It is one of those cases where you really shouldn't judge a book by its cover. As soon as you take the elevator up to the restaurant and come around the corner to the hostess desk you are greeted with views of the entire strip. The whole restaurant has huge floor to ceiling windows showcasing all the lights and luckily none of the sounds of the strip which is magical and most of all you get the best view of the Bellagio fountains which is phenomenal in itself. The food here is exceptional and prices are not bad at all compared to what you could spend at other high end dinning establishments on the strip. The wine list is definitely the more expensive option with not so many cheaper options. So I would think of this place as a special occasion type of place more than just "this looks nice. lets's have dinner here!!" kinda place.It was a fantastic and opulent experience which one should definitely plan for while in vegas. Oh yes and please definitely get the Foie Gras.

doc.title: Better than the real Eiffel Tower restaurant
doc.review: All I can say is WOW! The food was divine, the service impressive, the views Incomparable. What's not to love about this place. We've had dinner in Paris at the real Eiffel Tower, which was really cool and food was also great, but not memorable. Last night's meal was definitely memorable. You gotta have the seafood appetizer! Includes fresh king crab, lobster, jumbo shrimp, and oysters. Enough for four people. And the desserts!! The best Creme Brûlée on the planet.

doc.title: Stunning food and View!
doc.review: My husband and I decided to dine here and took advantage of their guaranteeing a front row, Sunset view table for two if you reserved at 5:00 or 5:30 pm. (Since we were arriving from the East coast, the 3-hour time difference made it feel like 8 p.m.) We both got the prix fixe menu at $110/person, well worth it! From the lobster salad appetizer to the mushroom soup to the chocolate souffle', it all was exceptional. Service was perfect. You can't get that view of the sunsetand the Bellagio fountains anywhere else!

doc.title: Romantic
doc.review: We did the Chef's tasting menu and two bottles of wine so it was a very pricey dinner. Dinner lasted about 2.5 hours and was absolutely wonderful. We had a view of the fountains and watched the sunset from our table so we had an awesome view of the strip as well. Our food was delicious and each course offered something different. The service was wonderful and cordial. One of the top ten meals I've had in my life and for the price....well, it was our big treat in Vegas. Lovely.

doc.title: Excellent In Every Way
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant - I had written in advance and told them if was a special occasion for us and if we could get a good view of the Bellagio Fountains. That they did. It was stunning. You ride up an elevator that lets you out in the kitchen, and you are lead to the dining area. We had reservations - one group did not and they were disappointed they missed the view.We had an appetizer of scallops - and they were delicious, the sauce was delightful. For dinner I had the filet minion and my husband had the surf and turf. He continued to say how wonderful the cut of meat was. Mine was also tender and good.We had a small chocolate mousse to share after dinner.I cannot say enough good about the Eiffel Tower. It was expensive, but it was worth it.Enjoy!!!

doc.title: Decadent
doc.review: I enjoyed dinner with my business associates that were part of the same trip. We had a private dining room in the Tower overlooking the strip. The meal was wonderful, from the shrimp cocktail appetizers to the bread to the salad to the entrée to the desert. The service was attentive with my water glass and wine glass always full and just a short wait between each course.I have nothing but good things to say about my wonderful meal at this splendid restaurant.

doc.title: Window View Dining overlooking the Bellagio Water Show
doc.review: This is one of our favorite spots on the strip. This spot is a must for either lunch or dinner; request a table by the window overlooking the Bellagio water show and enjoy. A perfect spot for a romantic evening dining experience as well as family and friends The waitstaff is well trained and attentive and the food is well prepared and for he lack of a better word; "YUMMY". Bon Appetit

doc.title: Special treat for my 50th
doc.review: Wow! The money we paid for 5 adults was expensive; however well worth it! The food, service and ambience were awesome. I have visited Paris France a few times. The Paris hotel in Las Vegas does a fine job creating a French cuisine experience.

doc.title: Excellent food with great view
doc.review: It is best to reserve a table. We had a view of the bellagio fountains which was lovely. Our waiter warmed up during the course of the evening. The food was well prepared and beautifully presented. Very expensive but we knew that; the drinks, too. The dinner menu was a la carte but I found that the portion size of my entree was more than enough - although I have to add that I probably eat less than the average person. It's definitely nice to indulge at a fancy restaurant once in a while if your budget allows. Expect to pay through the teeth, but also expect a great meal and experience. The Eiffel is worth a visit.

doc.title: Excellent food and service!!
doc.review: My husband and I ate at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant to celebrate our 25th anniversary. My husband had the surf and turf, and I had the filet mignon.The food was top notch and the table overlooking the Bellagio fountains at night was a nice added touch. We were treated to a chocolate souffle in honor of our anniversary, complete with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate around the plate. A nice added touch by the restaurant to help create a memorable experience for us. The wait staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about their food and wine offerings, and also very prompt with serving the food and keeping our water glasses filled. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

doc.title: ooh la la
doc.review: went here for drinks...the view is magnifique...the service is wonderful...we felt like visiting royalty...can't wait to go back

doc.title: Beautiful setting and fantastic service
doc.review: In town for the NASCAR weekend, we stayed at the Planet Hollywood Towers and had a wonderful dinner and experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris. The view from our table was magical. With the Bellagio fountains and the lights of the Vegas Strip as a continuous backdrop we enjoyed excellent personal service and fantastic food. This restaurant is well worth making a reservation for. A nice pass through of the kitchen upon exit from the elevator gives you a glimpse of how precision culinary coordination and artistic presentation combine. Don’t be in a hurry as you will want to enjoy and absorb every second of the total experience.

doc.title: Wow, what a view!
doc.review: First of all this is a wonderful restauran. It's is quite overpriced, but you have to go at least once. The service is efficent top notch. The wine list is wonderful is overpriced. The drinks are very expensive, but just this once you need to have one. Don't order on the rocks, they charge for the rocks. The food iw wonderful!

doc.title: Don't forget about lunch
doc.review: This has a wonderful view and offers a lunch menu that is affordable and delicious. For half the price of dinner, this is a bargain for Las Vegas strip dining. Request a table by the window and enjoy the sites of the Bellagio Fountain. Service is great

doc.title: Epic Lunch on Black Friday
doc.review: Let's be honest, the Eiffel Tower restaurant is expensive. And we're not completely baller, so we need to make our money stretch. So, LUNCH at the Eiffel was totally the ticket for us. We were careful to reserve on Friday, because brunch there is a whole other pricerange. We were there over Thanksgiving, so Friday was our only window. We reserved a table for right when they opened. We of course got a fantastic window seat and were REALLY surprised and pleased that they did 4 Bellagio fountain shows early because it was a holiday weekend. The food on the lunch menu has 'normal' dinner prices, but it was fantastic. We each had a middle priced entree, a non-alcoholic "fancy" drink, and shared an amazing dessert and where out of there for $75 total. Pretty damn good for such an upscale experience. I was surprised that the dumb kid next to us showed up in flip flops and shorts. Does anyone have pride in appearance anymore? But overall it was a fantastic experience and value and we'll do it again in a heartbeat.

doc.title: Wonderful!!!
doc.review: We went tho the Eiffel Tower Restaurant after we renewed our wedding vows. It was a Thursday night and we had made reservations. We got there about 1 hour early and they were still able to seat us in the very crowded restaurant by the window with a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains. It was beautiful and very romantic. We ordered the Filet Mignon with Lemon Butter and the other with a wine sauce as well as 2 sides of gratin potatoes (which we could have split just one order), and water to drink. The bill was $160. They give you a small, actually tiny, appetizer and a choice of bread. Because it was our anniversary we were given a small parfait to share, on the house. It was a wonderful experience. We have never paid that much for a meal before, but the food and experience were worth every penny. The staff were also very attentive and made our night special.

doc.title: Loved it.
doc.review: We came to Eiffel Tower Restaurant for brunch. Requested a table by the windows... not a problem as almost all were empty at 11 a.m. The view was lovely and it was nice to watch the Fountains at Bellagio (though not as good without the music). Service was outstanding ... attentive, but not overly so as other reviewers have mentioned. We were served Sunchoke Mousseline and Cheese Puffs. I ordered the Half Avocado appetizer, Eggs Benedict and Creme Brulee. My husband ordered the Creamy French Onion Soup, Eiffel Tower Classic Hamburger and the Sorbet Sampler. All of the food was delicious. the Creme Brulee is probably the best I've ever had.Would definitely return. Dinner next time.

doc.title: The View, The Service, The Luxury
doc.review: If you flinch at $100.00 menu items, stop reading. If not, don't say you weren't warned. There is not a better restaurant view in Las Vegas. The restaurant is glass enclosed at the midway point up the Eiffel Tower replica at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. It overlooks Las Vegas Blvd and the Bellagio Fountains, which is as good as it gets. Personnel are professional, well trained, immaculately turned out, and well versed in accommodating a discerning clientele. The food is best quality and expertly prepared and presented but.................doesn't taste all that good. This Louisiana boy is admittedly spoiled in that regard. But, would it kill them to use a little salt and pepper? So by all means go, but skip the table reservations and have cocktails and a small plate at the bar where the view is just as spectacular. The Hostess guarding the Tower elevator on the casino floor will admit you for drinks without a reservation as long as you are well dressed. Business casual or better will do. But by all means, let your attire match the glamour of this place. My wife and I saw the 5 pm Jersey Boys show at the Paris and then had dinner afterwards at Eiffel Tower for her birthday. Best date we ever had.

doc.title: Lovely food but service a tad overpowering
doc.review: We ate in this restaurant as a party of 6 to celebrate my birthday. We made a reservation for the advertised 5pm sunset where you get a table with the best views at the front overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The table right against the glass are only for 2 people so we got a booth style table just behind - lovely setting. The blinds were down (but see-through) until the sun set behind the Bellagio at 6:30 and they came up just in time for the fountain show. The menu choice was good and the food we all received was of excellent standard. This is not a cheap place to eat, so probably best saved for a celebration meal or special occasion! I received a complimentary dessert served on a plate that said Happy Birthday around the edge - nice touch. The only negative comment I would make is that whilst we appreciate good service, the staff were a little over-powering. There were constantly at least 3 or 4 staff hanging around waiting to pounce, we got asked if everything was ok by 3 different people and the main waiter was looking over at us the whole time we sat there and I personally felt uncomfortable with this. We chose not to pay extra to take the ride up the tower as we did the Stratosphere only the day before and didn't think we could possibly top the view!

doc.title: Great View, Decent Food, Awkward Service
doc.review: The view from this restaurant can't be beat -- looking directly at the Bellagio fountains and lights that perform every 10 minutes. Food was certainly excellent quality but not anything you couldn't get somewhere else for less. We really enjoyed the hazelnut chocolate cake, it was to die for! Overall, the service experience was a bit uncomfortable. We sat for almost 10 minutes before we were offered a menu and a chance to order drinks. We were rushed through our entree; the server even took my plate of bread and the side we ordered WITHOUT ASKING before I had a chance to finish eating! I would have liked to try the potato gratin! The waiter kept sneaking up on us and standing directly behind us without saying anything. It was very disconcerting. For the price of this restaurant, we expected better. I would recommend this for the location but not for the service or food.

doc.title: Good choice
doc.review: We chose this restaurant before attending Jersey Boys in the same hotel. The 6:00 reservation got us finished just in time to get to the show. We arrived at 5:45 and waited for a window seating which happened prior to 6. The food was outstanding and the service by hostesses and waiter excellent. The view of the sunset between the casinos and the lights coming on the strip was enjoyable as well. This is an upscale place so plan to spend a chunk of cash.

doc.title: Excellent restaurant!
doc.review: I went twice to this place in January and was never disapointed by the excellent meal served, as the service and ambiance. Very gourmet and tasty food. Price reasonnable for this quality meal.

doc.title: Gluten Free Menu
doc.review: The gluten free menu is excellent. Many choices. The "puffs" are great! I had the crab on avacado appitizer and a Chopped Romaine salad.

doc.title: Wonderful!
doc.review: We visited during Restaurant Week for lunch. I had the special and it was delicious, every bite! I selected to pair it with the wine selections. My husband ordered off the menu and was equally thrilled. There were lunch selections that will not break your bank such as sandwiches under $20. For the spectacular ambiance, it is certainly worth spending a little less gambling and enjoying a terrific lunch!

doc.title: Superb Dining With Awesome View
doc.review: This is one of the highlights of Las Vegas. You will pay a lot for the excellent service, superb view of the strip, and outstanding food and drink. We loved the attention and courtesy from the staff. This is a fine dining experience you should give yourself at least once.

doc.title: Romantic dinner.
doc.review: The food was amazing, although a bit pricey. Had a wonderful view of the fountain at the Bellagio hotel. The service was top notch.

doc.title: Great Views and Food
doc.review: Recently, I went to Las Vegas to meet my friend from the East Coast for our annual girls week vacation. This was her first trip to Sin City and I haven't been there in 14 years. We are not gamblers. First of all, we had a great time doing a lot of free and fun things. We decided on one expensive dinner so we choose the Eiffel Tower restaurant in Paris Las Vegas. We had a spectacular window view of the Bellagio Fountains which go up every 30 min. The food was excellent and the service was slow enough to enjoy our dinner and conversation. Drinks are expensive but not weak. We both enjoyed our filet minon and rack of lamb respectively. Cooked to our specifications and not rushed. Yes, it is $$$$ but worth it if you really want to spurlge. While we were there a young couple was celebrating their wedding dinner still dressed in their formal wedding attire. They came from France to get married in Las Vegas and go the Paris Las Vegas and the Eiffel Tower for their private celebration. All in all Las Vegas has changed a lot in 14 years but still has that special charm.

doc.title: Just Average
doc.review: The food was good, not great, just good. The view advertised is for only a few near the windows and the tables are crammed. My wife is in a wheelchair and when leaving we had to disturb a few fellow diners to get out. The service was poor. our waiter was fine but plates were removed in front of our faces. The bread is delivered by a busboy in a large tray, you pick out what you want and he/she places it on your bread plate from one position so it is served across the table. The bread was cold, not room temperature, cold. Another thing to note is that although it is advertised as a Paris Hotel restaurant it does not except or qualify for "Reward" points.After eating at a few of the so called "high end steak houses" in Las Vegas. My advice is to go to the middle of the road steak houses close or in your hotel and you will do just fine.

doc.title: Best meal of the trip
doc.review: For my first trip to Vegas I was a little overwhelmed with all the restaurant choices. We had Jersey Boy tickets and decided we would have our splurge meal here. It was possibly one of the best meals I have ever had, I ordered the Caesar salad to start, the filet with red wine sauce (steak did not require a knife to cut and the sauce was amazing) with potato gratin for dinner, and chocolate soufflé for dessert. Rene our server suggested everything we ordered and we were not disappointed at all. Our bill for two was over $200, but would definitely go back next time I am in Vegas. We made reservations and requested a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains, a definite must when choosing this restaurant.

doc.title: Beautiful Sunset View on Valentines Day (2/15)
doc.review: I surprised my "special lady friend" with a sunset window reservation for the two of us. When reserved the hostess asked if I wanted Roses on the table and I said yes. The roses and the vase were included when we left, which was a bonus. The service and the food were wonderful. We had a nice french wine (which can range from $50-5000+), but the waiter was very helpful in finding us a French Cab that fit within our budget ($150-200) and was an excellent choice for our wine pallets. We both had salads, a steak (NY for me and Filet for her), brussel sprouts, and potato dishes. We finished with the chocolate soufflé which was fantastic. The staff, the experience, the pictures, and the memory was awesome. Not the cheapest fancy meal in town, but definitely not the most expensive and definitely a must do for a romantic experience on the Vegas strip. NOTE: a sunset view in one of the first available time slots, when you reserve is a must!

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant a highlight of our trip!
doc.review: Although a bit on the pricey side, keep in mind you're paying for a bird's eye view of the Las Vegas Strip, and a fabulous perspective of the Bellagio Fountain... definitely worth the money! My husband and I had lunch there on a Saturday, and loved the experience so much, we took my mother-in-law there for dessert as part of her birthday celebration on Tuesday night! While the view of the Bellagio Fountain is beautiful during the day, it's even more spectacular all lit up in the evening! If you're budget conscious, but want to enjoy a meal here, lunch is definitely the way to go! The seafood salad and the lamb burger are both tasty and affordable choices! And I must say, the chocolate dessert tray is scrumptious, and the pistachio souffle is out of this world!And the service is top notch.... very accommodating! Whether it's for brunch, lunch, dinner, or just dessert, make sure to visit this restaurant at least once during your stay in Vegas... you will not be disappointed!

doc.title: A little dissapointed
doc.review: Booked our group of 12 for a farewell dinner on our 4-day convention trip. Decided we'd spend extra and go for a memorable meal. The food was outstanding but as we'd booked 6 weeks in advance I expected at least a table together. The noise in the restaruant was deafening when we arrived...it got a little better but was louder than expected for fine dining.

doc.title: A wonderful restaurant!
doc.review: A wonderful restaurant!The service at the highest level!The food is great! Position of the restaurant opposite the fountain,What could be better?Like a movie!

doc.title: Fantastic! Great food, service and views!
doc.review: We went for lunch so we could see the view during the day and it was spectacular! We had a lamb burger that was outstanding and the BLT that was also magnificent. Great chips with the sandwitches. The avacado crap salad was excellent and the chocolate desert was the best ever. Great service and staff, so friendly and they do not rush you. The views of the strip were wonderful. Exellent value for the food, service and views. The breads they serve are outstanding and everything is so fresh and warm!! Don't miss this place!

doc.title: Fantastic dinner experience
doc.review: We went for my birthday dinner. The service from the staff was great; from the moment we were greeted in front of the elevators to the moment we exited the elevators to leave the Paris hotel/casino. We had an incredible view of the Bellagio fountain show from our seats. It was a semicircular table abutting the glass walls which gave us a great view of the Vegas strip. The food was served in a timely manner, had a great presentation and was quite tasty. We had the duck breast, and sea bass, and souffle for dessert. I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant (more so for special occasions or if you care to splurge while in Vegas)

doc.title: What a gem!
doc.review: We love going to the Eiffel Tower in the Paris Casino for a special occasion. From the moment you step out of the elevator and see the pristine kitchen bustling with activity, you know you are in for a special treat. We always have excellent service, usually starting at the bar for a perfectly chilled glass of wine. Many tables ovelook the Bellagio fountains and a stunning view of the city. The food is equisite, prepared with care, and plated beautifully. Don't miss this exceptional restaurant overlooking the heart of the Las Vegas Boulevard.

doc.title: Great service, great food!
doc.review: We had a great 50th celebration dinner at the Paris and thoroughly enjoyed the meal and the service was great. They ask at the beginning of the meal if you want a souffle as they make it while you're enjoying dinner. I ordered it but have to say the surprise dessert creations they brought for us were better. Great view, great food, great service. It is pricey is the only negative but you get what you pay for sometimes.

doc.title: Amazing view and great food
doc.review: We visited for a special birthday dinner last May. The restaurant itself is really nice and the view is amazing.The food was really good, but it is expensive. I think we paid about $200 for the dinner, so it's definitely for a special occasion. I would recommend it!

doc.title: Great meal and service
doc.review: After having had Dinner at Jules Verne at the Original Eiffeltower in PAris we opted for The Eiffel Tower restaurant located at the PARIS in Las Vegas must have one of the best Rack of Lambs in the world; Ceasar Salad was so, so - Breast of Duck excellent / Great Souffles - Service from Receptionist, Busgirl, Maitre'd were all outstanding.We made our reservation via "Open table" - requested Window Table was available, in time which is a surprise in such a popular and busy restaurantAn extensive winelist from $6000 Chateau Moutons to very good Californinan - Sebastiani WinesA great evening - can strongly recommend the "Eiffel Tower" -

doc.title: Great dining and service at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: My wife and I dined at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in Las Vegas on February 25th, 2013. We had the cold foie gras, excellent winter green salads, sturgeon which my wife said was very nice, a good NY steak, a really outstanding creamed spinach with mushrooms, and an excellent Grand Marnier souffle. The sommelier recommended a very nice half-bottle Bordeaux from Margaux. The food and wine were all most enjoyable but we were especially impressed by the service from waiter captain Anthony Jamison. Precise and impeccably timed, it was the best we have seen for many years! Complementing the dinner and service was a great view looking down over the Bellagio fountains. This was just a superb dining experience!

doc.title: 5-star price, 4.5-star experience
doc.review: You can definitely do worse in Vegas. If you're looking for the full-on French fine dining experience in Vegas, this is an easy call. I'll break it down easy...Pros- Well executed versions of standard French fine-dining fare, and a few imaginative additions.- Outstanding views from almost every seat, but especially if you can get a window seat.- Service is fairly high-end for Vegas. These people are trained to provide a passable high-end experience.- They'll take special arrangements in advance and usually can accommodate.Cons- You have to walk through Paris, Paris to find the elevator up, and it aint easy- Just a bit more expensive than it has a right to be, IMO. But what the hay, it's Vegas, a town where you can blow a 5-star dinner for one in cash just waiting to be seated.- You can't specifically reserve one of those awesome view tables. (On the pro side, $20 in the palm of the maitre 'd would probably get it done if you can wait a hot minute.)One thing that's a little weird is that the elevator to the restaurant deposits you in a waiting area right off the kitchen. This is a little odd, but gives you a chance to get a smell of what you're in for, and plant a seed of doubt in your mind that will be removed as soon as you see the stunning view from the dining room.

doc.title: Paying for the View
doc.review: When we first came to LV in 2008 we decided to have a nice night out at this restaurant for some fine dining and take in the view. While we did get a nice table on the window, that's about where the experienced ceased, our watier was awful, was not attentive at all - never topped up our water let alone take another drink order, we sat on the same overpriced drink we got at the bar on arrival also he did now know his menu at all - hopeless. Paid a fortune for something quite average. We returned some years later to give it another go and to be honest not much had changed , still a nice view but poor service and food that is bland. Save your money and try somewhere else, perhaps at the Bellagio -if you want a fountain view with Dinner.

doc.title: Special Occasion Restaurant
doc.review: I took my wife for a birthday dinner in November of 2012. I knew the restaurant was expensive but it was a special occasion. I pre-arranged a window table weeks in advance so that we could have views of the nighttime Las Vegas skyline. The table happened to overlook the Bellagio fountains (which I would recommend) since they go off regularly with a light show.If you don't like French food at all then you will be disappointed. You can certainly stay with a steak and be fine but you won't enjoy many of the choices available.I chose the prix fixe menu which allowed me to have smaller portions of many of the chef's specialties.I'm glad that I did because they were all terrific and I was completely full at the end.Not so full that we didn't choose the grand marnier soufle for dessert...The tables are very close together but you do not feel overcrowded. It is not very noisy so you can have an intimate dinner with outdoor entertainment with a window table.The service is terrific and the food is excellent.If you can afford a pricey night out - this is a worthy selection if you are in Las Vegas.

doc.title: Best Steak Ever and Great View of the Strip
doc.review: This was my second time dining at this restaurant. Both times, the steak was superb. All tables have a great view of the strip. I was visiting on business, but this is the perfect spot for a romantic dinner.

doc.title: Unique expérience.
doc.review: Elevator up to the restaurant drops you off in the kitchen, which may be off-putting to some but I found it very interesting. Coming from CA, where you can no longer get foie gras, to find it on the menu was a definite plus. We had a window table overlooking the Strip which was very nice. Very good Pacific Salmon and Muscovy Duck Breast. Vegas prices.

doc.title: Only If You Want to Be Frustrated
doc.review: Made a reservation and requested a table for 6 with a window view of the fountains at the Bellagio. Was told we would have to make this request upon arrival. Arrived and told they only had tables for 4 with the window view. Seems they could have told us this when the reservation was made. The young lady who greeted (poor choice of words) us didn't even look us in the face, much less greet us. We were seated promptly, waited about 10 minutes before anyone showed up...they quickly gave us a wine list. Now I understand their promptness with the wine list. This is where it became interesting. Big wine list - but probably not a dozen bottles under $100...plenty in the hundreds + of dollars. Ordered wine and cocktails...received the wine fairly promptly but 30 minutes later I had to ask about them about the cocktails. The food - very good, but inconsistent in some areas. At these prices, everything should have been outstanding...it wasn't. Service picked up after we started drinking wine...imagine that. At their prices, I would be pushing wine too. Everyone knows Las Vegas food in general is expensive (and over-priced), however, if you want to spend this kind of money, there are a lot of better options.

doc.title: Great Views, Food ad Service
doc.review: It is a little touristy, but the food is very good and the service was also very good. Maria did an outstanding job and I would strongly recommend you ask to sit at her table (if it is one by the window of course). The food was well prepared and served. The fountains give a nice view. It is worth the trip.

doc.title: Absolutely Stunning restaurant in every way!!!
doc.review: This restaurant is truly incredible. But let me start by saying this is where my partner proposed to me so that makes this restaurant even more amazing for me. It is very pricey but its not only dinner its an experience the views are breathtaking and more amazing than any photos you will see.It cost me and my partner £250, we had steak for dinner and Eiffel Tower Soufflé for desert, and let me say just thinking of the desert is making my mouth water lol!! We also had a few champagne cocktails which was really lovely!!!If your in Vegas you must come here!!!

doc.title: Don't go to this place
doc.review: Ok if you really want to go to this place be ready to pay 200$ sticker for a view.food was absolutely horrible .i ordered sturgeon and it tasted worse then when my husband made me fish for 1$ from grocery store once.The garnish was a salad my Russian grandmother marinates from all the veggies she can find in her garden ...My husband ordered duck and it was just blah and very tough.We were in a hurry to see the show so we didn't complain.We just didn't eat it.Noone even asked us why our plates are full.There are a lot of wonderful restaurants in Vegas.Do yourself a favor don't go to this one.

doc.title: Food fine but pricey
doc.review: The food was fine and of good quality but it was quite pricey. Designer cocktails $18-$20 each. Again, they were excellent, but this is downtown big city prices.

doc.title: Could have been so much better...
doc.review: Booked months in advance from the UK, requested a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains on arrival this requested had not been secured. We waited about 45 minutes in the bar whilst a table became available. Staff were a little rude when we said we wanted to wait for a window table. Food was ok but not memorable. Service very good but not the best we've ever had and for the price we expected a little more. Nice touches were the complementary chocolates at the end of the meal and the view we eventually got from the table. The views are impressive and hard to beat for an restaurant in Vegas. Small point of annoyance was an over charge for a shot of brandy, when we were asked why we were charged more than the menu stated, we were told it was cheaper to have the brandy with a mixer?? Refunded but frustrating non the less. Very romantic setting but we wouldn't return based on the experience.

doc.title: Good dining experience, if pricey...
doc.review: During our time in Vegas we had some wonderful meals at great restaurants, so dinner at Eiffel Tower had a lot to live up to. The view was great, overlooking the Bellagio Fountains and the south end of the strip. Service was good, waiters were all very polite. We found our French waiter to be ever so slightly "snooty" but really not a complaint. Just an air about him. Didn't diminish the level of service, though. The menu is definitely french, and slightly pretentious. Lots of elements of the dishes that have fancy names that many people wouldn't understand, and may feel self conscious asking about. Overall, it was an expensive dinner that we weren't sure was quite worth it. We've had just as good steak dinners for slightly less.That said, the meal was good. The mushroom soup was very nice, and the filet with red wine sauce was really tender and delicious. My husband's surf and turf was good, but the steak didn't seem as seared and "yummy" looking as my filet. The lobster was small - hefty price for a fairly small plate of surf and turf. The crowning glory was dessert... we both had the souffle (chocolate and the caramel) and wow! Delish! Really an excellent end to a good meal.My one beef with the restaurant is their "dress code". When making reservations we were told that no jeans were allowed - to be proper attire for men and ladies, etc. Well, before heading up for dinner, we noticed other couples going ahead of us that were wearing jeans, and somewhat casual dress. Many folks, men especially, in the restaurant were wearing jeans. That really rubs me the wrong way - why specify a dress code if you're not going to enforce it?And being that most folks are doing a lot of walking through Vegas, you'd expect people to be dressed comfortably in jeans and running shoes perhaps. So why make a point of telling some to come dressed appropriately for dinner, then allow others to wear 'whatever'?

doc.title: AMAZING
doc.review: Absoultely amazing! Great views of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. Spectacular food! My husband and I did the tasting menu because we just couldn't decide! Maine lobster salad, cream of mushroom soup, sea bass (my husband substituted for the duck), filet mignon, chocolate Soufflé were all exquisite and delicious! Be prepared for a hefty bill but service, ambiance, food and overall experience make it so worth it!

doc.title: A must every time we are in Vegas!
doc.review: Each year when we head to Las Vegas, I make sure I book reservations at the Eiffel Tower! The view alone is amazing, but the food is fantastic! They added a new mushroom pasta dish.....oh my goodness, AMAZING! Wish I was there now enjoying it and the veiw! You can't go wrong here, we will be back next January!

doc.title: Overrated and Overpriced
doc.review: Booked this for my girlfriend's birthday and had high, yet realistic expectations. Was very disappointed. Had a reservation that wasn't met at the exact time, so we got a drink at the bar. Had to settle that tab before we could be seated at our table which is annoying. Had a window table which was nice but I feel I should mention this restaurant is NOT at the top of the tower. It's really only 3 stories up from ground level. View is ok but not worth the overpriced food. Dinner was average, not great, not bad (not worth $56 for a steak). Service was good but you'd expect it to be when they have a chance at 20% of huge bills. Atmosphere was very loud as the bar area is not separated from the restaurant and a lot of people come up just for a drink and the view (I.e. rowdy businessmen). All in all, would not go back. Eat downstairs at Mon Ami Gabi instead. Food is 1/3 of the price and twice as good. View is also better.

doc.title: again wonderful
doc.review: We, again had dinner at the Eiffel Tower and it was wonderful. Our wait staff, especially Ron was the best.

doc.title: Took my wife to Paris for our anniversary.
doc.review: Well Paris in Las Vegas. The food was good and the view was nice. Staff were very nice and accommodating.

doc.title: Excellent food.
doc.review: This is a very nice restaruant. The food was really good and the service was very attentive. The views are great as well! It's expensive, New Your City Expensive, but if you are up for that, you will enjoy.

doc.title: Great view
doc.review: After several stays at Paris, we decided to have lunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. The view was fantastic, and the food was lovely. Quite large portions, which surprised me in a fine dining restaurant - I could only eat about a third of the pasta on my plate. I've had better food in Vegas, but the experience was very pleasant.

doc.title: Boo!!!
doc.review: We had reservations weeks in advance with another couple for a window view of the Bellagio fountains; we were assured if we arrived early they would have availability. We arrived 30 minutes early for our reservations and were told it would be an hour plus wait. We accepted a table outside the area and requested a reseat as available. The waiter was amazing and said he would try to accommodate, just as a new couple arrived at a 4 table seating area at the window. I requested a manager who informed me they did not accept reservations at the window. I politely thank him and walked away. He then said he 'found' a table and I refused. The dinner ended with the waiter wanting to bring a complimentary dessert, that I again refused as we were not expecting a handout. We spent well over $500 on dinner, and did not need or expect a consolation prize for what we expected from the evening. Long and short, Vegas is doing well and the customer experience is beginning to show it again. Be careful what you expect as you will be disappointed overall...

doc.title: Service, plating up, view
doc.review: Spur of the moment decision to eat here, starting with friendly and courteous service making a booking day before. Service, presentation of food, window table for two overlooking the Bellagio all superb. My fillet mignon was perfect, however my wife's salmon dish slightly undercooked and a few bones found. Overall a great place to eat, but be mindful that this level of service and presentation, and food quality costs a bit more. Recommended and will dine here again.

doc.title: Valentine's dinner 2013
doc.review: We made reservations for Valentine's dinner and are glad we did. It was set menu of 3 courses plus a few Amuses, and great bread and rolls and drinks. One has to worry about dinner on a special occasion because serving 800 dinners that night could have lead to some problems. Not so. The food was as good as you could hope for. The portions were big enough that by the end, you would not complain about being hungry. The service both at the bar and table was lovely and friendly - nothing snooty about this retsurant. We especially got a kick out of exiting the elevator on the way up to dinner and finding ourselves in the kitchen! Never had that happen before but it was great seeing all the chefs at work.Even though the place was full, we never felt rushed at any point. What a treat - and what a fine restaurant. I'd go back in a flash!

doc.title: Second Time is as Good as the First!
doc.review: We had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant last September for my wife's birthday, and we wanted to go back for Valentine's Day. Unfortunately, we could not get the right time on Valentine's Day evening, so we reserved for the night before Valentine's.Just like the last time, we were greeted at the ground floor of the Paris, and then took the elevator to the 11th floor where you pass by a view of the chefs in the kitchen as you go to the reception desk. We had arrived early for our dinner reservation, so we waited at the bar - and it was a very pleasant wait! It's a beautiful bar with a view of the Strip. The bartender was pleasant and quick to get our drinks. I would recommend a French Martini to get you in the mood for the dinner! Expect your drinks to be in the $15-$20 range.Our table was ready right on time, and once again we were brought to the table I had requested - right at the window with a good view of the Bellagio fountains and the Vegas Strip at night. It was a small, half-round table, but plenty of room for the two of us, and very romantic!For the appetizer, we both ordered the roasted Foie Gras, which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. We savored every bite! For the main course I had the Lamp, and my wife had the Short Ribs. Both were absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly, but if there was a contest between entrees, the Lamb would once again have won. We didn't order any side dishes this time, as the entree itself is more than enough to leave you satisfied.If we ordered anything more, it would have been far too much food. As it was, we really didn't have room to try the deserts. If you want the desert, I would suggest to skip the side dishes. The total for the dinner came to $242.00, including a martini and champagne for the both of us - not bad at all for such an amazing meal.Everything about this dinner was perfect, and as I stated last time, we'll definitely be going back to the Eiffel Tower again!

doc.title: Oh la la la la
doc.review: We had lunch at 2pm the fountains came on at 3, we had one of the best tables in the house, the crab and avocado was amazing and shrimp came out on a bed of ice. I had parmasam chicken which was nice and spicy lamb burger which was delicious. For desert we had creme brûlée and apple strudel. I would recommend booking early and say its for a special occasion so they accommodate a good table.The only down side was our waiter had black teeth which really need seeing to as it put me off ordering for a split second! Plus at the end a group of waiters were talking about people giving them tips and being derogatory which I find tasteless, I know people come here for a special occasion and not everyone can afford giving 50 dollar tips, they should be grateful whatever people give them not taking the Micky, they should choose a time and place to do that not infront of customers on a late lunch.However, food and views where great.

doc.title: Great view with great service
doc.review: The service is first class. The chef was more than willing to make our 6 yo his own menu. Dress code is present, yet they are very relaxed. Make a 5 pm reservation to ensure a window seat. The price was average for the style of restaurant and the food was good.

doc.title: What a view and meal
doc.review: As I read from 1 review, they didn't think that walking out of the 11th floor lift into the kitchen was attractive and I tended to agree until I watched some of the chefs plying their art. The attention to detail is wonderful not only to watch but to taste as this was a wonderful taste experience.The view was also magnificent except you couldn't get the bellagio fountain music in the restaurant to see the theme of the show. The only suggestion I would have for the experience is to have softer French music playing. During our meal, the music was abstract and diverse and just a tad too loud ... Maybe we were located too close to the speakers but I don't recall.An excellent dining experience.

doc.title: Big dollars, little food.
doc.review: As with apparently all high end dining establishments, you pay a lot for a little. The food, what little there was of it was EXCELLENT. Having said that, I now know why the bread service came around three times while we waited on our entree. You better fill up on bread, or you will leave hungry after paying anywhere from $42 - $90 for your entree. Salads and sides will cost you extra at $18 for a salad and $10 for each side. The sides are not nearly as generous as you get at Ruth Chris or Morton's so sharing is not really an option. The service was impeccable and the view was great, but the experience unfortunately was not worth the price.442

doc.title: Fantastic last night!
doc.review: We dined a the Eiffel Tower restaurant with another couple and requested a table with a view of the fountains.Having stayed at the Bellagio we were curious as to what the view from the other side would be like.The restaurant was busy but we were seated within a couple of minutes.Our table was on the fountain side but could not be directly next to the window due to only tables for 2 people being located all along the window but when the fountains started we were able to see almost everything so this was not a problem.The leg bases to the tower itself run through the restarant but this just adds to the experience although it may obstruct some views so always worth mentioning when you book your table if you dont want to sit near to them.The food was fantastic and the staff were excellent.The staff made sure we didn't have to wait too long for drinks and food.One of our party ordered beef Wellington and asked for it to be cooked so his meat was well done.The waiter came back to us to let us know it would take a few minutes longer than usual but they arranged for allfood to come out together and it was all cooked to perfection.the staff were helpful and knowledgable about everything on the menu and also about the building.We were intending to go up to the top of the tower afterwards as you can order your tickets at your table and have them added to your bill rather than queuing up down in the foyer.It was a particularly windy day and during dinner I asked the waiter if He had any advice as I am not great with heights and he recommended that I try it during he day when it wasn't as windy as this might be less daunting than at that time during quite high winds as it would feel even more so the higher up we went.We took his advice and I think he was definitely right ! The drinks ate pricey but thos is in all restaurants in vegas.One of the couples was celebrating their anniversary and the kitchen sent out 2 lovely complimentary desserts with the plates personalised to their occasion which was a lovely touch.The attention to detail was fantastic and we felt like we had a really attentive night.Although it may cost a bit more than some restaurants it was money well spent on a memorable last night in Vegas.

doc.title: Love at First Bite
