doc.review: We celebrated a birthday with a family dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and were impressed with the fantastic service, food, and view of the Bellagio Fountains. Yes, the prices are extremely high, but not out-of-line with other top-notch restaurants. And, most people drop that kind of money in the slots or at a gaming table in less time than it took to eat the meal.Our party of 6 enjoyed advice and recommendations from the waiter for the evening, John Paul. You must order a soufflé before you eat, if you want one, so it will be ready when you are finished. There are many flavors and the soufflés are big so unless you’re a piggy, plan on sharing. We started our meal with a bottle of chardonnay and a tiny cup of cold cauliflower and bacon soup. Then, on to fresh breads, which we enjoyed entirely too much. We split two of the scallop appetizers, most of us wishing for more of the savory treats. We ordered the delicious creamy soups. I selected the creamy French Onion. Yum! Red wine accompanied the rest of our meal. When our main courses arrived, the smells alone were delicious. We ordered two of the vegetables to share which was plenty for most of us. The portions and servings were a bit puzzling to me though since I had Beef Wellington and lots of fresh peas that were more than enough. Yet my daughter had one little part of a boned duck with nothing else. The Beef Wellington is wrapped with fantastic dough that is too good not to finish. The pies de resistance soufflés arrived warm. John Paul tapped a hole in the top of each and added hot fudge to the chocolate soufflé and hot caramel to the caramel. By then end of our feast, no one could complain about not having enough to eat. We were extremely satisfied and glad we could walk some of our dinner off on the way back to our hotel.

doc.title: Dinner
doc.review: It was just okey! We tried to eat at the steak house but was booked every night. The service was timely, and the food was hot, but I can't say more than that about my meals. We even tried it twice just to see if it was a off night, but no!

doc.title: Excellent Food with a View
doc.review: This is a romantic place with an excellent view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The food is very good, and a little over-priced given its location. It is fine dining though. French food, with a good selection of fish and a variety of different filet minon dishes. Request a window seat and be sure to tell them at the beginning you want the souffle for dessert at the beginning. This is the only restaurant I know of that has a variety of souffles: I had the Pistachio, my wife, the chocolate, both excellent.

doc.title: Disappointed
doc.review: I had read good reviews and had a personal recommendation to the Eiffel Tower restaurant but was so disappointed. It was so crowded at the bar it took twenty mins to get a pre dinner drink. As soon as it arrived we were asked to sit at our table. The restaurant was very noisy and busy so we had to talk loudly to be heard. The views were good, but we were a few tables back from the window to fully appreciate it. The food descriptions were poor and I had to send mine back as it contained an ingredient I'm allergic to which was not mentioned on the menu or by the waiter when I had asked him. Won't go back - think there are better places on vegas.

doc.title: A beautiful birthday celebration!
doc.review: My husband, son and I made reservations at this restaurant to celebrate my 50th birthday. We were seated at a window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains, which added to the already beautiful atmosphere.This restaurant runs like a well-oiled machine. We were seated promptly, greeted by our waiter immediately, who took our drink order and left us to browse the menu. He answered all our questions, and was cheerful and gracious. He seemed to anticipate our needs and it seemed he was at our table almost as we thought of seeking him out!The food was amazing! Attention to detail in the preparation and presentation of each dish was evident. Everything looked beautiful - and tasted wonderful. My son had the salmon and he said it seemed like it melted in his mouth. My lamb was equally mouth-watering. My husband would have liked his filet mignon a little less red in the centre, but he said it was too delicious to return!The only thing that caused me to raise an eyebrow is that when you step off the elevator at the restaurant, you feel like you are entering through the kitchen. There is a hostess there to greet you (I suspect this entry has caused confusion in the past), but I think that for such a "high-end" restaurant, the kitchen should not be your first view.

doc.title: Food good, View great
doc.review: This place is very nice, but the food is a little pricey for what your getting, However the view of the bellagio fountains if you sit by the windows makes it worth going. I would reccommend if for a romantic outing if your splurging on price. Overall with the friendly staff and awesome location i could comfortably recommend it as a nice stop on your romantic vegas evening.

doc.title: Outstanding in Every Way
doc.review: You can be overwhelmed by choice in Las Vegas. I try to make choices with some informed decisions and in the case of Sin City, I knew that if I made a bit of extra effort cross-referencing reviews and articles online, on Trip Advisor, and in my 2013 Fodor's guide that I would produce some good results. This restaurant made it in my top 5 choices and it surpassed every expectation. We went with another couple who was relying on my 'research' and they were blown away as much as we were. We knew that dining in the evenings was going to be expensive(ish) (depending where you eat!) and we wanted to make every dollar count.Location: pretty unique - in the middle of the scaled down version of the Eiffel Tower, it offers a fantastic view of the strip and specifically the Bellagio fountains across the street, which popping up every 30 minutes makes for a magical backdrop while you are dining. We were sitting in the upper tier of tables and still had a decent view of the fountains and the city beyond. Service: Outstanding. A full fine-dining experience. The sommelier, which was summoned after we had made a few inquiries, had extensive knowledge. When my selection of wine by the glass had run out mid-dinner the sommelier made a selection of two alternative wines for me to try, both were brought to me for tasting and both were excellent substitutions (even better than what I had originally selected!) The staff from start to finish were extremely polite, courteous and had all been trained very well. Food: Wow. I had the Cream of Mushrooms, Wild Rice Galette, Crispy Shallots and the Char Broiled Filet Mignon, Béarnaise; I also sampled a few other things at the table and they were all delicious. One of our friends ordered the sorbets presented on a painters palette - very original and delicious. I can't imagine anything on the menu would have been anything but excellent.

doc.title: Exceeded Expectations as Usual
doc.review: We have dined here many times and have never been disappointed, the food was well prepared and delicious, presented and served well and the bar service excellent.

doc.title: Returned one year later
doc.review: Mi wife and me first tryed this staurant one year ago while attending a convention, it was in our plans to return to have the magnificent food they make.Once again they exceeded our expectatives.

doc.title: Phenomenal New Years Eve Experience
doc.review: We were a party of four for the 10 pm seating on New Years Eve. Great seats overlooking the strip, live music, and a beautiful pre set menu. Extensive wine list, of which we drank several bottles, and the service was top notch, accommodating a lactose allergy. They gave us the Eiffel Tower cookbook as a gift as well. A great choice for a New Years venue. Highly recommend it and can't wait to go back for the regular menu!

doc.title: You MUST treat yourself at least once...and will probably be back!
doc.review: We were in Vegas for the builders show and stayed in the Paris Hotel. We had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant twice and it was amazing! The staff and head chef were so hospitable (no arrogance at all which is refreshing in a high rated restaurant). The mixed drinks are the best. Dessert can't expressed in words...facial expressions only. Now, the view of the Bellagio Hotel water show and surrounding night lights set the stage for a wonderful dining Experience.

doc.title: Awesome view and prices!
doc.review: Loved the nighttime view of the Strip! The lights of all the hotels were clearly visible. The drinks were very expensive but delicious and attractive. The menu is small, everything is well made and attractively presented but quite overpriced.

doc.title: Best Meal Ever
doc.review: We enjoyed a delayed anniversary celebration last night at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The entire experience was an absolute pleasure! From the red rose and rose petals on the table right through to the decadent chocolate plate or creme brulee dessert. We had the Tasting Menu which was an awesome combination of flavours. The Bellagio Water Fountains added another level of enjoyment - a new show every 15 minutes! Definitely would recommend this restaurant for special occasions.

doc.title: Beautiful View
doc.review: We celebrated a 50th birthday at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. It was beautiful. We could watch the Bellagio Water Show from the restaurant. The food was pricey, but very good. It was a wonderful place to celebrate something special!

doc.title: Best Lunch and Best Service
doc.review: We picked this reataurant today for lunch and we are pleased to say that EVERYTHING exceeded our expectations. We arrived early and the hostess escourted us up to the restaurant even though the restaurant was not ready for seating. The bar was open and the bartender was prompt to take our order and deliver our drinks . The drinks were very good. The Matre-D also was GLAD to provide us with the requested table. We had a superb view from our table in the glassed corner. Our waiter, Todd was great, as was his assistant. Todd's suggestions were spot on. He was prompt and professional. We waited for nothing... The food was the best we have had during our stay in Vegas. We are here on an extended stay and are trying all levels of restaurants. Some have been outstanding and this is the top of the list. Servers have also been all levels and Todd is by far the best waitperson we have had during our stay. He and his assistant were seamless in their attention. We cannot wait to return. EXCEPTThe one thing that bothers us is that although we would love to return and are more than happy to make a reservation, I do not care to give my credit card to hold a reservation. We would like to return for our anniversary in a couple of weeks but...We did not need a reservation for lunch today yet to make a lunch OR dinner reservation on line I have to provide a CC number. Again both the food and the sevice was the BEST in Vegas. Thank you Todd for making our lunch a very memorable experience.

doc.title: From Paris with love
doc.review: A romantic dinner in Paris is a dream for many love birds. However, too complicated: Passports, dictionaries, etc. Well, I have a solution. Paris, Las Vegas. What about lunch or dinner at Eiffel Tower? Oh La-la! They even put red rose paddles on your starch white table clothes. The food is delicious, and the view is spectacular. Visit Eiffel Tower and fall in love; or refresh your sparkles!

doc.title: "OMG"
doc.review: Booked for my husdand's 60th birthday dinner and it was amazing.We Had a table that looked over the Bellagio fountantais which made it an extra specail night. From the moment we arrived we were made so welcome. We were looked after by Maria, she was so good and new what she was doing!! Our meal was superb and so loved our soufle's they were awesome. We found the wine a bit over expensive but hey ho it's Vegas!! Our over all tab was £340 $ which included our tip. Would we do it again for a special occasion, ABSOLUTELY!!!!!!!!

doc.title: So good!
doc.review: We went to Vegas for a conference. The best part of the trip was the Eiffel Affair drink. Absolutely amazing. I emailed the manager at 6:30 am to beg for the drink recipe, and had the response and recipe within 2 hours. It just showed a continuation of their incredible customer service. Thank you so much to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for making a great memory for us!

doc.title: Great atmosphere
doc.review: Tonight we visited the Eiffel Tower restaurant after seeing The Jersey Boys who perform in the same hotel.We had a drink at the bar first and that was great watching the bar tender who really appeared to know his stuff mixing and making various cocktails etc :) at our table which was great as it looked over the Bellagio fountains. I think if you book 24 hours in advance you get fountain seats automatically which is great :)Now the foodBread and butter = cold tasteless and boringStarter = belly pork = very nice on a bed of tasty lentils but I have had better.Mandys starter = warm foi gras = not quite warm enough but very still very niceMain course = fillet steak Rossini with foi gras and Mandy had lamb cutlets. My steak was cooked medium rare and was perfect the foi gras certainly added that certain extra melt in the mouth touch but the crouton base was awful :( now maybe it's Vegas as I've now had 2 ceased salads and both these came with awful croutons. We also shared brussel sprouts, spinach and potatoes. The sprouts where hard and unedible for me the spinach came in a chesnut creamy sauce which made the spinach really good :) now the best thing I ate tonight was a tase of mandys lamb chops, they where the tastiest bit of lamb ever ! Very pink in fact red but they melted in your mouth :) we didn't bother with a sweet but Mandy had just half a bottle of Pinot Gris. The total bill was $300 including a $29 tip but we did pay $ 40 pre dinner for 2 drinks in the bar. I was once again left feeling it just wasn't good enough for the money and yet I would recommend the place just keep off the sprouts !! I would say best place so far on my Vegas trip to take someone for a romantic meal x

doc.title: Beautiful place for lunch
doc.review: I had my birthday lunch here and I just loved the views, food and spectacular service. They even gave me a special birthday dessert mouse.

doc.title: Amazing sauces!
doc.review: I had the salmon - other dishes at the table were the short ribs and a steak. We all decided mine was the best. Whatever sauce it came with was magical - I've never had anything like it - and I almost order a seafood dish. There was a mushroom side dish option that was absolute heaven. I think I had a foodgasm! The service was friendly and helpful and brought complimentary desert bites at the end. If you like sauces with food - a must try. Be sure to make reservations!!

doc.title: Best place on strip to celebrate special occations!
doc.review: We went there for our Anniversary dinner and they provided us the best location overlooking the Bellagio fountain! It just can't get any better! Excellent fine dining experience, food was also very good! Ofcourse expensive :) But, sometimes you pay to create a memory, and this place sure did that to us!! Would definately consider going back!

doc.title: Booked Christmas Dinner 6 mths in advance - FOR WHAT?????
doc.review: We live in Australia and as we were going to be staying at the Paris Las Vegas for 5 nights over Christmas, I pre-booked "Christmas Dinner for 2" at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant direct with LyleTolhurst their Divisional Supervisor on 25 JUNE 2012 via confirmed email. YES, 25 June !!! And I specifically requested a window table overlooking the Bellagio water show. We reviewed their menu and wine list online prior to leaving Australia, and were expecting to spend in the vicinity of US$600 as there were some special wines my husband was going to try. We arrived early for pre-dinner drinks at the bar and the restaurant was packed. I introduced myself to Lyle Tolhurst and discussed looking forward to a fabulous night of dining overlooking the water show. Our booking was for 8:00pm and after enjoying a couple of expensive cocktails at the bar, at 8:40pm we were shown to a terrible table stuck in a corner with no view of the water show and one of us would have been looking at a wall. As this was my special gift to my husband for Christmas, I was devasted.....!!! My husband could see I was visibily upset, and after speaking with the apologetic female Maitre d', we were passed on to Lyle Tolhurst who attempted to appease us by taking us downstairs to the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant. This was not a compromise for us as we had already patronised MAG previously for a luncheon - and we had been anticipating a fine dining experience. It was now after 9:00pm and we decided we would look elsewhere. Lyle Tolhurst's parting words to us was "Sorry we spoilt your Christmas Dinner"..................... NOT GOOD ENOUGH LYLE!!!!!!

doc.title: Pricey but can be due to location and view
doc.review: I would return. Not sure my friends would. Service was great. Beautiful atmosphere. Can enjoy the Bellagio fountain show from your table. Food very good. My husband highly recommends the scallop appetizer. We shared the surf and turf and I had a Caesar salad. Wish we would have opted for the Souffle dessert. It looked amazing. Six different options available.

doc.title: Drinks and View
doc.review: We went here for pre-dinner drinks and to watch the fountains. The bar is situated above the restaurant and has a good view of the strip. We got a great seat at the bar for the fountain show. It was only a view of 2/3 the fountain, but is still was worth the trip. The drinks at the bar were AWESOME! It was $18 for one of the specialty drinks, but they were all great! Try the Eiffel Tower special if you like ginger. I could have drank these all night.

doc.title: Wonderful New Years eve dinner
doc.review: We went to this restaurant for New Years Eve 2012. We managed to get a booking 3 weeks in advance for the 7pm sitting. When we arrived, we were able to enjoy a drink at the bar first before being shown to our table which was seated at the window, directly opposite the Bellagio fountains. This meant that every 15 minutes from 8pm onwards we were able to enjoy the wonderful sights while enjoying our meal.The restaurant only offered a set menu on New Years Eve however I found it to have some lovely options. All courses were wonderfully presented and all met our expectations.Although obviously pricey, it was an excellent experience and a great way to start New Years celebrations.

doc.title: Service not as good as we remembered
doc.review: The last time I ate at the Eiffel Tower restaurant, the service was absolutely impeccable - the maitre d', the sommelier, the waitstaff placing everyone's plate on the table at precisely the same time and clearing the same way. This time, not so much. We arrived a bit early for our reservation and were seated promptly in front of the window, but then we were left there for a long time without seeing a waiter, without menus and without being offered a cocktail. The waitress then gave us menus and sent the sommelier to our table before we had any idea what we wanted to eat, so we had to send him away and ask him to return once we had decided on an order. The waiter then returned and asked us if we had questions on the menu, but still did not offer to take a cocktail order. After we asked to whom we were supposed to give our order, the waiter finally took one down for us. The appetizers were quite good, as were the wines recommended by the sommelier, but the individual beef wellingtons disappointed our dining companions, who remembered them as being remarkable on a past visit. The waitstaff seemed confounded by the slow pace at which we preferred to eat so that we could have a leisurely meal with good conversation, and actually cleared some of our plates while leaving others on the table - faux pas! While the meal was "good", it certainly did not hold up to our expectations. Order the foie gras or the blue cheese souffle, skip the escargot and the beef wellington. Don't skip the side dishes - entrees are served without vegetables or potato, so you have to order those on the side to complete your meal.

doc.title: Great food and Great View
doc.review: We had a fantastic tasting menu dinner experience with matching wine. One of the more costly meals in my lifetime but worth the price paid. At the end of the second course, we felt the dinner was moving along too quickly. I asked the waiter to slow down the pace, and he obliged so we could spend plenty of time taking in the Bellagio fountains at sunset, watching the casinos light up as we stared transfixed at the beauty of Las Vegas and the beauty of each other, quietly holding hands under the table, engaging in fun conversation about us, each other, life, and so many things. Sometimes a dining experience is positive because the food is excellent (as was the case with the Lamb - wow), but what I strongly recall as I compose this review a week later is how the meal facilitated a romantic interlude. It also facilitated a marriage proposal at the table next to us. I recommend this place even more so for those who are in love or want to fall in love. Show owner comment »

doc.title: So good we ate there twice
doc.review: Great location and great service from John Anthony (Captain) - ask for his station if you can. The food is awesome and you have GOT to have the Soufflé - we had ours with caramel sauce and its to die for. (For those of you who care about your health don't read the recipe as its full of all those things we should avoid, but we didn't care!).The pork belly starter is great and so is the Beef Wellington for those traditionalists around.Great atmosphere and if you get a table facing the Strip then you can watch the Bellagio fountains while you are dining.

doc.title: Excellent Dinner
doc.review: We dined here on a Friday night and it was less busy than I expected. We were seated promptly at a window seat that had only a very partial view of the Bellagio fountains. Our main view was of the Arc de Triomphe and the southern strip, which was nice, but could have been better. That was our only slight disappointment of the night. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and attended to our every need. The food was excellent, the lamb and the filet are recommended. Our waiter was also courteous enough to give us a complete list of his personal favorite night clubs and things to do while in Vegas. The photo opportunity was an excellent addition to this experience. Overall a great romantic meal and yes it is pricey, but that was expected. Check the menu on the website if you do not want to be shocked before you get the check.

doc.title: great place to eat!!
doc.review: fantastic food, wait staff was good, loved the whole dinner experience. I thought the views were fab. too! you can not go wrong eating here.

doc.title: Just about perfect!
doc.review: DH and I visited Las Vegas recently and because I'd always wanted to try the Eiffel Tower restaurant, this was at the top of my to-do list. I visit Vegas yearly with my mom and sister, but this was never an option as I viewed this to be a romantic experience. This was not the case however; there were groups of women and even parents who'd brought a child along.I had the surf and turf which was outstanding. Excellent presentation and delicious. DH had a steak which he enjoyed very much. We both had the mushroom soup for a starter, which was amazing. They brought the bowl with a wild rice-filled stuffed mushroom in the center, then brought over the pot containing the soup and poured in a generous amount. Delicious!For dessert, soufflé was excellent. Because we were celebrating our anniversary, our server also brought a chocolate mousse with a decorated plate for the occasion. Again, delicious.My only negative was we felt a bit pressured on the up sells. Did I want more wine, did we want 2 desserts, did we want additional sides... I was told there was a very small amount of potato with my dinner, but in reality it would have been more than sufficient. Instead, I ordered the potato fingerlets--like fried mashed potato sticks. These were fine, but didn't seem to fit the ambience. We also ordered the mushroom spaetzle which was terrific. I should add there was plenty of bread offered. Phenomenal baguettes!Definitely recommend booking through open table, at a 5 or 5:15 reservation which guarantees a window table. We overlooked the bellagio fountains and watched the sun set over the mountains. Just perfect. Well worth the splurge!

doc.title: The views are to die for!!
doc.review: We booked this on arrival at Paris and hoped we would get lucky and get a window seat with a view. WOW what a view! We had the best seats in the house, overlooking the fountains at Bellagio and great views of the strip. The food and wine was expensive, but hey, they can charge those prices for that view alone. Really enjoyed the whole experience of eating here. The service was top notch, as you would expect and the amuse bouche and sorbet cleaners were a nice touch.Be aware the dress code is strictly enforced, men must weat long pants and closed in shoes with socks.

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: We dined there recently and it exceeded our expectations. My husband called for reservations and told them we were celebrating our anniversary. When we arrived the hostess wished us a happy anniversary. When we arrived at our table there were rose petals strewn all over it. Our waiter congratulated us and thanked us for choosing the ETR. The service was attentive without being overbearing. The food was excellent. Many tried and true listings and some excellent unique offerings. The view of the Bellagio Fountains was beautiful. We had 5:15 reservations on a Saturday which is usually early for us but the hostess suggested we come early so that we would be assured of a window seat. I actually think in retrospect it was a very good choice because we were able to have a differnt view going from dusk to dark. I would deffinitely suggest this restaurant for anyone that likes fine dinning.

doc.title: OUTSTANDING !!!!
doc.review: I was in Vegas from Jan 18 - 21 combining business with pleasure. Took my wife here for an Anniversary celebration and WOW did we hit a jackpot here (in fact the only win I had all weekend LOL). When i made my reservation I told them we were celebrating our anniversary From the moment we arrived the staff made our night one to remember. Little things like rose petals on the table to a window seat overlooking the fountains at Bellagio were just the beginning. The menu was loaded with so many excellent choices, one hardly could make up one's mind. I had the Short Ribs (5 stars) my wife had the duck (5 more stars). Everything was well prepared and delicious. Our waiter Igor was very helpful in suggestions as we navigated the menu. He was extremely attentive, yet not annoying in fact the entire staff was first rate. I will definitely dine here again. Guys if you want to treat that special lady in your life take her here. As some else mentioned your first thought is that you are paying for the view, totally not the case the view is just a throw in, the FOOD and Service is the star. You have to go here once, I know I am going to go back.

doc.title: Lovely view but disappointed
doc.review: We booked this restaurant to see the view of the Bellagio lightshow at a window table for 3. I called and was told these seats were on a first come, first served basis so we need to arrive as close to 5pm when it opened as possible and we would have no problem. We arrived at 5.10pm and were told by the lady on the desk that unfortunately we could not have window seats as they have all gone. We weren't happy and when we were seated we noticed most of these window tables were for 2 so were were misled originally that there was ever a chance. The waiter Joseph was extremely courteous and helpful. The food was very expensive as I had anticipated but when I only ate half my chicken dish as it was ony warm when it arrived, it was taken away without anyone asking us all night how we enjoyed our food or was my meal to my liking when it was only half eaten. The lights were lovely but I could eat on Sydney Harbour waterfront on New Years Eve with the best light show in the world for less money and get the window seat I booked. I would not recommend this restaurant.

doc.title: Perfect Night
doc.review: Took my husband there for his 40th birthday and it was excellent. There was one small misunderstanding on our part when we each requested the surf as and add on to the truffle filet......it was no where close to 6oz on the tail, maybe with the claw (which is rubbery) and their lobster mixture underneath....other than that small piece everything was excellent!!! We had the scallops and cocktail shrimp for apps, which the scallops were fanominal!! We both had filets which were outstanding! And for dessert we tried the chocolate souffle and Creme Brûlée, which the Creme Brûlée was so awesome.....best ever!We had a view of the fountain and our picture came out great! He had a great birthday.Initially I had reservations at Gordon Ramsey's Steakhouse, but after all the not so raving reviews I looked around and am so happy we moved the reservation to here! Would totally go back!!

doc.title: Better than I thought, quite a relief
doc.review: We booked the ETR for our final night in Vegas. We were slightly apprehensive that we were falling into a tacky tourist trap. After all, it is a restaurant in a fake Eiffel tower in the middle of Las Vegas. You can't get more novelty factor than that. The prices are mid to high range (for us), and we thought it was probably purely due to the location rather than the quality of the restaurant. But we figured it would be fun. We booked the restaurant while on the casino floor. The lady at the ETR podium was a little crazy but good fun. We spent a little time explaining we were from near London, and also from England. After that hurdle, she was keen to find out all about Prince Harry.Upon arriving for our meal, we asked for a window seat and explained we didn't mind waiting. The Hostess told us to grab a drink and she would get us when a table was available. Perfect. The table we had was fantastic! right in the middle of the fountains overlooking the strip. The waiter was slightly intense, but very professional. The wine list is one of the longest I've ever browsed. It's almost ridiculous. But I'm sure you can get exactly what you want, regardless of who particular you may be. The whole experience was lovely, but the the food exceeded our expectations by the long way. It helps that the menu was to my liking, but the execution was just perfect. My girlfriend had the Salmon, and i had the lamb rack. Both were a step above most restaurants. It seems they have not got caught up in trying to be too innovative, but deliver flawless classics. To finish we had the soufflés, which were also fantastic. I would recommend the ETR to anyone. I will be visiting again.

doc.title: Delicious
doc.review: Very upscale and delicious experience. Knowledgeable and experienced waitstaff. Attentive, yet helpful. Loved it!!

doc.title: A Great Night At The Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: This is part of a letter that we sent to the Manager of the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.Mr. Lyle,I just wanted to let you know that my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our last visit to the Eiffel Tower on 12/29/12 at 8:15. As always the food, wait staff and view were all magnificent. The Hostess we talked to at the host stand has a tremendous attitude, being both courteous and professional. When we first approached her, she ask about our preference of view and was quite charming in advising us of our options on waiting and approximate length of wait.I would like to commend you on your leadership of the restaurant. The changes that we saw this time really made our dining experience a five star event. Thank you.....Sincerely,

doc.title: Never dissapointed with this place
doc.review: Again, lovely dinner overlooking the Bellagio's.. you cannot ask for anything more Vegas. Highlight was the filet mignon with seared foie gras over a nice brioche.... Impeccable service as always.

doc.title: Great drinks with a view...
doc.review: Enjoy dinner or drinks with a great view of the Bellagio fountains, the view from atop the tower makes the show even more spectacular to watch... While eating or drinking I may add!

doc.title: Good view a must !!!
doc.review: We booked the Eiffel Tower later in the evening after a show, it was busy when we arrived but as our booking was for 9.30 we were asked if we wanted to wait til 10 for a window view seat. The food was lovely and the service was great, the table in the advert is the prime table but there are a few other nice tables with excellent views, we got one of these. It was expensive for our pocket, probably spent £160 for 2 meal mains plus bottle of wine. Seeing the fountains while munching into my Beef Wellington definately made the experience more memorable though and for me made the costly dinner worthwhile !! Without a view though I would have been disappointed!

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant Las Vegas
doc.review: The food and service here were fantastic, the waitress we had on the day was so good and very friendly. The food was magnificent, loved it.

doc.title: Mehhh
doc.review: I booked dinner for our family here Christmas Eve. We wanted something nice, but also a Vegas thing, so this restaurant seemed like the thing to do. The ambiance is very nice, great views of the Bellagio Fountains, and the Strip. Decor is very nice as well. Our food was very good and very french. My partner, being from France, said his plate was exactly what he ate at home for Christmas, and he said it was delicious. I tried it, but did not love the polenta, thought it was very bland. I dont eat meat so I didnt try his lambchops, but he said they were great. For appetizers I had the blue cheese mouse, which was FENOMENAL. As a main dish I had the salmon, which was good, but did not come with any sides. I ordered some potato things as a side and my partner ordered another thing......they were both something out of Denny's......fried, over creamy, fatty........nothing to do with the upscale menu of the restaruant. My son had a kids meal.....great that they have kids meals at a place like this........chicken and fries. It was, well, a kids meal. Wine selection was great, but of course, be prepared to pay 15 dollars for a glass of wine. Our bill for 2 adults and one child was $250 dollars with no dessert, and 3 glasses of wine. If you look past the setting and ambiance, this is just a place with overpriced good food. In New York or even Vegas, you can find better food at more reasonable prices. We had a good time here, and I would say it was a good pick for Christmas Eve, but I would not return.

doc.title: Superb!
doc.review: Fantastic service, gorgeous view, reasonably priced and delicious food! I highly recommend the Eiffel Tower restaurant!

doc.title: Eiffel Tower
doc.review: Nice view of the Bellagio fountains and they supply informal diners with a decent dinner jacket. Hated the foam on the food that looks like frog spawn. I have had better food.

doc.title: Best dining experience I've ever had!
doc.review: The view! The service! The food - wow!! Table for two along the window, watching the Bellagio fountain show and happenings on the strip - attentive but not annoying waiter, fantastic martini!! Even better meal - I had the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the lamb, which was succulent. Absolutely amazing flavor. If they are serving the Spaetzel, order it - fantastic!!

doc.title: Nothing's too good for my Baby
doc.review: Took my wife here to celebrate her birthday. Booked in afternoon at lift entrance,told them it was a Birthday suprise and would be back at 7pm. arrived ,best table in the place overlooking Hotel Bellagio fountains. The meal was superb and the staff could'nt do enough for us. they also make a great vodka bloodymary. We must have seen every variation of the waterfall displays that evening as we weren't rushed. Highly Recommended.

doc.title: Perfect romantic dinner
doc.review: I surprised my fiance with dinner and a show in Vegas, and set the entire event up via email. The staff at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was superb. We had a perfect table at the window directly across from the Bellagio Fountains, rose petals on the table, a dozen roses and a special birthday cake. The food (we had the salmon) was fantastic (albeit pricey) and the evening was better than I had imagined. Our server (Lee) was a polished professional and made our time there enjoyable and memorable.

doc.title: Put this on your bucket list
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower restaurant is an experience not to be missed in Vegas. You take a short elevator ride to a restaurant that overlooks the Bellagio water show. Hold out for a table next to the window. It is worth the wait. This is a very romantic restaurant that has an excellent bar and the food was wonderful. We both had filet mignon with sides of mushrooms and au gratin potatoes. The confused our steak order so it took a few minutes longer to get our meal but the waiter gave us complimentary dessert so all was forgiven. Although you have to donate a kidney to pay for this meal, it is one of the great dining experiences in Vegas.

doc.title: Incredible evening
doc.review: We booked this restaurant for our wedding dinner as we were getting married in Vegas. I emailed in advance and asked for a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains. From the moment we walked in we knew it was going to be a special evening. They had given us the best table in the house and wow, the view was amazing. We decided to go for the sampler menu which was $110 per person. Everything about this restaurant is first class and we could not fault it. The service was incredible, the food exquisite and the views to die for. We were not rushed to leave the table and ended up sitting there for 3 hours. If you are looking for romance or even to treat the one you love, this is the place to go in Vegas.Thank you for a truly memorable evening which will stay with us forever!

doc.title: As always, superb!
doc.review: However, wish they had kept the "bar" menu which made eating less expensively a very attractive option.The bartenders are SO attentive and eating at the bar is actually often more fun than a formal table.It's a Must Do for every trip but that one little "tweek" was disappointing.

doc.title: Best meal in Las Vegas
doc.review: I was in Vegas for 13 nights Dec/Jan 2013. The meal I had at this restaurant was by far the best. I did not frequent the buffets as is the norm in Vegas. I ate at the Verandah, Charlie Parker's, etc.

doc.title: Incredible view of the Bellagio Fountains
doc.review: We booked a dinner to celebrate getting married at sunset. We were seated in front of the Bellagio water fountains and the view was beautiful. The food was fantastic as was the service. Very romantic atmosphere.

doc.title: Wonderful experience!
doc.review: The food was absolutely amazing!! It was pretty pricey but worth every penny. The steak was melt-in-your-mouth and sooo yummy!

doc.title: Beautiful Cocktails
doc.review: Went up to the restaurant for a cocktail. The staff were fantastic and the view was spectacular. Had a Cosmopolitan and my mum had a piña colada which tasted lovely. Well worth a visit.

doc.title: Gorgeious view and delicious food...what more could you ask for?
doc.review: We ate at this restaurant after a 45 minute wait (my only complaint, but in fairness it was a weekend) and we did have a reservation, but we enjoyed a lovely custom made cocktail with fresh berries in it (sorry I can't remember the name) but it was a great start to what was to be an amazing meal! After sipping our drinks and enjoying the Bellagio water show (directly across the street) we were seated at a cozy romantic table for two right at the window with a front row view of the water show. The delicacies were scrumptious and the soufflé dessert...to die for! Highly recommend it...a little slice of Paris, right here in Vegas!

doc.title: Engagement celebrations
doc.review: We ate at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant the night of our engagement - it was a wonderful night. The food - albeit wifey-to-be didn't really eat much (!) - was exceptional, with the steak a particular highlight. We paid for roses at the table and were given a view immediately overlooking the Bellagio - which made it all the more special.

doc.title: Wow wow wow!
doc.review: We went to the restaurant 4th Jan for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. Prior to going I emailed Lyle Tolhurst and asked if we could have the corner table overlooking the bellagio fountains to celebrate his birthday. I never expected we'd get it as it was very busy. We arrived and from start to finish were treated like royalty and we got the corner tsble with the best view. We had rose petals on the table and complimentary courses from the chef . The food and service was superb! Our waiter and Lyle were fantastic. You have to visit this restaurant if you visit vegas.we had a wonderful time thank you

doc.title: Amazing view, decent food
doc.review: We ate here on our wedding day, we didn’t actually tell the restaurant as we wanted to just have a great meal and enjoy the view. The restaurant delivered.The elevator does open out to a corridor by the kitchen, so you can see the chefs at work, which I think shows a confidence about the place. The restaurant is quite a big space, was clean and does truly have a wonderful view.We arrived early as we wanted to see the restaurant and make sure we got a table on time, so we let the host know we had arrived and she checked our reservation and agreed to get us at the bar. Bang on 8:30 she came and got us as promised. Great start.We got a table for two up against the glass which was what we wanted, the restaurant has an awesome view. There are only tables of two up near the windows, but the rest of the place is on levels, so from what I can tell you should get a view from anywhere. The waiter was friendly and very knowledgeable, drinks or rolls were always on offer for refills, was a great service experience. First we were given an amuse bouche which was cream of cauliflower, which was nice and a bread of our choice, a solid selection. For starter I had the blue cheese soufflé which was excellent, the cheese not as overpowering as I was expecting, which made it seem nicer. My wife had mushroom soup, which was also very tasty, two fantastic starters. For my main I had the Beef Wellington and my wife had the salmon. We also ordered a creamed spinach and potato gratin. Now the Beef was fantastic, I would honestly say it was one of the nicest meals I’ve had. The salmon was also very good both well worth having. Still I’d have the beef any time, and when I’m next in town, I’ll be booking this restaurant, and I’ll be having wellington. We didn’t actually eat both the sides, I thought the Gratin could’ve come out hotter, that is the only negative aspect of our meal. It was very nice tasting though, it was very rich which is another reason, why we didn’t finish it. The creamed spinach was also very good, also quite rich, but did taste exquisite. After the meal we were to full for dessert, so I can’t really say what they’re like, we were given a little chocolate treat after the meal, which was very nice. The bill for us which was 2 starters 2 mains a coke and bottle of coke plus a tip was $200, and to be honest I thought the meal and the overall dining experience justified that cost. We’ll definitely head back to the Eiffel tower restaurant next time we’re in town.

doc.title: Eat downstairs instead!
doc.review: The view is the only good thing you can say about this restaurant. You are herded through since this is one of the biggest tourist traps in Vegas. Food is mediocre and they can't wait to turn your table. Eat at their sister restaurant downstairs instead. EVERYTHING is great! If there is a wait, go through the place and eat at the front bar. Same view, just lower.

doc.title: not touristy - a seriously good restaurant with great views and great food
doc.review: we had a 5 course degustation here with views of the strip and bellagio fountain. service was top notch and the food was excellent too. Good as was mid level pricing too. we wandered in late and still got served no hassles at 10pm

doc.title: Wonderful Time
doc.review: We had brunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on Christmas Day, 2012. It was just a fabulous time and the food was wonderful. The view over the Bellagio Fountains was just breath taking. I recommend going at night because the fountains don't start until 3 pm. The view is beautiful but once the fountains start the experience takes on an entirely different feel. The French Toast was too die for. The only thing I didn't understand was the dress code. We dressed up for the occasion but a few others were in torn jeans. Thought the other diners should have followed the set rules. But I guess there wasn't much the staff could do. I did appreciate the nice photographer that came around and took our picture. Usually don't go for those but she let us see the picture and it was a really nice shot with the Bellagio and fountains in the background. It was the best deal in town at $10. One last mention the staff are just incredible. Never had better!

doc.title: Truly amazing restaurant for a special occasion!
doc.review: My husband and I travel to Vegas at least once a month for the past 10 years. We have eaten in many restaurants and when we came here to get married we chose this restaurant for our wedding reception,so that says a lot! Yes it's expensive but the quality of the service,food and location matches this. The staff from booking the venue to choosing menus were top notch and nothing was too much to ask for. We go back here for a drink in the bar each time we come and they always remember us. It's simply brilliant and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Vegas. There events team are great for a larger event also. Enjoy!

doc.title: Pricey but a wonderful meal
doc.review: We enjoyed not only the food, but the view was spectacular. As we dined we watched the fountains at the Bellagio :) Our meals were cooked to perfection. Very attentive service. Loved that we entered through the kitchen...it was spotless!!!! Would definitely return.

doc.title: Spectacular Las Vegas experience- one of the best meals ever
doc.review: The setting is amazing in the Eiffel Tower in Paris Casino. We had the perfect corner window table elevated above the Bellagio- with a fountain show every fifteen minutes! Attentive service, wonderful cocktails and the food was perfection. All the food was great- just save room for one of the souffles. Will dream about this meal for a long time!

doc.title: An afternoon in Paris, Las Vegas style
doc.review: We celebrate New Year's Day here. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The food was amazing and the service even better. Hopefully, you will be lucky enough to be served by Todd. Happy New Year!

doc.title: Great, except for one thing
doc.review: Dned here Christmas Eve 2012. Elegant place, upscale food, excellent service. They say they have a dress code- it fact, they let anybody in who has a pulse and money. Harry the hobo and his family dined right behind me-they should draw the line a torn jeans and tshirts. I bet Steve Wynn wouldn't let just anyone in his elegant restaurants. The view was spectacular.

doc.title: Stunning in every way
doc.review: There are so many choices in Vegas. We chose this restaurant because we were staying at the Bellagio and Paris is right opposite so we wanted to view the 'dancing fountains. Did not have reservations. We had very good cocktails at the bar and they found us a window table in 20 minutes. Stunning and romantic views. Exceptional service. We tried the tasting menu with pairing wines. Each one of the 6 courses were superb and we liked 4 of the 5 pairing wines.

doc.title: Expensive but So Worth It!
doc.review: We loved this place! Our dinner was wonderful. It was pricy but you're in Vegas and they do make a wonderful steak! The view is breathtaking. I would recommended getting there early and checking in to make sure you can get a seat along the windows facing the Bellagio fountains, especially if you have a group of 4 like we did. We only made reservations 2 days in advance but had an early dinner because of this. I have to say that we were very pleased with the service as well. The wait staff was very attentive and took great care of us including educating us about the city and knew the menu very well. Highly recommended!!

doc.title: Experience GREAT!, food hit and miss
doc.review: I recommend this restaurant for the experience of fine dining. Our wait staff did a wonderful job of catering to us and it is fun to enjoy the service and atmosphere.The wine selection is what you would expect in this type of place - but the prices were higher than most. We are wine drinkers and their list, while impressive, leaves little option for those who don't want to blow their budget on drink. But you can enjoy some great wines if you are willing to drop some $$$$. We enjoyed all our selections very much and the staff is well versed in the options.The Cold Pate and Creamed Spinach with mushroom are out of this world. The salads were just OK - we had both the Mixed and Ceaser. The Pheasant is good but nothing special to recommend. We did have the Chocolate Souffle and were not disappointed.If you have the budget and the time I think it is worth a trip for the experience since you don't find many restaurants like this anymore. You may think the food beyond belief - as it is always a matter of taste.

doc.title: Fun experience. Amazing view and food
doc.review: This is the kind of place you go once. But it's worth it. Loved the view of the Bellagio Fountains. Food was incredible. The Mushroom Soup and the Pate were surely made by unicorns and angels with golden wings. Simply superb. The place is a bit noisy but hey it's Vegas. And would be a great place for a romantic dinner. I can't imagine that they don't have a couple of engagements a night there. Funny sidebar - we had a great waiter. Loved him. He told us his name was Rene. But he talked like a guy named Bob from Omaha. HA! Surely they use "stage" names ala Disney! Nevertheless he was excellent. Note - pricey experience but hey - you live only once!

doc.title: Best restaurant in Vegas (or at least out of the ones I visited)
doc.review: Everything about this restaurant from the moment we entered to the moment we left was pure class. it is expensive even on London based standards but I think it was well worth it. My friend is a veggie and I even had food envy of her dishes. The staff were attentive and well groomed. They were knowledgeable about both the dishes and the wines. My friends and I had a great evening. Ask for a table near the window, as the views of the fountains are just amazing.

doc.title: Pricey and lacking service
doc.review: We chose this restaurant to celebrate our father´s 60th birthday, so we made our reservation online and requested (if possible) a view due to our celebration.When we arrived to the restaurant it was crowded and the hostess was not very polite. We had to wait for over 15 minutes for our table to be ready which was annoying since there was no place to be seated .On the bright side they did give us "special" seating at the window right infront of the Bellagio fountains.Since the moment we arrived we felt the waiter "pushed" us toward choosing the most expensive items on the menu...Service was also slow, it took forever to get our drinks on the first place and we never got them refilled.Food was good, but not great. I've had way better meals for less money. Be ready to spend more than $100 dlls per person, plus drinks and gratuities.

doc.title: Not the place to go if you have allergies
doc.review: My son and I had high expectations for this restaurant reading Tripadvisor reviews. The meet and greet was a bit perfunctory and we were told to sit at the bar until the table was ready. My son didn't have time to get a drink before we were summonsed to the table. It was an excellent spot to see the Bellagio Fountains but the table was cramped and we were cheek to jowl with the couples sitting either side. I made it known I had gluten and alcohol allergies and asked for advice on what I may eat from the menu. I felt I was putting my server out by asking this question. He was very brusque and unhelpful and grudgingly found out what I may have. The meal was passable but certainly not worth the $200+ price tag (without alcoholic drinks remember). Presentation was poor (my son's boeuf Wellington looked like a steak pie!) and we were made to feel rushed (we were dining early because we were seeing a show) presumably so they could fit one one else in. Sorry, but I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone!

doc.title: An expensive experience!
doc.review: I chose Eiffel Tower Restaurant for the view..which is amazing over the Bellagio Fountain. But seriously, the food is average and whilst the service is very good (there are more waiters than any other restaurant I have eaten at) there are so many people eating here, it is hard to feel special. The food is some of the most expensive I have ever encountered. When you are paying $60+ for a steak, you are crazy or have won big time on the pokies down stairs. Not to mention the compulsory 18% gratuity which was added to the bill without notification. If you want great food, try a place without a view...that is the golden rule. By the way, there is an attendant in the restrooms who expects a tip.

doc.title: Outstanding
doc.review: One of the greatest restaurants I've ever been to. Pricey but it's worth it! The view it's just spectacular, the meal unbelievable, the atmosphere, the music, the service, even the bread it's great. Definitely the right place to a special moment with your lady.

doc.title: After the wedding....splurge .....
doc.review: We chose romantic Eiffel for our after the chapel celebration...for four. We had a table overlooking the Bellaggio fountains and the service was outstanding. ( Reminded me of how disappointing was Todd English' restaurant in NYC a few months ago)--this dinner was as memorable as the real Paris last New Year's Eve!!!! I highly recommend it to all couples in love or celebrating a special day!!! Totally loved$$$$$ it!!!

doc.title: Can't Stop Raving About This Place!
doc.review: One of the most impressive restaurant experiences I've had lately. From the food to the service to the impressive view of the strip and Bellagio's fountains, everything was superb. Plan on spending around $150 for a meal for two (with minimal alcohol). To me, the price is worth it. Spot on service from arrival to departure. It felt like we had a server for just us as he was very attentive. Food was 5 -Star....if I could give more, I would! The place was very busy as it was Christmas night and on such nights, I've experienced wait staff in bad moods (cause they had to work the holiday), slow kitchen staff, etc. The staff here made us feel like we were at there home for Christmas dinner.

doc.title: Outstanding Romantic Dining Experience
doc.review: My husband and I had one of the best dining experiences that rivals some of the best restaurants in the world. From the moment we arrived at our window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains the service was of sterling quality, and not overbearing or intimidating as can happen in some higher end restaurants. The service staff catered to all our needs without misssing a beat and was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. The food was very authentic French. We were impressed that the menu offered such variety. They were serving from the new Winter menu that included a stupendous mushroom soup and short ribs that melted in your mouth. The soufles are great.Even the cocktails were exceptional. We had a classic Old-Fashioned with 3 crushed cherries that can't compare to even the most well known bars. As a same sex couple we received the royal treatment in this most romantic of rooms with a view to rival Times Square. We were so moved by the experience that we had a romantic kiss while watching the dancing water fountains across the street. Defintely welcoming to LGBT couples.

doc.title: GREAT VISTAS
doc.review: I didn't find the food to be that great but WOW the view is awesome. They make some pretty good cocktails!! I found the service to be decent as well. Just don't go expecting a 5star experience.

This was by far our best dining experience in Vegas. The restaurant is beautiful, the service is impeccable, the view is unforgettable and the food is excellent and matches the standard of some of Paris' classical restaurants (I lived there for several years). Apart from the steaks I can also recommend the duck in foie gras sauce. Dessert is a must, chocolate soufflé, perfect for sharing. Main course, shared dessert, wine and coffee is about 100USD.

doc.title: Lovely but not amazing
doc.review: As my boyfriend and I were staying at Paris Casino we thought it would be nice to have a meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. While much of the casino is quite good at replicating major sites and designs of the real Paris, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant didn't quite manage to serve the type of food that you'd find at top restaurants in Paris or even in Adelaide, Australia, where I'm from. The food was nice enough but not amazing for the prices. The service was excellent though and the view of the Bellagio Fountains is spectacular.

doc.title: Best view on the strip
doc.review: This restaurant has it all. A spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains, great martini (and bartenders), awesome food and very professional but friendly staff. My fiancee treated me to a very romantic dinner on the last night of our holiday vacation. It was the perfect ending to a wonderful vacation.

doc.title: 3rd Time and She's Still A Bright Star on Vegas Blvd.
doc.review: We just dined for our 3rd time here. The food is spot on, but the service is what makes this the best dining option on the Strip. Yes, I said the service. Remember great service? Remember the kind of service you would kill to tip for? I am sure all of their staff is great, but we have always been indulged by John Paul DaLuz. And it has always been as great as great service can get. If he is busy ask to be sat with a lovely young lady named Allison. We watched her care of a table next to us and she was nothing short of perfect, as well.Like I said, the food is spot on French cuisine. The somelier Joe is an expert of pairing your meal with the perfect libation. Just tell him your price range and he is excite your palate. For an after dinner treat, maybe he will let you have some of the very rate PX sherry they have.If you are looking for the strip's best meal and magnificent view, then The Eiffel Tower is the place. All during dinner you are entertained by the dancing waters of the Bellagio fountains. They should be giving Bellagio some $$ for the entertainment. so get dressed up (there really isn't a dress code) and take your favorite gal out for the most romantic night on the town. BTW, when making your reservation, tell them it is a special romantic evening and ask for them to sprinkle rose pedals on the table. It is a free service and gals eat that up.

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: Visiting this restaurant tonight was without a doubt, the highlight of my trip.I've been fortunate to have visited some of the best restaurants around the globe and this place definetely deserves a spot high on my list. It is beautiful! Felt like I was dining somewhere in Paris. The view and the ambience are magnificient. Everyone was very polite and accomodating. The service was impecable and the food amazing nothing short of perfection. Such a memorable experience...

doc.title: Million dollar view.
doc.review: Our first time here! If you want great service and a million dollar view this is a place to be. But, Drinks were way over priced 2 drinks for $27.00 for less than top rail drinks. Our waiter we great and they didn't disappoint there. Food was great, but after a $200.00 + meal for 2? I expected a little more. Over all, give it a try they have many things on there menu that might impress.

doc.title: Another Memorable Evening!!!
doc.review: The last time we were in Vegas we had dinner here and it was one of the best we ever had. When we decided to go back to Vegas for a birthday and anniversary celebration it was no contest that we would not return for dinner. Again, the entire evening was outstanding!! Special thanks to David for the excellent wine choice and to Roman who could not do enough for us. We were greeted with smiling faces and by name when we arrived and seated as requested. Our meals of lamb and steak were perfect!! . Lyle, please pass on our thanks to the entire staff.....hope to see you again soon!

doc.title: Ok, but nothing special
doc.review: My husband and I love Vegas and regularly holiday here. This time we thought it would be nice to treat ourselves to dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant.Our table was lovely, with a knockout view of the strip and Bellagio fountains.Overall though, we were left disappointed with the food as we felt it didn't have the 5 star feel to it with the food being over seasoned and more style over substance.What particularly left us stunned was that when I pointed out to our waiter that my starter of Foie Gras roulade had been served to me still wrapped in Cling Film (saran wrap?) and that I'd inadvertently eaten some, his comment was (and I quote) 'oh well, anything served with Foie Gras is always tasty, even if it is plastic' We were totally gobsmacked as he made no offer of an apology whatsoever!Don't thing we'll be returning, which is a shame as this could and should be a top class restaurant.

doc.title: Atmosphere
doc.review: We had drinks at the bar, which were quite pricey, but worth the view and the great service. A very nice place I would save for a special occasion, but too much for us otherwise.

doc.title: Consistently Outstanding
doc.review: My friends and/or family and I eat at Eiffel at least three times a year, either for lunch or dinner. We have been going to the Eiffel for the last 8 years and it always a must when in Vegas.The wait staff is friendly and the service is impeccable. You cannot beat the beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountains. Definitely a great place to take anyone; always impressive.

doc.title: Charges like a 1st class restaurant, but sadly doesn't behave like one
doc.review: We visited as a special treat for my Husband's 30th Birthday. The food was good (not as good as the prices would suggest, but then you're supposed to be paying for an overall experience), and our personal waitress was lovely. However, another staff member clearly had three of her friends sat at the next table, and continually stood over us talking to them loudly about her plans for next week, whether she would have to work the next day, the discount she would be offering them, how they should visit her at her house on Tues, etc. etc. We put up with this for a good while as we didn't want to cause a fuss and her friends had already had dessert. Eventually though it became so distracting and noisy that my husband went to the manager to let him know what was happening. The manager agreed it was unacceptable and thanked my husband for the feedback. The situation only got worse as the restaurant emptied and the waitress was soon stood permently over us with her friends, who had long since finished their meal. We decided to hurry up and get the check as this was now very distracting and it was difficult to hold a conversation. Despite advising the manager of the problem, and the obvious way in which it had worsened, we were offered no discount. When I challenged this and objectively pointed out I was paying for a complete experience, which we had simply not had, he completely dismissed me and contradicted his previous comments to my husband by saying his staff member was clearly just having a good time, because 'this is Vegas'. Eventually he offered us $24 off a $374 bill for an evening we had not been allowed to experience properly. The restaurant, and particularly the manager, needs to rethink the way it conducts itself in the context of the prices it charges. We felt completely ripped off, disregarded and left feeling rather sad about the way the experience had turned out.

doc.title: oui oui
doc.review: The restaurant was loud, understaffed, service was poor, the food was mediocre at best, overpriced, there was no ambience, very disappointing

doc.title: Fantastic Experience
doc.review: The Eiffel was a great restaurant with tremendous food and excellent service. I know it gives the aura of being potentially cheesy, but it was quite the opposite. The food was delicious and the servers were mindful of our needed departure time for a show we were attending. We recommend reservations and that you try the Beef Wellington, fillet, and the soufflé with strawberry reduction. The view of the Bellagio fountains across the way certainly didn't hurt the ambiance.

doc.title: Amazing, authentic french.
doc.review: Read the reviews and took the plunge. Everything was first rate. Well worth a visit. From start to finish the evening was magnificent. Started with a warm friendly welcome, nice bubbles at the pleasant bar, table with outstanding views, fantastic food, quality wine menu and exceptional service. A truly authentic experience and up there with one of the best meals i have had. Upper end of the price scale but quality and true value for money.Delicious. On a final note I loved the service, not too in your face, not too pompus, just friendly and well pitched. Thank you very much folks. Do not hesitate. if you love food treat yourself to a visit.

doc.title: Fantastic
doc.review: I dined here wi my family, 2 kids and my wife. The food was everything we expected it to be. For a five star restaurant he meals were quite big and filling. We had a mixture of steak, salmon, fish and chicken between the four of us. For desert we had the house speciality - soufflé. Delicious. Add a great bottle of American wine for us and soft drinks for the kids, it as a great meal.Our table was against the glass windows overlooking the Bellagio. We were able to watch the fountain show several times from the restaurant, which was a treat.The service was second to none. Our water glasses were never more than half full, and our meals were attended to quickly and without issue.Overall a very good experience here. Highly recommend to all,even those with kids.

doc.title: Nice view, quite pleasant experience
doc.review: The restaurant offers views of the Belagio water show and the strip. Food is quite nice and the service attentive. Well worth a visit.

doc.title: Priceless!
doc.review: Party of 5. Called for a reservation for 7pm on tues night and we were given a fantastic view of the bellagio fountains. The service was great, food fantastic. Had the taster menu, filet, pheasant and chicken. We were all treated to two complimentary appetizers and they were amazing. Had the crab salad, mushroom soup, potatoes au gratin and green beans...amazing again. Souffle and apple turnover for dessert. Two thumbs up. Expensive? Definitely! However, we can honestly say our most memorable night. Over the course of a week of our stay we ate at Diablos, Stack, Julian Serrano, Mon Ami Gabi, Maggiano's, BLT burger and Fatburger. All really good for different reasons. Vegas really does have a wide variety of great food in all price ranges. I happened to pick 1/2 of my choices based on reviews from this site. They were fairly accurate to the overall rating. Some people are super picky or critical but the overall rating is the most important factor.

doc.title: Excellent experience - if you don't mind breaking the bank!
doc.review: You would be hard-pressed to write a bad review of this fabulous experience! Opulence abounds, mostly. The servers are performers and the view can't be beat. The food. The food is really really good, but not fantastic. For these prices, I want fantastic! I've had better caviar presentations other places and the overall flavors could be brighter. If you're a souffle fan you will not be disappointed. I am not, really, but enjoyed it none-the-less. Would I go again? Yes, but probably not for a complete meal....unless I'm into that third cocktail and someone says "please" :)

doc.title: Ridiculously overpriced and worth every penny!
doc.review: We had a reservation for 4 at 5:30 p.m. We were celebrating a birthday and going to see Jersey Boys at 8:15. We arrived about 10 minutes early and were seated promptly. Because the show was in the Paris showroom, we had plenty of time for dinner. Any later and we would have had to rush or skip dessert. If you are going to a show in another hotel, do the Eiffel Tower another night or go for lunch.Our party ordered a salad course, entree with sides and a dessert to share(not the souffle). We walked out of the restaurant at 7:45 p.m. 2 had the winter greens with roasted beets, 1 caeser salad and 1 mushroom soup. The winter greens and mushroom soup were outstanding. The caesar was described as"different". But no complaints were voiced. Entrees ordered were the filet with red wine sauce, venison chop, salmon, and beef wellington. Each one was expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The sides of scalloped potatoes, asparagus and green beans matched the quality of the entrees.Besides an complimentary chocolate mousse for our birthday girl (see other photos posted in previous reviews) we ordered the creme brulee. Fabulous ending to a memorable meal.The staff was exemplary. Several have noted that the hosts/hostess were rude or inefficient. We had placed a reservation several weeks before our trip and made mention of our show tickets/time. Since we were seated promptly, we had minimal contact with this part of the house. Our waiter was one of the best we have ever had. Quietly efficient and respectful. Seamless service of all courses. Charming. I so wish we had remembered his name. He deserves high praise. The other suppport staff was just as qualified. We haven't experienced such competent wait staff in years. Their training shines through.The one complaint from all four in our party was the lack of dress code enforcement. This venue deserves better. There is a desk at the elevator that could easily address the issue before patrons walk into the restaurant. We rarely spend this much on dinner. At these prices one does not want to be disappointed. The Eiffel Tower is memorable in every way. Enjoy the spectacular views, indulgent cuisine, and attentive staff. It is a worthy experience for all the senses.

doc.title: Most romantic dinner ever
doc.review: Just had the most romantic dinner ever with the love of my life at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris in Vegas...the window-side table viewing the Bellagio fountains was quiet and intimate which was perfect for our special dinner! The food was excellent and the service was nothing short of incredible! We will always be back to the Eiffel Tower every time we are in Vegas!

doc.title: Well worth it
doc.review: After trawling various Las Vegas restaurant web sites for my birthday treat we eventually picked the Eiffel Tower and we were not disappointed.There were four of us and as requested we had a clear view of the Bellagio fountains opposite.It was a busy night but we were shown straight to our table and given the menu and wine list.The food was ordered and the starters came pretty quickly, and were delicious. After about 10 minutes the waiter came and informed us of an accident in the kitchen and our mains had to be re done ,we were then presented with a course off the taster menu to tide us over by way of an apology from the chef.The mains came and again were fantastic, we were surprised however by the portions all being larger than expected.Dessert was Souffle for us all, again first class.Wine was a little on the expensive side but the quality of the food more than made up for it.As I had mentioned my birthday on booking another sweet course arrived for me beautifully presented followed by a variety of sorbets again complimentary.Staff were attentive and friendly, overall one of the best ever dinning experiences I have had.

doc.title: Food was blah, view was amazing.
doc.review: The only reason this restaurant gets anything above a 1 star is because of the view. We watched, from our table, the fountains at Bellagio throughout our entire lunch. I had the chicken sandwich. It was okay, but I make better at home. Boyfriend and sister-in-law's boyfriend had the BLT...I tried a bite, it was alright. Again, I make better at home. Sister-in-law had the burger...it looked tasty but I didn't try it. Chips were too greasy. Server was too pushy trying to get us to order higher ticket items. View was incredible. Prices were reasonable for lunch. I wouldn't go back for dinner.

doc.title: The Hosts Were A Total Fail
doc.review: We got to the restaurant about 5 minutes early and expected a short wait for our table. The hosts at the entrance to the elevator sent us right up. When we approached the hosts on the restaurant floor we were told that we would be seated closer to 8pm and to go set in the bar or in their waiting area. Didn't like the way they talked to us but OK. The proper way would've been to say your table isn't ready or were waiting for a window seat to open for you. A lot better way to tell your customer that there's going to be a wait. I rack this up to lack of training of the staff. While waiting we noticed that even though they have a dress code it isn't enforced. NOT EVEN CLOSE!!! There were people that came in dirty jeans, Tee shirts and pants that didn't come close to falling under their dress code. At 15 minutes after our reservation time and people that walked up were being seated I again went up to the host stand and asked about our table. I was told in an indigent tone that our table wasn't ready. I really dislike being talked down to by hosts. I told the three of them that I hoped that it would be soon otherwise I would be talking to the Manager and they weren't going to be happy with the outcome. We were seated within two minutes at a window table. Our waiter came up to us and said they had been waiting on us. Our table had been waiting for about 15 minutes. I had ordered Roses for my wife and had seen them delivered to the table.Once we were seated things changed 180 degrees. Our waiter was great!!! The food was great!!! and we had a great time!!! The fail with this night were the three young people that were acting as hosts on the restaurant floor. They need to be retrained. People that spend big money for a meal don't like to be talked down to.

doc.title: Eat downstairs.
doc.review: This restaurant is guilty of sex discrimination. My sister and I had made reservations and were assured that we'd have an excellent view of the fountains across the street. We were stuck at a table all the way down to the end, and sat for awhile watching couples be seated at the good tables. I spoke to the waiter, who called the maitre D and I asked him if we had to be men to get a good table. We were given a better table but the food was not good - the steak and lobster combo was $100. for the 2 of us and we didn't even get a whole lobster tail ! It was a tail sliced into halfs or possibly fourths. My advice is to avoid it - eat downstairs - the food was fabulous, the prices were reasonable, the ambiance is delightful and the servers were very pleasant and efficient.

doc.title: Excellent food and service
doc.review: Pricey! But food and service was amazing... Book ahead and be specific about wanting a window seat with a view of the strip!

doc.title: Spectactular View of the Strip!
doc.review: Very romantic view during the evening of the beautiful fountains of the Bellagio across the street. Excellent food and wine selection.Wait staff extremely attentive. we will be back again.

doc.title: Robertson Family Favorite OMG
doc.review: Best in Vegas. It is so easy to get a reservation, all the tables are nicely set up with the best view in Vegas. Everyone working there is 100% on the A game. My family and I love going here because the food is cooked perfect and everything they do to make sure your happy. Just when you think you you need a refill on your drink they are already doing it. It's like you have your personal server. Last time in it was my two kids and myself and the cost with tip was $400. Worth every dollar. We alsway have the Filet plus sides. If your a desert person, no question order a SouffleSide note: I have never seen kids in there. But I take my son and daughter twins age 10-1/2 and they dress up and the manors are great. Never had a problem. We go about 5 times a year.You get what you pay for here. TOP CLASS

doc.title: great food wonderful souffles.
doc.review: everything was excellent but, extremly over priced. ave app$54,entree $85 cocktails $18-30. the caramel souffle was worth $17.

doc.title: High quality service with exquisite dinner and wine, topped with a romantic atmosphere
doc.review: My boyfriend took me to the Eiffel Tower restaurant before watching The Jersey Boys and we LOVED this restaurant! Our waitress, Michelle, was great and our sommelier had a great sense of humor and very knowledgeable. Our dinner with wine were excellent and the romantic view of Bellagio fountains topped off the evening. Lyle introduced himself at the end of the evening, which we thought was really nice and adds that personalized touch. We would recommend this fine dining restaurant to anyone- you will not be disappointed :)

doc.title: delicious food
doc.review: amazing views, awesome service, the food was amazing, woudl def go back , on our next trip to las vegas. the menu was varied, and waiter staff very helpful

doc.title: 40th Birthday Celebration
doc.review: Absolutely amazing experience was had by all in our party of 11. We dined on Chef Joho's Seasonal Tasting menu which was divine, service was impeccable and the view was extraordinary. You must try the coffee martini to polish off a fabulous night!

doc.title: Mediocre for the price.
doc.review: We have had the pleasure of dining at several of the top restaurants in Las Vegas. For a change we wandered across the street to Paris and decided to check out the Eiffel Tower. The view across to the Bellagio is fantastic.....but that is the only thing that was excellent.We elected to do the Chef's Tasting Menu and while nothing was bad, there was also nothing that stood out as being truly fantastic. They were accommodating with a request to change a course which we appreciated. The service was also good, but not great. They are definitely not 5 star dining but yet still charge the same exorbitant prices. $600 for two is a bit much for an slightly above average dinner. For that kind of price we expect to be wow'ed like at Picasso, Cirque, SW, etc.
