doc.title: Delicious and expensive
doc.review: There were so many delicious appetizers on the menu that I ordered three of them instead of an entree. I would definitely order any one of them again. They were the cold foie gras, the pork belly (with French lentils), and the escargots and sweetbreads. Yummmm! My husband's salmon looked and tasted divine. I had two little girls with me, so they split the chicken. Even that was scrumptious. Yes, it is expensive, so budget accordingly. We were a party of 6 and managed to get away with a bill that was a little over 300 (we didn't drink). The view is nice; I wasn't blown away. The music (American jazz) was great. The main negative was that the waitstaff seemed oddly stressed (it was 2 in the afternoon). And our waitress only addressed me, not the two other men at the table with me. Odd. But, overall, wonderful.

doc.title: Impressed restaurant !
doc.review: I personally experienced many top restaurants in Las Vegas, and it was the first time I went to this restaurant to celebrate my partner's birthday.Like:- Good location: Located at the middle of Eiffel Tower of Paris Las Vegas. It is a unique location to have a romance dinner where we can look out the city at night. - Food: it is HAUNTE CUISINE means it is served in small courses. Honestly, I felt full after dinner at the restaurant. Foods are authentic and taste good. - Services: good services. Waiter and waitress are well-trained and professional. Unlike: - Price: You pay what you get. So obviously, it's expensive. If you are a budget traveller, don't consider this place. Totally, we paid $300 for dinner of 2. We had cocktail, appetizers, main courses and desert. I think it's worth ! Some tips:- Haute cuisine. Don't expect to be full :) - Dress up. Semi-formal and business attire - Make reservation to have a nice view - Expect to pay at least $100 per person for dinner - Cannot go wrong withToasted Salmon for main-course - Enjoy as much as possible !

doc.title: Enjoy a fantastic experience at Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: We had an impeccable experience shared with my family at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Greeted by the friendliest GM Lyle, fabulous drinks poured by Keith, exquisite service by our waiter Michael and staff, complimented with the tastiest dinner AND the most gorgeous view on the Las Vegas Strip watching the Bellagio Fountains = bliss! Thanks to all for a wonderful memory on a very special occasion. Wishing you much continued success.

doc.title: Wow.
doc.review: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been there twice now. The food is outstanding. The moment you step off the elevator your are greeted with a tray of appetizers. They always give you little extras. Take a look at the menu online. It's imaginative and varied. There's something for everyone.In addition to the food, the place had a great view of the Bellagio Fountains, and is just a place for a nice quiet, romantic dinner.Tip: make reservations for lunch. Lunch prices are significantly less than dinner. With a bottle of wine and tip, lunch was under $50 pp. Really a bargain for high end food.

doc.title: Good, Bad, awesome
doc.review: I have to say that this is the 3rd and last restaurant in our TRIPADVISOR RESTAURANT RECOMMENDATIONs tour of Vegas. Ok, first off, when you get there, ask for a window seat so you can see the Bellagio fountains. It may take a few extra minutes, but it is worth it. here is the biggest hint, if you arrive at least 30 minutes before your reservations, you can sit at the wonderful bar while you wait. The reason for doing this is that it almost assures you of getting a window table.I asked our server if it was possible to get a shrimp cocktail (not on the menu), not a problem, it was served chilled with the other salads. Bread is beinig served all the time, but don't fill up on it. My companion's filet w/ bernaise was wonderful. we shared the potatoes au gratin and green beans almondine. My steak however had a problem. I ordered medium, the deep inside of the steak (they are very thick), was on the rare side of medium rare. Simple fix, ask them to butterfly it for you, I am pretty sure they would.As our order was being taken, my companion ordered the Chocolate Mousse for dessert (30 minute prep time) that was being offered as a special. I went for the warm apple strudel. It took over an hour for these desserts to get to our table after we had finished out main course. That is unacceptable for any kitchen. Even before they came, our server had told us they were being comped due to the time involved. When they did get there, the chocolate mousse had mysteriously transfomed intsself into the the chocolate souffle and the warm apple strudel had cooked too long and a knife was necessary to cut through the bottom of the crust. The other bad thing is that while we were waiting for the dessert, I ordered an adult beverage. What I ordered and what what arrived were two different things. A food/drink runner brought it, I drank part of it, the server noticed it was the wrong one and comped the right on, which he brought forthwith. However, it was so strong I could not drink more than a sip.Overall, a great experience, would I go there again? Maybe.

doc.title: Scenic venue, great service
doc.review: We were at this restaurant for a special occasion on a Sunday night. The staff was very good from the bartender to the sommelier, who came up with an excellent choice for a hard to please and disparate taste group. Food was very good, prepared well and presented beautifully, with several imaginative choices. The venue is spectacular. Cost is moderate by East Coast standards.

doc.title: Romantic
doc.review: On our last day in Vegas we stopped by the reception area of the restaurant and a wonderful lady named Linda took us up in the elevator. My husband made reservations for us that evening immediately. We told them we were celebrating our 36th wedding anniversary and they gave us a beautiful table with an unobstructed view of the fountains. They even put rose petals on our table. Our waiter Iurie Trofim was extremely attentive. Our food was delicious and they even gave us a mini dessert with Happy Anniversary written on the plate. The most romantic place foe dinner in Las Vegas--it brought tears to my eyes!!

doc.title: Beautiful night sky
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower has been a long standing favority for lunch, the best drinks around for a late brunch! Located at the top of the Paris Hotel, it overlooks the Bellagio Fountains. This trip we went for dinner after seeing a show. The food was great and I like that you can order your entree and then a few sides to share at the table. The food is French and rich, so save your appetite to enjoy this experience.

doc.title: disappointing
doc.review: We were in Las vegas as part of a trip celebrating our anniversary. We went in the Paris hotel and looked at the menu for the restaurant. The lady offered to take us up and show us. The lift opens onto the working kitchen, which is interestinghaving taken in the view of the bellagio fountains and the strip we decided to book and asked for a window table. We were assured by the lady all table for 2 were at the window, but we couldnt book a specific table (we wanted the corner one)we arrived ten minutes early, it was chaos, the bar was busy it was noisy and raucous, just horrible. There were people waiting everywhere. we checked in and were told to go wait. there was no room at the bar and dozens of people waiting. there is absolutley no point expecting to get your table on time its just hit and misswe were standing getting jostled with about another 30 people, after waiting half hour we asked how much longer, to be told by a very unhelpful lady she didnt no and we just had to wait. Our table was booked for 8..we wanted 7.30 but there was no availibility. By 8.45 i had had anough of the noise and delay and was about to leave and go elswhere when we were seated....NOT at the windowthere was an empty window table opposite which we asked for to be told someone else had been waiting longer. they hadnt. We had specifically asked and been assured yet it seems that got ignoredThe food was good but we were fed up and wished we hadnt botheredThe wine was expensivewe had one course and left partly because it was an overal disappointment and partly because of the noise and partly as it was late and we wanted to see the brilliant duelling pianos on the bar downstairsI woudnt go back here, the waiter was very polite but the lady checking us in was rude. there is no system of order they dont stick to times and it was just a fiasco.on the way out we met a couple at the lift who had booked online months ago, they too had to wait nearly an hour and felt the food was ok but nothing special. the best thing about this restaurant is the view...and we didnt get the window

doc.title: Food is excellent but there is need of an attitude adjustment
doc.review: We have been frequent diners with the LEYE group for quite a while, most often dining at Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak and Stone Crab here in Las Vegas. Last evening we were guests of our daughter and her husband at Eiffel Tower. This was our third visit to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Despite my table request to the "could care less" staff person handling our check in at the restaurant we were seated in one of the more undesirable tables adjacent to the upper rail. Our server and her team did a very fine job and the food was excellent. The manager did not stop by our table until we asked the server if there was a manager on duty. The manager was not working the room in any way shape or form. He did not identify himself and came across as particularly snooty with a "could care less" attitude. He didn't give a whit if we were frequent diners or not or that our table request was totally disregarded. What a huge,huge difference between Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak and Stone Crab and the Eiffel Tower in so far as attitudes exist toward the restaurant patrons. For a quality organization, there is some real work needed at this location to bring the attitudes of every employee and management staff to the level of the great location and the outstanding food. Eiffel Tower clearly did not meet the level of our reasonable expectations and did not live up to the outstanding standards of the LEYE group of restaurants. Just a touch more of attention to the guest/patrons will make this restaurant the "real deal".

doc.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
doc.review: It would firstly be fair to say that we went to this restaurant on a Thursday night and we had not made reservations. Already thinking we wouldn’t get a table I asked the lady at the reservations desk if there was any availability for dinner at which point she smiled, said yes, and put us onto the elevator to take us up to the restaurant. When we arrived at the restaurant we were met by two other ladies who we gave our name to and were told to wait at the bar. After two drinks at the bar and a 45 minute wait, my partner checked with the lady that we gave our names to, how much longer the wait would be. She advised him that we were next. After waiting over an hour and watching other people being seated before us I approached the lady and explained that she had told my partner we were next however at least three other groups had been seated. It was only at this point that she decided to advise me that we were the next on the ‘waiting list’ and that we would only get seated if there was a cancellation or a no-show. It was at this point that I told her to take us off the list and we left the restaurant – no apology or remorse from the lady. Obviously the restaurant was fully booked and the lady downstairs should never have sent us up in the first place, or should have at least warned us. However the next two ladies that we met in the restaurant continued to keep us in the dark, uninformed and allowed us to wait at the bar for over an hour without a single word from them – even though they knew we might not even get a seat for dinner. I am extremely angry at the low level of customer service that this restaurant offers. I have been to many first class restaurants and could never imagine being treated so rudely as we were here. For such a high priced menu, I would expect first class service, unfortunately that was not offered and I am left with a very negative outlook towards this restaurant. Go to Gordon Ramsey’s restaurant Steak instead – they will at least tell you they are fully booked for the night!

doc.title: Excellent cocktail hour
doc.review: Prior to hosting a dinner down in Mon Ami Gabi, we held the cocktail hour in a private room at the restaurant. Traveling up the tower and seeing the sights was cool and you're greeted by the staff when you exit. But when you exit, you have a full view of the working kitchen. The views from above ar eoutstanding and the Bellagio's fountian show is special when viewed from this vantage point.

doc.title: Eiffel Restaurant -great food, service and view!!
doc.review: My wife and I dined at the Eiffel this past Saturday evening. I had booked the reservation two weeks earlier requesting a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains across the street. The restaurant was very very busy (Saturday night in Vegas no less!). Our reservation was for 6:30 pm and I had doubts about whether or not we would be seated on a timely basis as the bar was packed. We were promptly seated at 6:35 pm, which was very impressive! Our table was front and center looking over the fountains and down the strip with no one in front of us.Our waiter for the evening was John. He was excellent through the entire evening and answered all our questions.Started with a lobster salad and green salad which were very good.My wife and I both had filet mignon with two sides.My steak was excellent! My wife said her's was very good.The portions were of a good size for a fine dining establishment.The desserts were excellent as well.It is quite expensive but well worth the price for a special night out in Las Vegas. Our thanks to John and the rest of the staff for a great night out!!

doc.title: An evening to remember.
doc.review: The view, wow; the staff DOUBLE WOW! The FOOD - well, you must taste to believe. I love the special treat as you walk out of the elevator. Be sure to ask for a table with the Bellagio as the view. Our waiter had a special sense of humor. We had a wonderful time.

doc.title: Superb atmosphere and view for that unforgettable evening.
doc.review: OK, I don't know what it is like during the day, but at night this is the place to be to look at the Bellagio fountain, the lights of The Strip or the sparkle in your loved one's eyes.From the time the elevator doors open, you know this will be a special place. The place is immaculately clean, the service totally professional and the food wonderfully presented and delectable.This restaurant takes you completely away from smokey casinos and places you in a surreal position overlooking the Strip. We were paying for your view and ambience, so we enjoyed it thoroughly.

doc.title: Nice special occasion restaurant
doc.review: We decided to spurge one night while in Las Vegas, so we saw the Eiffel Tower restaurant at the Paris Hotel and decided to give it a try. Generally a very good, if expensive, experience. Luckily, we went early, about 6:30 pm, so we got a good table with a great view with no reservation and no wait. The nicest thing about the view is that it overlooks the Bellagio Hotel water show that that occurs every 15 minutes during the dinner hours. We decided to try the tasting menu with 6 small courses. Expensive, but tasted great and was well presented. With a half bottle of decent wine are bill was $300 plus for two. The service was pleasant and attentive,though somewhat overbearing at first to get you to buy expensive wine. Because of the cost, I wouldn't go here often, but for a special occasion with the view and the quality of the food it was worth a visit.

doc.title: Exceptional food, impeccable service
doc.review: We were very pleasantly surprised by the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Las Vegas. We went early in the evening and were seated near a window with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains. The decor was plush with a lot of red velvet and comfy booths. They started us with a tiny serving (amuse bouche) of chilled cream of cauliflower soup which was excellent. Next came a variety of breads that were offered repeatedly throughout the meal. No stinting here. We tried all 4 types of bread, and all were excellent. Our entrees (the salmon and roasted chicken) were delicious. Desserts were to die for in terms of both taste and presentation. The creme brulee came in a huge bowl with fresh berries. The chocolate hazelnut cake was equally beautiful. We were very impressed! Highly recommended.

doc.title: Excellent experience
doc.review: My new wife and I were in Vegas on our honeymoon and this was by far the best dining experience we had in our time in the city. The staff were attentive without being intrusive and the food was so good we didn't want the plates to empty. Although the prices were on the high end it was entirely justifiable, the view at the apex of the corner overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains was amazing.I was glad to see the collared shirt and jacket rule being enforced!

doc.title: Perfect wedding day lunch
doc.review: I wanted to try this place, but couldn't splash out on dinner. They do a great choice for lunch at very reasonable prices. The view during the day is wonderful, right opposite Bellagio and Ceasars Palace. I booked in advance and said it was a lunch before my wedding. The restaurant made an extra effort - reserving a great table and sprinkling with rose petals. The service was great and evn though we only had one course, we were not rushed and had time to enjoy a ladies lunch. I would love to return to try an evening meal on one of the window tables for 2. However, lunch is a great alternative if you just want to experience the view.

doc.title: very poor first impression....
doc.review: After reading all of the wonderful reviews and the restaurant website guaranteeing a window table for a 5 or 5:15 seating, we called to make a special booking for ourselves and our 2 daughters pre-show. The man who answered the phone was extremely rude and absolutely would not accommodate our request, even though it was for 5 pm on a Monday evening. We will not be dining here next week or any other time. We will hit Olives and see the fountains from there knowing we will be treated to great service and amazing food.

doc.title: Very good service and food but will cost you
doc.review: Ate there with my wife and the view, food and service was excellent. I recommend ordering off of the menu rather than the course special. Some of the items during the 6 course meal were very good others not to my liking. The souffles are a specialty and I recommend them, mine was delicious. This place will cost you some dollars so be prepared. You will need reservations. If you are combining this with a show for a night be aware that getting down after your meal (there is a single elevator) can take some time so allow for that when you plan your evening schedule.

doc.title: Outstandin With A View!
doc.review: Make a reservation and garner a window seat. View is outstanding and dinner is even better. Wait staff are Da Bomb! This is a must do in Vegas if you like fine dining.

doc.title: Romantic and flawless
doc.review: I went there with my husband to be to have a romantic evening. The wine was great, the filet mignon was Mmm mmm Good, cooked perfectly as I asked for it. It is worth the money big time. The view over the Bellagio itself is worth the money. There is a ride up an elevator from the casino to the restaurant. They truly kept the feel of the Eiffel Tower, yet, keeping it Vegas-y.LOVED IT! Be ready to spit money out for a worth while evening though. Beware of the budget because it is costly. I recommend it if you know what a real French restaurant is about.

doc.title: The most glorious place to be in Las Vegas
doc.review: Why haven't we come here sooner? Well, the price might be part of the issue, but his is definitely a "big deal- worth it" kind of place.The food is excellent. While I have been places with more inventive menus in New York, Paris, San Fran, etc., the food is nothing that you will make at home, all supurbly prepared. We had excellent short ribs and pheasant as the mains -- I love pheasant and it did not disappoint. Starters were more inventive, even the salads.The wine this is extensive and well-selected. It's not cheap, but I know my wines and it is fairly priced. The sommelier can offer excellent advice.There is a tasting menu option, but we passed this time. Maybe next time.Of course, a big reason to come here is the great view over the Bellagio fountains across the street, and te other lights of Las Vegas. Tables for two seem to have the best option for views right up at the window; larger tables are set across the aisle, but still have great views.Hot tip: there is a bar here where you can come for a drink (and maybe more?) but still get the great views without going for the expensive dinner. It is still not a cheap place, but will not set you back as much.

doc.title: Amazing birthday dinner with a view!
doc.review: Booked a 5.15pm seat for 4 by the windows for a special 30th birthday dinner. Wow, what a view of the fountains! Amazing service, beautiful food. The thing we were worried about was the dress code as we read that they kept trousers in reception if people didn't adhere to the dress code so we went mega smart. But we were disappointed to see people in there in jeans! But all in all, amazing food, generous portions. Expensive though, but you get what you pay for!

doc.title: NICE
doc.review: This is a nice "attraction". You will have to reserve - or WAIT for a window table. Otherwise you don't have much of a view. Prices reflect the "ambiance" with little food and taste for the cost. It is nice "impressive" place for a First Date.

doc.title: Beautiful night.
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated his birthday here and it was fabulous. Beautiful experience. We enjoyed the presentation of the food. The show outside the window was breathtaking.

doc.title: Spectacular but pretentious
doc.review: Despite my above comment I would still recommend this restaurant for a special occassion. The food was very good and the view of the fountains is something special! It was my mum and dads 40th wedding anniversary and it was simply the perfect setting. Our only negative comment was that after enjoying the happy American service throughout our trip it was a shock being hit with such a pompus French attitude. We were requested to sit down at our table as we were waiting in the bar but we were not aloud to add our bar drinks to our table tab, we were not aloud pay our bar bill untill we had our drinks, and we'd been waiting for our drinks to arrive for over 10 minutes but still getting attitude for not sitting at our table!? Were very confused! A lovely restaurant but dont expect the staff to smile at you.

doc.title: Best Dinner in Vegas
doc.review: I took my wife to the Eiffel Tower Restaraunt for a treat whil in Vegas on business. It is an absolute must. Get the tasting menu and you will never be disappointed. Chef Joho out did himself, the service is exemplary and the setting is impeccable. If you ever get the opportunity to dine here, take it.

doc.title: Expected better
doc.review: Stopped in on Friday night to have a drink at the bar. Absolutely impressed by the views and our bartender Keith. We decided to make a reservation for dinner Saturday. Host was friendly and helpful. Ran into Keith again and was given fabulous service at the bar. Our formal dinner server, was just ok. The reataurant was VERY busy so I can understand on occasion things may slip however, the whole meal was barely average. Shrimp cocktail was good although one shrimp was not deveined. Gross. And the $18 soup was removed from our bill when we asked whether it was supposed to be served cold. At that point, I honestly didn't know. The server made up a story about the new metal ladles used to pour table side and how the heat escaped at the top. I've worked in a couple of fine dining restaurants, your excuse was ridiculous. You should have freshly poured that right before it left the kitchen. I was convinced by the server to try the duck (probably because it was $10 more than the chicken I wanted) and when it arrived, it too wasn't hot, barely warm and was chewy. I didnt care for the rice bed it was on either. A true dissapointment. I didn't complain about that one, i just stopped eating it. I tried some of my husbands filet and that was actually really good! No one ever asked me how I liked my meal, only my wine. I hated not tipping the guy better but seriously, he didn't deserve it. I could see how typically the service would be better. Just not the great experience others have had. Disappointing. Keith the bartender should however be recognized. He was awesome! And would be the only reason to return.

doc.title: Great meal, fun location, awesome view!
doc.review: I have dined here several times and it is consistently good. The service was great and it was fun to watch the Belagio fountain from our window side table. I was a little disappointed with the Beef Welington. The pastry was great but the beef was not. That being said, everything else was good and I particularly liked the desert soufflé. It takes extra time so make sure to order it in advance. Also, request a window seat when you make your reservation.

doc.title: A must if you're looking for a romantic escape in Vegas!
doc.review: We went here for lunch on our last full day in Vegas. Seeing that we were a couple, they immediately sat us at a window that faced the Bellagio fountains. And although I could have simply just sat their watching the fountains all day, we were there to eat. And eat we did! The prices were reasonable, the service outstanding and the food incredible! From start to finish, I only have good things to say about this restaurant!

doc.title: Most amazing anniversary dinner!
doc.review: We celebrated our 13th wedding anniversary with dinner here and it was so worth it. We chose to take an early 5:00 reservation so we were guaranteed a window seat and we were nervous it would be too early. It ended up being perfect because at this time of year the sun sets at around 5:30 so we got to see that and then the beautiful Bellagio fountains in the dark. By the time we were finished it was around 7:00 and that gave us our whole evening to see a show etc. The food was exceptional! I had the filet mignon with red wine sauce and my husband had the rack of lamb. Both were unbelievably good. The restaurant brought us a complimentary dessert for our celebration but we still ordered the chocolate souflee too and it was amazing. We left feeling stuffed and totally satisfied! It was pricey for sure but as a special treat it was worth it.

doc.title: Very Romantic, great view !!!
doc.review: We had dinner here on our 7th aniversary and it was great, very romantic, perfect !!! Everything is so elegant from the moment you arrive and check in at the desk outside the elevator, then you go to the Restaurant floor and you can see the beautifull kitchen and then somebody will take you to your table. It is very dark inside but you can see all the lights from the city from the glass walls, our table was great, great view of the city and bellagios fountains, the food was delicious. Best dinner experience of our lives !!!

doc.title: When with Romin...
doc.review: We dined at Le Jules Verne earlier this year and made a point of visiting this restaurant on a recent getaway to Las Vegas... A "twofer" if you will.Our server had just returned from Paris and he assured us that his goal was to make our dining experience as memorable as that one in Paris. He delivered big time. There are many reasons why a single factor can make or break an evening. Our Server, Romin made the experience for us. He was everything that a professional is and does and his service was off the charts! The view of the Bellagio fountains was breath taking, The Food was impeccable~ We had the tasting menu with wine pairings. Our bill was approx $450.00 before tip. Would we return? Absolutely, If Romin is there to serve~ You need to clone him!Sadly there were guests wearing jeans and trying to carry in their own cocktails. Our Elevator attendant did a remarkable job in gently explaining protocol, Some people's kids,,, right!

doc.title: What we expected
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was as we expected it to be. It was quite good, but not overwhelmingly so. It was also quite expensive, but that has to be expected. They honored my table request when I made my reservation (a reservation fee is charged if you do not show up) and service was good, though somewhat in the "French Style." Meaning he was as personable as every Parisian waiter we have ever had, meaning, not very. I generally prefer that to down-homey over familiarity though. It was good. It was romantic. I am not sure I would go again, except for drinks.

doc.title: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas.....Always Elegant but Never Pretentious.
doc.review: While searching several years ago for a very special place to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday I turned to tripadvisor. Here, I first learned of the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. It was hard to miss with one glowing remark after another...each poster mentioning how helpful Lyle, the supervisor, was in securing just the right window table for their special occassion. I never would have dreamed that the supervisor of an establishment would take the time to contact me, but each poster assured me that Lyle was part of what makes the Eiffel Tower so successful. So I contacted Lyle full expecting my email to be passed along to someone in reservations. Not so! Lyle responded personally and made all the arrangements for our first visit. Much to my surprise, on the evening of our reservations, we were personally welcomed by Lyle who escorted us to our lovely window table scattered with red rose petals. The service was old world and elegant....the food beyond words. I realized then that I had stumbled upon something very special. We have made numerous trips back to the Eiffel Tower since our first visit two years ago. We are never disappointed in the romantic atmosphere, the professional service, and the delicious food. It is always elegant but never pretentious. Last evening we returned yet again to what has become our favorite spot in Vegas. We were welcomed by Lyle, who we now consider a friend we look forward to seeing. If you are searching for that very special place to celebrate one of your life's milestones while in Las Vegas, look no further. Lyle and his wonderful staff will insure that your special occasion will be an evening of romance and celebration.

doc.title: Could of done better
doc.review: I was really looking forward to visiting the restaurant for great food and great views. The views were pretty fantastic but the food was quite a let down. Each course was warm and lacked the quality finishing touches you'd expect. It was a busy night but when you're paying top money then you expect perfection I guess. The venue needs a tad more light and maybe not so much air con.

doc.title: Romance in The Tower
doc.review: Have dinner around 745pm and see the sun set and the fountains at the Bellagio. One of the most romantic spots to have dinner. Very relaxing and the staff are excellent. A splurge that is well worth the money.

doc.title: Perfect.
doc.review: Having seen the restaurant for our hotel room (The Cosmopolitan) across the strip we decided had to give it a try and weren't disappoint at any stage.We didn't have a reservation, but this didn't appear to be a problem. After a very short wait at the front desk on the casino floor, we were escorted to the restaurant floor, past the open plan kitchen and handed over to the table manager. The ambience of the place hits you straight away. It's fantastic and emulates a classy Parisian establishment to a tee, with excellent views over LVB and the fountains of the Bellagio.We were advised of a ten minute wait for a table so we opted for drinks at the bar. Excellent cocktails mixed by a pleasantly charming bar tender.Our original table was away from the huge windows, so I approached the Maitre D' and enquired as to the availability of a window table. This meant a slightly longer wait but was well worth it, and in the end we waited no longer than originally advised, and this was just enough time to have pre-dinner drinks at the bar anyway, so it never really felt as though we were kept waiting. The view from the semi-circular table, placed up against the balcony-style frontage was stunning - the Bellagio fountains to our right, the Casino Paris hot air balloon to our left. Perfect. And the lighting inside is just right so as to make the most of the night time view outside. No irritating reflections off the glass.The food was amazing. Simply can't fault it in any way. The menu wouldn't be a huge challenge for any skilled chef, but the critical difference is it was just superbly prepared. Classic dishes done extremely well.The service matched the cuisine, with even the manager stopping by our table to check everything was in order, and all the staff were attentive and enthusiastic without being intrusive.We weren't rushed, and by the end of our meal the first few chairs were being stacked as the restaurant wound down for the night. Anywhere else this might seem a little rude, but it fitted perfectly with the Parisian theme.Cost isn't prohibitive, and when set against other dinner options on the strip, the Eiffel Tower competes very well.This was a last minute choice for us - so glad we made the right decision. A fantastic dining experience, great for our honeymoon.

doc.title: Spectacular
doc.review: We ate here several years ago and had a fabulous experience. This time was equally as wonderful. We had a table overlooking the strip, and because of a movie being filmed, the fountains at the Bellagio were continuous. From the pear martini to the special tasting menu to the banana soufflé, everything was superb. The service was also memorable. Highly recommend!

doc.title: Just cheese and wine
doc.review: My wife and I swung up to see the Strip view and because the elevator operator was so accommodating, we decided to accommodate a cheese plate and some wine. The bar service was very helpful and we still had a decent view from the bar. Well worth the time and the price, at least for cheese and a couple of glasses of wine, was reasonable.

doc.title: Service from the time you walked in to the time you walked out!
doc.review: Top notch service, food and view. What a great way to see the view and fountain on your 40th Anniversary

doc.title: Perfect wedding dinner
doc.review: We reserved in advance when we knew we were going to Vegas to get married and we were not disappointed! We had a wonderful table overlooking the strip and the fountains at Bellagio! The cocktails were divine and the food was amazing from our starters, mushroom soup and lobster salad; to our entrees, steak and beef wellington; to dessert - the amazing chocolate souffle! Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairings and his recommendations were right on point. We were attended to well, including a visit from the manager, but it wasn't overbearing. Overall, a very worthwhile experience and we will definitely go back and recommend the restaurant to friends.

doc.title: RUDE
doc.review: If you want to waste $70 to be ignored, make way to this place. The staff is rude and could care less about customer satisfaction. The bartender was more interested in stocking than attending to customer's needs. When a manager was requested, it became apparent where the staff's attitude originated. Save your money and ride to the top of the tower for the pictures and atmosphere. The food was "Lean Cusine"-ish.

doc.title: Really Very Good
doc.review: I made reservations well in advance to ensure we had a window table for 2 for our 20th wedding anniversary. Window tables for 2 are only reservable for the 5pm or 5:15 seatings. When we gave our name the hostess acknowledged our anniversary - which was a nice touch. At end of the meal they brought us a special little mousse cup with happy anniversary written in chocolate (on the house). The view was gourgeous as was expected (directly across from Bellagio fountains). Food was very good - I remember commenting when I ate it, but I do not give the restaurant an "excellent" rating because less than a week later I can't really remember what I ordered. And for that kind of money I should still be raving about the meal, I can rave about the service - and the atmosphere and for a one shot special occaision definitely worth it.

doc.title: Romantic dinner
doc.review: Had a romantic dinner here. Many 2 top tables are against the windows which is great because you overlook the Bellagio fountains. Service was great. Food was very nice. Price is a bit high - but what's not in Vegas. In all, you definitely have to try it out for a nice romantic dinner.

doc.title: Make sure you book
doc.review: Friends recommended the Eiffel Tower Restaurant so we booked ahead which was absolutely necessary because they are always busy. When we arrived they didn't have a window seat as these tend to be kept for couples but we told them we were happy to wait at the bar until a table for 4 came up. 15 minutes later they had created one for us. We also had a very personalised service from the manager. Just be prepared for a very expensive bill for your meal and drinks but well worth it and a once in a lifetime experience. Enjoy. :)

doc.title: The best dining experience I've ever had!
doc.review: For a special lunch or dinner out, THIS IS THE PLACE!With easy access from the Strip, you take an elevator up to the restaurant, and the elevator doors open to the KITCHEN! You can see the chefs cooking and dressing up the plates. They like to surprise their guests with how proud they are of their kitchen and chefs, I was later told.My husband and I had lunch, and were celebrating my birthday. We ordered the lamb burger, and the seafood salad. Both were absolutely awesome. We shared each other's meals, and with the palate cleanser, the fluffy rolls they serve you, the very attentive service, the beautiful linens on the tables, the classy red Eiffel Tower plates waiting for you at your table, the fabulous views....it all added up to be a truly wonderful experience. We paid $18 for the lamb burger, and $26 for the seafood salad, which had a wonderful dressing, lobster, crab, shrimp, and various greens. I've never tasted anything like it! My diet pepsi was $6.00, and I had three refills (free)! We could see the Fountains at the Bellagio, and for the hour we were there, it was nice to see the dancing waters, people walking along the Strip, and the other hotels. It would be an awesome view at night. I would go back again, for a special occasion. I will never forget this restaurant!

doc.title: Excellent
doc.review: This restaurant was excellent. The wait staff were top notch. The view of the Bellagio Fountains were amazing.

doc.title: Tremendous Service
doc.review: My wife and I were in Las Vegas celebrating our 10th anniversary, and we chose the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our "fancy" dinner. I could not have been more impressed with the service we received. I contacted the manager of the restaurant, Lyle Tolhurst, a couple months ahead of time to request the primo "corner table" that directly overlooks the Bellagio fountains. He responded promptly and assured me they would do everything they could to impress us. Did they ever! He personally greeted us upon our arrival and offered us a complimentary photograph. We were then led to the corner table that I requested which was covered with rose pedals. Over the next couple hours, we were treated to a fantastic dining experience that included several complimentaries from Lyle. Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant. It was the perfect ending to a very special vacation.

doc.title: Second visit from the UK and still amazing!
doc.review: This is my second visit in as many years from the UK and its the best restaurant I've ever been to and probably won't be beaten. I was with five other guests who were all 1st timers and were going on my recommendation, so I hoped it was going to be just as good as my 1st visit. We had booked a table online before we jetted off and once we arrived everything was taken care of and our table was ready. Our waiter was amazing! He broke everything down into plain English and there was nothing he didn't know. The appetiser was a cauliflower cheese flavoured sauce in a shot glass which was divine. Then our starters arrived and I had the mushroom soup which was fresh mushrooms in an empty bowl and then came the waiter pouring over the soup flavourings !!! You have to try it. I never knew soup could be this good. My main was lamb which just fell of the bone and was so juicy you wouldn't believe!! Everyone had different mains and all enjoyed each one!! Now for the view... It's like a picture!! The location looking over the Bellagio and Cosmopolitan is breathtaking with full view of the fountains. If you go to Vegas, you HAVE to come here to try a meal and experience a setting you'll never get anywhere else.

doc.title: Wonderful meal,fantastic view, attentive service
doc.review: My husband and I recently visited Las Vegas and decided to celebrate our anniversary at Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Las Vegas. We were very impressed with the attentive service and wonderful meal presentations. Our view was terrific as we sat together facing a window overlooking the Bellagio and viewed 5 fountain shows (shows every half hour) just like the end of Oceans Eleven....we ordered lobster salad and escargot as our appetizers and I had the lamb and my husband the muscovy duck. So delicious and beautifully presented. We also split a wonderful Grand Marnier Souffle that was placed on a plate decorated with "Happy Anniversary" in chocolate. Lovely. The waiter and staff were very attentive and the Supervisor of the restaurant visited our table personally and asked about our meal. I would definitely return to Eiffel Tower on our next Vegas visit.

doc.title: Spectacular View and Disappointing Service
doc.review: This was our second visit to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We returned for the spectacular view of the Bellagio Fountains and service. The sea bass was ok- a bit salty and the filet mignon was good but served too cool. We had very disappointing service from a server named Carmen. She was very impersonal with no conversation. The tables next to us obviously had a much better experience and their waiters seemed friendly. We will probably not return again as we expect much better for a $200 meal. We did speak to a manager when we left. Overall- too expensive for the service and food we received.

doc.title: One of the best in Vegas, no question
doc.review: The view is amazing at the Eiffel Tower restaurant but the food is also some of the best in town. Get a seat next to the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and you will have the best seat in town.Service was excellent, I could not praise the staff highly enough, they should be proud of their amazing restaurant! I thought the food was very good, and very filling as well. The wine list is also extensive and has bottles ranging from around $40 up to sky-is-the-limit prices!A must visit in Las Vegas, reserve early and request a window seat.

doc.title: Excellent service
doc.review: The location of the restaurant accross from the Bellagio fountains is great. Even if you are unable to get a window seat the restaurant is tiered so you still have an incredible view. The cocktails and food were delicious. The service was impeccable. Expensive, but definitely worth it

doc.title: Thoroughly amused my bouche!
doc.review: Food Excellent! Cocktails Excellent! Service Great! View - out of this world! Got to watch the Bellagio fountains whilst dining. Order the steak, yum! Price, reasonable.Avoid after dinner coffee's at $8 each!

doc.title: Las Vegas Fine Dining At It's Best
doc.review: Took two of my best girls to this restaurant on a Vegas Girls Weekend and absolutely loved it. Bleu Cheese souffle' was the stand out, as was the sparkling wine we had. (Couldn't recall what brand, but the sommelier highly recommended it. It was pricy but every drop of it delicious. I easily could have ordered another bottle had my wallet allowed such an extravagance.) Steaks were perfection, the service impeccable and I would eat here again in a heartbeat. We found it incredibly ironic that we left this beautiful meal in this gorgeous setting and stepped immediately into a cab to head downtown to the diviest of Dive Bars off of Fremont and proceeded with what has to be the most diverse weekend of dining and partying ever. So fun.

doc.title: A wonderful and romantic dinner to remember!
doc.review: The food, view and service was perfect! We could see the Bellagio fountains and views of the strip from our table. We had wonderful cocktails at the bar before our meal. Our table for two at the window was great and our waiter was so friendly and personable. The food was scrumptious; pheasant and halibut was prepared beautifully!

doc.title: Wonderful but expensive
doc.review: The food and view of the bellagio fountains were wonderful but be prepared to pay through the nose for it. I had the salmon and it was fabulous, my husband had the sea bass and it was great. The friends we went with both had steak and thoroughly enjoyed it but be prepared to spend about $100 per person if you want a glass of wine with your dinner.

doc.title: Anniversary Dinner
doc.review: Excellent anniversary dinner, with great service, great food and a very good view. Worth the early reservations to get a window seat, overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the strip. Fairly expensive, but very good.

doc.title: Excellent Cuisine in Unique Setting
doc.review: The dishes were beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. It added up to a relaxing evening. I highly recommend The filet mignon with red wine sauce.The sorbets which were uniquely presented on a silver painter's palette were to die for.

doc.title: You get what you pay for
doc.review: Expensive, yes, very much so but they do cater to you and the food is completely fantastic. The view is awesome too. If you can afford it, you must go. Great time.

doc.title: A burger @ Paris Las Vegas
doc.review: A very last minute choice for Sunday lunch. Nice ride upto the the restaurant, no waiting and seated at probably the best seat with a view. Fast professional service, as you would expect. Quick drinks service. Server came with a comp amuse bouche cold mushroom soup, very nice, then the main course arrived, superb presentation, drinks topped up,no pudding for me but a complimentary petit four and the bill, all in all a very interesting and inexpensive meal at Paris Las Vegas in The Eiffel Tower. You also get a peek at the kitchens, you could lm sure eat your dinner from the floor they are so clean. to top it all, put $5 in the slots and won $62...

doc.title: Excellent Service
doc.review: This was our third time at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and truly enjoyed our experience. We had the best service of our lives (I think this name was JP) and enjoyed an excellent view. Our food was perfectly prepared from the entrees to the appetizers. We had a very negative experience the second time with a extremely rude waiter who was a jerk throughout so we are very happy that the third time was by far our best experience. We will always plan a trip to the ETR when in Las Vegas!

doc.title: Amazing views and great food
doc.review: We ordered the 5 course menu which was very good. But the main reason to have dinner in this restaurant is the view of the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: Average
doc.review: We didn't have a bad meal in Vegas but this was the worst. The food was very average and our bill was close to $300. The waiter was so prentious! The drinks weren't nearly as good as they were priced for. The view was great but we ate here the last night and by then, had seen the great view several days and nights in a row. Don't waste your money. There are so many great restaurants in Vegas. This isn't one of them.

doc.title: A must Dinner
doc.review: We go to Vegas 4-5 times every year and always include an Eiffel Tower stop. We're always able to get the table we want and the service, food, wine, cocktails and view of the Bellagio fountains are just perfect. Chef Joho is deserving of every accolade. They know how to treat their guests. The tasting menu and wine pairings are a great treat and are changed frequently, and do a brunch if $500 dinner is too much.

doc.title: Disappointed
doc.review: I visited on October 13th with my mother and her boyfriend to celebrate a birthday. We wanted the experience of dining in the "Eiffel Tower". I would recommend reviewing the menu before making a reservation. We were not expecting to spend over $125 per person. Disappointments: The elevator took us up to the restaurant. When the doors opened I didn't expect to see the kitchen. The interior design surrounding the kitchen space should be more inviting to the guests. When you walk around to the other side, the ambiance is very sophisticated. A glass of wine was approx. $20 and the serving size was much less then half of the glass, the beans almondine were tasteless, and the vegetarian crepe was not worth $32. I was very disappointed with the crepe. My mother and her boyfriend ordered the filet mignon. My mother's was very veiny and she was not happy but her boyfriend enjoyed his. The potato gratin was forgettable. The spinach and mushrooms were very good. I have no problem spending my money on a nice meal but this restaurant is over priced for the quality of the food. Overall: I'm glad we had the experience but probably would not go back. (The table next to us was complaining about the menu and cost.)

doc.title: Anniverasry-Birthday Celebration
doc.review: The food was just awesome, Sat right by the window looking down on the water show at the Bellagio and the Paris ball. Is was quite the experience. Although we found it a bit noisy at times, other wise highly recommend.

doc.title: So romantic!
doc.review: Chose this spot because of my love for Paris and the Effiel Tower. Pricey, but worth every penny. We had a glass of champagne while we waited for your table. We both had filet mignon, which was cooked to perfection, ordered the spinach and mushroom and green beans for sides....both were outstanding. Chocolate Soufflee was decadent and delicious....don't share it like we did. Get your own and enjoy every bite! We had reservations for 9:30, which enabled us to look out on the lights of the Vegas Strip and the Bellagio fountains. I am ready to go back!!!

doc.title: Overall, A Disappointing Dining Experience
doc.review: We had eaten at ETR six times previously and regarded each as a wonderfully enjoyable experience making this restaurant perhaps our favorite in Las Vegas. Our Sunday October 7th. dinner was such an unexpected disappointment. We arrived at ETR right on time for our reservation but despite seeing our table was ready for diners, the woman at the podium greeting and checking in customers kept us waiting while she seated three parties who had arrived after we did; the woman’s brusk and indifferent attitude bordered on being just plain rude. My companion had the quail appetizer and Autumn Greens salad, both of which he enjoyed. His entre was the rabbit which consisted of a loin, sausage and a mousse; he said the loin was okay but not special, the mousse kind of strange and the sausage terribly dry (to which the waiter said it looked very dry) and he did not eat much of it. I had the foie gras which was quite good and the surf and turf; the filet was pretty good but the lobster included a large amount of rather odd mousse which was not at all appetizing. Our chocolate desserts were super good and we were not charged for those, I suppose because I had ordered a fairly expensive wine.The wait staff did a truly attentive and efficient job. The restaurant can be very noisy and that perhaps lessens enjoyment of the ambiance and experience.Bottom line however is that for a dining tab of $$600 plus (before wine and tip) one would wish for more welcoming treatment from the podium lady and the quality of the entrees.

doc.title: Fantastic view and excellent food and service
doc.review: We had a lovely dinner for my husbands birthday, but the reception needs to be improved if they want to make this truly a destination. I was looking for the theatre as per the review, private glass elevator, opening into the kitchen et etc, what we got was cattled into the elevator with about 15 others than herded through the kitchen and left with a very flustered hostess who didn't appear to have a grasp of what was happening, there was a huge queue at the desk and about 30 people milling around' it felt more like ihop than a fine dining establishment (it also took 15 mins to get a drink at the bar whilst we waited for a table)Thankfully however after we were seated it turned around, lovely table for two right at the front with a direct view of the Bellagios fountains ( though I did make the reservation 6 months previous and did request the table) food was excellent as was the service, faultless and they even bought my husband a small birthday cake with his coffee which was a lovely touch . Id recommend the Restaurant for the view alone, the quality of food and service is an added bonus ( once you get past the reception desk)

doc.title: 50th Wedding Anniversary
doc.review: We planned to have our special anniversary dinner there because of previous dining experiences at the Eiffel tower Restaurant. We dined there on Oct 2, 2012 and were treated liked celebrities and had a wonderful meal. we were seated at a window table overlooking the fountains at the Belligio.My only disappointment was was the manager had his photographer take a picture for us promising to email it to us, but we never received the picture. We highly recommend this restaurant and will visit it again on our next visit to Las Vegas.

doc.title: Great dinner! Girl Weekend for Rod Stewart concert
doc.review: What a great dinner and sunset view overlooking the Bellagio fountains - 4 of us BFF were in Las Vegas for the Rod Stewart concert and we went for a pre concert dinner. I had been there in December 2010 for mine and my husband's honeymoon. The food was excellent, the service was excellent, the view, spectacular! We started with cocktails, mine and one of my friends had the Autumn in Paris - a vodka and pear puree drink, yum, it was so good! I am a big time pear lover and this was delicious. My other two friends had the Cosmopolitan and the Pink Lady (I believe that's what it was called.) They both were very impressed! Prior to ordering, the Chef sent out a cauliflower soup shot - oh, my it was tasty! Three of us began with the Maine Lobster salad, roasted butternut squash, wilted kale and old cider vinaigrette appetizer, the other the Blue cheese soufflé pudding, walnut, pecan, petite salad. The lobster salad was excellent, lobster cooked perfectly. Though I didn't taste, the blue cheese soufflé pudding was to die for from what my friend said. One of my friends and I shared the Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington - have seen it many times on Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen but had never had it before - the pastry surrounding the filet was flaky, and delicious, the filet perfectly cooked medium rare, just as we both liked. The other two had the charbroiled filet with béarnaise sauce - I was a little envious as I am a huge fan of béarnaise sauce. They both raved about how good they were - both cooked medium rare perfectly. The beef wellington was plenty for two especially since we also shared the Galette of Potato Anna side. The potato anna is sliced potatoes layered and roasted with duck fat. We skipped dessert as we were on a time schedule which we had informed our server before hand and without feeling rushed in the least were out by 6:30 - reservation at 5:00 - we were seated within 5 minutes. Not to mention the fact we were all very full! We have decided to make this an annual trip and no doubt, next year, we will be visiting the Eiffel Tower again! Superb dinner and well worth the cost excursion.

doc.title: Best Food EVER in the US
doc.review: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing view- loved it. Not cheap but if its exceptional food you are after while in Vegas, highly recommended.

doc.title: One of the best meals ever
doc.review: My wife and I visited on 9/27/2012 and fell absolutely in love with this restaurant. As the elevator doors opened we were presented with their immaculate kitchen. The hostess took us to our table overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains, what a view! I decided on the Alaskan King Crab with marinated melon balls and my wife had the Maine Lobster Salad, both arrived in a short time and were delicious. Our server was professional and had a great sense of humor. For our entrees, I had the Filet with lemon parsley butter and a side of Green Beans Almondine. She had the individual Beef Wellington. Again, the best fillet I have ever had and the Wellington was incredible. About this time the supervisor, Lyle, stopped by to say hi and ask if everything was ok. He handed us a business card and told us if we ever needed anything to contact him. Time for dessert. We both decided on the Creme Brulee. They arrived along with a complimentary selection of house sorbets that were incredible! My wife and I will definately visit every time we are in Vegas! Great customer service, great food!

doc.title: Great way to spend Anniversary!
doc.review: We made reservations on-line with Open Table before we headed to Vegas for our anniversary. We arrived early so we could see sunset. They greeted us with a "Happy Anniversary" and were told that they had a very nice table available right now if we wanted to sit right away. They brought us to the very best table in the house-the one seen on their ad on their website! It was amazing-to see everything as the sun was setting and watch all of the lights come on. We ordered from their drink specials menu and we had the surf and turf ($74!!) and Beef Wellington ($59) and the mushroom spaetzle ($10). We pre-ordered the chocolate souffle for dessert. You don't get a salad unless you order one, but they do come around with a big basket of 4 different types of bread to chose from. They do not rush you-which is so nice, so that you get to see the fountain show at the Bellagio. Our dinners were wonderful! And we were so full by the time our souffle showed up-but we managed to eat it!!! They also brought out a beautiful plate with a small cup of chocolate mousse with a sliver of choclate (with a picture of the Eiffel tower on it !). They had written "Happy Anniversary in chocolate around the plate. We did not have the photographer take our picture-instead we asked the folks at the table next to us to take our picture and we did the same for them. It was the most expensive dinner we had ever had ($250 with tip) but we don't regret it at all. It is truly the most romantic dinner we have ever had.

doc.title: What an array!
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and I dare say somehow got one of the best tables there, but it also looked like many people there could have that claim as well. Would absolutely recommend trying to get a table for two. That way you are more likely to get a table around the perimeter so you can look out the window. We sat looking out over the Bellagio Fountains and watched their show every half hour. We ordered the pre fixe menu which was well worth it - it went on forever and was absolutely incredible. Maybe too much actually. I had a hard time eating the dessert. Although this was expensive, I felt worth it as it really showcases the chefs talents. Drinks, on the other hand, were way too expensive I thought. We also indulged in having our picture taken and the photographer was nice enough to email it to me as well, which out surcharging me - which was nice since that was what I really wanted anyway.

doc.title: romantic dining experience
doc.review: If your looking for a quick meal this is not your place. Go their with your wife or significant other to "pop" the question or for your anniversary. Truly romantic setting with attentive wait staff. Food, wine dessert everything was spot on along with a view of the Bellagio fountains makes this a great dining experience.

doc.title: Have a Business Account
doc.review: Unless you can score a table with a view of the Bellagio fountains, I do not recommend this restaurant for dining with your personal funds. Instead, see if you can have a drink at the bar. At the end of the bar toward the fountains there is a high countertop with some high seats. Have a drink and watch the fountains, but be aware you can't hear a think, no booms, no music, no ahhhs...only the chatter in the restaurant. Three drinks, 2 house gins and a glass of wine ran $55, so even drinks aren't inexpensive.That said, this is a posh restaurant with a terrific view and you are paying for that as well.The wine list is extensive and varied, but in my mind very expensive. Prices start at about $70 with most in the lower range being in the low one hundred dollar range. This cost seems excessive to me, but they fill the room and get it.Our group of 3 started with mushroom soup which was enjoyed thoroughly and I had pork belly which was a small serving but very tasty - I can't opine further as this is the first time I tried it. The rack of lamb was nicely prepared although my companion felt it was a little on the rare side, that said, there wasn't a morsel on his plate when done. The fish fillet was typical and my guest wasn't overwhelmed. I had the farm raised chicken which was one of the lower cost entres on the menu and very good. Again, the serving size wasn't large, but it was adequate. We had two sides and they were night and day. One was potatoes gratin and the table enjoyed them - not my cup of tea due to the heavy cream and dense cheese. The asparagus was forgettable. In the day and age when most places serve vegetables al dente, these brought me back to the days of my grandmother cooking them until they were dead. There was no life in them and we should have said something, but didn't. I would return if on the Company dime again due to the view up and down the strip - we were seated far from being able to see the fountains, but I would not return if I had to pay out of my own pocket.

doc.title: Good restaurant...not great
doc.review: Was looking forward to a fine meal........the appetizer of $15 for what was really a sliced tomato did not get me off to a good start......but fortunately the meal and wine helped me overlook that little setback. The service was attentive, the view was nice, and the food was very good, but could stand some menu adjustments here and there. All in all, a good place, but not great.

doc.title: Beautiful!
doc.review: Romantic, great views, good food, good service, and expensive. We had a great view--having dinner looking down on the fountains makes this worth at least one trip.

doc.title: Tremendous food and view at a cost
doc.review: I will start out by saying this restaurant is quite expensive as our the top tier restaurants in las Vegas. It was worth every penny of our almost $400 tab. We went their to experience the best of Las Vegas, tremendous food, the view of Bellagio's Water show, and terrific service.We both had Filet that was served just as we had asked. The red wine sauce on my wife's steak was very tasty and the foie gras on mine was like butter. The appetizers were just as good and our waiter was attentive without being overbearing.When we are back in Vegas we will be returning.

doc.title: Second visit
doc.review: Went here in May of 2008 and got engaged. Just had to go back during our 2012 trip. Service is great and the food is even better. You cannot beat the atmosphere at this restaurant. Request a view of the fountains or a window seat, sometimes you have to wait a bit. Also, the souffle desserts are out of this world, but FYI, they take 30 minutes to cook so give yourself time to order.

doc.title: A Most Pleasant Evening
doc.review: The entire dining experience was, simply put, amazing. The food alone would have made it so. The ingredients were superb, fresh, bursting with natural flavor. From lettuce that actually tasted like lettuce should through the lamb, the potatoes, the green beans, everything was at its peak. And, as you would expect, everything prepared perfectly .... The natural flavors were enhanced, not masked. No over-powering sauces, no over-whelming herbs and spices .... The right preparation to maximize taste and consistency throughout the meal. The wine list was very well chosen, even the coffee was superb.Had that been all, it would have been more than enough. However, the service was attentive with no sense of hovering or intrusion. The view was spectacular. All memorable, in the most pleasant way.

doc.title: Great Dining With A View Of Bellagio Fountains
doc.review: A little pricey but the service was great, the food was great and a beautiful view of the bellagio fountains. This was truly a wonderful experience!

doc.title: Wonderful view and great food!
doc.review: My husband and I just went there last week and had a wonderful time! I made reservations for 7pm on a Thursday and was lucky to have my request for a window table confirmed. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains during dinner. There really isn't a bad seat there though. Our waiter was very pleasant and I thought the food was great. Definitely on the pricey side but worth it for the experience and atmosphere. Their smoked salmon appetizer and duck entree is delicious!

doc.title: Memorable Dining Experience
doc.review: Although I have read many trip advisor restaurant reviews, I have never taken the time to write a review. After thoroughly enjoying a wonderful evening at Eiffel Tower Restaurant, I felt compelled to share my experience. My wife and I were recently in Vegas to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I emailed the restaurant supervisor, Lyle Tolhurst, to request a great table with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Lyle took my request a step further and suggested that we come a little earlier than planned to also catch the great sunset over the strip. The entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our server, Michelle, was professional and knowledgable. We were impressed that she congratulated us on our anniversary when she first arrived at the table, and she never made us feel rushed. The food was fabulous and the atmosphere can not be matched. Pricey? Yes. Worth it? Absolutely worth every penny. If you want a wonderful dining experience while in Vegas that you will never forget, you must try Eiffel Tower Restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

doc.title: Terrible
doc.review: We had a pre-dinner drink, the barman waited until I was in the restroom and then propositioned my girlfriend in the most disgusting fashion. Dreadful.

doc.title: Love and a View
doc.review: My fiance and I had the tasting menu with wine pairings. Plus we added two of our favorite foods the beef wellington and pate. The food was incredible! Our server coursed everything out so we had the perfect amount of time to enjoy the food and each others company. On top of excellent food and service it was the best dining view imaginable in Vegas. We sat at the corner table with views down both side of the Vegas strip and the water show at the Bellagio. It made for a decadent, wonderful evening with the one I love!

doc.title: Great First night in Vegas
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower on our first night in Las Vegas. We had a spectacular view of the strip and the Bellagio Fountains. The service was excellent. We all really enjoyed our meal. I had the lamb chop that was fabulous. We ordered the chocolate suoffle for dessert and it was amazing. It is very pricey but was worth it. We had our photo taken during dinner by restaurant photographer and it seemed to be the best photo from the whole trip. This is a perfect place to celebrate something special or just treat yourself to something unforgetable.

doc.title: A Truly Memorable Experience!
doc.review: I was looking for a special place to propose to my girlfriend and after reading the numerous glowing reviews, I decided upon the ETR. I contacted the ETR, told them I was planning on proposing to my girlfriend and requested a window table for 7:00 overlooking the Bellagio fountains, even though they do not guarantee these tables beyond 5:30. We arrived on time and I was overjoyed to find, in my opinion, the best table in the house waiting for us. We had a complete and direct view of the Bellagio fountains. From the moment we arrived until we left, the entire experience was nothing short of first class and memorable. The food was truly fabulous, the service staff friendly, attentive, yet not obtrusive. And the ambiance was fantastic. My finance was duly impressed. After watching the fountains and slowly savouring our appetizers and some delicious wine, I got down on one knee and asked my girlfried to marry me shortly after the next show of the Bellagio fountains began. Of course, she said yes. Suffice to say, she was truly impressed. Throughout our meal, we were never rushed and left to enjoy the evening. Yes, the prices are not cheap, but they are not overly expensive and well worth it. Let's just say you can spend a heck of a lot more in Vegas for a lot less. For me it was great value. Overall, it was a truly memorable experience in a first class establishment, and I am very thankful to the ETR for making it memorable.

doc.title: A must for the romantic in you
doc.review: An excellent dining experience. The wine list was extensive and the service was well paced considering how busy it was on the saturday night. And the view - well you can't beat it.

doc.title: Outstanding in Food, Service and View!
doc.review: As a surprise birthday dinner for my wife, I brought her to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. This was an excellent choice.You are greeted at the ground floor of the Paris, and then take the elevator to the 11th floor where you pass by a view of the chefs in the kitchen as you go to the reception desk. We had arrived early for our dinner reservation, so we waited at the bar - and it was a very pleasant wait! It's a beautiful bar with a view of the Strip. The bartender was pleasant and quick to get our drinks. I would recommend a French Martini to get you in the mood for the dinner! Expect your drinks to be in the $15-$20 range.Our table was ready right on time, and we were brought to the table I had requested - right at the window with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains. It was a small, half-round table, but plenty of room for the two of us, and very romantic!For the appetizer, we both ordered the roasted Foie Gras, which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. We savored every bite! For the main course I had the Lamp, and my wife had the Filet Bearnaise. Both were absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly, but if there was a contest between entrees, the Lamb would have won. For a side dish, we had the Potato Gratin - an excellent choice.This amount of food turned out to be perfect for us. If we ordered anything more, it would have been far too much food. As it was, we really didn't have room to try the deserts. If you want the desert, I would suggest to skip the side dishes. The total for the dining room came to $224.00, including a martini and champagne - not bad at all for such an amazing meal.Everything about this dinner was perfect, and we'll definitely be going back to the Eiffel Tower again!

doc.title: Great atmosphere, great food!
doc.review: The food was great. The atmosphere is unbeatable. Great couple location. A must for first time Vegas travelers.

doc.title: Beautiful view of the Bellagio Water Show
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is my favorite eatery in Vegas. The service is top-notch. The food is delicious. And all the dining happens while having a stellar view of the Bellagio Hotel Water Show. I must if you have the money to eat somewhere classy.

doc.title: Magnificent views!
doc.review: We had lunch there, and it was worth every penny. Their menu and interior are somewhat reminiscent of Jules Verne restaurant on the actual Eiffel Tower, but the prices are much more affordable and you don't require a reservation. This restaurant has a direct view on Bellagio's fountain show, and this alone makes it a perfect spot to relax after a tiring day in the heat. You just turn your head to the window - it is all there, and you have the best seat.The food is also incredibly good. The way they cook salmon is remarkable, as are the salads and pate. And if you like something so much that you'd want to recreate it at home, there's also their recipe book for you to browse (and purchase, of course:).

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: This place is so amazing and worth every penny! My husband and I love this place so much that we had our wedding reception there and recently went back for our anniversary. This was one of the best meals we have had in a really long time. If it is your first time and you want to try something, I would highly recommend the beef wellington and the chocolate soufflé for dessert. The service is impeccable and you can't beat the view! This restaurant is romantic and perfect for a special occasion! Bon appetite!

doc.title: Great food! Beautiful Atmosphere! Wonderful Service!
doc.review: I thought the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was an amazing way to start off our girls trip to Vegas! The service was excellent, we were seated immediately. Because we were a party of four, we could not get seated "against" the window, but was still able to see the Bellagio Fountains. We had reservations at 6pm and it was PERFECT because we got to see the sunset and the Strip "light up"! I had the Beef Wellington and it melted in my mouth! DELISH! It was cooked medium and spiced just right! The sides came with snap peas, which were drowned in butter and oversalted. My other friend was a Vegan and they accommodated her request and gave her an excellent meal (by far, the best out of all the restaurants we visited). One of the girls in the party was celebrating a birthday, so they brought her a yummy espresso mousse in a shot glass. We did not feel rushed, we enjoyed the ambience and the "old school vegas" vibe with the large booths and lush decor. It's definitely expensive, but they post the menu and price on their website, so you can choose your items and set your budget in advance and not be hit with price shock. It's Vegas after all! Go big or don't go at all!

doc.title: The best!!
doc.review: This was the third time for myself and my 86 year old mother. It was the first time for my husband and brother-in-law. The food, setting, service--everything was superb. I would recommend the experience for anyone visiting Las Vegas. It is a "not to be missed" occasion.

doc.title: Great Birthday Lunch!
doc.review: My wife and I went for a late 1:30pm lunch on Sept 26th and our experience was fantastic! The menu was more than satisfactory for lunch and prices very reasonable. We left around 3:30pm and our table had a fabulous view of the Bellagio Fountains. We each enjoyed glasses of wine, shared a tomatoe salad, and chose the Lamb burger and Parmesan crusted chicken which were tasty. Finished with a triple chocolate cake desert and my wife was given a nice birthday mousse desert! The service throughout was great. Overall, we had a fantastic experience at a much less cost then dinner!

doc.title: Beautiful experience from beginning to end
doc.review: Every detail was perfect at our pre-theater dinner. We were seated at the windows overlooking the strip and the fountains at The Bellagio. The limited menu for the dinner which was purchased as part of a package with tickets to Jersey Boys gave us great choices for appetizer, entree and dessert. The waitstaff was impeccable, the food beautiful and tasty we were served efficiently but unhurried, so that we arrived at the theater right on time!

doc.title: Bus boy got our tip
doc.review: I would have to agree with the other reviewers. We had bettter service from our bus boy than the waiter. It appeared they were short on wait staff that evening which happened to be a Monday. Like some of the other reviewers, our reservation was for 8:30 and we weren't seated until a half hour later. There was no communication as to the delay. I must say the rack of lamb was outstanding, so if the service and communication improves, I would give a higher rating. And the views; you really can't beat. I would recommend for those celebrating a special occasion knowing what to expect based on the reviews.

doc.title: Expensive - but what the hell, our last night in Vegas
doc.review: We were recommended by our daughter who ate here last year, we were not disappointed. We booked the day before, although they couldn't 'promise' a window seat, when we got there they said they had got one for us anyway. The little extras we got with the meal were delightful, and although the courses were quite small (unlike the rest of America), they were beautiful,. when we had finished the meal we were both full, and certainly did not want any more.Yes it was expensive, but it was a night to remember, everything about our evening was perfect, and the fountains of Bellagio were the icing on the cake - so to speak. Although we did not hit the Casinos 'big time' it was lovely to be treat like a millionaire just once in a while!!!! - and we were.

doc.title: Ruined my honeymoon dinner
doc.review: My husband and I had reserved a table for our honeymoon dinner during our stay in Vegas, and we were both looking forward to our experience. We got all dressed up and arrived a little early but sat at the bar and chatted with Keith, besides the desk clerks and bus boys he was the friendliest employee. We had a spectacular view of the fountain across the way nd unfortunately I was glad to be witness it but had wished I wasn't paying $200.00 for the show. I have a rare mushroom allergy and the waiter had no clue what I could or could not eat. He told me to pick something and he would double check. Point lose number 1. We both ordered steaks and expected for $60.00 you would at least get a side salad but this is un true. So we wait and enjoy our view and we spoke more to young man serving bread and water then our waiter, our food arrives and its two hunks of beef. That's all, a sprig of parsley for plate design nothing 60 bucks worth. Mine had butter and lemon on it, my 3 year old can mix that up. Point lose 2and3. We cut into our dinner and filet minions are supposed to melt, cut with a spoon kinda deal, not so much. I needed effort into my steak knife to cut it.
