And my husband's steak, well he lost half his to a huge tendon and fat strip down the middle. Point lose 4and5. We again were on our honeymoon and we were surprised with a chocolate mousse dessert that was pretty good And the pistachios souffle was my favorite part but it did arrive very shortly after our dinners were gone, almost completely saying ok get gone. Point lose 6. I have told everyone avoid this establishment and grab a drink at the bar and go to a buffet. It was devastating.

doc.title: Awesome!
doc.review: We celebrated our friends 50th (a do-over 40th) and the food, waiters, bartender was top notch! My wife and our friend had the Beef Wellengton wile I had the Filet with a sauce...COOKED TO PERFECTION! No one was rude. everyone was very friendly...and we're known to be tough from the east coast! The reservations were made 2 months in advance so we made sure we had a front window seat! They accommodate but will warn you that every seat has a view....maybe, but for a special occasion you should be up front...and we were! Very pricey! Dropped $250.00 for 2 full corse meal and a fine wine....but again...we knew that coming into it....highly recommended...bring money.

doc.title: No Better Place To Watch The Bellagio Foundations
doc.review: We had a window table overlooking the Bellagio Foundation which made the experience special. The surprise was the food -- it was great! We thought we would just be paying for the view but the food, service and atmostphere were exceptional.

doc.title: Not worth the money or the view to be honest!
doc.review: While it seemed like a great idea to eat here, it turned out to be a waste of money and time. I made a reservation 3 weeks in advance of our trip and asked at that time for a window seat. Called again 3 days ahead of our arrival to make sure we had a window seat with a view of the fountains. Then came in that night, checked in, and once again asked for a good window seat....we got stuck in the far corner of the restaurant and could barely see the Bellagio fountains.We ordered a filet mignon (well) and a flat iron steak (med well). The waiter suggested that they cook the flat iron medium because medium well would make it too tough. I told him as long as it is pink and not bloody I will try the medium. He assured me it would be cooked to order.The steaks came out...the filet mignon was as tough as rubber and dry. The flat iron steak was pink on the edges and basically raw on the middle. It was still "mooing". Very disappointing.I have also been to plenty of Texas Roadhouse restaurants and they can cook the juiciest well done filet mignon, so I had thought a high end restaurant like this could figure that out...but I guess not. The sides were mediocre at best...potato croquetts, green beans, and au gratin. They were also $10 bucks a pop.You are clearly paying for the ambiance and view (which we didn't have anyway).Save your money and go to one of the buffets for better food.If we had to do it over again and save $250, we would NOT go here.

doc.title: Gr8 location, food and waiter. Bad front desk staff.
doc.review: We had a booking for 8.15pm we did arrive 5 mins late however we were not seated at our table until 9.25pm and then it was not the table requested by the window to watch the Bellagio fountains. The staff managing the bookings were terrible we just had to sit and wait, there was no communication about why we were waiting we just sat and watched people come and go and were told nothing.The restaurant was really loud more like a night club than a restaurant which took away from the atmosphere. On a positive they did find us a table as requested and the waiter who served us, James, was wonderful. The food was sensational their rack of lamb was perfect and the chocolate souffle was the best I've ever had. I'm not sure the delicious food and James is enough to make us return unfortunately the drama at the beginning and the overall experience was terrible.

doc.title: Wonderful!!!
doc.review: I dont need to write a long review because the restaurant simply has great food, grade A service, fabulous location and spot on cocktails. Our best night in vegas!!! Great spot to propose its so romantic but i wasnt so lucky!

doc.title: A Vegas Classic!
doc.review: Really a wonderful, memorable experience for our 31st anniv. You've no doubt read all about the view, romantic atmosphere and what I think is a nice comfortable bar, but be aware the food is truely outstanding!I did not think prices were at all out of line for what are the upper tier of Vegas restaurants. Add in the view/ambiance and it is well worth the price IMHO.But service was the real star for us this night. Thank you Lyle for going out of your way to make this night so memorable. Thank you Mario for your friendly attentive serviceWe WILL return without question.

doc.title: Best Bar
doc.review: Best bar on the Vegas strip. You pay strip prices, but worth it for great drinks. Did not eat at the restaurant, just drinks at the bar.

doc.title: style over substance
doc.review: The food was okay, but very overpriced and pretentious. You're basically paying for the view of the bellagio fountains, which are free outside, there were 6 of us we had 1 main course each, a bottle of wine and 2 beers and the bill was over $500 dollars with a hefty service charge added. One example of the snobbery was when my husband asked for a beer he was asked what profile of lager he normally drank... go to Roy's restaurant instead and enjoy the fountains for free another night

doc.title: cindy
doc.review: the best dinner in vegas with great service. A little pricey for vegas but well worth it. great view of the bellagio fountains show. staff went out of the way to accomidate you and make you feel sepcial

doc.title: Awesome view!!
doc.review: We had a table right at the window and we had an amazing view of the strip!! We saw the Bellagio fountains during our dinner, and it was an amazing experience! The food was great too. I had salmon and it was perfect!

doc.title: Not even close
doc.review: My wife and I had dinner on the 19th of September and I could have made six or more steaks better for $120 it cost for the two steaks. The only thing that was good about the steak was it was cooked to the med rare we both requested. I have had many filet migon that you could cut with a fork for half the price. How ever this one you need a chain saw to get through it. I also could have picked out a strip steak at my local chain grocery store that you could clearly see no fat in it. The strip steak was aged however and I asked my server how long the steak was aged for. His answer " I'm not sure no one has ever ask that. I can ask. They get delivered every morning though.". My server never returned with a answer so I still order it as my personal experience with aged strips have been flawless. However that was a mistake because of the giant piece of fat and tendon running through the middle. My wife and I did eat are steaks though and didn't complain of the poor quality of meat due to it being almost 9:00pm and we were looking forward to the pistachio souffle we order after are steaks arrived. Again a disappointment as pistachios have a strong precess of flavor in my opinion and this particular souffle does not. I have worked in the restaurant business for all my life and left a adequate tip for the service provided. How ever he might have been a rookie as we hardly seen him. On a good note Keith the bartender was very pleasant and made a drink for my wife that she enjoyed as she rarely drinks. He was very talkative and attentive to everyone's needs at the bar. I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone and tell them to buy what they want and I will cook it better for them for about a tenth of the price. For the money you pay you should enjoy every bite however that is not the case here. Also are busser was great as he provided extra bread did seem like he was nervous though.

doc.title: Best meal I've ever had!!
doc.review: We were recommended this restaurant by one of my husbands college's and it didn't disappoint!!It was our last night in Vegas and the end of our honeymoon so we decided to end it with a nice meal and a show!!This was possibly the best meal me and my husband had ever had,for my main I had the beef Wellington and my husband had the surf and turf,for dessert we had the soufflé,the service was amazing the view was fantastic and we cannot wait to return to this restaurant on our next visit to Vegas in August next year!!

doc.title: One of the best views in Las Vegas, great food, and impeccable service.
doc.review: We enjoyed lunch here immensely. I fully expected this to be a "touristy" type of a dining experience and was pleasantly surprised to the contrary. The chef sent out a pea puree palate cleanser with cracked pepper cheese puffs that were delicious. We ordered the cucumber lemonade which was so refreshing and light after walking all around Las Vegas. I ordered the crepes with artichoke hearts and roasted tomato puree, wonderful. My husband had the lamb burger with homemade chips that was huge, succulent, and the best he has ever had. We had no room for desert but the chef sent out small bites of jellied and chocolate candies that we thoroughly enjoyed. The service here is also beyond reproach. This is a "must do" in Las Vegas.

doc.title: Nice end to a great trip!
doc.review: I was looking online for the perfect restaurant for our last night in Vegas, I decided to book at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant after reading the reviews.I was so looking forward to this meal. We made a reservation for 6:30 as we had a show to go to later on that evening. We got there a little early 6:00 and asked if they could accommodate and they did, no problem. We got a window seat with a great view of the Bellagio fountain. Service was amazing from the get go. My dinning companion has a gluten allergy, and they had a gluten free menu which she was happy as it can get very limited at times. I ordered the roasted foie gras as an appetizer that was to die for. Melt in your mouth. For the main course, the pork chop. Although the taste and preparation was really good, it was a tad too salty for me. For the sides we had the green beans almondine and the potatoes gratin. I have to admit I am not a big fan of green beans but I could not stop eating them, they were so delicious. For the dessert I had a hard time deciding on which of the 6 soufflé flavor to choose, but went with the classic chocolate. It did not disappoint. Overall the meal was a great success. I wish I could give it a 4.5 but it won't let me. I wanted to give it a 5 but the pork was a little too salty for my taste. I would definitely go back.

doc.title: Too expensive for quality of dinner
doc.review: We were pleased that we were able to have dinner at this restaurant since we did not make a reservation. We were seated quickly and had a relatively good view of the Bellagio water show. The appetizer menu did not contain anything that any of the four of us desired, but, being a french restaurant, that was expected. Two of us had the beef wellington, one had a filet mignon and the other a steak. We shared a side dish of green beans. Three of us had a glass of wine. Everything as a la carte, which came as no surprise. The entrees were a bit above average, not anywhere near delicious. We each had a coffee, no dessert. The bill came to $388 and with the tip close to $500.00. The service was very good. The food, ok.

doc.title: excellent food, ambiance, service and views
doc.review: a first class meal, excellent service, a real must do meal out with great views of the bellagio Fountains

doc.title: Everything from the stunning view to the incredible food, this restaurant does not disappoint!
doc.review: Everything about this restaurant was terrific. When I made the reservation (always recommended ) a week ago, I was asked if we were celebrating something special - we would be celebrating our 28th anniversary. On our arrival at the base of the elevator, we were escorted upstairs to the reservation desk, where we were congratulated on our anniversary and shown to our table. Our table for two was at the front window, facing the Bellagio so we had an excellent view of the fountain show during our meal. First, let me say, the service was impeccable. Our waiter was friendly and courteous and each course simply flowed into the next, without the feeling of being rushed. We started with a taster serving of Gazpacho that was so good, I'm now inspired to try making it myself again. Then Caesar salad followed my melt in your mouth Dover Sole for me (the best I've ever tasted) and the roasted Rack of Lamb for my husband, which he says was delicious and very tender. We didn't try desert although they looked wonderful. I would definitely return to this restaurant and highly recommend it.

doc.title: Great food with a fabulous view
doc.review: My husband and I had dinner reservations at Gordon Ramsay Steak the other night. After having a drink at the bar, we were seated at our table. The British rock music was so loud, we couldn't hear each other speak. Asked the waiter to please turn the music down and he said he wouldn't, "chef likes it like that."So, we left and had them call upstairs to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We were shown right in and had a table overlooking the Dancing Waters fountain of Bellagio and The Strip. It was fantastic!The decor of the restaurant was very elegant- black and red velour. We ordered and shared an appetizer of escargots and sweetbreads that was very good.My husband got the Beef Wellington and I got the Braised beef shortribs. Both entrees were delicious, and we were too full to even think about dessert.We have eatedn at the Restaurant Jules Verne on the Eiffel Tower in Paris, and this was just as nice an experience. Highly recommended!

doc.title: Great food and view of the strip!
doc.review: We enjoyed a wonderful meal at the Eiffel Tower restaurant during our stay in Vegas. They provided a variety of options on the menu and the bartender was extremely helpful with the wine choices. He asked a few questions on the type of wine that I liked and asked if I wanted to taste test a different wine than what I originally ordered. He was right and I enjoyed his recommendation.The view was spectacular!! We faced the outside edge by the windows and had a great view of the strip which included the fountains at Bellagio at night.The prices are a little expensive but well worth the quality of food, views, atmosphere of the restaurant, and excellent service we received.

doc.title: A fantastic meal with even better views at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in Paris, Las Vegas
doc.review: We had booked a table at 5pm to guarantee a view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip on the day we were renewing our vows at the LIttle White Chapel in Las Vegas.As soon as we walked into the restaurant we saw the fabulous views which we enjoyed all evening since we had a table by the window.The menu was so varied with reasonable prices for a restaurant of this quality.We chose 2 starters which we shared (King Crab and Foie Gras - both were delicious)For our main course we chose the duck with an order of potato gratin to share.The souffle had been recommended so we shared that which was again superb.With the bottle of red wine our total bill was $210.The service was brilliant, right from being greeted as we left the lift on arrival.A very special day was rounded off with a superb meal in lovely sorroundings.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant - Las Vegas
doc.review: Best experience ever! I went with the wife to celebrate her birthday and the experience was just perfect. They gave us a table by the window right in front looking at the Bellagio. We were able to enjoy the fountains show while we ate. The food was just perfect and they even had roses for my wife at the table. My special request for a birthday cake worked like a charm. The cake was made by a special chef they have and it has been one of the best I have ever tasted. The service was very professional and they were very friendly and attentive. I will definitely come back during my next visit to Vegas.

doc.title: very expensive but view is fabulous
doc.review: we had a seat by the window overlooking the bellaggio fountains and we had the pleasure of watching them over and over again as it got dark. The service was excellent, we had the Taster menu, i had mine with wine but my partner had his without wine but it still set us back a very hefty $300!! i tried not to think about it too much and i got to taste oyster which i had never had before and wasn't that keen. It was an experience though which i'll never forget.

doc.title: great view/great food
doc.review: Dinner at the Eiffel Tower is a special treat. The atmosphere is really nice (more formal), the view is awesome, service excellent, and the food melts in your mouth. Don't go if you are worried about prices, but for me, it was well worth it!

doc.title: View is great for a special occasion, otherwise just a typical tourist place for Vegas
doc.review: Went here for my wife’s birthday after getting a reservation 2 days before. They gave us a window table which was great. We had eaten a lot (it’s Vegas, right?) the previous day and since I tend to find French food to be the most overrated cuisine in the world (it relies on a reputation that died more than ½ a century ago-Southeast Asian cuisine-Thai, Vietnamese and Indian all blow it away but you still can’t overcharge for them at fine dining establishments) was not going to go all in and over order for items that I find bland (case in point-I was visiting a friend in Paris in 2004 and he took me to the alleged “place” to have cassoulet and it was bland and crappy as all can be and it was $20 at lunch a la carte). Well, the menu doesn’t make it clear but all the entrees are extremely a la carte (the “accompaniments” section is small and not inspired, buried at the bottom of the menu and easy to miss which we did). As in the main courses, while well prepared, are very petite. My seas bass was tender and nicely prepared but I almost couldn’t find the bed of quinoa it was sitting on. My wife’s Muscovy duck breast had the same approach. We had to scramble to order a side of potatoes as our entrees came out INCREDIBLY fast. In fact, so fast, that a major “faux pas” occurred. While our waiter was engaging and sharp, SOMEHOW, our entrees arrived before our bottle of wine did. I kid you not. I was shocked. I worked as a waiter eons ago to put myself through college at some pretty nice restaurants and this was something that just could not happen then or now. I just don’t know how this could happen at a top end place like this. I didn’t say anything since it was my wife’s birthday and didn’t want to make any sort of scene.They did redeem themselves nicely by bringing a gratis, personalized chocolate mousse for my wife which she loved. We had also ordered a chocolate soufflé in advance and that was prepared perfectly. In closing, this is a romantic spot and the view was great for Vegas (as I never want to return to cloudy, grimy and sad Gay Paris as my second wife has never been there so this served as a stand in for her) but I would rather pay top $ at, say, Nobu but I recently already did that their location in San Diego as this place tends to serve as a tourist event restaurant and not one of great culinary vision.

doc.title: Amazing
doc.review: My friends and I were looking for a restaurant that would be a special treat to make our Vegas experience even more memorable. We were recommended the Eiffel Tower by a family member who said they had recently been and had an amazing time here. The view is awesome, the service was also great but the food was by far the best part of this experience and I was blown away by how amazing it was. I can’t wait to go back to Vegas and go here again.

doc.title: OMG! Loved it!
doc.review: Definitely you need to go and experience the food, service and the view. Never been to Paris to compare but what an experience! Restaurant located in the Eiffel Tower which I thought was really cool. Booked reservations online, quick and easy. Requested the table location and our request was fulfilled. Decor is beautiful, black and red velour. Service was amazing so was the food. Atmosphere was very romantic. The view of Belaggio fountains just wows you. Highly recommend it for couples for any occasion or just a night on a town. Spent about $100 per person but you have to remember you are in Vegas so if you think that is expensive, think not! You will have to spend same amount of money just going to a regular restaurant, that's how expensive Vegas is. Overall the restaurant wasn't pricey compared to other restaurants on Vegas strip. The only thing I didn't like was that the entrance to the restaurant is thru Planet Hollywood (casino area) which stinks like beer/smoke/bar, just awful. I guess the casino area has poor ventilation. Also, please remember the restaurant closes at 10:45 pm. on a weekend but you can stay at the bar until midnight. Anyway, we loved it and it was worth it! Hopefully you'll enjoy it too.

doc.title: Terrific Service, Phenomenal Food
doc.review: I set a reservation for our second night in Las Vegas for myself and my girlfriend (only she wasn't my girlfriend at the time). Our reservation was set at 7pm with a request of a rose to be presented on the table at time of arrival. The interesting part of this review is that I actually had plans to ask my girlfriend out at this restaurant. We had been "dating" for months but never really made anything official you could say. Anyway, she was awe-struck at the rose pedals and rose placed on our awaiting table over-viewing the Bellagio water fountains. It was a sight I won't soon forget. The timing was also amazing since the sun was setting as the water fountains played across the distance. It was a perfect time to pop the question.The waiter caught on to how special of an evening this was, and was extremely attentive with a great personality. He was sure not to get in the way but also made sure our night was one to remember. He took pictures of us at the table, near the bar, and even near the kitchen. There was a professional photographer who also took our picture and had it presented in a red envelope after our meal.All of this already seems like a perfect night, but it gets better. The food was literary the best food I have ever had the pleasure of eating. My girlfriend had an amazing order of salmon while I enjoyed perhaps the best cut of rib eye ever. If you really want to enjoy the most excellent food and restaurant in Vegas, don't hesitate at making reservations at the Eiffel Tower.

doc.title: Exceptional
doc.review: The entire experience was pleasant and inviting. The food was cooked to perfection, our server was sociable without being invasive. His recommendations were right on target for our pallet

doc.title: Ahhhhh, the view!
doc.review: Fantastic dinner. We had a table for two next to the window looking down onto LasVegas Blvd with full evening view of the Bellagio Fountains routine. It was magical. Awesome service. Fab food. The Rack of Lamb cooked perfect, so tender and tasty. There were four ribs. Partner had the tender tasty filet with Bernaise sauce. Nothing left on our plates. Waiter was fantastic. All employees treated us like valued guests. Expensive but you get what you pay for. We will be back!!!!!

doc.title: Vegas at its' Best!
doc.review: My friend and I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant while vacationing in Vegas. This restaurant was the best! This was the greatest restaurant experience that her and I had in Vegas.You take a beautiful up to the restaurant. The service was fantastic. As expected, the drinks were a bit pricey, but the food was very reasonably priced and very tasty. The restaurant walls are entirely made of glass, which gives you a stunning view of Vegas. My friend and I went seated right in front of the Bellagio hotel just in time for the water and light show, which was a true sight to behold.The staff did not try to rush us out once we finished eating and paid our bill. We sipped our drinks and relaxed while taking in the spectacular view.

doc.title: Not everyone gets a good view...
doc.review: We were celebrating our 30th Anniversary and expecting top service and food for the price. Unfortunately we were seated in a booth with limited view and our server was neither friendly nor helpful. Disappointing experience.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: Wonderful setting and great food. Expensive but worth the experience. Best food in the hotel. Service matched the setting and the food.

doc.title: Beautiful view, good food
doc.review: My fiance and I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on Sept. 3, 2012 to celebrate my birthday and our engagement. I had made prior reservations through open table and requested a window seat to view the Bellagio fountains. We were there around 8:15pm which was a wonderful time as the sun had just about set and the view was spectacular. We thankfully had our window request granted. Soooooo worth it. This is a very nice restaurant. Dress up. Men- if you don't have on proper attire the restaurant will even provide slacks and shoes. I witnessed that happen to a couple that obviously didn't understand what type of restaurant this was. Make a reservation or you will be waiting. We were promptly seated at our reservation time. I tried the escargot with sweet breads for an appetizer and my fiance had the fois gras. Both were very good! If you've been curious about trying escargot this is a safe version. Very nice sauce. If I didn't know what I was eating you wouldn't be able to tell :-)For dinner I had the lamb and and my fiance had one of the steaks (forgive me, I don't remember which cut). Both were excellent. We had the grand marnier souffle for dessert. Again, awesome. You have to order the souffle ahead of time which the rest of your meal though because it takes a while to prepare. I think maybe I should have had the creme brulee instead because I have a major sweet tooth and the souffle didn't quite give me my fix haha, but it was great none the less. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for special occasions/splurges. It is a bit pricey. I would not recommend it as a family restaurant as there are too many couples trying to enjoy themselves. Hope that helps!Thanks Eiffel tower~ we will be back!

doc.title: Serious Dining in Las Vegas...
doc.review: Highly anticipated, we had invited friends and family to Las Vegas for The Dinner at what was reputed to be among the top three dining rooms there. We have been to Las Vegas numerous times, and enjoy dining at the top dining rooms there as well as in some of the finest of the world. For this occasion, I even bought a new dinner jacket, coming from Hawaii to dine high above the maddening crowds, overlooking the Bellagio Fountains and Las Vegas Boulevard. Leaving Las Vegas three days later, I am trying to recall the memorable evening's pluses and minuses as they come to mind.We were seated in a strategic table which did overlook the Fountains, and were greeted by our waiter, a young chap who made sure we remembered his name loudly. Very attentive, he was mostly business and suffered us little for our lighthearted attempts at humor...or was that being the French - mode' Parisian waiter inside him? He immediately agreed with our wine selection of a Chardonnay St. Michel, from WA state, at $82. It was good. However the next day I heard it was selling for $11 at Trader Joe's. Not good. But I digress, as I am not a connoisseur of fine wines. Our party ordered from a wide variety of offerings, tomato-basil-mozzarella salad, blue cheese souffle pudding, roasted foie gras for starters. It was amusing to note that our server Joshua took the "French" liberty of dousing the salads with "Tomato Water" poured most liberally from a dressing pitcher, a clear liquid which we rejoiced in, as if it were a holy anointment of sorts. Reminiscent of "The Emperor's New Clothes"-this was the crowning invisible, yet praiseworthy touch! C'est formidable! We will talk about it forever, even though we were probably victims of yet another Paris-inspired dining myth. It took me a while to peruse the menu for the fifth time before ordering the whole boneless Dover Sole, laden with capers; it was in the end, a tad too salty with the Grenobloise overload and ala carte prix of $69 the most expensive "meat" dish by far... The Racks of Lamb were uneventfully acceptable to good, and orders of both highly recommended Beef Wellington dishes did not disappoint -- at least in volume; somehow they count as overrated when my wife said she "shoulda ordered something more exciting and tasty" comparatively speaking. Melt in your mouth Wellington? Not quite. When in France, think: should you really order a beef dish with an English title? Or a fish from Dover, England?Copious sides of French beans, creamed spinach and potato gratin took the lesser roles nicely at $10 each, while everyone kept repeating, "That tomato water sure hit the spot!" Thus at the end, we shared three different flavored dessert Souffles, which were on the tiny side, sweet and tasty but with wet, smooshy endings--so Francaise!. Joshua put a sweeter finish to the dinner's end with a tray of fineFrench? chocolates which we had to pack for take out. All said, the dinner was a success, the Bellagio fountains playing in the background and mostly having good family and friends to enjoy it all. So what if Joshua did not enjoy the witticisms and corn-fed jokes of his guests? Is he really French? C'est la Vie! The next time, we will try lunch there, and the chicken looks good. I don't know when I will use my new jacket again, however!

doc.title: Best View in Vegas
doc.review: Went there for our wedding anniversary and had to wait a few minutes but the Hostess arranged for us to have a table next to the window with an amazing view of the Strip, especially the Bellagio Fountains, the service was excellent and the food was good but a little pricey. But I would go back.

doc.title: Worth it
doc.review: Ok. Denied at Ramsey's. Our fault, no reservations, but the offer of the lounge fell flat. No service, irritating music and atmosphere. Everything from the greeter at the elevator, to the hostess at the top to our waiter and bus boy and the beautiful bridal party at the centre of the hotel was ... Sweet. The chicken was delicious, my husband loved his Wellington (nana boo boo gord) and the extra care and attention to our seating ( it was our anniversary) was top notch. I will go back. Our should take the chance and go.

doc.title: Great views, good food, "blah" service
doc.review: We had a good experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The view was great, the food was yummy but we thought our server was cold and lacked humor. If the service would have been friendlier and more engaging I would say this restaurant was excellent! I completely recommend the Duck with spaetzle and from what I heard from my husband and friends the Lamb and the Pork Chops were delicious as well. Would definitely go back when in Vegas!

doc.title: Fancy Feast!
doc.review: The meal was rich with flavor, and a bit on the heavy side with ingredients. The view was spectacular, and the waitstaff vert attentive and curteous. It's worth at least a single visit, but not twice in my opinion without a guest to treat.

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: we had a table by the window and got a great view of the bellagio fountains and the strip outside, the wine and food was excellent and the ambiance of the restaurant is fantastic

doc.title: Excellent dinner experience
doc.review: Yes, it's pricey, but the food was great, and the view was spectacular. Our waiter was friendly, and recommended good food for us. We later found out that the restaurant had actually charged us more than our bill - they took out more tip than we had already given them. We called the restaurant and they gave us a refund, but I did think it was odd that the waiter would make that kind of "mistake" at such a high end restaurant. Other than that, it was a good experience.

doc.title: Excellent!
doc.review: Stopped in for a glass of wine mid-afternoon and found we liked the ambience and service so well that we made reservations for dinner. Superior service and excellent Atlantic salmon. We split the salmon and ordered the potatoes and green beans as sides. Had food left over and were stuffed. If you are in Vegas and don't eat here, you will miss a wonderful treat. Be there by 6:30 to get a window seat so that you can see the Bellagio's water show several times during your meal. We will definitely go back.

doc.title: great view but food just average.
doc.review: The atmosphere is romantic, the views of the strip are beautiful but the food was just ok for the ridiculous price. I'd recommend just going up for a drink and the souffle (which was very good). Eat at Roy's if you want an amazing meal.

doc.title: Great dining on the strip!
doc.review: I rarely if ever dine on the strip, but a friend was visiting for her birthday and wanted to go here so I went. I was very happy I did. I had the blue cheese souffle appetizer, the short ribs, and croquettes. They were all very good, mouthwatering is an understatement they were cooked to perfection too, we had a another side of the green beans which, while the flavor wasn't my favorite they were actually cooked perfectly. The view and the fountains going off every so often were great, I enjoy the way the restaurant is set up so that there are only good views. The service was attentive and helpful, I would definitely go back if I could afford it more often!

doc.title: Amazing...worth every penny!
doc.review: We dined here for my 30th Birthday. The food and service were 5 star all the way. One of the best meals of my life! Ask for a window seat, we were lucky enough to get one and the view of the Bellagio fountains is fantastic. We did not order an entree but got a small shot glass of soup for free and it was mouth watering. The deserts were works of art. As it was my birthday they also gave me a free desert with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate in chocolate. I highly recommend!

doc.title: Our best meal in Vegas!
doc.review: We had a beautiful evening here - enjoying beautiful food, immaculate service and a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains. We wrer particularly impressed that despite having a window view of the fountains there was no pressure for us to move on quickly.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris
doc.review: Worth the money. If you're used to MickyD's or BK then your taste buds may be damaged and you won't be able to fully enjoy the meal. We've eaten there several times in the past, and last Sunday on 8/26/2012 we had brunch. I had the Ground Lamb Burger and my partner had the open face steak sandwich. Everything was perfect as usual... except drinks were a little slow but then again it was very busy. They used to have Jazz on Sunday but no longer. Still worth every penny and a great view of the fountains at Belliago.

doc.title: Very good meal and service
doc.review: We celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary at The Eiffel Tower restaurant. They gave us a table with an awesome view of the Bellaggio Fountains. The wine, food and service were exceptional.

doc.title: Fantastique!
doc.review: My new husband and I went there for our Honeymoon dinner and it was beyond spectacular. We had an amazing view at a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The food was delicious and the soufflé was amazing. They even brought us a little chocolate mousse course with "congratulations" written on the plate. The service was outstanding. So friendly and on top of every little thing. A magical night.

doc.title: Just like being in Paris
doc.review: The food is very good, a little on the pricey side but the view is spectacular. When your done dining make sure you go to the top of the eiffel tower.

doc.title: Good food but below-par service
doc.review: Went there two weeks ago. Asked for a table by the window, which we got. Fantastic views of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains.The food is quite pricey and while the starters were nothing out of the ordinary, the mains (the steak and the chicken) were absolutely magnificent.So far so good. What doesn't quite add up in this place is the service. First, the two hosts were just miserable. The "Eiffel Tower Restaurant" is a place you take your girlfriend or wife for a special occasion but you are greeted by two girls who quite clearly wouldn't look out of place at your average highway diner. What is more, they offered no smiles, not even the shallow "How are you?" that is so ubiquitous in the U.S.Then, our waiter. Again, if you go to a fine restaurant, you'd expect your waiter to be knowledgeable, discreet and polite. Our waiter was none of these things. He had no idea about the wine - he offered me rosé champagne when I asked for a recommendation of a rosé wine to accompany our dinner. When a restaurant boasts a 40+ page wine menu (with the more reasonable wines costing $80 and upwards), you'd think they have a sommelier or someone who could at least tell the difference between sparkling wine and wine. Not here.Lastly, the bathrooms. They were filthy. There was a bathroom attendant but I always wonder why I should give them a dollar or two for handing me paper tissues when I would happily give them double that tip if the facilities were clean.All in all, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Yes, the food is great and so are the views but if you pay $300+ for a meal for two with wine, you should expect more class from the service. I don't know whether I just picked a bad night but in this price range, you can find much better in Vegas.

doc.title: Best meal of our lives!
doc.review: We arrived at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our wedding meal.There was a slight wait for a window table but we were in no hurry so got a glass of champagne at the bar which was lovely!The view from our table was outstanding! The Bellagio fountains and the strip, what more could you ask for. The ambiance inside the restaurant was buzzing, every table was booked and the smell was amazing! We didn't fancy any of the appetizers so I went for the Fillet Mignon with herb butter on the side and my partner got the steak and lobster with a red wine bernaise sauce on the side. We also got sides of potato gratin and creamed spinach and mushroom.The steaks were the best steaks we have ever had... you didn't even need a knife! The sides were also amazing!The waiter suggested we get a bottle of the house champagne as it would be cheaper than us ordering by the glass, it was delicious!The steaks and sides were more than enough but the offer of a pistachio soufflé was too good to pass up, the waiter then brought over a little chocolate dessert thing compliments of the chef as we just got married, that was also too good!The soufflé was perfect and the best way to end any meal, it was so romantic and we will be heading back for our first anniversary... a really special experience.The bill came to $300 plus $50 tip.Worth every penny.If you have any questions, just message me!L x

doc.title: Fabulous
doc.review: Our menu and cost summary at the end of the review.The Set-Up:My husband made reservations here a week in advance for our wedding anniversary. Rez are necessary, even on a Sunday night they are busy. There is a dress code (collared shirts, long pants for men - don't remeber for women) which was not too difficult to abide by for a Vegas tourist. The restaurant is not on the top of the tower; it is a few stories above the strip for a perfect viewing of the Bellagio fountains. They have a bar/lounge area, all dining tables have a view, and a full viewing area of the kitchen if you are so inclined. We arrived 30 minutes early and had specialty cocktails at the bar. The Service:Each staff member was 100% on with their customer service skills, from the elevator greeters (title?) to the managment. The table bussers were amazingly fast and efficient - like none I have experienced before - just waiting to pounce on any perceived need. Our table was ready on time, and prepared correctly with the roses my husband had ordered. Our table captain (Joshua) knew the food and menu intimately, and could explain any dish in detail. Clearly he had worked there for a long time, which I feel is a good sign in the restaurant industry. We also rated a visit from the manger, Mr. Mackani, who checked in on us after our meal - before dessert. Again, I feel this is a good sign, and it also served to make us feel like special guests (I did not observe him doing this for other diners, so maybe we were trouble-makers?)The Food:All of the courses arrived with perfect timing. We were asked at the beginning of dinner service if we had time constraints (ie, show reservations), which we did not. We ordered our dessert (the soufle) at this time as well. While all the food is 'a la carte and individual portions' on the menu, (we were told this by Joshua as well), do not be fooled into thinking you should order a lot of extras to fill up. Portion sizes are just fine if you are normal eater. They serve bread of which you can have as much as you want - 4 or 5 varieties, an amuse bouche pre-app, and petits fours post dessert. We were also served a special anniversary chocolate mousse-cream bite. We did not order wine - I cannot drink it - however according to my husband the wine list looked fine. Here is my one 'if I could do it over' comment: we would have ordered less food, so we could have room for another dessert at the end. Apps: Blue cheeze soufle (will order this everytime - awesome) Quail (sauce was very good, bird cooked well, nice app - but - with the main course meat, I will probably not order it again as it was too filling)Main courses: Beef Wellington - cooked med rare perfectly, complex sauce, just right pastry, and even the snap peas were just right texture. Rack of Lamb: Outstanding, cooked to perfection medium rare, could cut it with a fork. Sides: Mushroom Spaetzle - good mushroom flavor - but would drop this item as well to prevent over-filling. Creamed Spinach Mushroom - Very good side for both dishes. Dessert: Caramel Soufle - Heavenly. I wish we had room for and ordered a second soufle (there are several varieties).Cost summary: We were not on a budget. We had a total of 3 specialty cocktails, as well as bottled water as opposed to tap water. Along with the above listed food items, our bill (not including roses or tip) was just under $270. While this seems pricey at first glance, by Vegas standards for a high-end meal, this is a good value. And, I would venture to say that two people could eat here very comfortably for a $200 tab, and not feel like they missed out.I would definitely eat here again for a special occasion.

doc.title: It had some good points and some not so great
doc.review: While in Vegas we visited several 4 diamond restaraunts, this was one of them. We booked a window seat early. It was quite busy. The window tables where very small, half tables really. We saw the fountains go at least 3 times during our meal. We ordered the prefixed dinner and my husband added the wine pairing. The chef added at least 2 extra courses. The soup was the best part of dinner. Both my husband and I had been sick the last week, so half way though our courses both of us where turning green literally and on top of that we where really getting full. It seemed like the plates just kept coming and coming. I ended up drinking almost all the wine pairings. We where so full and not feeling well that we boxed our dessert and main courses. One course, the halibut, was aweful. I love fish and couscous but this preparation was terrible, it was very fishy and the couscous was runny and tasted spoiled. The restaurant manager came over personally and deducted that part from our bill. Also, I didn't much care for the lobster salad. The lobster was cold and rubbery. Out of all the 4 diamond restraunts we visited on this trip, this one had their wine pairing spot on. Who ever the Sommelier is, they deserve a raise, outstanding. The meal was higher then the other places we went with the final bill over $300 for two people. Although we where full, when we mentioned in conversation that our trip was to celebrate our anniversary we recieved another dessert (mango sobet) to share, which they did not have to do. By the end of our meal it became almost commical at how many plates of food we had. Both my husband and I joked about it the rest of the night. In the end, most of the food was average other then the soup, the wine pairing where excellent, the view wonderful, and staff very on top of everything. Not likely we would ever go back, for us it was a once in a life time dinner.

doc.title: Great food and superb view!
doc.review: My BF and I went to Vegas a couple of years ago. We walked the strip, we saw Celine Dion's concert, went to various restaurants, we played at the casinos, won nothing but we had fun! But one thing I'll never forget about that trip was our dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant at Paris Las Vegas. While we were enjoying the wine and the great food, we were also enjoying the view from the top! We timed our dinner reservation so that we could also watch Vellagio's spectacular water fountain show while having dinner! We could see the whole show from the top of this restaurant! What a wonderful experience!

doc.title: omg! what a sight!
doc.review: let me tell you the fabulous time i had! cable car was my drink: excellent! i ate here 3 nocs in a row. one of my dinners the waiter noticed i didn't finish: he asked how i liked it: i told him i didn't care for it: he comped me! loved every little moment. and the fountains!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i wanted to die and go to heaven!

doc.title: Fabulous
doc.review: We actually went to eat at Mon Ami Gabi - in the same complex, but it was raining - so we went up the tower. It was the best meal we had in a week of Vegas ... seriously. Get a window seat - across from the Bilagio. It was pricey, but definitely worth it. Great staff, great food, great view.

doc.title: Fantastic
doc.review: This is the best restaurant on the strip as far as I'm concerned. The food is spectacular, and the value is great for what you are getting, five star food with the kind of views you dream about.

doc.title: Best meal in Vegas!
doc.review: We got recommendations for this place from my parents and so, for our anniversary, we booked here. We were told though that it was first come, first served, in terms of having the ideal seats by the windows that overlook the fountains of the Bellagio and The Strip. We went for lunch though, so it wasn't too busy. We were seated by the window and were promptly served some sort of puffed rolls, with cheese and herbs infused. They were delicious!We ordered the onion soup to start and I ordered parmesan chicken and my husband ordered a lamb burger. Our food came and was delicious. The soup was probably my favorite part. We were feeling very full by the end and so declined dessert, but were still given some jellies and chocolate truffle and then were served a small chocolate mousse, on a decorated plate that said Happy Anniversary, which was a total surprise (they had asked when I booked if it was a special occasion, but had said nothing while we were there). Overall the service was great, the food delicious and the view wonderful. It was a great experience!

doc.title: Superb!
doc.review: Great food, great atmosphere, friendly courteous staff, not stuffy, just a good meal. Pricey but worth it. Enjoy!

doc.title: Best Cocktails in Vegas!
doc.review: Loved it. Best view of Bellagio fountains. Best breakfast (we visited twice not breakfast and cocktails on the same visit).

doc.title: Fantastique!
doc.review: Cannot beat this restaurant for atmosphere, service and food. Very high end so expect to spend some time languishing over your meal.

doc.title: Fantastic food with priceless view
doc.review: My husband and I had the tasting menu and were not disappointed. Over the top service, table service was very attentive and all the staff was well trained even the busboys were excellent. The food was well prepared and wonderful presentation. Give yourself enough time to enjoy your dinner, this is not a place if you are in a hurry. There were many couples the night we were there. It is definetly an adult atmosphere and a great place to celebrate a romantic evening.

doc.title: Not Bad;)
doc.review: We dined here for my husband's 40th birthday. The service was prompt...we were seated right away, there was always someone available when needed, our waitress was sure to ask us if we wanted the chocolate souffle (sp?) before our meal was served because she knew it would take a 1/2 hour to prepare and didn't want us to have to wait too long since we had the Celine Dion concert right after. Our dinner was fantastic.. I didn't know I could enjoy a pork chop as much as I did. The potatoes gratin (sp?) had little to no flavor so I do not recommend that side dish, but everything else was very good. A little expensive, but I guess when you figure in the entertainment from the Bellagio Fountains, it's worth the added expense.

doc.title: Great Experience
doc.review: This was one of the best meals we have ever had! The atmosphere and view are spectacular. I have eaten in French restaurants my whole life and I can tell you that this place is the real deal. We had a spectacular meal and finished off by taking the elevator up to the viewing deck of the tower.

doc.title: Disappointing
doc.review: You have to keep reminding yourself that you are paying for the view! Food was not that good - house salad was horrible but homemade bread was wonderful. Restaurant was very noisy and service was very slow. Would not reccomend this restaurant to anyone. Every other meal we had during our 3 day stay was much better.

doc.title: Pretty, good
doc.review: Conveniently located opposite the Bellaggio's fountain. You can enjoy a great view if you manage to get a table on the terrace. Pretty satisfied with food quality and service.

doc.title: Spectacular views and even better food
doc.review: I travel a great deal for work and as such, have the opportunity to eat at many wonderful restaurants. You'll be hard pressed to beat this place. Every bite of something different as good or better than the last. I started with a great blue cheese pudding appetizer, enjoyed a wonderful short rib dish for my entree and finished with the most amazing souffle I've ever had. Don't waste your money on the buffets in Vegas, spend similar money and enjoy this real treat.

doc.title: Outstanding food and service
doc.review: Since my favorite restaurant is Jules Verne in the Eiffel Tower, we went here for dinner since it's cheaper than flying to Paris. We've been twice. The food is outstanding. The service is incredible. The view is not as good as Paris. Price, of course, is $$$$$. Well worth it for a special occasion.

doc.title: Great Food - "Slow" is an understatement of service
doc.review: I was at the restaurant last weekend to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. We were seated promptly at 8pm, per our reservation, but that's where the promptness stopped. It was 15 minutes later when we got the drink and wine menu. I told our server that we'd make a wine selection after we made our meal choice so we could pair the two accordingly. I did this in hopes he'd bring a food menu.It was 8:30 before we received our food menu and 9:00 before we received bread. Finally, at 9:30 - a full 1.5 hours after sitting down, we had our meals in front of us. The food was delicious but I can't say it was worth the 1.5 hour wait - especially not when we're spending $200+ on the meal.I asked one of our table attendants if this was a common occurrence or an unusual situation and he said it sounded unusual and he'd look into it. We never saw him again. Overall, I was pretty disappointed in my experience.

doc.title: One of the best meals in my lifetime!
doc.review: Where to start with this restuarant, I won't lie I was sceptical at first... I mean trying to recreate the ambiance and quality of dining in Paris is no mean feat, especially in Vegas but I am pleased to say that I wasn't just impressed I was wow'd! Once inside this restaurant you could be in any Michelin star restaurant in the world! The layout, ambiance, lighting, atmosphere and service was impeccable and faultless. We were directed to the bar until our window seat table was ready, the barman was skilled and well trained and could see that we were overcome by the 400 page wine list, so asked what we liked and offered us a specially made drink to compliment our tastes and preferences. Our table was intimate and by the glass window over looking the Belagio fountain which was superb, although you can't fully appreciate the atmosphere as you can't hear the music but the views are equisite. The menu was varied and extensive and out of all the places we have eaten around the world, to this day nothing has replicated the steak that we experienced here! It was moist, tender, succulent and tasted divine! I don't eat desserts generally but I couldn't resist trying a french culinary classic to test the kitchens true abilities And ordered a pistachio souffle, I was not disappointed it was probably one of the best that I have ever eaten! I cannot tell you how impressed I was, I only wish we could have done the chefs tasting menu, which I can only imagine to be fabulous! Some people have commented that the service was not great, but our servers/waiters were attentive and informative and we wanted for nothing! Overall an unexpected wonderful dining experience!

doc.title: Amazing Experience!!
doc.review: We had dinner here on our last night of our honeymoon, I had booked it a couple months prior and stated honeymoon on the reservation, when we arrived we where given a table right in the corner overlooking the Strip and the Bellagio fountains! Amazing!I had booked it for 8pm so by the time dessert came the sun had set and the fountains where all lit up, def a must if you go.The dinner was awesome, so tasty, I had the Steak which was one of the best steaks I have ever had and was cooked to perfection, my wife had the beef rib with Noodles and this was also delicios, great combination of flavours. Dessert is a must, I had the chocolate tasting platter and my wife had a banana and white chcolate tower thing, both where amazing to look at as well as eat!Service was perfect, you dont want for anything, treated perfectly.Overall a great experience, One warning is it is expensive, we where $200+ for our diner but dont let that put you off, it is worth it after all the only other place you can dine like this is in the actuall Eiffel Tower in Paris!

doc.title: Service didn't match food or price
doc.review: We had booked the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our 30th Wedding Anniversary meal. Unfortunately on the night we were there in July, the service did not meet our expectations. We had requested a table at the window, which we did get, however we felt hurried throughout our whole meal experience. I had not actually finished my amuse bouche when the waiter arrived with our starter and proceeded to move plates around for space. At various times during the meal we were startled as a waiter appeared unexpectedly between us (the tables for two face the window) and poured more drinks (a simple' excuse me' would have been appreciated!). Either during the Starter or the Main the waiter asked if we would like to order dessert, and that if we did and wanted the souffle, we had to tell him now, as it took 30 mins to cook. For what we were paying, I would expect to be able to remain seated long enough after my main dish to await this dessert's preparation! To cap it all, we were still eating our main dish when the bill was placed on our table. I have to say the food was lovely, but as the title says, the service did not match. We had looked forward to a really lovely experience, but felt rushed the whole time. It was only a Monday night too.From other reviews it does appear that we were unlucky with the service that night, however we will not be back.

doc.title: Wonderful experience
doc.review: My Birthday dinner was at the Eiffel Tower on July 4,2012. It was the absolute best birthday anyone could experience. The service was exceptional, the food was fabulous, and the view beautiful. Ron was the greatest. This is always my go to restaurant when ever we are in Las Vegas. Thank You for a wonderful evening.

doc.title: Epicuruous Experience in Las Vegas
doc.review: This restaurant experience begins with a private elevator ride to a space with a gorgeous view! We were 3 and started with the seafood platter, foie GRAS, caprese salad, and a few other items. Delicious! We ordered 3 souffles for dessert: pistachio, chocolate, grand marnier. Scrumptious! My entree was black cod provencal, it was cooked in parchment and was excellent. Great food, experience, and service, but $$$$!

doc.title: A Treat
doc.review: A TreatWe were 7 for dinner and we loved this place. Our waiter , as well as other staff members, were funny as well as efficient. We have all had those folks that made our dinning experience even better.We had the braised short ribs. A little over done, but very tasty. The rest of our group had steaks and they were perfect. We had a great view of the fountains of the Bellagio, as well as the strip.Great experience and we will be back. The casino wasn’t the best, but we were there for the food

doc.title: Excellent food, fantastic view
doc.review: Fantastic setting overlooking the Bellagio fountain, excellent food and great wine choices. Leave room for a French dessert.

doc.title: We had high hopes
doc.review: We dined at Mon Ami Gabi last time we were in Vegas and hoped that the Eiffel Tower restaurant would be a similar experience but with even better food (we loved the food at Mon Ami Gabi). How could this not be better? Let me count the ways. Our server had very little knowledge of the menu, the food was just ok, and the service was slow. The view of the fountains of the Bellagio helped take some of the focus away from the service but not entirely. One expects excellent service in a place like this. I actually waited several days to write this so I could cool my proverbial jets. We made a reservation many months ahead and the staff was short and rude. We should have known then this wasn't the same caliber we were expecting. We were shortly in to our dinner and the photographer showed up and offered to take our picture. We thought this was a great option and chose the fountain view picture. She said she would return one of the times the fountain was going. She never came back to our table. She took the pictures of the table next to us and we figured she would be back but she wasn't. We saw her chatting in the kitchen as we left. We sat and waited quite some time for our check so she had plenty of time. We were there almost 2 hours with all our courses. Speaking of courses... if anyone at the table orders the tasting menu, everyone has to. Most restaurants are able to plate other food around the tasting menu. This one can't/won't. We have both worked in restaurants that do this on a routine basis, and this was certainly not a busy night there as less than half the tables were filled. They did have an amazing mousse, but that is to be expected in a French restaurant like this. Probably won't be back, but looking forward to going to their downstairs neighbor asap.

doc.title: Dining with a view
doc.review: A bunch of us enjoyed dinner here one night. It was a fantastic view. They provided us with a palate cleanser (aspargus puree) and some fresh breads in different varieties. I enjoyed the duck as my entree, which was very good, though I wish the sides were a little bigger so I also ordered their green beans. They were delicious. I would have liked to order some wine, but they were very much out of my price range. I also tried the braised short ribs, which were very tender and the sauce was yummy! The view here is just simply amazing. Though service can be a little slow it was an enjoyable time!

doc.title: Good view of the Fountains
doc.review: Enjoyed our meal there. We were seated at the window with a good view of the fountains of Bellagio across the street. The atmosphere was terrific as was the service. Prices were a bit steep, but that's modern day Las Vegas. The food was well presented and tastefully done.

doc.title: The elevator takes you to the kitchen
doc.review: Excellent food and atmosphere. Nice staff. My steak was very good. The view to the Belagio is a plus. I´ve been to a couple of expensive restaurants from where you leave at the end of the night wondering if your money was really well spent. Well... I´d say the money was well spent here. Nice idea: the elevator takes you to the kitchen. That´s an original way in! (I was there in October 2009)

doc.title: Highly disappointed!
doc.review: My husband brought me here for our 16th wedding anniversary. We live in Las Vegas and this restaurant was on my list for many years as a place that I wanted to go. We had a reservation for 2 at 6 pm, so it was a bit early and few tables had been seated at this time. We were asked to wait, and we did for about 15 minutes. When we were sat at our table, very good location, the table cloth had spilled salt and pepper on it. The charger plate was dusty?!?!?!?! How does this happen at a restaurant with this sort of reputation? When our waiter approached us we were asked us if we had plans to see a show after dinner, were we in a hurry? I assured him that we were not in a hurry and that we planned to take our time. The steaks we ordered were overcooked. We were hurried out and not even offered a desert menu or coffee?!?! I will not be going back to this restaurant and I will not be recommending it. If I want to eat a hurried steak I can go to Outback!

doc.title: Incredible Views and Stunning Food
doc.review: When planning our trip to Vegas, I selected the restaurants, bars and clubs we went to based on a number of criteria...Trip Advisor Rating and Contributor Comments, proximity to our hotel and the View...afterall, the view of the Strip from sunset onwards is one of the most amazing things about this unique city.I'm pleased to sat that the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris EXCEEDED our expectations!!One of the best things that really helped make this evening special was that I happened to find the name and contact details (from a review on Trip Advisor-THANKS!!) of the Restaurant Supervisor (Lyle Tolhurst ltolhurst@leye.com ) so I e-mailed him a few months prior to request a special table by the window, overlooking the Bellagio Lake. He not only responded promptly but he secured probably the best table in the restaurant, right on the corner of the building, with a perfect view of the Fountains. The restaurant staff who served us all knew it was our Anniversary and we were made to feel very special. Lyle even organised for a special trio of desserts (like a sampler dish) with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate sauce around the edge of the plate to be delivered to our table at the end of the evening.It truly was a magical experience and a memory that we will cherish for years to come.I have no hesitation in recommending Eiffel Tower Restaurant as a 'must do' expreience when you are lucky enough to be in Las Vegas!

doc.title: Great view, average food
doc.review: My boyfriend and I set aside enough money for one nice dinner while visiting Vegas. We saw "The Eiffel Tower" and decided to give it a try. The view was perfect, especially at sunset. Our waiter was great, just a little difficult to understand. Our food came shortly after we ordered it. The servings were tiny and definitely not worth the $130 for the meal. Its a good place to go if you have money to waste, but for us it was a bit of a let down.

doc.title: Excellent every time
doc.review: I have eaten at the Eiffel Tower several times and have always left more than pleased. The food is always world class and the service has always been fantastic. On several occasions I have requested a table with a good view and have been rewarded with a great view of the Bellagio fountain show throughout dinner. This restaurant has been wonderful for both business and romantic dinners. I highly recommend.

doc.title: worth a visit for the view
doc.review: Very high end French restaurant with a great set up in the Eiffel Tower. We went with a larger group to celebrate a milestone birthday and had impeccable service in a private room. There was a preordered menu, food all came out timely, hot, delicious. My only complaint, a guest requested a change of course from the preset menu. No problem with the change, but was never informed that this would incur additional cost to the host. So if you are looking for a romantic setting, and high end French Food with the according price tag and attitude, then this is your place.

doc.title: Fancy Shmancy
doc.review: It was pretty good and the views were great! Look up the food online before going because there aren't any pictures. The vegetarian crepes were a little too lemony. And everything was really expensive. But we had a great time. I think night time would've been prettier.

doc.title: Great Meal as usual
doc.review: Very time we stay at Paris hotel we have are last night dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The view are great as the sun does down. The food is very good.I tried the corn soup and it was very creamy, i usually do not like corn soup But our waiter stated it was like a clam chowder. For entrees my wife had the salmon and i had the Dover Sole. Each was prepare excellent. For desert we each had a souffle. Their souffles are the greatest we've had. We always have Velentino Crespo as our waiter and he makes sure our meal is a special ending to our visit.

doc.title: 33rd Anniversary
doc.review: We celebrated our 33rd wedding anniversary with dinner at the tower. The view was spectacular...the food was delicious, and our service was impeccable. Very expensive...but the dining experience was top shelf.

doc.title: A must.
doc.review: Whether you like Paris and the Eiffel Tower you must eat at this restaurant. The views, service and fhe food are the best in the city. A bit pricey but nothing different than any big city or great restaurant. Ask for a window seat to watch the Bellagio's fountain shows. This was my second trip to Vegas and my second dinner at the Eiffel Tower. I know I will be back.

doc.title: Anniversary Special
doc.review: We reserved our second time at the Eiffel Tower restaurant for our 10th wedding anniversary. The first time I had the best fish I have ever had. This time the beef ribs tasted as though they simmered an entire steer of flavor into the six strips that adored the delicious buttered noodles under them. Superb service throughout the meal makes this a standout choice in a town noted for excess.

doc.title: Great Views, Very Expensive
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for New Years Eve a couple of years ago. We were lucky enough to get a table at the window which offered fantastic views of the Bellagio fountains as well as the strip and the fireworks at midnight.The food was nice. We ate about 6 courses as part of the set menu which included a lobster mousse, fois gras, and oysters. I can't say I'm really into French cuisine however I did enjoy the food presented to us. The waiter was great and recommended a couple of great cocktails and a fantastic Armagnac. You do pay a lot for this all though. For myself and my partner, the bill came to $1100, which included the tip.Whilst it was a good experience, I definitely wouldn't go back on New Years Eve again, simply due to the massive bill. I think the restaurant at the Stratosphere would offer a better menu at a cheaper price with just-as-awesome views.

doc.title: Nice View
doc.review: Nice View of the fountains, the food was good, had the short ribs.We had 4 drinks, and desert. The ser vice was good, not a bad thing to say. The bill was 275.00 with tip

doc.title: Best Birthday in 59 years!!
doc.review: Went here for lunch today to with friends to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. Could not have been happier!!! We were a table of junior senior citizens :) and our server TODD could not have been more attentive or friendlier...he just played the game with the ladies(..that we started) perfectly!2 of us had the Parmesan crusted chicken which was outstanding and 2 had the steak sandwich that they loved and one had the trout and he said it was perfect. The cream onion soup was a hit. We ordered all the deserts and made a buffet..ha the Creme broulette was my favorite but all were exceptional 'The specialty drinks were great.We got special deserts for our celebrations. Saying happy birthday and happy anniversary in chocolate on the plate.The star of the show was the service!!! Todd could not have handled these crazy old ladies better!! He was handsome and quick with his wit!!My best birthday ever!!! Thank you Eiffel Tower restaurant!!!!

doc.title: Very good
doc.review: Good view, service and food ok, not excellent. Nice place to visit in LV and not expensive.

doc.title: over priced!
doc.review: Excellent view of Bellagio fountains and of the Strip. The food was excellent as well as the atmosphere. Besides being too expensvie my only complaint is that we had a party of 10 and I asked when I ordered if we could have separate checks and the waiter said that could not be arranged! I thought to myself how can we sort out the bill ourselves and pay our share! Finally, at the end the manager was called over and he did in fact instruct the waiter to arrange separate bills, which he should have done in the beginning. However, I must say the dinner experience there was impressive.

doc.title: Best in Vegas
doc.review: I wanted to take my missus out for a nice (expensive), romantic dinner. I booked through OpenTable. We had an outstanding seat on the northwest corner, and could easily see the Bellagio fountain show. Dinner itself was excellent, we both had steaks and sides. As with all upper-class restaurants, pretty much the entire menu is À la carte. For a full meal for two plus two drinks we paid around $200, which is obviously pricy, but was worth it.Hostess took our coats, our table was ready and waiting for us, wait staff was attentive and very polite, asked if we were celebrating anything. I'd highly recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for a romantic dinner out, as long as you have the bucks to shell out for the experience.

doc.title: Worth the Price
doc.review: We came here for lunch. I (my husband) wanted to save a little money and so came here for lunch. We got an excellent view by the window of Bellagio and its water show. The meal was worth the price. We bought 1 appetizer and 2 main meals. We were full by the end, including tip was $60. Great service, my husband who drinks water fast never had an empty glass. It was relaxing, very delicious, and beautiful.

doc.title: Elegant, never uncomfortable
doc.review: You can go to their website http://www.eiffeltowerrestaurant.com/We went to lunch. My husband and I took our eight-year old daughter as she is in love with all things Eiffel tower. They treated our daughter like a little lady. They have a kids menu although I would not recommend this place for children unless they are the very quiet type. It is a French restaurant. Everything is expensive and the portions are small. All food was tremendously delicious! I had half avocado, and tomato salad (I don't eat much red meat). Both were exquisite. My husband had the open faced steak sandwich (it was served beautifully of course) and he loved it. My daughter had spaghetti :) http://www.eiffeltowerrestaurant.com/images/eiffel/pdfs/menus/lunch.pdfI had an Eiffel tower signature drink (18$) which I can't stop dreaming about. For dessert I had strawberry souffle. The service was outstanding. The atmosphere ... well look at the pics. It was definitely worth the splurge. Highly recommended if you are ready to spend the money.

doc.title: What A View!
doc.review: The food is amazing! The view spectacular. Try to get a table by the window to watch the fountains at Bellagio!

doc.title: Do yourself a favor and go for drinks. Food was not good.
doc.review: We went here for a nice dinner before seeing Cirque Du Soleil.pros: They were very fast and professional, service was excellent views are fabulous side dishes were goodcons: The food was not good.I got the salmon and my boyfriend got the cod. His food came out and the um... "cod" tasted more like warm, unflavored gelatin. The only discernible flavor in the dish was the plastic-y taste of the bag used for poaching. "Not good" doesn't even begin to describe it. When we told the waitress, she said that everyone hates that dish but the chef refuses to remove it from the menu. I had ordered the salmon, and although it was slightly overcooked, it was very tasty. They offered to replace the nasty cod with the salmon. So we waited. and waited. and my food got cold. we ate the side dishes which were good. we ate bread, which was good. His salmon came out and after a few bites, we discovered that it was entirely raw in the center. We told the waitress and she said "oh, that's medium, medium-rare. That's how we cook it". I told her that I'd never had salmon prepared that way without an indication in the menu/description and pointed out that their cooking must be quite inconsistent since we both ordered the same thing and got completely different preparations. And she argued with me about it and said "Yeah, I'm sorry but that salmon isn't raw... I guess yours is just overcooked"whatever. I guess she felt badly about it... or realized that she'd just managed to significantly reduce her tip.... she came back and gave us a few candies and removed the salmon from the check. Totally didn't matter. We still paid a lot of money for a terrible, awkward, poorly timed, not-good dinner.

doc.title: Great, High price but worth it.
doc.review: Beef Wellington. Who has that on the menu?? This place does and it is amazing! Service above excellent. View spectacular. Price High. be prepared to spend some money here but by far the best meal in vegas for me.

doc.title: "You can smell the terroir"
doc.review: It's 12 years since we were last there and it is still as good as when it was new. The wait staff is exceptional, and the sommelier knew his stuff (including the smell of soil on the Rhone vineyards!) The lamb was perfectly pink, the duck cooked like I can never manage at home and everything came at the right time. It was very busy -- Saturday night -- but looking over the Bellagio fountains with a jaw-droppingly expensive martini (ginger-flavored) killed the time nicely. We were seated about 30 mins after we arrived but I think that's just a ruse to get you to buy something at the bar. Wine is pricey but well selected and the food is so delicious we bought the cookbook. All the mousses -- savory or sweet -- are perfect. And they brought us a special dish for our anniversary - a sort of card on a plate - written in chocolate with a chocolate mousse shot glass. We saw other people celebrating events and they were all recognized with a complimentary food item. When you make a reservation they ask if it's for a special event. Overall it's expensive but they give you amuses bouches throughout the meal and petites fours at the end. For a treat it can't be beat. (Take money to the Women's room - there's a lady handing out towels and it's customary to give her a buck or two. )

doc.title: Amazing Lunch
doc.review: Brilliant lunch and signed book by the chef made an excellent gift. Wonderful views of the fountains. Great experience.

doc.title: Amazing Experience
doc.review: We have been to this restaurant this year and last year. The atmosphere is awesome, with friendly staff. The food is superb. Make sure you try a cocktail from the Bar too! We went this year to celebrate our wedding anniversary and the staff were gracious enough to put us in excellent seats for us to watch the Bellagio fountains. I would highly recommend this restaurant and we plan to go back next year.

doc.title: Perfect place for our wedding dinner!
doc.review: We booked this restaurant in the afternoon for 8:30 pm. We told them ahead of time that it would be our wedding dinner. When we arrived our table wasn't quite ready so we went to the bar for a drink. 2 gin and tonics were $32 ... a little pricey but what the heck it was our wedding day! A little while later our table was ready. They sat us at a lovely table for two right at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the strip. It was very romantic and perfect for this occasion. We started with the King Crab which was amazing. We both decided to have the duck which was the best I've ever had... we had no room for dessert but they brought us a small mousse to share as their gift for our special day. The entire meal, ambiance and service where perfect! Thanks to everyone at the restaurant for helping to make our special day even more special!!

doc.title: Great food and great service
doc.review: It was good food and very good service. We had 8:30 reservations on July 4th but we were not seated until about 9:15. We finally got seats at the bar as the waiting area was quite crowded. I just love standing around in heals. The wine was exceptional but pricey. Same with the restaurant. The view was spectacular, We had nothing to complain about the food. I have had better, but there was not a crumb left on anyones plate. I would recommend it. But I wouldn't eat there again. Downstairs or the elevator in this case is a lovely restaurant called Mon Ami Gabi. It was cheaper and better food. It also had terrace seating across from bellgio's fountains. Even in the heat of summer it was lovely.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the PARIS Hotel.
doc.review: Great and delicious food. The service was excepitional.

doc.title: AMAZING FOOD
doc.review: Me and my college roommates went to Vegas for spring break, and we had an amazing time!On our last night we decided to splurge and eat at the fabulous Eiffel Tower Restaurant! Food was amazing! Escargot was delicious!We all got a different dessert and shared and had a great time!Perfect location we could see the Belligo water show right for our seats, theres not a bad seat in the house here!Pricy, but worth it!YUM!

doc.title: You are paying for a view and not the food
doc.review: My wife had the lamb chops. She spent the rest of her night beside the toilet. I had the Black cod and tasted so plain. I expected to be blown away considering a plate was $40 plus, but really I was left with an empty wallet. Our server was rude, and I can say that this is one place I will never eat at again, or ask anybody too.

doc.title: Wonderful Meal
doc.review: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews, but my husband and I made reservations to celebrate our 18th anniversary here. I have to say that our experience was fantastic from the beginning! We got table overlooking the Bellagio and views were amazing. Our server was excellent, attentive but not pushy.
