The menu is kind of limited but food was great. I had the tomato salad which was everything I hoped it would be and my husband had the bleu cheese souffle -- excellent as well. Entrees were good, and save room for a souffle for dessert they were wonderful. It was expensive, but knew that going in and we would definitely return there again.

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: Great food, exceptional service. The view overlooking the Bellagio fountains was amazing. It was my friend's birthday and they gave her a free dessert! Expensive, but who cares it's Vegas!

doc.title: Great food and service
doc.review: They gave us a window seat for a great view. The appetizers are excellent. We had the duck and it was cook superbly! All the people that served us were the best! It is not a cheap place but you are getting some of the best food served to you in Vegas! Will go again the next time we are there.

doc.title: Oo La la, Las Vegas!
doc.review: Our son and daughter-in-law provided us with a superb 'Wedding Breakfast' dinner here following their wedding at the Bellagio - we walked from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower and ascended to the restaurant where the views while you were eating were amazing. The food was amazing and delicious French cuisine. Beautifully cooked, impeccably presented, and courteously served! Following the meal we went to the top viewing platform for a wonderful view of Las Vegas. Most recommended.

doc.title: Exactly as expected
doc.review: Celebrated our anniversary July 4 at Eiffel Tower. I went in with very high expectations, and the staff did not disappoint. Waited about 30 minutes for a window table, but expected as much on a holiday. My wife was wowed by the great view of the Belaggio fountain show, which was the reason I chose Eiffel Tower. Wait staff provided the perfect balance of attentiveness without being obtrusive. The food was excellent. My wife enjoyed her rabbit, and my rack of lamb was perfect. Topped off by an amazing soufflé for desert. The price was actually pretty much right where it should be considering the quality of the food, service and ambiance. Would definitely recommend.

doc.title: lunch
doc.review: We were having lunch at the restaurant, was drinking a pink velvet, very good and my wife had a champagne with fruit soaked in them, can I say terrific!!for our lunch we had the most tasting onion soup ever made, yum! and some ham and cheese finger sandwiches.It was all superb and a nice few

doc.title: Best Views in Vegas
doc.review: This is one of the best views in Vegas and also one of the less expensive things to do.I went during dusk so I could see the strip when the lights came on. I am scared of heights so it took awhile for me to calm myself and walk towards the railing to look at the view.

doc.title: Great Food, Great Service!
doc.review: If you're looking to spend your money on great food and great service vs losing it in one of the casinos, Eiffel Tower is THE place to go. The staff are great; they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. They understand their menu, so much so they are able to make accommodations, as necessary (and within reason). Recently, my husband and I took our daughter to the Eiffel Tower. She had a great time, enjoyed the view of the dancing water at The Bellagio. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and made great recommendations throughout our meal. The restaurant has ambience for that special occasion, but can serve up a nice retreat after a long day going from casino to casino (or golf course to golf course)! Highly recommended! We'll definitely be back...for our 5th or 6th visit!!

doc.title: Not to be Missed
doc.review: A wonderful experience. The view was amazing - our table was by the window overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio. The food and service were both excellent. We were looked after from the moment we entered the restaurant until we left and made to feel special the whole time. This is a must for anyone that appreciates good food and service.

doc.title: outdated and needs a revival
doc.review: First time visiting Paris hotel and thought i'd be "wowed" by the restaurant but it was "Meh". A bit disappointing that the quality was not there and the decor was definitely dated. Would have been nice to have a fresh coat of paint and change up the decor. Food was ok but would have appreciated if the food was a bit more tastier. Basic is the word I am looking for. Not as regal as I expected.

doc.title: Gluten Free Review
doc.review: The food was really good and the view amazing, but the best thing is the GLUTEN FREE ROLLS that are served to everyone! I couldn't get enough. Had the crab/avocado appetizer and trout. Delicious! Had a window seat for lunch.

doc.title: Delightful
doc.review: Went there for my birthday and had a fantastic time. The food is simply excellent, the service attentive and knowledgeable. Situated in the Eiffel Tower, Las Vegas, it has a wonderful view overlooking the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: Amazing setting with one of the best views in Vegas
doc.review: Amazing view with fantastic waiters that cater for your every need! If there's two of you try to get a table on the outside by the windows to take in the view of the fountains of Bellagio!! The prices reflect the location and quality of food but are not too out of reach for the average person who fancies a fantastic meal and surroundings. Well worth a visit

doc.title: Very expensive and it helps to speak French when ordering
doc.review: Went for a special honeymoon meal but left feeling a bit of a plonker. The menue is in french so I nearly ordered snails with steak! The wine menue is huge, and a little guy tries to give you advice, but given the prices, he should be giving you a loan instead. I can't deny the food was excellent, although I've had just as good for a fifth of the price. Nearly $300 when we only had 2 mains and shared a desert is just to much. Nice location but we where put deep in a corner. The guy expecting a tip in the toilet really isnt necessary, and expecting a tip for watching you take a pee is just rude. In summary like many things in Vegas now,this place is overpriced.

doc.title: Top Shelf Dining
doc.review: This review is as much a tip of the hat to my fellow reviewers at Trip Advisor as it is a glowing review of the dining experience we recently enjoyed at the Eiffel Tower restaurant at Paris Las Vegas.What I mean by that statement is this... Las Vegas was the jumping off point for an eight day AAA Executive's National Park Adventure, so we had decided ahead of time to crash one last night in Las Vegas after our whirlwind adventure and we decided a fine dining experience was the best way to finish off our western trip. So, how to choose? Naturally a visit to the Trip Advisor website was in order. In a short time the reviews kept us coming back to the Eiffel Tower as the spot that best blends fine dining with the whole 'Vegas' experience.I am now pleased to report that our visit to the Eiffel Tower on June 27, 2012 not only met all our expectations, but I will safely say they exceeded them. We had made our 7pm reservations months before with Lyle the restaurant manager. Since we had made this deal via e-mail naturally we were worried that we would be kicked to the curb upon arrival as 'high-rollers' took all the good window seats. I am so pleased to report to all our fellow Trip Advisors that Lyle kept his part of the bargain by reserving for us not only a window table, but THE table featured in their ad--you know the corner table that overlooks the strip as well as the Bellagio fountains. We were blown away. I feel that this table assignment is a great reflection on the power of Trip Advisor. I do not believe one for a minute that we would have received the same treatment if we had just called the restaurant directly on our own.Now for the actual dining experience, I will simply say that the service, the food, and yes the prices charged were all in line with what the positive reviewers had foretold visitors what to expect. Therefore I shall not attempt to do a 'food' review because that is well covered by so many other reviews. But what I will say is this..we went by our hotel's casino on the way to the Eiffel Tower and saw that one of the slot machines featured single plays at $100 a pull. So the choice is yours..two or three pulls on a machine or a couple of hours of top shelp dining. Either way it satisfies what you will call a "Vegas" experience.

doc.title: Excellent view, food and service
doc.review: We love eating at the Eiffel Tower - the view of the Bellagio fountain is great, and food and service never disappoint!

doc.title: View was amazing, food was nothing special
doc.review: Had dinner with another couple and enjoyed the view and had great service. I had beef Wellington and was not impressed. The meat was bland and a disappointment. Salmon was ordered and was told it was best she has had but also was first fine dining experience. My husband ordered rabbit and enjoyed it but wouldn't reorder the Dish again. Overall not impressed with food but views were amazing. Too many great restaurants with views to chose from to have medoricore experience. Wouldn't go back.

doc.title: OUR BEST MEAL!
doc.review: Eating at the Eiffel Tower was a wonderful experience! The food and drinks were outstanding and the view of the Bellagio fountains made our experience even more memorable.

doc.title: A special experience
doc.review: We chose to have lunch here simply because it was more affordable, and we still get to have the experience. FYI, the fountains at Bellagio don't start until 3pm, so if you're going to watch the fountains, you'll want to go for late lunch or dinner. The view was still amazing and beautiful! We arrived just before 11:30am and were seated in a corner window overlooking the strip and Bellagio. The service was prompt and friendly, the food was good, but not spectacular like I was expecting. But I'm still giving 5 stars for excellent service and a good experience.

doc.title: Amazing View, Stellar Sevice, Fantastic Food, but NOT cheap
doc.review: Without a doubt, the absolute best meal of our trip!! Elegant atmosphere, Extremely personalized and attentive service, fantastic food, great wine selection, and a sommelier that practically reads your mind. This was a very special occasion, so it was worth the money to us. It was indeed pricey, but worth every bit in the end. Ask for a west side table to enjoy the sunset, view of the strip, and fountain show at the Bellagio.

doc.title: Yummy food and grand view!
doc.review: My sister ordered a BLT Tower sandwich. Little did she know that it would actually be stacked in a tower! Amazing food! And you get to watch the fountains at the Bellagio! I would highly recommend this!

doc.title: Beautiful view lovely setting, and ono food!!
doc.review: For a last minute change of plans for my birthday I couldn't have asked for a better place. The view was absolutely beautiful!! We sat in the corner in full view of the Bellagio fountain show. The service was great. They were very nice and very consistent!! The food was great!! The appetizer breads were also very good. In all it was one of the most romantic dates with my boyfriend we've had in 4 yrs. The only downfall was that it was a lil too dark for me, but everyones got their preferences. I would suggest it to honeymooners, n love birds period.

doc.title: Disappointing.
doc.review: Caesar salad without egg? Stale bread? Seafood soup with one piece of seafood? Halibut chunk on couscous packed with parsley. Sea bass with nondescript asparagus shavings. Marginal wine for $54. Total spent $200; left hungry.

doc.title: Awesome place! Must eat!
doc.review: We went for our first wedding anniversary. We live in Las Vegas but have never been there before. The view is amazing. We sat at a half moon table that faced the stip looking south. I was impressed by the level of service. The food was to die for as well. My only issue is the price. You can eat at other local places in Las Vegas and get just as good food, but they do have the best view. But the good thing is the price keeps certain people out (tacky dressed tourist and other poorly dressed people). We had a blast and will go back sometime. My wife and I had 2 glasses of wine each and dinner and with tip it was $250.00. Well worth it for the anniversary!

doc.title: Good food, a little pricey, with a great view
doc.review: The food was very good -- perhaps a notch below truly top-tier, excellent French food, but certainly very good. It's pricey; definitely check out the menu on the Paris Hotel website before you go to make sure you're comfortable with the prices. (I'm calling it "a little pricey" -- appetizers in the mid-to-upper teens, entrees in the mid-30's to mid-40's -- but I'm sure it's in line with most of the higher-end restaurants in Las Vegas. For some people, this pricing is not a big deal; for others, it's much higher than a normal night out, so I'm just trying to provide information to help guide anyone considering dining here.) I won't go into detail on the food choices, as I think many of the previous reviews here do that pretty well. I'll just reiterate that it's very good, and if you're looking for a nice meal in Las Vegas, and willing to pay a bit of a premium for the view, then the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a good choice.The view is as good as advertised. If possible, you want to get a table as near the front point of the restaurant as possible, as that will give you the best view of the Bellagio fountains. Our table was fairly far to the left side, and I could see about half the fountains without really craning my neck or standing up; if your table is closer to the center, you can take in the whole view of the fountains dead on. If you're not in a rush to dine, and they start to lead you to a table too far off-center, ask if you can wait for a front-and-center table opens up. (We were going to a show after dinner, so I decided not to risk a long delay asking for a different table.) Again, there are no BAD views; I'm just offering this as a tip if getting the best view is important to you.

doc.title: Excellent Staff, Food and View. Unforgettable Evening
doc.review: I Went To the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on June 19, on my 2 year anniversary with my girlfriend.I had made a reservation a few months before and got in touch with the restaurant manager Mr. Lyle T. (who you can see reply to some reviews in here) and he was very helpful in setting up an amazing dinner experience for me and my girlfriend, we got a very lovely window table with an amazing view.My plan was to propose during dinner so i called in advance and made arrangements to have the ring delivered. The staff was very nice and helpful , i asked the waiter to take a video with my personal camera while the ring was delivered and i proposed. It was great.The food was amazing... never in my life have i had so much sensory overload on my tastebuds we were full to the max and we even left a little bit of our main dishes but we couldnt take anymore in..... and then they brought the souffle.... wow. Delicious, amazingly light , we were full but we still ate it all in a breeze. I had the chocolate and my now fiancee had banana.The whole experience while expensive was worth every penny, we got out of there happy, engaged, mesmerized by the view, and we have memories that will last the rest of our lives.I really want to thank the manager Lyle and everyone in the staff and our waiter (his name was 'Roman' or 'Roland' or something like that, i apologize for not remembering it to well but i was nervous by the proposal.Highly recommended restaurant, would gladly skip a show on next visit to dine here again.-Daniel

doc.title: Amazing view, good food
doc.review: We made a reservation as soon as we booked our trip so that we could sit right on the glass and overlook the fountains. We went early enough to also watch the sun go down, what a treat! The daytime view with the sun setting is spectacular! The food is expensive, you are paying for the view. It was all very good, the desserts were spectacular.

doc.title: Best meal ever!
doc.review: We loved this restaurant! The food was amazing and the service was great. It's small, quiet and romantic with a great food. Lyle is the supervisor there and hd took great care of us. It's expensive but it's worth it if you can splurge.

doc.title: Excellent in every way!
doc.review: I first visited Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris a few years ago (it was pretty new), and thought it was a gimmick, popular just because of the view - which is to die for. However, the service was superb and the food was out of this world. I have been back a couple of times since, always expecting that I'd never have that magical first experience again, but it has NEVER disappointed. I highly recommend this gem in the desert!

doc.title: Excellent!!
doc.review: Truly amazing experience! The foie gras, the shellfish soup, the rabbit but the steak and lobster is to die for! Great view and excellent service also add to the atmosphere of the restaurant.

doc.title: Outstanding view
doc.review: From the greeter on the first floor, to the hostess, to the wait staff, to finally the restaurant manager, the people involved made this a memorable dining experience.Oh, and by the way........the food is outstanding, and the view is the best in Las Vegas.Some might find the Eiffel Tower a bit expensive....but as the saying goes, "you get what you pay for". The chefs tasting menu and wine pairing is a fun way to dine. The wine pairings were spot on, and enhanced the flavor of each menu item.We were treated graciously, and felt pampered every step of the way.

doc.title: Great view - don't waste your dough on dinner
doc.review: Never again! Except maybe for a cocktail. While the views are fantastic, the service and the kitchen does not measure up to high-end Las Vegas standards. The menu is truly pedestrian with no imagination whatsoever. Prices are targeted for lame high-rollers and we pity the poor punters that take their significant others there for a once-in-a-lifetime celebratory occasions.My wife and I joined her clients in from out of town with another couple for a birthday dinner. We opted for wine-by-the-glass, but the list was MBA/CPA optimized for maximum gouging. The menu was strangely limited, although each category - beef, fish and non-beef - about 6 selections each, was hardly stimulating. New York Strip, rib eye, rabbit, halibut. Yawn. Started off with a vichyssoise that tasted like it came from a can. The taste of the French bread was terrible! Local Vietnamese sandwich shops offer fresh French bread with better texture and taste. Then we waited - for an hour before the mains were served. The average entre price is $50. Salads are $12. With so many fabulous restaurants in greater Las Vegas, we're loath to return. All the view in the world didn't make the dinner experience any better.Semi-retired food snob. He doth protest too much.

doc.title: Some Things Are Really Good, Some Really Bad
doc.review: I am giving this 4 stars based primarily on the Service of our waiter and some of the meal. Appetizers and most entrees were excellent. I had surf and turf and was not impressed at all. The turf was a finger size piece of lobster and the rest was a type of pudding made up of the other parts of the lobster...not really my style and certainly not what was stated in the menu.Also, the item that rates a 1 star is the Maitre d'. After making reservations and given that I had family from Brazil on their first visit, I requested a table next to the window overlooking the water show at the Bellagio. I was informed that I would have to request specific seating from the Maitre d' upon arrival. I arrive early and was advised by the lobby attendant for the restaurant that a tip would help. I tipped the Maitre d' $50...got nothing, except not by the window and half of our table's view blocked by an iron pole running through the restaurant.If you can't or won't accommodate, don't take the tip!!

doc.title: Beautiful view while having lunch.
doc.review: Food was fantastic, we each had large salads, one with duck and the other seafood. Would highly recommend.

doc.title: Wow .....
doc.review: Amazing view as your eat your meal - looking out over the belagio fountains.The food was amazing and the service superb.Not cheap - but for a special occasion it can't be beat.

doc.title: high priced, great service, mediocre food
doc.review: Ok, I went here about 5 years ago and thought I would give it another try. This is a hugh room, some tables have great views but the prices will make you dizzy. Tux clad waiters are all pros and will take care of you. The food was totally over priced, not very creative and had a mediocre presenatation and taste to it all. Ok if you are from out of town and want to take photos, but for a real dining experience, you can go to 30 better places at these prices.

doc.title: Perfect
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our 12th anniversary there. We had expectations that it would be expensive and worth it. They surpassed expectations. We made reservations with open table a month in advance where we wrote in that it was our anniversary, and then forgot all about it. Imagine our surprise then when, WITHOUT TIPPING ANYONE, we we're given the most amazing table - directly in front of the Bellagio fountains. The waiter knew it was our anniversary (he gave us a little pre-dessert dessert treat with 'happy anniversary' on the plate) and so did the manager - who stopped by our table not once, but twice. The service here is exemplary. The food was wonderful. I had the heirloom tomato salad (OMG, amazing - I could have tipped the plate and drank the tomato water, but then again, I'm a veggie person) and the chicken (very good). My husband had the peeky-toe crab salad (good) and the lamb ("AMAZING!! The best lamb I have ever had"). We both had souffles for dessert - my husband had caramel (incredible - infact it was so good, that he, who is not a dessert person, only gave me one tiny bite). I had chocolate souffle (excellent). While we were having dessert, the manager came by and asked if we were enjoying it. We said yes, then he asked if either of us cooked. !!!!!! I DO !!!!!! He promptly pulled the recipe out of his pocket, gave it to me, and offered 3 suggestions for preparation.WOWand the view . . . I don't know how it could have gotten better. I can't imagine that even the Bellagio's rooms could have that view - they just don't have enough distance to see the whole thing.It was a very lovely evening, and my husband and I would like to say thank you to the wonderful staff who made the evening so wonderful and to the manager, Lyle Tolhurst, whose service extends above and beyond - in fact, the day after our meal, my husband recieved an email thanking us for coming.

doc.title: Great place to celebrate a special occasion in Vegas
doc.review: We made our reservations on Open Table several weeks in advance, although we were disappointed we did not get a table at the windows, we did enjoy the comfort of the horseshoe-shaped booth and a nice view of the Bellagio Fountain show. We took the waiter's recommendation and ordered the baked bleu cheese appetizer (yum!). The bread was pleniful, fresh and a wide variety. The wine list was extensive and they offered several wines by the glass. I enjoyed a California Chardonnay. Our son and I ordered the Beef Wellington, which was flavorful and cooked to a perfect medium rare. It was served with fresh pea pods and pearl onions. The side of sauted mushrooms was a perfect pairing. My husband ordered the lamb and it was delicious, perfectly prepared and full of flavor. Our desserts were the highlight though. It was our son's 21st birthday celebration; they brought him a decadent chocolate mousse on a decorated plate--very nice. In addition, he ordered a choclate souffle--scrumptious! I had the cookie plate, it was an array of small sized chocolate cookies, cakes, and mousse. My husband enjoyed his creme brulee-- though average in his opinion. We were stuffed and happy, then our waiter came around with a tray of choclate and cookie samplers. A perfect way to top off the evening.

doc.title: Perfect dining experience
doc.review: My husband and I ate here last year for our anniversary meal. We made reservations several weeks in advance and upon arrival were shown to a table at the front of the restaurant next to the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Wow!Our waiter was extremely helpful and as my husband isn't a wine drinker we opted for a recommended bottle of champagne which was delicious ($70).We had read reviews about the portions being small so we opted for a Starter, followed by a Soup, Entree and we ordered the signature chocolate and caramel souffles in advance. The Blue Cheese souffle starter is to die for, although the raw marinated beef that my husband ordered was equally delicious. We had the salmon and rabbit for entrees and could highly recommend both. By this point we were so stuffed, but we had the souffles to come, they were very light and not too sweet and we're glad we ordered them as they finished off the perfect meal. I can only presume that the people who complained about small portions are more used to standard american restaurants where, to us Brits, the portion sizes are enormous. I can honestly say that we ordered 1 course too many and that 3 would have totally filled us up.We thought it was a lovely touch that the Manager came and introduced himself during our meal and congratulated us on our anniversary. I also received an email from him when I returned home to thank us for dining and welcoming us back in the future.All in all the 4 course meal + bottle of champagne + tax + decent tip (for a truly lovely waiter) it came to $450, but we had accounted for this and were prepared for paying this much. Anywhere else and I would have felt a little begruding at paying so much for a meal but my husband and I felt it was worth every penny......and we are lucky enough to be able to celebrate there again this year. I can hardly wait!

doc.title: Great views and service
doc.review: Had Sunday Brunch, Eggs Benedict,French Toast. Ala carte,good prices. Really enjoyed everything. Service was great,views the best.

doc.title: Okay to try once
doc.review: The view was not really all that spectacular. The food was good but was way overpriced. I can mark it off my "Been there, done that" list.

doc.title: Most amazing Italian food
doc.review: We have tried many times to go to this restaurant, but never had luck, no openings. This time we got lucky. Now I know why they are always booked. The food is so tasty, you want to order more and more. We tried from the mozzarella bar, burrata and mozzarella, three different pastas, fish, ribs, fried potato and prosciutto. Since I have been to Italy ten years ago, after their authentic tasting pasta nothing was comparable, except this place. Out of all the Italian restaurants this tops off everything. I will definitely go back. The service is also very good and nice ambience. Super clean table cloths, glasses, all good quality. Go enjoy!!!!!!!! It is LOVELY!!!!!!

doc.title: awesome service
doc.review: You can guess the nice things: great view, fine cuisine, great wines... the best part of my dinner there (corporate event) was the great server we had. The tables put together to cater for our group of 20 were crowded, there was so little space but the server just kept smiling, apologizing for what was our faults and made the evening quite special.

doc.title: The time of my life with my beautiful wife.
doc.review: Exquisite dining experience with the love of my life. Amazing place and excellent food.

doc.title: Nice enough
doc.review: We went to this restaurant on the 5th June where my husband popped the question. I always wanted to be on top of the Eiffel Tower to be proposed to so why not in Vegas? :)The restaurant is nice enough. The window seat has great views. The waitress was great.The entrees were OK to good. But not great. For the price, you expect great. I had the pea soup with carrot caviar. It was good. But just good.First of all, we were still eating our entrees when they came with our mains (only halfway through our entrees). The waitress apologised and offered to keep them warm. This worried me a tad because I'm pregnant and food has to be served hot, not warm.When we finally finished our entrees, our mains came through within seconds. As I'm pregnant, I was very specific about my lamb to be cooked completely (no pink) and towards the "well done". I made sure the waitress knew this and to let the chefs know. I had to take it back 3 times (it was definitely medium rare) and still wasn't good enough. I gave up the 4th time and gave it to my husband to eat. All they did was heat the plate - not actually re-cook the meat!After that, I just didn't feel like dessert. Apart from the lovely waitress (where 2 stars have been awarded plus 1 for view), the food was OK, chefs didn't listen to what was asked and the bill at $300 (with only 1 glass of wine for my partner and water for me) was exorbitant (as we only had 2 entrees and 2 mains).I recommend Le Cirque hands down over this place. Sorry Eiffel Tower.

doc.title: Pricey with a fabulous view
doc.review: The panoramic view overlooking the strip is gorgeous and the restaurant is well-appointed with great service. While the quality of the food is excellent, the prices are quite high-budget $200 for a two course dinner for 2 with coffee. Beware: a standard cup of coffee is an eye popping $6.50!!! and was fair at best. If the price were on the menu, we would never have ordered it. I am sure no one else would either...which is why the price is not on the menu.On the plus side, they served the finest filet mignon any of us has ever eaten (at the cost of $56 for a 9 ounce portion with a delicious red wine sauce) but no other accompaniments.Scallops were also excellent. When we were last here in 2011, we had the tasting menu which was a $99 per person gastromic feast. Unfortunately, everyone at the table has to agree to order this, and some of the selections this time were not to everyone's liking.As a special occasion treat, this place is worth a visit.

doc.title: Fine dining with a view
doc.review: I made reservations for my wife and I at the Eiffel Tower a couple days ahead for a special dinner before a show on our dress up night. It was our 2nd time dining here. The food was exceptional, as before. The wine list is staggering, but they'll be glad to help if you like. The view was so good that my wife asked me if I'd "arranged" to have the table we had. I didn't, but I can't imagine a better dining view in Las Vegas, with the dancing Bellagio fountains just across the street, and the strip at your feet. Service was perfect, and that's a word I almost never use. It's pricey, without a doubt, but for that one big dinner I couldn't suggest a better place.

doc.title: I love this Restauarant!
doc.review: My wife and I have dined at Eiffel Tower on several occasions and for my money this is my favorite place to dine in Las Vegas.The food has always been outstanding.The Service has always been top notch.The view overlooking the Fountains at Bellagio make for a very romantic dinner.The prices are very reasonable considering you are in las Vegas and it is a very cool restaurant.We can't wait to get back there again!Ed S

doc.title: go for the view
doc.review: Four of us ate here for a birthday. The view of the Bellagio hotel and lake were the one of the highlights. The food was good, but I didn't like the duck. Of the four dishes we had lamb, steak with escargot and mushrooms, duck and halibut, the steak and halibut were the best. the wine list is very extensive and we ordered wine by the glass recommended by the sommelier. The appetizer blue cheese souffle was really good! for dessert we had the chocolate souffle which was super fluffy and light! the staff is excellent! The views of the water fountain were awesome. It is a great place for a special occasion.

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: I had dinner here last week with some friends and had a wonderful time. The service was excellent our waiter Valentino was brilliant fun and kept us laughing whilst still being attentive. We had direct views of the bellagio fountains which was beautiful. I had the cold Fois Gras with figs to start which was lovely and then the short ribs to follow which were the best thing I have ever tasted! I would love to come back and visit again!

doc.title: What a view...
doc.review: With a view of the Bellagio Fountains, you can hardly go wrong. My hubby wasn't enthused with his Beef Wellington, I got the Lamb Chops, and they were very good! The waiter was very attentive and kept the glass filled w/ wine and who can complain about that. We enjoyed the view and the waiter's attentiveness the most. Not sure we would go back, due to the price. But the experience is one to remember.

doc.title: Spur of the moment
doc.review: Had trouble getting into restaurants before a show, but the service and food were excellent and we made the show on time.

doc.title: Excellent food and great view of Bellagio fountains
doc.review: I thought it was great to experience this place. It seems more like a special occassion place unless you have an unlimited bankroll. A birthday or an anniversary or to try to impress someone on their first time in Vegas, this is the place. The food is killer as well.

doc.title: Best View
doc.review: The view was spectacular and entertaining being across from the fountain show. The people are friendly, excellent service and the food was great.

doc.title: Beats flying to France.
doc.review: Expensive but fun.I would do it again!Try the Duck and Fois Gras.

doc.title: Best food I've ever had
doc.review: Please note that this is an expensive French restaurant. If you do not have $200 to spend, then don't go. With that being said, the food was the best food I've ever had. I had the salmon and green beans almondine. Mouth watering, absolutely incredible! The service was exceptional and very informative. The cocktails were excellent and they even servce domestic beer. I suggest making a reservation around 7:30pm and ask for a window seat to ensure you can watch the sunset. Please dress to impress!

doc.title: The place we take visitors for a dinner experience to be remembered!
doc.review: Food's good, albeit expensive ($$$-$$$$); bottle of wine is double or triple what you find in the store. But get there a half hour before sunset and be ready to watch the lights of Vegas come up as the sun goes down, and the Bellagio fountains come to life every fifteen minutes. The ambiance is hard to beat!

doc.title: Excellent choice!
doc.review: I was a little hesitant to try this restaurant because I wasn't familiar with some of the items on the menu, but happy that I did. The food was excellent and service was also fantastic. I would definitely recommend trying it.

doc.title: Great View, Overpriced Food!
doc.review: I was very dissappointed in the restaurant and maybe I just had it too hyped up in my mind before we went. I was expecting something AMAZING like everything else in Vegas and all we got was so so and for a very high price... we have had much better for much less. Maybe it was just the type of cuisine but we were not impressed. I give it 3 out of 5 because of the view and location. You get a perfect view of the strip!Problems:We had a reservation for a table by the window so we could look out over the strip while we ate, we showed up 10 minutes early and ended up waiting 45 minutes for our table. The menu selection was small, the food was WAY overpriced even for Vegas and not very good... The server was alright but not great compared to everywhere else we had been. We were very disappointed we wasted our money there. The buffet at our hotel was would have been a better choice by far! Then we wanted to get a picture with our own camera, at the same time they have a girl walking around offering to take pictures but with her camera and then makes you feel like you have to purchase the picture from her...

doc.title: what a joke!
doc.review: my sister and i first went in there, actually sat down, ordered a drink . small drink !18. each! then we looked at the food around us. the 'rack of lamb' was one single piece of rib. for 30. THEN you have to buy a potato for 10 bucks. AND a veggie for another 10. The soup was smaller than grandmas tea cup. we paid for our baby drinks and went to ramsy's restaurant and had the best meal ever!

doc.title: Amazing view and great food!!
doc.review: I found this to be the most "unique" and special meal of our trip - but despite the high quality food, everything in Vegas has that sort of Disney-like, plastic feel. The view of the strip is absolutely amazing, especially the Bellagio water show. There's not a bad table in the house. The service was lacking - our waiter seemed like he wanted us in and out and couldn't be bothered to stick around to chat or answer questions. The lamb was amazing and the wine list is excellent. A good choice for a romantic occasion!!

doc.title: Very good food
doc.review: The atmosphere is wonderful. The food was good and not as expensive as I had expected. We had a short 15 minute wait.

doc.title: Best lunch I ever had!!!
doc.review: I came here for lunch with my mom during our shopping trip to Vegas last week and it was honestly the best lunch I've ever had. I'd definitely recommend going here for lunch if you'd like the service of fine dining but don't want the $200 bill that comes with ordering supper here. We came at 11:30 when it opens but even an hour later there wasn't that many people in the restaurant. I suspect that everyone there for lunch had a window seat. Even though the fountains aren't running at lunch the view is still spectacular. The service was excellent, although my only small complaint is that our waiter was VERY pushy in trying to sell more. It got quite uncomfortable towards the end of the meal. For example we ordered one appetizer to share and he kept trying to sell us two, we ordered two drinks and he was trying to push a bottle of wine on us, after we finished his meal he asked us like 5 times if we were sure we didn't want a coffee or dessert. However everyone else in the restaurant who attends to you is the pinnacle of polite and professional! The food was excellent. I ordered the BLT and it was the way a BLT should taste. The bread was amazing and they didn't skimp at all on the avocado slices. My mom had the open faced steak sandwich and she really enjoyed it. We were served these little cheese puffs before the meal and I could have eaten them in place of my meal!! Sooo good! We ended up ordering the creme brulee to share. It's quite big as it comes in a bowl not a little ramekin so don't believe your waiter if he tries to sell you two. It was cooked perfectly, the way creme brulee should be!

doc.title: Just A little below Expectations
doc.review: As suggested in their website booked at 5:15 to see sunset. That's really a little too early but a later booking will not have you planted at the window (as requested.) Food and wine was probably 3 star and the view 4+ star. We were staying in the Paris and had a view of Bellagio fountains from our 25th floor room so having that same view for dinner was not a huge plus for us, but would be for others. I found the service to be a little overbearing. Even though we passed on ordering the souffle desert at the same time as our entree, a desert menu was provided again at the conclusion of our meal (not a big deal by itself but read on...). Frankly, thought it was a little pretentious (and insulting) when I was told how to eat my meal "to maximize the convergence of tastes and textures on the palate". Saw major efforts to upgrade wine/drink orders, entrees and deserts at tables surrounding us. Even heard a pitch for the Eiffel Tower ride that "could be added to their dinner bill". Seemed the wait staff had commissions riding on upgrades. Overall, the food was better than average, the view excellent (otherwise the setting is about average for an upscale restaurant), the cost on the high end and the overall experience about 3 stars. Wasn't disappointed but it did not blow me away either.

doc.title: Amazing Experience!!!!
doc.review: Amazing night dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant celebrating our 27th anniversary. First let me say that my wife and I are not used going to restaurants with this type of atmosphere. I read lots of reviews on this site and one other prior to our trip to Las Vegas. I knew most reviews were wonderful. I read a couple of reviews that mentioned a waiter named Valentino and how awesome he was. I was also curious about the manager, Jennifer, responding to so many customer reviews. I wondered if she even existed. I knew we had to pay them a visit. Let me say wow, wow, wow!!!!! Making the reservation was a breeze both times. I had to call and reschedule and they had no problem with that. Our reservation was for 7:45 PM. Perfect for seeing all the lights of Vegas get brighter. The view of the strip was great. But the view of the fountains at the Bellagio was simply amazing. Guess who came to our table as our waiter.....Valentino himself. What I had read about him did not do him justice. He was great. He was so attentive to everything. He was not too loud, not too quiet. He seemed to know exactly the evening we needed to experience. I actually told him that I had read about him in some reviews and he seemed genuinely excited. The food was amazing, too. My wife had the rabbit prepared 3 different ways. I had the filet mignon, but being from Texas where we know beef, it wasn't quite what I expected. But everything else was wonderful. We actually had 3 desserts!!!! They were unbelievable. Guess who else came to our table.....Jennifer, the manager. She does exist. She wanted to make sure everything was great and it was. She did not just breeze by either. She visited with us for few minutes and she, too, was amazed that we had read about Valenino on this site and then had him as our waiter. Overall truly an amazing night. It wasn't just a meal. It was a night full of memories that my wife and I will remember for a lifetime thanks to all the staff.

doc.title: Thank you... again
doc.review: This was our third visit to the Eiffel Tower and again had a lovely meal. We had a nice table for two overlooking the Belagio Fountains so we couldn't ask for more.The food was delicious especially the souffle's for dessert - very nice!The service was good and coming from London we didn't think the price was too steep at all.This restaurant has to be tried once.. you may like it - we do! You do need to book.

doc.title: Everyone should go once
doc.review: Like every restaurant in Vegas, it's a bit overrated and overpriced, but at least we felt like we were close to getting our money's worth because of the ambience. We stuck with the Eiffel Affair cocktail at $12 a piece instead of spending $100 for our very familiar $15 bottle of wine, which would make each glass $25. The waiter was well familiar with the menu, which was nice. My husband ordered the duck and was very pleased with it. I had the rabbit and it was very nice as well. The best part is really the view of the Bellagio fountains. Once is probably enough though.

doc.title: Superb
doc.review: Perfect dining experience in every way. Server was excellent, the view was incredible and the food was delicious. This was a great dining experience.

doc.title: Nothing special
doc.review: We came here for our 1 year wedding anniversary. So i was excited to eat here because i read all the reviews that it was good. The food was nothing special!! For the price, it wasn't worth it!! My fish wasn't even cooked, you can see the it was still raw inside(pink). My husband ordered the prime ribeye he didn't enjoyed, and my husband isn't picky at all. Our waiter told us that the meals came with a side dish. Well when we got our bill they charged us the side dishes. Our waiter wasn't good at all. I don't recommend this restaurant!! Las Vegas has a lot of really good restaurants. If you want a restaurant to see the fountains, try the restaurants at the Bellagio!! We ate at The top of the world restaurant at Stratosphere, that was the best meal!!!

doc.title: expensive but a fabulous night
doc.review: my partner and i had prebooked a table overlooking the bellagio fountains. we booked for 5.15pm had a fab view, watched the sun go down and the fountains. the staff were very attentive although i did feel pushed into choosing a very expensive bottle of wine, however my fault i suppose i should have been more assertive, the wine and food were nice, but it was the whole experience and view that made a great evening. i would have been disappointed if i'd not been sat at the window overlooking the fountains though.

doc.title: Great food!!!
doc.review: It was an experience worth every penny! The food was amazing as well as the view.....Its an experience worth reliving again!

doc.title: Great View If You Can Get It
doc.review: We celebrated our anniversary here. We had reservations and waited in a lounge area to be seated for about 20 minutes. We asked for a table with a view and were lucky to get it overlooking the strip. Everyone wanted a view and many were turned down. The food was very good. We enjoyed the ambience. A special anniversary dessert was served to us. The only negative was a girl in the bathroom wanting tips for a paper towel. I understand this, but don't like it. But it is Vegas, everyone wants tipped!

doc.title: Authentic French food with great views
doc.review: Great food with a wine list to match; tables are very close together and window tables too small; choose a table on the tier above or behind to gain space without sacrificing the view

doc.title: FANTASTIC!!
doc.review: We loved it, had a great waiter, funny, charming. The view was amazing, and the food was perfect! Very worth the money. It was our fav place in vegas!

doc.title: Very good menu
doc.review: For a dinner with a view it is hard to beat this resturant. Excellent service and fine dining cuisine.

doc.title: Bar with a...
doc.review: ...view. We stopped in for a glass of wine and ended up staying for several. The view to the Bellagio Fountains is right on. Our bartender was well informed and very gracious. Super wine list. I suspect this place is the best part of the Paris hotel experience. A view in Vegas everyone should see.

doc.title: Wonderful all the way!!
doc.review: If we hadn't drank so much, I'd probably remember more BUT being in Vegas... you know how it goes! ;) It was a wonderful meal from start to finish! The food was top notch! I had the short ribs over egg noodles which were succulent!! Sister had a fish dish which was tender and melt in your mouth yummy!! Our server was so patient with us and put up with my husband and brother in law jokes. He was laughing with us the entire night! (or was it AT us?? ;) ) The view was the BEST in all of Vegas in my opinion! It was not stuffy or pretentious to me but like I had, we had alot to drink all day! LOL! I would highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for something upscale and celebratory!

doc.title: Unforgettable Anniversary Meal
doc.review: Dined here on the evening of our 30th wedding anniversary. We were given a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains as we had requested when we made our reservations. Service was excellent and even though it was a very busy evening and we do not drink we were not rushed. Our sever stretched the meal out to almost two hours but the atmosphere was so enjoyable the time passed quickly. Would recommend to anyone for a special, unforgettable evening!

doc.title: Wonderful dinner
doc.review: We had a wonderful dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant last week. I made the reservation for early evening so we could watch the sunset and the lights come up on the Strip. We both felt that the service and the food were equally fantastic. Not too attentive and not ignored. The portions were also just right. Take your time and enjoy!

doc.title: Surprisingly Good Food and Ambiance
doc.review: Bright, beautiful panoramic view of the Bellagio and its fountains, cordial, professional staff, very good French cuisine. I had crab stuffed avocado to start and the duck confit salad. The glass of Vouvray was over-sweet but not bad. My guest had a similar meal and the two of us were out $120 including tip. Really quite good value all in.

doc.title: $$$$$ but great for a big occasion
doc.review: We normally couldn't afford to eat somewhere like this, but it was a gift for a big birthday. They gave us a great table overlooking the Strip (opposite the dancing fountains at Bellagio). Service was superb, food was just amazing, and there were a lot of nice, extra touches that made it a very special occasion. Would highly recommend it if your budget stretches that far.

doc.title: Bon appetit!!
doc.review: Getting a reservation at a reasonable time is a challenge; however, we were able to get in very quickly by going up to the restaurant area and ask to be placed on wait list. No one was waiting; therefore, we were sat at a table for two by the window in a matter of minutes!! Our waiter was exceptional. He was very knowledgeable about the food and wine. We had the most exceptional 6 course meal and waiter recommended wine. If I had to choose between gambling or dining at the Eiffel tower restaurant---dining would win!! GO--do not hesistate to make reservations early or gamble on the wait list!!! Just GO!

doc.title: A wonderful night!
doc.review: Wow! How many ways can I gush about the Eiffel Tower restaurant? My husband made the reservations and I was happy to go to this place. We were treated very warmly upon arrival. The hostess was lovely, as was the bartender who served us cocktails while we briefly waited for a table (which was a fantastic one looking at the Bellagio fountains). Ou server was the awesome Velentino... he did not overlook a single detail for us all the evening. He was great and we were sooo well looked after. We eat out often and we travel often and this, no word of an exaggeration, was our BEST MEAL EVER!!!! I had the blue cheese souffle and my husband had the scallops... both were delicious. Even the bread and butter was delicious! (the bread comes to your table and there are 4 fresh choices and the butter is specially ordered from France; I think it is called Pologne butter).We had a wonderful bottle of wine (Caymus Cabernet) with our entree. We both had the filet mignon. It was so delicious that after every bite, you kind of had to put down your knife and fork and just sit back in your chair and savour it while you ate. Unbelievable! For dessert we had creme brulee and a caramel souffle. Heavenly! The souffle came to the table and as the caramel was poured into the centre of it, it rose and puffed up even more. It was the kind of night where you are so full... but the food is so darn delicious that you still keep eating because you know this is a rare, special night - it isn't just anywhere you can find food this well prepared. I loved Vegas more after eating here. Warm thanks to the chef and our server Valentino but an unforgettable evening.

doc.title: We just eat at the bar...
doc.review: Once again (like for the 5th time!), this was a magical evening. We always just sit at the bar and nibble/wine our way through the evening.Have never met such a consistently interesting, educated, interested group of bar tenders and they always make our evening special. They make us feel special!The views are actually better from the bar than from anything other than a window table!BARBARA

doc.title: Overpriced...
doc.review: We ate here because we had tickets to see Jersey Boys later that evening. Our reservation was at 5pm and we were seated right away. The view of the Strip was very nice but since it wasn't dark yet, it wasn't as spectacular as it would have been if all the lights of Vegas were on. We did not have a window seat, instead we were seated next to some heavy beams that blocked a lot of our view. The service was very good and the staff was extremely friendly. The food was just OK. I orderd the rib eye that was suggested by our waiter. It was not cooked to my liking, the sauce was bland and it wasn't even warm. I would have sent it back but we were pressed for time. My husband didn't like his meal either but the other couple we were with seem to like theirs. If I had to do it over again, I would come up here for drinks and appetizers only and enjoy the view. The food downstairs at Mon Ami Gabi is much better.

doc.title: All the food taste the same, and be prepared to bring a woolen sweater. Its COLD.
doc.review: Service was great. The food however didnt taste anything. I have no idea why but we both found the food to not taste good at all. We went with the chef tasting menu, and well not a cullenary great experience. I would stay away from this place. If anything order a desert or some coffe to see the view, its great. But stay away from the food. The vine however was great. Also the A/C was on full go, so I was cold into my bones that day. There was nothing they could do about it. The casino under the restaurant had the power over how much air and how cold air that was pumped out. So if u get a window seat u might get a really really cold experience. They also forgot our cheeseplate, but we didnt really care cus all we wanted to do was to get out of there and get thawed. The servant we had did however bring me a shal and for that they get 2 tripadvisor dots and not one. He was very polite and helpful.

doc.title: The food and atmosphere is wonderful
doc.review: We didn't have reervations, but we decided to have libations and an appetizer at the bar. The restaurant at the Eiffel Tower requires that one dresses unlike most of the people that one sees walking the strip. We were able to get a table and enjoyed fine French cuisine. The view of the Bellagio fountains and the sun setting over the mountains was great.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: For a gourmet meal, you can't beat this place and the view is breathtaking. I had the rack of lamb - the best I have ever had and the desserts are incredible!

doc.title: Great View - wonderful Chef's Tasting Menu
doc.review: We had an open evening and spent the evening have the Chef's tasting menu. Such wonderful and different options were provided on some old standards and exposed to some great new dishes and styles. If you do the Chef's Tasting menu plan on at least 2 hours. The tables around us turned 3 times as we enjoyed a great evening overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. The photo girl was a littel ackward in her communication style but we ended-up buying the picture anyway. Staff was very attentive and Valentin did a great job of pacing the meal. Lyle the manager introduced himself and was available; but we never needed him. The tables are a litte close together and there were lots of groups on the evening of our visit, at times it felt loud.Highly recommended!

doc.title: The BEST view!!!
doc.review: My wife and I were very fortunate in that we were sat at a window table right in front of the Bellagio. The view was spectacular and the food was delicious! A very romantic venue and dinner with the love of my life with the best seat in the house.....hard to beat that!!!

doc.title: Better than expected
doc.review: I booked this restaurant for my birthday because of the view of the Bellagio fountains and because I wanted an elegant meal. I had some reservations based on the past reviews, but I was relieved when everything turned out just fine. Based on past reviews, I was careful to book an early reservation (5:30 pm) so we could get a table with a view, which we did, and the view is definitely worth it. We also went on a weekday which may help since they are probably not as busy then. All the staff were very friendly, so no complaints there. I will agree that the food and especially the drinks are very expensive, but everything tasted and looked great. We had the salmon and the chicken entries with a couple of side dishes, but you don't really need to order sides with these if you have appetizers first and you probably should save room for a dessert (they are worth the cost). We didn't bother with the souffles as the other desserts looked much more appealing and they were great!

doc.title: Great view, excellent food and service
doc.review: Outstanding view of Bellagio fountains, the service was outstanding, very attentive and the food was excellent also. A great dinner experience.

doc.title: Be prepared
doc.review: Some of the very best food in Vegas and the view is outstanding. It helps to make up for the snobs that work there. They must make a half million per year because they act like they make more money than you do and they are doing you a favor by just serving you. Swallow your pride and enjoy the food.

doc.title: An even bigger rip off than the original!
doc.review: What a poor, poor restaurant this is! The food was in imaginative, poorly cooked, poorly presented and just bad. This is the old, tacky Vegas at its height...but was unjustifiably high prices. Wines are poorly chosen, over priced and often poor vintages. Stay Away!!,

doc.title: Good Food, Good View
doc.review: We made reservations before we left home which i highly reccomend - be sure to ask for a window seat if it's just two of you - and arrange for after sunset so you can watch the Bellagio Fountains.Expensive - yes. Worth it? Sure - why not. The view is worth the price and the service is good except for us when there was a disconnect between the kitchen and the server and it look an hour and 20 minutes to get our entrees. Everyone apologetic, free desserts etc etc - but still, not something I expect at a fine dining restuarant. There is a very nice bar up here too.

doc.title: Best of the best
doc.review: There are a lot of fine dining choices in Vegas. But I have been to very few that are attentive to the ENTIRE dining experience like the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. From the minute you step up to the elevator you feel completely taken care of. The GM, Lyle Tolhurst, is absolutely amazing. As is the rest of his staff. The sommelier, Brian, is the best I have encountered.Anything I can say is an understatement. The food, the service, the atmosphere, the attention to detail....there just aren't enough adjectives....perfect, amazing, incredible. The only way I know to say it is that it's as if the entire restaurant and staff had partnered with us to provide a perfectly magical evening. They almost seemed emotionally invested in our special occasion. I simply cannot say enough. This was our second of what will surely be many visits to Eiffel Tower.The prices are exactly what I'd expect for a fine dining experience of this caliber. And I would consider them to be reasonable considering there have been times at other establishments I've actually paid more for less. I've been to places where my money was seemingly spent on the cache of a trendy name as opposed to quality and service. In conclusion, this is a place to indulge, to be pampered, to be taken care of, to have an experience with loved ones that you'll all remember for the rest of your lives. Let the Eiffel Tower Restaurant be part of one of your special memories. You'll be glad you did.

doc.title: Paris without a Passport
doc.review: My husband and I ate at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our Twentieth Wedding Anniversary. When we entered the main lobby to the Paris Hotel, we found what looked like the elevator shaft, but were told that we had to go around to the back side to find the maitre d' stand. From there we were whisked to the second floor, with the elevator door opening onto an open kitchen and a smiling hostess who escorted us around the corner into the restaurant. To the left of the entrance there is a wrap-around bar and to the right is the main dining room with tiered levels--cozy banquettes on the top tier, large tables on the main floor, and intimate tables next to the plate glass windows. We had a reservation for 5 o'clock, when the restaurant opens for dinner, and were lucky enough to get a small table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. The fountains are amazing from street level, but to see them from up high with a panoramic view at sunset was incredible. The menu is a la carte, with all items priced separately. I would recommend going to the restaurant website to look at the menu, that way you will have an idea of what you might want to order and you won't have sticker shock when you actually arrive at the restaurant. As everyone says, dinner is very pricey. I think an average meal with drinks, dinner, tax and tip will run $100 pp. It's definitely a special-occasion dining experience, and the wait staff works very hard to make you feel special. Our waiter was very gracious, and even though she looked busy she happily took the time to take our picture. Also, towards the end of our dinner the manager came through the restaurant greeting guests, inquiring after their meals, and handing out his business card. For dinner, my husband ordered the house salad and the beef short ribs, which were tender and tasty. As a vegetarian, I chose the spring pea soup and the artichoke crepes. I was a little worried because sometimes vegetarian food is not that flavorful, but the crepes were delicious. The slow roasted tomato coulis was especially good. Before our meal a server brought around a tray of freshly baked breads for our selection, and we were also served a chilled carrot soup amuse bouche. After dinner the wait staff crumbed the table before serving us our passionfruit souffle. Also, for those diners celebrating a special occasion, the kitchen sends out a small chocolate mousse with "Happy Birthday" or "Happy Anniversary" written around the rim of the plate.Even though it was a Saturday night and the restaurant was filling up, we never felt rushed. You could easily spend 2 1/2 to 3 hours at dinner. We had tickets to a show so we didn't want to linger, but it was nice that the whole experience felt very relaxed and leisurely. The restaurant also carries on the French tradition of a bathroom attendant who personally hands you a towel to dry your hands and offers an array of perfumes and lotions for your use. Unfortunately I had forgotten to tuck a few dollars into my clutch before leaving our hotel room.The Eiffel Tower restaurant is an event dining experience with beautiful views of the Bellagio Fountains, delicious food, and attentive service. If you don't care to invest that much time or money into dinner, you may want to consider going for lunch or for drinks at the bar, both would be more affordable but with the same amazing views. Whenever you go, though, you will be able to experience a little bit of Paris without the hassle of jetlag or a passport.

doc.title: Excellent for lunch.
doc.review: The views from this restaurant are awesome - at lunch tables of two are all seated facing the strip/Bellagio fountains as the restaurant is only partially open. Food was very good, prices what you would expect in that location. Not sure what to make of the service - seemed a little disjointed in places. Definitely worth a visit at lunchtime - book at the desk at the base of the tower in advance.

doc.title: Great views and good food
doc.review: Went here the day after getting married, for a celebration meal.This is the perfect place for that, its in a mock up of the Eiffel tower so you've already got the romantic atmosphere, plus you have fantastic views of the fountain display at the Bellagio across the road.To start with were taken to the bar for drinks while we were waiting for our table, the bar man does mix a pretty good Manhattan. The food was very good, we had from the set menu, and can't really fault it although its a little top end price wise. The service was pretty good, a little overly attentive, but its better than being left waiting all nights, also as we had tickets to see a show we did need to be out on time so it helped.Just as a word of warning take a jacket as the resaurant is very overly air-conditioned....I know its hot in Vegas, but if your in the good seats by the windows your right on the vents so it can get chilly.

doc.title: Service sucked, food was great.
doc.review: We made a reservation, turned up on time and were made to stand around for 15 minutes looking like idiots around the entrance while the waiter found us a table. After that, the service just went even more downhill from there. Had to summon the waiter many times for drinks / refills etc. However, on a more positive note, the food was superb. They need to work on their service skills though. The view of the Bellagio fountains was nice.

doc.title: Great food and great views
doc.review: It was an experience really.It wasn't cheap and the food is not Michelin standard but it was good and the view was stunning

doc.title: Stunning views
doc.review: Our favorite restaurant was The Eiffel Tower restaurant which boasts breathtaking views of the Bellagio fountain show. You can ride to the top (which is 1/2 size of the real Eiffel Tower in Paris) for an additional $10 to enjoy a panoramac view of the strip and mountains beyond.

doc.title: Fantastic, Memorable Meal
doc.review: I was excited to enjoy our dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant as I celebrated my anniversary with my wife. I was hoping it would be a special, memorable meal when I made my reservation on Open Table and the staff did not disappoint. We had a table by the window with a superb view of the Bellagio fountain shows as the sun set. Multiple staff members wished us a happy anniversary with genuine cheerfulness. I had read some reviews that said you paid for the view at this restaurant, not the food quality. Well, I strongly disagree. The food was delicious! I had a halibut dish and the middle-of-the-deset fish tasted as fresh as the seafood I get here in Boston. As a treat for our anniversary, the staff even treated us to a small after-dinner dessert. I was greatly impressed by every element of this meal. The decor, the view, the amazing staff and service, the great food, all perfect. Book a meal here for a special occasion or simply an elegant night out... and be sure to follow the formal dress code to keep the place classy! =)

doc.title: Fantastic dining experience
doc.review: I booked a reservation well in advance to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and it was a fantastic experience. My husband and I were in Las Vegas with his nephew and wife to celebrate a 30th birthday. We chose the Eiffel Tower to celebrate this special occasion. If you want to guarantee yourself a table along the window, you need to arrive when the restaurant opens at 5:00, which is what we did. They have tables of two or four along the window, which gives you the best view of the strip and specifically the Bellagio fountain show (fabulous). My husband and I had reviewed the menu on line prior to arriving so we knew what to expect. We found the service was excellent and included a discussion with the sommelier. When we first arrived the shades were drawn but once the sun set they were raised and we enjoyed the view immensely. We all ordered drinks, shared a bottle of wine, appitizers, main course, sides and dessert. I had mentioned in my reservation we were celebrating a birthday and the server brought a special birthday dessert out for our nephew. We also ordered creme brule, which we were advised they need 30 minute lead time to prepare, so this was done when we ordered our meals. Our meals were fabulous, the best beef tenderloin I have ever had, prepared exactly as I had requested. Everything was a la carte but the sides we ordered were enough for the four of us to share. Our dining experience lasted almost 3 1/2 hours and we enjoyed every minute of it. The restaurant was packed when we left, including many people waiting at the bar to get a table in the dining room. Note that men are required to wear pants and collared shirts. We enjoyed the opportunity of dressing up!Highly recommend dining at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant while you are in Las Vegas.

doc.title: Beautiful view, great service, food a let down
doc.review: Took my wife here for her birthday. Had to wait for our table, but didn't mind as the bar is beautiful and the bartenders were attentive. A small group was crowded around the a small table near the bar and were obnoxiously loud. Several complaints, but visits from wait staff and managers just made them louder. We were seated a level below them for dinner. The views of the fountains were amazing, and the service was above par, but mediocre food and the very loud drunks quickly made the meal a bad experience. Finally the loud group left, dessert arrived and life was good again. I won't return only because there are too many fabulous restaurants in Vegas.

doc.title: Great view but food not worth the price
doc.review: This is a special occasion place - even eating and drinking the cheaper items from the menu, the 2 of us paid $230 for what was a two course meal with a glass of wine each - so seriously expensive. The main attraction is the view over the Bellagio fountains and the window tables directly overlook it. They have packed in a lot of tables, however, so you are right up against your neighbours and, in our case, the serving station. Food is OK, although not as good as the price tag suggests. None of the main courses come with accompaniments so you need to shell out an extra $10 a portion for vegetables and it's easy to see how the price can rack up. I would give it two stars for the general experience and an extra star for the view of the fountains.

doc.title: Great food! Pricey!!
doc.review: We stayed at the Paris hotel and thought we'd try this restaurant. We go to Vegas a lot and had never tried it. We heard that it was good, but pricey. I'd have to agree. The food was really good and we had great service. The wine list is extensive. We bought one of the cheaper bottles of wine and it was still great. If you are going to go here and pay the prices, make sure that you make a reservation and request to be by the window. That view is worth paying for. It over-looks the strip as well as the fountain show at the Bellagio. For an appetizer we got the crab salad and blue cheese soufflé. I wouldn't order the crab again. For dinner we got the chicken and we were between the famous beef wellington and the short ribs. Our waiter talked us out of the beef Wellington (love an honest waiter) and we were very happy! For dessert we had the grand marnier soufflé. Yum.

doc.title: Sublime!
doc.review: We had our wedding meal here straight from the wedding chapel. I was in my wedding dress and felt like a princess from the very outset. We were seated directly opposite the view of the Bellagio fountains and the night was absolutely magical.Our waiter was supremely courteous and assisted us with menu choices. The food was absolutely delicious and of the highest quality, it was positively the best meal we could have ever had in the most beautiful surroundings for the most romantic meal of our lives.

doc.title: Way..Way to expensive!!!!
doc.review: Lets start with the cost...just for entrees and wine was over $600. The most interesting part was us paying $117 for a bottle of wine from my home state (Washington). I priced the same wine at $20 here. My friends I were with were from Scotland and unfamiliar with wines from my state. It was an excellent wine, but not for that price. I can strongly recommended the dessert ... had chocolate/port cake with shaved dark chocolate for $12 (this was worth every penny) with coffee. Because there was group of us we did not have a clear view. My suggestion would be to come for dessert and coffee if you must come. Stay away from the rest the of menu.. There are so many other things to do in Vegas

doc.title: Great view but EXPENSIVE!
doc.review: The first available dinner slot is 5 pm. I recommend making reservations. We had dinner right before going to see Jersey Boys which started at 7pm and had plenty of time to eat dinner comfortably. It is a fancy restaurant but dress code is casual dressy. I saw a lady with denim capris and flip flops. So if you go in with jeans but dressed up you won't feel out of place. We spend $280 for just the TWO of us. Filet mignon is awesome with red wine sauce. Surf and turf is DEFINITELY not worth the $74. It was delicious but not worth that amount of money. Our waiter was very nice. He was French (so he was a bit uptight, no humor). Half the staff seemed uptight too (perhaps because it is such a fancy restaurant) and the other half was realy great(but its still a fancy restarunat, weird). Would not go back but only because of how expensive it was. Great one time experience though. Oh, the souflee was good but not so deserving of the raving reviews I seen about it.

doc.title: 40th birthday celebration
doc.review: Good value for the quality of food offered. Attentive service. Great view of the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: Simply FABULOUS! BEST FOOD EVER!
doc.review: This is the best restaurant hands down in Vegas...the service is always top notch and we have made it "our favorite place" to eat anywhere in the country. Would recommend going as the sun is setting and the fountain starts to use more lights...view is amazing, romantic..would highly recommend the drinks from the bar as well...not sure what else to say except you don't want to miss out on this one...spend the money it is well worth it!

doc.title: Amazing 17th Anniversary Dinner
doc.review: From the moment we walked in, every single person who greeted us wished is a Happy 17th anniversary. We had a window side table. My wife's table was set with a single red rose and the plate surrounded by rose petals, as requested. She was impressed. The wine list is extensive, however buried deep in the middle are 2 bottles about $45 each, and they are both fantastic. Every other bottle is about $80 or more so take your time with the wine list. The Foi Gras was the best I have had outside of Paris, it was complimented nicely with an fig jam reduction with a rough texture to go with the smooth texture of the foi gras. My steak was amazing, my wife's fish was great. The service was outstanding, they gave us a special dessert on the plate lettered in chocolate was "Happy 17th wedding anniversary". We also ordered the Soufle, that has to be ordered with the main course as it takes 45 minutes to prepare and it was the lightest fluffiest ever!

doc.title: Exceptional restaurant
doc.review: Went to the restaurant after getting remarried, there was no finer way of finishing off the day than eating here. Made you feel special from start to finish, attentive, unbelievable tasting food, and if anyone can help me, I really need to get the ingredients to the Jack Daniels cocktail with orange and cherries, it is exceptional!! Although it is more than I would normally pay for a meal, I would pay it again in a heartbeat, FANTASTIC - A MUST GO PLACE....

doc.title: Fantastic meal
doc.review: Great service, excellent food with lots of original choices, perfect view, but be prepared to spend the big bucks ($125 pp).

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: Scott was great. We felt really special. Although the menu changed we still enjoyed it. This is a regular lunch stop for us when we are in Vegas Will be back next year

doc.title: Incredible desserts and views of the Belaggio fountains!
doc.review: OK it's pricey, but you'll never forget it. There isn't a better spot to watch the fountains at night , my personal favorite thing about vegas. Get a reservation early. This definitely beats the stratosphere about a hundred times over. The stratosphere is so high, you only see the distant lights, and the place just doesn't have the same ambiance as the eiffel. Every window table for 2 on half of the restaurant has perfect views of the fountains. Beautiful.

doc.title: Over Priced- food was okay
doc.review: Over priced. But the view was nice. Food was okay.

doc.title: wonderful views and great food
doc.review: We arrived at our reserved time and it was packed. We were then told it would be another 25mins so we had a drink at the already over crowded bar where the service was not brilliant. But that is where the criticism stops because when my husband and I were shown to our table overlooking the stri and the Bellagio fountains it didn't seem so bad. My husbands blue cheese soufle was the best we had ever had and the rest of the meal was of the same standard. The service was very good, friendly but proffesional. Our waiter Valentino was fantastic with his unique flair.

doc.title: Classy
doc.review: Thanks to the staff for making our anniversary special. The tower is a must have for a romantic visit to Vegas.

doc.title: Best view, great food
doc.review: I thought the Eiffel Tower was just a touristy place, but my wife wanted to go..... I was very surprised by the food and its presentation. Waiter was fine. The view was excellent. If you go, ask for a window table for the best view. It is really cool to go at night and watch the water show at the Bellagio.

doc.title: Very good experience
doc.review: Made reservation on Open table, arrived a little early and was seated around the time of the reservation. Asked for a window seat over-looking Bellagio fountains which was granted.Service was excellent. Had the snapper and wife had the rib eye. Both were very good. The best part of the meal was the Soufflé that we both had. Nice upsell they pull, waiter mentions during initial order that soufflés are available but that they take a while to prepare, so if we desire same we need to order now. I bet they sell more than they would if people ate and were full and then were presented with desert choices. The Caesar salads were served with anchovy in the dressing which I very much prefer. I think they do a nice job here. I would rate 4.5 out of 5, but as it is not available, and I also dined at Top of the World which was truly a 4, I must give Eiffel Tower a 4.

doc.title: Bad experience
doc.review: Firstly I would like to say the views are fantastic.That is where the positives end. Our bill for 4 was $880 but this was not our problem. We ordered the set menu with the wine pairing. The food was poor and a number of our dishes were served cold. The sides in some cases were almost unedible. The wine was served not out of the bottle but out of a small glass flask which I have never seen at any tasting menu anywhere in the world. The waiter was robotic,plastic and annoying. This restaurant charges prices to compare with the likes of the PIcasso restaurant but offers food and service like some of the downtown budget places. If you want a treat I would suggest you look elsewhere.

doc.title: Just OK.
doc.review: We decided to have dinner here on our wedding night. The ambiance is wonderful for a couple. The view overlooking the Bellagio fountain is breathtaking. The food was just average for such a high priced restaurant. The waiter was a little arrogant to us. We are meat and potato people from Ohio, and frankly didn't even know what some of the items were on the menu.
