We both ordered the filet, and I ordered a potato side dish (it had a fancy name but tasted just like scalloped potatoes), and when my husband asked for the same side, the waiter told him that my dish would be enough for two and would not let him order his own. When the meal came, the one side dish of potatoes that we had to share was just one spoonfull for each of us. The steak was just an average filet, nothing special. We then ordered the chocolate souffle because I've never had one, and to me it tasted exactly like hot co co wheats cereal. We payed a lot of money for a great atmosphere.

doc.title: Fine dining? not really
doc.review: Food was good but the experience was not in keeping with fine dining.For example the waiter repeatedly leant across the table to pour drinks rather than walking round.Several guests had small children with them which were running around the restaurant disturbing the ambiance to the obvious annoyance of many other diners. This should have been challenged by staff on 2 counts, firstly the obvious danger of scalding from hot food being carried to tables and the comfort of all guests.

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: Had the chef's tasting menu with wine pairing, and a lovely view of the Bellagio. GO HUNGRY! Delicious and wonderful, a perfect date night.

doc.title: Great views, pricey menu
doc.review: French menu, very expensive. No entrees under $39. Drinks around $10 each. Beautiful views of Bellagio fountains and surrounding hotels.

doc.title: Great Meal!
doc.review: My husband and I had dinner at Eiffel Tower last week and really enjoyed the experience. The service was fantastic, the food was excellent and the view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip was very nice. I would recommend this restaurant for couples looking for a romantic night out.

doc.title: An enjoyable meal
doc.review: We booked the Eiffel Tower for a meal with my aunt - although we didn't get the Strip View table we requested, there was still an impressive view from our elevated inside table - and we were really there to chat anyway. Staff were friendly and efficient - although there was a half-hearted attempt at up-selling, it wasn't intrusive and we weren't made to feel unwanted for not ordering everything off the menu. Service seemed a little rushed at first but in the end we stayed at our table chatting over a glass of wine until well after the meal, and there was no attempt to get rid of us or make us feel uncomfortable (at least, if there was I didn't notice). And the food - very good, and in reasonable quantities - the scallop starter and the lamb and sole mains were particularly memorable. A good (though not cheap) spot for a celebration.

doc.title: Amazing!
doc.review: We had excellent service, food, and ambience. The view from our window seat was fantastic.

doc.title: I must have ordered the wrong thing?
doc.review: I was looking so forward to having dinner here. It is beautiful inside and the view of the strip, and the fountains at the Bellagio are spectacular . BUT my dinner was mediocre at best. I probably ordered the wrong thing which was a type of fish with vegetables. It came in a little baking bag which the waiter cut open at the table. It reminded me of how I use to cook fish or beef ten years ago. For dinner it will cost about $75 per person. I ate at The Mesa Grill at Caesars and thought the food was better there. Sorry.

doc.title: Good view, good food
doc.review: It's fun, nice ambiance, great service and the view and food were good.

doc.title: Very Overrated
doc.review: If you are used to finer dining experiences, this is not the place to go. First of all the view experience makes you feel like you are sitting in a crowded auditorium. The seats are so close to each other and there is no privacy. It appears they have tried to crowd as many seats and tables to give as many people as possible the "view". The food is definitely not worth the price. The first thing I noticed was the torn carpet that made the restaurant even more unattractive. I had called and told them my husband was celebrating his 50th birthday and if I could have a dessert served, with his name and happy 50th birthday. He received this little shot glass of a dessert with the words... happy birthday written on the plate with no mention of his name and the birthday he was celebrating. I don't mind paying the price when the food and experience is exceptional, this was not!

doc.title: Not worth the money
doc.review: View was nice however sun was shining in my eyes at 7 pm, food was fair,drinks expensive, would not return for dinner again ,too expensive and small portion. Dessert was fair.

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: This was a great experience. We really enjoyed the kitchiness of the Eiffel Tower in LV, but the restaurant made us forget kitchy in the superb meal and service. The waiters all gave off an aura of career-waiter, with experience laid gently at your feet to make the most of your choices. We had a table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains, which was a great way to see them, but the views up and down the strip were frankly better up in the air than down below! Food was delicious at our table, not a single thing I'd criticize. Highly recommended, if pricey.

doc.title: Pricey but very good
doc.review: The food here is very good, I have never been to France so I don't know if this authentic french food. The blue cheese souffle and chocolate souffle are both perfection.

doc.title: Excellent and romantic
doc.review: Food was very good and view is outstanding. We actually enjoyed lunch, more than dinner, but both were very nice and at dinner one views the dancing waters at Bellagio.

doc.title: Delicious Food, Superb Service and Spectacular View
doc.review: Our dinner was first class from beginning to end. We made our reservation for after a show and to be honest if you prefer to eat later I would recommend getting a 930 or later reservation. The restaurant gets quieter as you dine which was very nice. We selected the tasting menu which was a delicious and creative 6 course dining experience starting with appetizer and ending with a beautiful dessert. It was a bit more expensive then just a meal a la carte, however we figured since this would probably be a once in a lifetime experience for us we wanted to taste a little of everything. Our total dining time with the tasting menu was about 2 hours. I highly recommend that you make a reservation and if you have a small party request a window view of the Bellagio water show. That was so fun to watch while eating our wonderful food. Don't worry if you cannot get a window seat though the entire restaurant has amazing views. If you are planning something special or romantic this is the place to go all out. Yes its an expensive visit, but the experience is worth every penny!

doc.title: The usual French restaurant
doc.review: Unfortunately, I did not acquire a fine taste for eating in life. Not that I eat anything in front of me, but I don't see value in certain things. And this restaurant is part of it.Food is a-ok, if you're not a French cuisine enthusiast. Especially if you're not willing to spend A LOT of money eating. The views are nice, though. But the staff... meh. Might be something for people to experience France: you definitely get the attitude from the waiters as you'd get in France!Another thing that bothered was that, when I made the reservation over the phone, I specifically asked if there was anything in particular I needed to know about the dinner. They told me there wasn't and that I just had to show up on time for the reservation.Then when I get there, they only allowed me to enter the restaurant if I accepted to BORROW a blazer, because they had a dress code, which WAS NOT mentioned to me. I have no issues with dress code. I think each restaurant is entitled to enforce whatever code they want.But I definitely did NOT like being the idiot inappropriately dressed for dinner. Plus, wasn't a lot of fun to wear a blazer that who knows when it was last cleaned. Anyway, if you want to show off and spend a lot of money - or just speak French to other people, that's the place for you!

doc.title: very romantic place
doc.review: food is decent, view is great, very romantic for serious date or anniversary

doc.title: Top class restaurant!!
doc.review: We went last night, our last night in LV.When we booked during the day we were asked about celebrating any special occasion. We're here because of my 50th birthday. We hoped and asked for a nice table.We got the best table in the restaurant overlooking the Stri and the Bellgio Fountains.We decided to have the Tasting Menu ( $9 each). In total we had 8 courses including 2 sweets plus an extra fort birthday!!The service was impeccable and a lovely atmosphere.In total it cost $330 including tip ( omg -good job my H paid) with 2 white wines 2 red then a bottle of red....well it was my birthday!!!For a top quality meal AND the opportunity to get a bit dressed up ( there is a dress code) its a great restaurant. Enjoy!!

doc.title: Class personified!
doc.review: This is an upmarket establishment. Right from the word go the Eiffel Tower Restaurant delivers on all fronts. The staff were amazing, super attentive and the food was nothing shy of exceptional.Ask for a lake view of the Bellagio fountains, it' will make your dining experience that much more.

doc.title: Must be tried once
doc.review: This is a great venue for food. It is a bit pricey but for a special occaision it is impressive.I had the venison chops and they were fantastic and my wife had the Rack of Lamb and polished the lot.The staff were attentive and polite.Book in advance and you will get a table with a view of the bellagio fountains if you ask on arrival and are prepared to wait at the bar for 10-15 minutes.

doc.title: Can anyone say, "Best Creme Burlee in town"
doc.review: The location is great as you watch the bellagio fountains dance. The staff is better then "European servers" (just came back from 10 days in France). The food is one of the best in Vegas and the best item on the menu is the last item...Creme Burlee. It is lite, you are served a large portion and it is topped with a paper thin wafer larger then a pancake (oh and fresh fruit). Great atmosphere and reasonable pricing.

doc.title: Excellent Service with a Fantastic View
doc.review: My daughter wanted to eat here and I agreed despite the prices. We came for lunch; I had the BLT sandwich and she had a trout dish. Both were excellent, as was the creme brulee for dessert. It was a very nice experience despite the fact that it set me back a few $$.

doc.title: Great Place for Lunch
doc.review: Overlooking the food, the views are top notch. But the food is wonderful also. I must say that the creamy french onion soup is worth the trip. Our salads were crisp and fresh and the french toast was filled with calories and worth every bite. Service was wonderful and we will go back the next time we are in Vegas.

doc.title: Go for the drinks
doc.review: Dining experience was good - got a fabulous table that looked directly at the Bellagio fountains. Experience could not have been better. The food did not meet the expecations, or the value. Had a great wine selection - but food was just ok. Very romantic - and has some of the best views on the strip.

doc.title: excellent food and service
doc.review: what a great place to take a date becasue the view, food and service is perfect.

doc.title: A great dinner experience
doc.review: The restaurant is located on the 11th floor of the 1/2 scale Eiffel tower and offers some great views. The food was excellent but also high end in terms of price.We would go back again.

doc.title: Expensive for what you get
doc.review: You pay for the view and atmosphere. I had to send my steak back to get it cooked, it came out rare, but I ordered medium. Services was excellent, wine was expensive but good selection.

doc.title: Staff was outstanding, views too.
doc.review: Overall a great meal. Staff was the best I've had in Vegas. Views are top notch, especially with views of the Bellagio fountains if you can get it.The food was Very Good, but overpriced when compared to Mon Ami Gabi just downstairs. Wine list was verbose, but markups a touch high (3x) from what I could tell.I probably wouldn't go back, but certainly a must see at least once.

doc.title: Very Nice!
doc.review: The view of the fountains, combined with superb food, wine and desserts to die for make this experience worth every penny. It's not cheap, but it's worth every delectable bite!

doc.title: Great romantic dinner
doc.review: I took my wife here on our most recent trip to Vegas for her birthday. It more than exceeded our expectations. The service was wonderful, the view was fantastic and the food was exceptional. It was perfect for our romantic night out.

doc.title: Best restaurant in town
doc.review: Outstanding food and service with great ambiance at window tables

doc.title: Great Meal
doc.review: Great meal with a great view. We had dinner here on our wedding anniversary. Food was really good and the staff were very attentive. We mentioned it was our anniversary when we went to look at the menu to decide where we wanted to go for our meal. We were invited up to have a look at the restaurant. After that we just booked it because it looked very nice and the menu looked nice too. They must have noted that it would be our anniversary as all the staff came up to congratulate us. Other people say that it is very expensive but if you want a really good meal for a special occasion you have to pay for it. We actually didn't think it was overly expensive, you get what you pay for.

doc.title: The best restaurant experience ever
doc.review: This is a 20 star restaurant, between the staff, waiter, manager, and food eveything was perfect, better then perfect. I went with my gf and her sister and husband, it was there anniversary. They went out of there way to make it the best night possible. The atmosphere and views were wonderful. We would definatly do it again. I say this when you get a bill for $400 and you have no complaints or regrets and leave happy, then it has to be a great restaurant.

doc.title: Nice view
doc.review: We had lunch at the restaurant and it was good but very expensive.

doc.title: Expensive
doc.review: but probably the best food i have ever tasted and the wine selection was perfect. Loved our view!!

doc.title: Pricey great views...good place to burn some cash...
doc.review: you WILL be spending $130 to $200 per plate.... is food REALLY woth that? hmmm not for me...but hey Im a local what do I know (go get a prime rib dinner for $17 bucks at the Orleans Casino Prime Rib house or the steakhouse at Orleans for a MUCH less expensive...but nonetheless more enjoyable (pricewise)...experience

doc.title: A wonderful dining experience with great food and view of the famous Bellagio water fountain show
doc.review: We made a last minute decision to go to this restaurant and could not have reservation before 9pm. We took the suggestion to just walk-in and wait at the bar. We noted that many people chose to dine at the bar as it has the same menu and you could see the water fountain show even sitting at the bar (not all seats of course, but I think some may have better views than certain tables). We eventually got a table by the window after we ordered appetizer. The nightview of sin city is just so spetecular with or wihout the water fountain show right accross the street from us. Compared to the appetizer and main courses, the desert seemed to be a bit ordinary. But we were very happy with the food overall, given the price we paid. The service was great and everyone in the dining room seems to be happy. It is a very romantic place for a couple to enjoy a nice dinner.

doc.title: Great View - Good Food
doc.review: Visted for Lunch, not as busy and less expensive. Food was very good, had a table at the window with a view of Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: Best view in Vegas.
doc.review: Ear here once a year. Food this time wasn't as great. Soup and salad starters were good. Steak was stringy. Veggie entree (crepes), potatoes au gratin and green beans were VERY average. Excellent souffle and coffee. As always: exceptional service and views of bellagio water show. $250 for couple so a bit expensive.

doc.title: Expensive breakfast
doc.review: We went to the buffet at the Paris but the line-up was very long so we went to this restaurant instead. The service and food were fine (nothing spectacular but fine), but the price was outrageous for a few eggs, toast and bacon.

doc.title: Very Romantic
doc.review: We ate at great restaurants the entire 5 nights we were in Vegas, saved this one for our last night right after we got engaged!! Had a wonderful meal, great service, and the atmosphere is very romantic with great views of the Bellagio fountain.

doc.title: excellent food
doc.review: Service was impeccable and the food was amazing. The four of us each ordered something different, and all agreed it was of the highest quality.

doc.title: awesome
doc.review: My husband and i had a meal here last night 15th March. We were given a window table that had fab views to see the fountain displays at the Bellagio Hotel.The food was very very good and the staff were very attentive.The manager came to say hello to us which was very nice.Would definately eat here again if we came back to Las Vegas.

doc.title: Servers were the best ever! And I am a total pain!
doc.review: My server could tell I didn't like my drink, so she volunteered to take it back and suggested another one. She stayed while I tasted it, and when I didn't like it either, she took it back too! Finally went with my standby, beer. The food was unique and so tasty! Lamb chops prepared perfectly! Sea bass tender and subtle. Bread basket was always full. Impeccable. Views were beautiful.

doc.title: Worth it for the view, but not for the steak.
doc.review: We went here because of the fantastic view of the Bellagio Fountains. We arrived late in the evening and without reservations, on a quiet week for Vegas. We waited at the bar for a while until a table by the window was available. We chatted to the bartender while we waited for a table by the window, and he recommended the cod dish, but we were in the mood for steak--well, we should have listen to the bartender--as the two different steak dishes we ordered were below average (and the price was above average). I would recommend you skip the steak dishes...or skip dinner all together and the price tag, and just grab one of the four bar-stools that face the Bellagio fountains (the rest of the bar-stools do not look directly over the view).

doc.title: Fun, good food, good for Vegas.
doc.review: It has a great view of the fountains at Bellagio. The food was really good, the wine list was extensive. A range of people from being dressed up to people that looked very casual. It is a very busy restaurant, definitely make reservations before you go. We arrived and waited a little bit for our table. We were there on Christmas Day so it might have been more packed than usual. It was a bit of a zoo at the front "foyer" area but everything was good once we sat down. The portions are quite big so we all ordered appetizers and the girls shared mains. For the price, it's good for Vegas. Will go back.

doc.title: One of My Favorite Places to Eat in Vegas
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant to celebrate my husband;s early birthday; this was our second visit, our first time was after our wedding 2 years ago.The view is absolutely amazing, it's best if you can get one of the window tables that face the Bellagio fountains...you get dinner and a show!The service both times we've visited has been impeccable, they pay attention to every small detail. The food is also amazing! I had a center cut ribeye that was topped with escargot and mushrooms, which was fantastic, and my husband had the NY Strip. Both steaks were cooked perfectly. We went ahead and ordered the Creme Brulee to share, but our server also brought out a small chocolate mousse in honor of my husband's birthday.It is a little pricey, but so worth the money. It's great for a special occasion.

doc.title: Lovely respite from the action
doc.review: We just stopped in one afternoon after much walking and touring. We had a couple of nice cold cocktails and an appetizer. The cool quiet atmosphere and perfect view of the Bellagio fountains was just what we needed. Very nice service as well.

doc.title: Food was Delicious and view was outstanding!
doc.review: I absolutely loved this restaurant. I have never been to a nice high end restaurant like this. I went there with $100 gift card from a rewards program but I am so glad I did. The bill was 160 for two meals, one side one souffle and one cup of absolutely divine wine the waiter recommended for us. My husband ordered the Steak and I almost ate it all LOL It was like $56 I think and it comes a la carte but it was the best steak I have tasted in my life! I ordered fish and it was very light and flaky and tasted so fresh.. The souffle was fabulous and the server was very kind and patient with me and my many questions about the menu items.

doc.title: Not impressed...a bit dated
doc.review: just like the decor, the food was just as matched. There was a lack of effort and you could tell everything was just tired. First and last time....they could use a re-evaluation.

doc.title: La Tour Eiffel Las Vegas par excellence!
doc.review: The atmosphere, service and food were out of this world for a dining experience...by far one of the best anywhere! Highly recommend it. Get a table with a view of the fountains of Bellagio across the street. We had the lamb burger and Tower Sandwich, with French wines, and the entire experience was worth every penney!!!!!Thank you, merci, merci, merci!!!!!

doc.title: Excellent!
doc.review: We celebrated my thirtieth birthday at this wonderful restaurant. We were seated at the window, with a breathtaking view of the Bellagio hotel fountain. We had the tasting menu, which was superb. The waiter was attentive and the service was impeccable. Really loved my dessert with a "happy birthday" on the plate. We will definitely visit Eiffel Tower again on our next trip to Las Vegas!

doc.title: Excellent view of the Bellagio Fountains complete with a fantastic dining experience
doc.review: Great and recommended. The food was amazing, I had the surg and turf for main which I would highly recommend.Its worth emailing in advance to ask for a window table, they will reply saying they note your request but cant guarantee it and to remind the maitre'd on the night-this means slip them a $20! Its completely worth it!!

doc.title: Great view
doc.review: Great view on the Bellagio hotel fountain. Food was not bad but I was expecting more from a chic restaurant.

doc.title: Great Views...Bad food !
doc.review: We loved the view, but the food was expensive. The waiter was intrusive and rushed us, and the food sucked. I won't go back !!!

doc.title: Fabulous dining experience!
doc.review: I chose this restaurant for my 40th birthday and it was magical! I made reservations last minute and contacted Lyle the manager via email who amazingly accommodated my request for window seating. The view of the Bellagio fountains was stunning!! I enjoyed every dish and service was wonderful. Compared to restaurants like French Laundry and Michael Mina's, I enjoyed the food and dining experience at the Eiffel Tower much, much more and got the most value out of it. I can't wait to return....thank you Lyle and staff!!Sincerely,JSDanville, CA

doc.title: Bit of a circus - good food - great view
doc.review: 8:00 reservation - waited 40 minutes, would have been more but we stood on top of the host station. Great view of Bellagio water show. Slow service. Good, not great food. Very expensive. Over crowded and tourist driven. Would classify this as the Cheers Bar of Boston is Vegas: looks like a fine restaurant, but there are better. But not a bad stop for a decent bite and view.

doc.title: View was great, but unfortunately the food was served cold and got colder!!!!!!
doc.review: We were fortunate to have been given a window seat facing the Bellagio. The view was perfect! What was sad was that our waiter didn't have the time of day for us and that our meal arrived cold. It got colder due to the ventilation overhead that made our food even colder. We had expected the menu to be pricey, but it was sooooooooooo disappointing to not have enjoyed our meal along with a rude waiter. I do hope that they figure out how to get the food to the tables hot and maybe redirect the ventilation.JD from Ottawa.

doc.title: Great food-great view
doc.review: Was seated promptly at reservation time. Service was good but not outstanding. Food was outstanding. Asked for and got a window table. Best view in Las Vegas. Not cheap-but-worth the price.

doc.title: Romantic, but...
doc.review: Over priced and not that great of food. We celebrated our 10 year anniversary, but you are so close to everyone and I thought the value of the food did not match the final bill.

doc.title: Magnificent staff, magnificent view
doc.review: Nice astmosphere, spent a magic night with my wife with the nicest view to the city and Bellagio Fountains. Food was great, it's worth the price.

doc.title: Bring your fat wallet
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower restaurant is lovely, and has a great view of the Strip. However, it is astronomically expensive. In fact, as a resident of Las Vegas for 9 years, I believe it is one of the most expensive in town. If you have your fat wallet with you, it is a very nice place, with good food and service. There is an impressive exhibition kitchen, you can see, as you get off the elevator, with all copper cookware , that is impressive Maitre D is in tuxedo attire so wear your best. No jeans, etc.! You'd be out of place, and they probably won't let you in, anyway.

doc.title: Fantastic view but the food is the REAL star
doc.review: I recently visited here and stopped in for a quick bite with my girlfriend. We didn't get too crazy as we spent the morning at the Paris buffet so we were still a bit full but we wanted to sample something different. She had a sweet tooth and opted for the creme brulee. I opted for other light fare which was the half avocado stuffed with crab appetizer. This place is apparently well known for its creme brulee and I must say that the presentation of this dish is superb. The vote from my girlfriend was a resounding two-thumbs-up, as she savored it with her eyes closed. Wow, that must be good! She is about as picky as they come when she eats. My dish was equally presented well with very crispy shreds of iceberg lettuce surrounding the avocado and a heaping pile of a crab/mayonnaise mixture which I found to be very light tasting despite it's rich texture. The avocado was also a perfect consistency and it's buttery taste went a long way to compliment the crab mixture. Excellent! This place is not an inexpensive stop as my lunch appetizer was at $18 on recollection, so if you are looking for general fare this might not be your stop. If, however, you are looking for more high-end, SUPER high-quality food though, you should definitely try this restaurant. Reservations are highly suggested to avoid the wait from general curiosity seekers at the casino floor.

doc.title: Disappointing
doc.review: We had heard so much about the restaurant but we were disappointed with the food. The staff were great. Also we were probably there at the wrong time of year - lots of folk all needing a feed. All eating areas were very busy and crowded.

doc.title: Gorgeous view and velvety restaurant
doc.review: Gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountain show and parts of the Strip. Beautiful, sleek decor. When you step off the elevator, you're in the kitchen and they offer you a free taste (during day time hours.) Fun!

doc.title: I was a little disappointed...
doc.review: My spouse and I made reservations here for dinner last time we were in LV and had specifically requested a seat by a window as we were celebrating our anniversaries and birthdays (March 10, 11 and 14). When we got to the restaurant we were impressed with the beauty of the restaurant and I was impressed by the courteousness and attentiveness of the wait staff, but we were not given our window seat, and in fact were quite far away from a window. It ruined the celebration mood we were in and put a damper on our evening. The food we got was good, but, by the time it came to our table it was slightly cold. Overall I would attempt to go there 1 more time, but if I was disappointed again, I wouldn't go back. It was quite an expensive meal to be that disappointed.

doc.title: Try the soufflé
doc.review: This a nice restuarant with a good view. But it is known for its soufflé by the locals!

doc.title: Great food, yummy drinks
doc.review: All the food was A+, I went to this restaurant knowing it was in the pricy range for a night out but all the waiter's recommendations were excellent. Only thing I didn't enjoy was the booth we were in-it was a tad uncomfortable but the fountain view seating was all booked up, sadly I didn't book early enough in advance. I recommend you do and I would have stuck around for dessert had the seating been better.

doc.title: Top 5 Best Meals of This Foodies Life!!!
doc.review: My husband and I did the Chefs tasting menu, and its was by far one of the best meals of my life! I live for food, so it takes a lot to really impress me! It was worth every dollar we spent! It is expensive, but totally worth it! I think our bill was $336 I believe. I dont remember what exactly was on the tasting menu, but its was 7 courses and amazing! We did substitute the veal for filet Mignon (i dont eat veal). I will be going there again!

doc.title: Definitaly not worth the money !!!
doc.review: I made a reservation two weeks in advance for a table by a window , I wanted everything to be perfect as i planned to propose to my girlfriend , When we arrived we were herded into a cramped elevator which brought us out into the kitchen , then i was seated at a table by the bathroom far from the windows , when i complained i was just informed there was nothing they could do , we decided to make the best of it , food was alright not great , way way overpriced and not worth the trip !

doc.title: 10th wedding anniv
doc.review: I resv'd a table at the Eiffel Tower for our 10th wedding anniv. Servers was very prompted and very good. They recognized the occasion and provided a few extra treats. The dinner food was excellent but it better be - it was pretty expensive. I had the steak and my wife had the lamb. Both were perfect. We had the Soufflé for dessert and again, perfect. I would highly recommend if you can afford it. I would go there just to see the fountains. They are not as good without the music...

doc.title: Very Romantic
doc.review: We had a nice time here, we asked for a spot with a view but that was ignored and got a seat somewhere else. The server was nice, kind of acted like a little over the top in presentation. My husband had his black cod meals presented to him in a plastic bag that was cut open in front of him, kind of odd. All in all the restaurant made you feel like you had a million bucks and it was very romantic .

doc.title: Much better that I expected
doc.review: I actually liked everything I had here. The capriccio was excellent. The New York strip was excellent, so was the beef wellington. We had a great time.

doc.title: lovely atmosphere
doc.review: We had lunch here and it was very convincingly French, and considering i visit 'Real' France regularly I was expecting it to be cheesy and un-convincing, i was very pleasantly surprised, really enjoyed a very tasty lunch. Highly recommended

doc.title: Excellent food and view!! Pricey, but worth it.
doc.review: I had the New York steak and my wife had the Beef Wellington. We split a smoked salmon appetizer and a creamed spinach and mushroom side dish. Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted awesome!! As expected, the view of the Bellagio fountains was outstanding and entertained us the entire time. The food is pricey, but worth it for a special dinner or celebration. Our server, Ron G., was extremely attentive to our needs, and helped us with our food selection. We will definitely dine here again on our next trip to Las Vegas!!

doc.title: Disappointing
doc.review: The food lacked originality and flavor, also the servers seemed very "put out". Very overrated restaurant.

doc.title: Ruined our last night in Vegas
doc.review: My husband had enjoyed a good meal with his work colleagues earlier in the week and so booked a table to take me for the last night we were in LV. We arrived at our allotted time, 8.45 pm, to be told there would be at least a twenty minute wait and that would not be for a window table. We told the server that was unacceptable, and why had they taken our booking if they could not then provide a table. There were two other couples sitting on a bench seat waiting and people at the bar who obviously had taken the news in better spirit and bought drinks (which is what I suspect the restaurant wants to achieve by booking you in for a table they don't have). We complained and the girl serving us called the maitre 'd over who apologised and said she would get us a table as quickly as possible. Which she did, five minutes later we we sat at in the window over-looking the Ballagio fountains. But it had left a nasty taste even at that point. The waiter came bought us water and the wine list and then disappeared for quite a long time, he did not give us menus so we literally were just left to sip our water and watch the fountains - again! When he did come back we gave him our drinks order and told him we were not happy with the service so far. In the meantime the table next to us had been cleared and a couple seated there. The tables are small and VERY close together. So close in fact that the man at the next table thought it was ok to push his chair right back so it was resting on the side of our table and I could not move my arm. his rudeness and lack of consideration is not the restaurant's fault but the tables are very close to 'pack em in'. It was the last straw and when the waiter came back with the drinks we told him we were leaving. Having read reviews our experience was not unique and I accept most people have a good one, indeed my husband did on his first visit. It was just very disappointing. I think maybe the tables not in the window maybe more comfortable and warmer, and the entire restaurant is tiered so you can see outside and watch the fountains if that floats your boat. I didn't think the restaurant was particularly romantic, much too big for that, but great for groups as was my husband's experience.Anyway we left and headed back for the MOzen restaurant in the Mandarin, interestingly they have far more positive comments on Trip Advisor than this restaurant but are further down the league table because they are new kids on the block and have less reviews.

doc.title: Valentines Day in Paris
doc.review: My wife and I fully enjoyed our dinner at Eiffel Tower. Each course was presented in a first class way. Every member of the staff made us feel like VIP's. The view of the Bellagio fountains was awsome! Every mouthful of food was a "WOW" experience. I highly reccommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

doc.title: Most Romantic Dinner
doc.review: If I can make one suggestion, make sure you book!! This place was soo busy! In saying that, the service was still impeccable! We waited about 20 mins for our table ( we wanted to wait for one with a view) so we had a drink up at the bar…prices weren’t cheap but the cocktails were great! We were seated in one of the best tables of the restaurant looking straight over to the Bellagio and the fountain show. While the restaurant was busy it was still lovely and romantic. The wait stuff really knew their way around the menu and were able to pair our selection with a great bottle of red wine. When I booked I let them know it was my husbands birthday that night and they didn’t forget and ended our meal with a chocolate mousse with a happy birthday message which was really lovely. Now the food…wow!! My husband is an ex chef so he has high standards… we couldn’t fault a thing, Our tip.. make sure you order the chocolate soufflé for dessert, it was to die for!!

doc.title: Best Creme Brûlée we ever had!!!
doc.review: The food is to die for! The service is always GREAT! Love to go here and sit at the window seats to watch the Bellagio fountains across the street. The prices are up there, so we prefer to go there for lunch instead of dinner. Everything is a work of art when served. We definitely love going here! Very romantic atmosphere. Not a place I would take small children.

doc.title: c'est la vie
doc.review: Lovely views of the strip and a nice seating arrangement for couples.We were quickly seated and I liked the way you walked passed the kitchen as you exit the lift on route to the dinning room.The only thing I would say is that our server seemed a bit aloof and more concerned with other tables, service was good but a little slow and the food although of a good standard was by no means anything amazing.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Towers Above
doc.review: One might expect this restaurant to be a tourist trip....it is not. Plan on very high prices and tipping the M'd if you want your perfect table, but the view of Bellagio Fountains and premium service have been the norm for our 6 or more visits for the past many visits. This is not somewhere to take your children unless they are used to fine dining in an adult atmosphere. For a very special occasion, you will delight the graduate or the college student, but otherwise save this restaurant for those who want to enjoy their companions at dinner. Lighting is subdued, service is prime, and the dinner will be quite special. There are many wonderful restaurants in Las Vegas and you should include this one in your selections.

doc.title: Worth the money
doc.review: We were fortunate to get a window table near the front with an excellent view of the fountains. (If you dine early in the evening you can reserve a window seat). The service was exceptional as was the food. It is expensive but if you want a night to remember this might be the place for you.

doc.title: Perfect luncheon spot!
doc.review: Excellent food, (Ocean Seafood Salad) and great choice of lunch wines.. while overlookiing the Strip and the Bellaggio fountain show. Highly recommended

doc.title: Spectacular in All Respects
doc.review: View of Bellagio water show is great. Food was first rate and the service was fabulous.

doc.title: Valentines Day dissapointing given the price tag...
doc.review: My wife and I just attended for the Valentines day dinner. I am attaching my reply to the thank you email I received. I have yet to receive a reply.Hi Lyle,I appreciate your email and was going to post my comments on trip advisor but will share them privately with you first. The overall ambience for the evening was very good as was the entertainment. Our waitress was pleasant however I do have some negative comments. The first is timing, our reservation was 6:15 and we did not finish until 9 this is far too long with 20+ minute breaks between courses. The tables surrounding us came after and left before we did. We commented before our main entrée that the tables beside us were finishing dessert and then the entrée came right away but truthfully we should not need to point this out. My largest comment is on the wine pairing which both my wife and I ordered. We chose the same selections and when the wine was presented we receive half of one serving bottle each or ¼ glass. I personally feel at this price point that we should enjoy a normal serving of each choice. So in conclusion for an $800 plus evening I feel disappointed in the experience overall. I look forward to your reply.Regards,

doc.title: Romantic Evening
doc.review: The food was of a very high standard. There was an extensive (if expensive) wine list. The atmosphere was perfect for a romantic 40th Birthday meal and looking out onto the Bellagio fountain show made the meal.

doc.title: Incredible View and Amazing Food
doc.review: Recently we went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel while in Las Vegas to celebrate three birthdays. We'd made reservations in advance and chose to wait a few extra minutes for a table right on the window. The restaurant overlooks the Bellagio Fountains so you see a fantastic water and lights show every 15 minutes. While this entertainment made the dining experiene special, the food made it extraordinary. We had a treat of two extra courses -- a starter from the chef of a chilled soup and then a small trio of appetizers. I had the Beef Wellington which featured a fantastic filet wrapped inside a delicate puff pastry. Save room for dessert -- I highly recommend the a souffle -- I loved the chocolate one. As if you actually had any room left in your after the amazing meal, they serve you a small plate of chocolates with your meal -- also fabulous. While the food is a bit pricey versus some other options on the strip, the view and the quality of the food make it worth every cent. Be sure to ask the chef for any favorite recipes (he sent via email) or buy the cookbook. We loved it so much, we then went the next day to their sister restaurant - Mon Ami Gabi at the base of the Eiffel Tower and sat on the patio for dinner the next night.

doc.title: Great for a very special occasion
doc.review: It was very difficult to find the elevator. Once we went up, the doors opened upon the kitchen, so everyone thought we were on the wrong floor. I don't know why there are not signs. Perhaps they don't want to attract gamblers who might just stroll in there? Once we found the restaurant, everything was flawless. The service, the food, the view, none of these can be beat. One minor detail: the pix-fixe menu mentioned that a souffle could be added for dessert for $8. We did not get the prix-fixe, but added it to our regular dinner. They were $15 each. We knew going in that it was going to be expensive, but if you need to know the exact amount, I think the menu was a bit misleading.

doc.title: Romantic!
doc.review: Loved the view of the Bellagio fountains! Food a bit pricey, but worth it if it's for a special occasion!

doc.title: By far the best experience!
doc.review: You need to take a specific elevator to go to the restaurant. You are greeted by a hostess in front of the elevator. Then as soon as you get up to the restaurant you are once again greeted by a new face. As soon as you get off the elevator you get a glimpse of the kitchen and see them hard at work. There is a bar as soon as you get to the restaurant. The restaurant itself is a decent size all seated just right to get a good view of the Bellagio. The best seating though is near the window to see the Fountain show at 6pm. Let me tell you what a show to watch while you're eating-it was awesome! The server was super attentive. There is a separate server if you order wine--that is the first time I've experienced that. He is the one that comes to your table after the bottle's been opened to top off your glasses during your meal. So the service was the best. Food was very good ---the presentation superb. I ordered the duck and was cooked to perfection! What you MUST try is the Grand Marnier Souffle` ....which you must order at the time you place your meal. The experience was great, the service was great, the food was great....the only thing....that it is TOO expensive. But it's worth it.

doc.title: Best view in Central Strip
doc.review: The most photographed landmark in Las Vegas! One of the best fine dining French restaurant in the city!

doc.title: Take a load off
doc.review: Had an early dinner and drinks on the patio. The food, service and atmosphere were one of the highlights of our Vegas Experience. Gluten free menu options, excellent mussels.

doc.title: Romantic Dinner, Excellent Food, Best view of Bellagio Fountains
doc.review: This is definitely the place to go as a couple if you want a romantic restaurant, good food, and a spectacular view of the strip. We had a romantic dinner here on a Saturday night in January. We made reservations for 5:00 p.m. because it is the time the restaurant opens and to ensure both a good table overlooking the Bellagio fountains and to see the sunset. Arrived right at 5 and we were sat immediately at a table right along the edge of the room overlooking the fountains which is one of the reasons we came here. It looks like if there are more than two in your party then you won't get one of these tables as all the ones along the windows were for couples. The service was great and very attentive. They serve your choice of four different breads along with your meal. I ordered the Filet Mignon which was excellent and perfectly cooked (medium) and my spouse ordered the Snapper. I didn't try it but he said it was very good. I regret not ordering the tasting menu with a wine pairing because I wanted to try more food but we were on our way to another event with food and wine and didn't want to over indulge too early. Our dining experience took almost two hours and probably would have been longer if we had done the other menu and wine. When we left we checked out the kitchen while waiting for the elevator. It is bright white and appears very clean. Interesting to see all the different meals being prepared.

doc.title: Nice ambiance
doc.review: We had very good seats by a window and was able to see the fountain show at the Bellagio hotel. The food was very good but the price was a little high for what you got. Filet and prime rib were $54.00 each just for the meat. Then 10.00 each for potatoes. $15.00 for one dessert. I knew it was going to be high when I went in but thought maybe the price would include a little more? We did go by the dress attire as suggested and this was well suited for the atmosphere and when men and women showed up wearing jeans and tennis shoes I thought that was just not right. Come on people!

doc.title: Best Restaurant for Fountain Viewing
doc.review: The desserts here are to die for. If you don't order something with pastry creme, chocolate, or mousse you're wrong! Actually, you can't go wrong with this restaurant, it's top notch. Then again, most French-inspired cuisine is. I will be returning!

doc.title: Great food, best view on the strip
doc.review: Outstanding wine list. But get ready for a 2-3 hour meal.

doc.title: Mostly wonderful
doc.review: This is a great dining experience if you can afford it since most menu items are quite pricey. This is the place to go for that special occasion. Make sure you ask for a window table to see the fountain show across the street. The lights are quite beautiful from this tower. My only complaint was that a young couple brought a baby with them to dinner (not sure why in a place like this). The baby cried for an extended period of time which was very annoying. Management did not make any move to suggest they move into the hall or away from tables. Service and food both very good.

doc.title: Great!
doc.review: Amazing View! Great food! We did not have a reservation so it was a longer wait.

doc.title: The food was excellent
doc.review: The food was excellent and the service was even better! The dress code is business casual in the evening.

doc.title: Best Food/Ambiance we experienced
doc.review: attentive waiters and excellent food, amazing views of the Water Fountains at Ballegio

doc.title: New Year Dinner - Nice place to be
doc.review: We had dinner on the New Year Evening. It was very nice to be in this restaurnt on a special momment. The food was good but not great. Price was a bit expensive. But anyway it was fine.

doc.title: Magnificent!
doc.review: On top of the world, it seems. You can see forever over the Las Vegas strip - at night it is magical. The food was superb, the staff was wonderful.I love the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and will go again.We went before we watched the Barry Manilow show - which was fabulous, too.Lucky us, we were able to go meet Mr. Manilow afterwards. What a nice man.Love the Paris.

doc.title: Food with a View...
doc.review: Ah the Eiffel Tower...restaurant. You make your way up the elevator and are immediately greeted by someone who takes your coat and leads you to your table, or in our case, since we were a bit early, to the bar. The bar is nice, great view of the city, top shelf. Once our table was ready, they came for us, transferred our bar tab and took our drinks and us to our cozy table for two, overlooking the fountains. It's a beautiful view. The fountains go off. Impressive. Ordering al la carte is not cheap. We opted for the tasting menu ($93.00 pp) WITH their optional wine pairing ($65.00 pp)...This is a great DEAL people. An appetizer and entree would have been almost as much and we had 5 decent courses of beautifully prepared foods, beautifully presented. Now that said, the wines were decent but not what anyone would call fabulous; although I found their pairing of the seafood bisque with a Tawny Port, right on!Have you ever seen the show "Hello Dolly"? Remember the waiter scene, waiters doing the waiter dance with trays held over their heads? While service was prompt and well timed, there was also a frantic feeling of the waiter dance...and those trays, held over their heads, were happening over our heads and close to our back. A little disconcerting. But nothing was dropped or dripped on us so that was a good thing. And remember those fountains at the Bellagio? Well, those suckers go off every 15 minutes...so after the first few times...it's like sitting in front of a clock. "Has it been 15 minutes already?" With a large group, or even maybe a new man (or woman) in your life, that may not be noticed so much, but after 23 years of talking, sometimes you just look at the view, over and over.The food was good, a well thought out menu, nicely, although unevenly presented. My plate came looking one way, his a bit different. If you are serving two plates of the same thing side by side, they should look exact replicas of each other...at least at this level of service and presentation. Denny's...not so much.LindySez: It's a nice date night. Great food, great view, if you have something to talk about after the 6th time the fountains go off or, as in our case, talking about the fountains going off...and great service (see if we had been paying attention to the view, we probably wouldn't have even noticed "Hello Dolly" was being played out behind us.

doc.title: OK, but not impressive
doc.review: We had lunch here one day, and to be honest with you, it was a little disappointing for the price. The food was good, service was average. They could use a little improvement before I'd return. Interesting atmosphere, spacious. Worth a visit, but there are better choices in Vegas. .

doc.title: Great view, good food.
doc.review: My husband and I had our Anniversary dinner here. It was a very nice dinner. It's a great place to celebrate. They do a lot of little extras. I also overheard that the table next to us had food allergies and the chef was overseeing their meal to make sure it was ok.

doc.title: Nice view
doc.review: The view was fabulous. The food was good, but pricey.

doc.title: Fabulous view, but the food is not worth the price
doc.review: We had a window seat overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio. Beautiful! We ordered a really yummy drink, but that was the extent of the things we were happy with here. My husband had the Beef Wellington, and it was just ok. I ordered the Filet Mignon, and it was a little overdone and tough. For the price, it should have been great. I've had bettert filet mignon at Longhorn Staek House for almost a quarter of the price. The sides were good, but they are a la cart.

doc.title: Best of the Best
doc.review: Worked with the staff at this establishment for a couple months for my daughters wedding reception. Everyting was perfect. Food, atmosphere, service, staff all truly the best of the best.

doc.title: Expensive, Great Food, not much of a view
doc.review: Went to the Eiffel tower hoping to get dinner with a great view. The tables with the best views are for 2 people next to the window not the 6 we had. A glass of champayne will run $30 and/or $40. Food was very good but probably not worth the $300 it cost me for the 4 drinks and dinner for 2 with a poor view fo the Strip. They do show prices and menu at the elevator.

doc.title: Lovely view but inconsistent food and service.
doc.review: We were 'greeted' by a woman who could not have taken less interest in us if she'd tried. A similarly aloof woman seated us. As requested when we'd made our reservation we received a window table with a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains, and fortunately our waiter was excellent - friendly and well informed about the food and wine list. My steak was perfect, my husband's was cold. Although his meal was completely replaced, including side dishes, this did not make up for our not having been able to enjoy eating our meals together. Overall we were rather disappointed. We felt the restaurant was somewhat overpriced, it was rather noisy and some of the staff were almost rude.

doc.title: Best meal we had while there!!
doc.review: We had a 5 star meal while watching the Fountains at the Bellagio across the street! It was over all the best meal we had while we were in Las Vegas but the competition was pretty tough amongst all the other places we ate!

doc.title: Poor service, sent food back, cramped table
doc.review: A group of eight of us had a booking for 9.30pm on Saturday 28th Jan to celebrate a friend's birthday. We weren't seated until nearer to 10pm at a table that had been shoved in, with one member of the group squashed beside part of the tower's angle poles.Our waitress had a knack of disappearing. It took about half an hour to get menus or anyone's attention. When the food arrived our waitress again disappeared and check the dishes were alright. As three of the dishes (venison) turned up cold and needed to be sent back we had to hunt down other staff members. The venison was taken away and reheated, we were not offered freshly cooked meat. They came back tough and one dish was inedible.If you want a soufle for desert (which were delicious) we were told to order them before the mains turned up, as they take 25 minutes. The deserts turned up before all the mains did! The restaurant had to re-do them.Poor service, bad timing, invisible waitress, cold food. A disaster.

doc.title: For Drinks
doc.review: WE celebrated after our son's wedding at the bar in the Eiffel Tower cocktail area of the restaurant to see the view from up there and it wasn't disappointing. The bartender was very nice and took pictures for us. THe prices were high for cocktails, but then we went downstairs to the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant in the Paris Las Vegas on the first floor towards the front. The prices were more resonable for us there for dinner. But going to the Eiffel Tower for drinks made it special before dinner.

doc.title: Seriously good food
doc.review: This is an elegant, romantic restaurant that is very similar to the feel of the ‘real’ one in Paris. You have a great view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains with tiered risers so almost every table has a good view of something. The menu is a good mix of tasty French and Americanized dishes with excellent service, along with a good wine list that has a few bargains and lots of opportunities to spend if you hit it big at the tables. This is a good place to try something new, because whatever you order, it will be well prepared and tasty. Don’t pass on the Peekytoe (Atlantic Rock) Crab appetizer, it is very tasty. This is a place you need to make a reservation, open your wallet and enjoy it.

doc.title: Very classy!
doc.review: Loved everything from the decor to the food! The best part is the view of the 'Fountains of Bellagio' - best seats in town.

doc.title: So romantic just perfect!
doc.review: My partner and i went here for his 30th birthday, it was truly amazing and very very busy, lovely food, very romantic looking out and watching the fountains just perfect, the only niggle is that it was very cramped and the waiter kept knocking our chairs when walking past. And its not cheap we paid nearly 300 dollers for two courses each and 1 bottle of wine.

doc.title: Best expression of french cuisine in Vegas.
doc.review: A perennial favourite ! Good selection of french culinary delights served in a quintessential french ambiance with an agreable smile.

doc.title: Outstanding Fine Restaurant Experience
doc.review: For Las Vegas, this is one great restaurant. Service was impeccable. Food was brilliant. Wine was beautiful. Dessert was killer.I've read many reviews on this restaurant, and we have to get a few things straight: fine dining that costs a couple $275 + tip does not mean you eat all you can stuff in. Fine dining means the best ingredients prepared skillfully and presented artfully in an atmosphere where the finer things in life are greatly appreciated.The Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Las Vegas does this well amid surroundings that are less than angelic.My wife's lamb and my filet mignon were about as good as it gets. Both were served very pink and melt in your mouth tender.My winter greens salad and my wife's spinich salad were spot on.....with just enough dressing drizzled over......JUST enough......JUST the way it should be.The sides were O.K.....but not fantastic.We shared a bottle of Storybook cellars Zinfindel.......excellent.Bread was an ever-circling-the-room basket of different selections.For dessert, my wife had the creme brulee and I had something I had never had before......an individual baked Alaska-type dessert that had passion fruit sorbet inside. Somehow the sweet tang of the passion fruit went very well with the slightly sweet, toasted meringue.Reservations are a must if you want any hope of scoring a good table. It seemed all the tables around us had their own server......a very special touch in a cheesy, plastic-is-beautiful city.One GREAT winter tip: Space your meals the day you go to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant so that your reservations are at opening time....5 p.m. You will most likely get a front row table for 2 overlooking the Bellagio fountains AND it will be well past dark by the time dessert is served. Hope you guys were paying attention.......I'm sure the ladies were.

doc.title: A true delight; Exceeded expectations in all aspects
doc.review: Wow! I wanted something different for my annual trip to Vegas with my wife, so we skipped going to a show and splurged on dinner instead. Trusting the Trip Advisor community of reviews was the best decision I recently made. My original impression of Paris Las Vegas was that the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (ETR) was a gimmick just to oversell you food with a view. How happy I am now that I was SO wrong in this case.I "liked" ETR on Facebook and began the process of making a reservation by e-mailing the manager, Lyle Tolhurst, a month before our visit. I requested a date and time (6:45 pm sunset was a good pick), and he was prompt in his reply with a reservation. Upon arrival, we had rose petals scattered at our table with a panoramic view of the Strip, facing the fountains of Bellagio and the new Cosmopolitan. Quite the romantic ambience. Our waiter David was well equipped with top customer service skills, friendly and personable, with just enough conversation for a peaceful evening. Bus staff was attentive with the crumb sweepers, refilling wine and sparkling water.We had Le (tasting) Menu of the night, with highlights being the selections of BREAD, Warm Maine Lobster Salad, Olive Oil Poached Halibut, Veal Medallions, and Crispy Farmstead Artisanal Camembert. Even at $98 pp, cheeses/salad for $12 extra, and Souffle for an extra $8, I consider this meal and experience now in my Top Five dining experiences of my life. Well worth EVERY dollar and penny in my foodie opinion. Since we had such an amazing dining time, we had our photo taken, which they posted later on Facebook, and we bought a copy in the card frame for a keepsake... a rare instance for me.I've gone to plenty of other trendy restaurants in Vegas (Mix, Olives, Circo) and felt underserved and robbed of a good food and experience value for the excessive money spent. ETR surprised, exceeded, and made me feel wonderful as I left in deep appreciation for the service that Lyle and his staff given us and his other diners. It is simply how fine dining should be done, leaving out the pompous, over-hyped and too-cool-for-school attitude . Cheers to Eiffel Tower Restaurant, and please keep up the fantastic work!

doc.title: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a Very Nice Experience
doc.review: I have eaten at the Eiffel Tower restaurant 5 or 6 times over the years, and overall it is a very beautiful place to dine. All of the meals that we have eaten there have been good. The restaurant also has a very nice wine list. What really makes this place a cut above is the atmosphere/view (obviously). It is certainly worth giving it a try if you have never been before. We travel to Vegas several times a year and every so often we squeeze this place into our dining list to enjoy great food and superb views. If you have not been, go at least once. The type of people that frequent this restaurant tend to be on the touristy side, often going just for the scenery, but it is still an elegant place to enjoy fine cuisine.

doc.title: Amazing!! Would advise anyone to go!! Perfect!!
doc.review: We got our hotel to book us a table at the Eiffel tower restuarant for our wedding anniversary...Yes it's a little more expensive than some of the places you can eat in vegas, but worth every single penny!! Our food was perfect, they had given us a table looking directly over the bellagio fountains, it was amazing!! The staff couldn't do enough for you. Then after we finished they brought us a small pudding free of charge with " happy anniversary" scrolled around the plate in chocolate sauce. The views over the strip are brilliant!! Lovely lovely place!!

doc.title: Great view and food
doc.review: A must see when you are in Vegas! We have had two delicious meals there, impressive wine list and great service!

doc.title: Pricey and average food
doc.review: The view is great! I wish the food had been also. It was average, but the prices are very high for what you get. The Beef Wellington was ordered by several people in our party - very expensive. It was not liked by any of them. The salmon was good. Souffle was really good. Just be prepared to drop a lot of money if you eat there.

doc.title: AWESOME
doc.review: We had a table overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The service was excellent, the food was top notch, the desert souffle was not to be missed.

doc.title: Classic french food in a wonderful location
doc.review: A fabulous menu with many French classics. I was served by a French waiter which added to the authenticity. Has a great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. A top Las Vegas restaurant.

doc.title: Very pricey, but worth it!
doc.review: If you have one expensive, luxury dining experience in Las Vegas, let it be at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The food is outstanding, and the view from the restaurant gives you a breath-taking view of the Bellagio Fountains!! Very romantic!

doc.title: Great Experience for Large Group
doc.review: Visited on Tuesday night of CES week with a large group (25) of business colleagues. The staff did a wonderful job with the set up, pre dinner drinks, appetizers. The space was a bit tight for our large group, however everone managed successfully. The staff was courteous, friendly and efficient. The food, especially desert was very good. The views of the strip were exceptional.

doc.title: Not what we expected
doc.review: After reading the raving reviews on TA, we decided to book this restaurant to celebrate my wife’s 50th birthday. The friend that we were traveling with, had made the reservation months before, and asked for a window table, only to be told that this could not be guaranteed, but if we came early we would have a better chance. We got there at 6h30, and the restaurant was already pretty busy. We were taken to our table – a booth on the second row from the windows. Although we could see the fountains, my wife was very disappointed. Moments after we sat down, the window table in front of us cleared and I quickly asked to be moved there. Our waiter inquired at the Maitre D and returned to tell us that the table was already promised to someone. How can that be when apparently we cannot reserve a window table months ahead? It ended up that a couple already sitting at a window table a little further was moved to this table. And yes it could have fit the 4 of us, because later on they did sit a party of four. My wife was then extremely upset, since we had booked over 4 months ago and she was so looking forward to this evening. She did not want to ruin the evening so she did let it go.On another note, the service was good, although we did feel a bit rushed. We were eating our main course, after having had an appetizer, one hour after we sat down. We wanted to make it an evening, but it was clear that our table was needed for another sitting. The place was extremely busy and noisy.The food was delicious but my wife’s meal was not hot, barely warm. I did tell our server who immediately took it from her and returned with another plate, much better then. It should not happen in a restaurant like this.My wife and friend had the duck; they were a bit disappointed by the presentation although the flavor was very good. Her husband had le loup de mer and was also a bit disappointed as it was too cooked. I had the rack of lamb, and loved it. The tomato tart was also cold.We did enjoy our evening but we were not overly impressed by this well renown restaurant and the bill was fairly high. Maybe we had set our standards too high.

doc.title: Great service and great view
doc.review: The best of this place is the view to the Bellagio fountains and to the Strip. The also have a 5 stars service and good food. The place is expensive but with the crow in Vegas ot has to be. We have very good memories of our visit to this place.It is a little noisy.

doc.title: Nice food but at a heafty price
doc.review: My wife and I had visited The Eiffel Tower Restaurant back in 2009. On that occasion we had a table against the window with a beautiful view of the strip and Bellagio Fountains.The meal then was expensive but the considering the overall experience, which was just that little bit special compared to the norm, it was worth it.On our recommendation our friends booked a table (for 6 of us) after their wedding at the MGM Grand. We were shown to our elevated table, three of us had strip / fountain views, three of us faced our friends. We chose the set menu on the recommendation of the waiter after our great deliberations. Service was efficient, the food was nice albeit a little rich in flavour and this was the theme for the 90 minutes or so we were there. Whilst I cant fault the food, it was very well done although it was not as special as I remember it being back in 2009. The bill came to approx £100 per head which for what we had was a bit of a shock. The frequently offered bottles of water were charged at £7.50 from memory! The wine list was extensive and with none of us being wine experts the £50 recommended bottle was a territory unmapped for a "party" meal!In retrospect I wish I hadnt recommended the Eiffel Tower, the cost / experience / value just didnt gel for a party of 6 of different tastes. As a venue for a special meal for two or even four then yes. For a meal that was bound to include banter and conversation as opposed to taking time to enjoy the views and the food then it just didnt work for us. Good points...If you like fine food and wine to match and have deep pockets or want that special occasion in Vegas then its a winner and recommended.Bad points...It really is pricey and not a brilliant place to bring a party of people to who the occasion is more of a priority than the food...as this makes ot prohibitively expensive.

doc.title: Food is ok... drinks are good!
doc.review: We ate here for a nice dinner when we were in vegas. The food was ok... nice atmosphere but nothing special really. The drinks on the other hand are amazing! Now we just go up there for a drink. My favorite is the one with champagne and fresh fruit!

doc.title: THE BEST Restaurant in Vegas
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower is definitely THE BEST restuarant in Vegas. Everything in the menu is extremely delicious, perfect and unforgetable! The decoration, the service, the view, the dishes (flavor and presentation), the ambiance, absolutely EVERYTHING is perfection!!!

doc.title: Wedding Reception Excellent Organisation and Food on the Day
doc.review: We arranged our wedding reception for 11 people at the Eiffel Tower from the UK months in advance and were superbly dealt with by Annie who is the Events co-ordinator. We eat on 30th December 2011 and it was very busy but everything was arranged superbly including a Champagne welcome for our guests in the little bar area before our meal. Everyone was impressed with not only the view but the food. The Fillet Mignon was like butter and everything from start to finish was a pleasure and a delight. This place is not jut about the view, it is about the service and food aswell. It is a pretty high end French restaurant so be prepared to pay high end prices for wine and food but it is well worth the experience of being served quality food whilst watching the Bellagio fountains going in the background.We would go back next time in Vegas.

doc.title: Come for the view and that's about it.
doc.review: My husband and I picked this restaurant for a romantic night while in vegas. We got seated in what we thought was a great spot in the restaurant. As we were enjoying the view of the fountains a large group behind us started ordering shots. We ordered drinks as well and a starter of quail $19. The drinks were very good but pricey at $18 a piece. For dinner I had the beef wellinginton $59 and my husband the filet mignon $54. My husband said his was alright but mine was very strange. It was greasy and just not good. I ended taking the filet out of the pastry and eating that. Back to the noisy table behind us. At this point they became even more loud and continued to order shots. Not only were we annoyed but other patrons were as well. There were many other couples around us trying to have a romantic dinner like us. We finished up dinner and I had preordered the souffle, which was very good. Overall I was disappointed with our choice to come here.Pros: VIEW! The service was good too.Cons: PRICE for the value. I don't mind paying good money, but the food better be good. And we were upset that management didn't do anything to calm the party down behind us which was annoying us and other patrons. The restaurant was full of couples, this was no place for a frat party.We will personally never come back here again. There are way too many other dining options in vegas. If you want a good view of the fountains come up and sit at the bar and have a drink. Then leave.

doc.title: This restaurant is simply MAGICAL!!!
doc.review: My fiance and I came to Las Vegas in November of 2011. Unbeknownst to me, my then boyfriend would become my Fiance upon visiting The Eiffel Tower Restaurant. He proposed to me before we ate, which was the smartest thing, that way we could both celebrate and enjoy the 6 course tasting menu that was prepared for us. The food is classic French cuisine and it was delicious!! Especially the Souffle at the end of our meal. This restaurant will always have a very special place in my memory and my heart.

doc.title: Amazing experience
doc.review: Dined during an anniversary trip and were very happy to have picked this place. The service from the time you are taken up to the restaurant by elevator through the desert is fantastic. They even brought a customized desert to help us celebrate. Ask for the window view if possible (we waited an extra 5 minutes or so even though we had reservations for one to open up and were very happy that we did).

doc.title: You are paying for more than the food here...
doc.review: The food was very good but probably not worth the price. I felt that we were paying more for the view and atmosphere rather than the food. Probably would not return.

doc.title: Definitely a place to eat for a special occasion.
doc.review: We recently visited the Eiffel Tower restaurant for the second time, no special occasion, just because we enjoyed it that much the first time. I am very glad we did, just to prove that this place was that good. The entire staff does an incredible job. The food is absolutely fantastic and the view nothing short of extraordinary. Many thanks to Lyle for making it a great evening out.

doc.title: Amazing views and top class food
doc.review: We pre-booked on their website for our visit on New Years Day and we got given a great table by the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains, which seemed to be going off constantly for the whole time we were there which was great!The restaurant looks great, the food was amazing and the service was first class, overall a fantastic experience and one I would do again

doc.title: Great food and view
doc.review: My fiancé and I love good food. We dine in some of the finest restaurants all over the world. We are fortunate enough to be from New York so we know good food. I have walked by this restaurant many times and I always wanted to try it because it has a great view. We decided to stop in for lunch one day and just loved their food so much that we went back every night that we were there. I really enjoyed their food very much, and I also thought the service was great and the prices were reasonable. Very nice place to have lunch or dinner and the view is just amazing. This is one restaurant I can't wait to revisit when we go back to Las Vegas.

doc.title: Views spectacular !!!
doc.review: Great food, views, wine and souffle is a must (cheese and dessert ones !!!).....

doc.title: Great service and food!
doc.review: For my bachelorette party, a large group of us booked a lovely table at this restaurant. We asked for a table facing the strip, but sadly due to how the tables are arranged, they could only fit us in the middle. The food was AMAZING. I had the salmon, my best friend the quail, another the steamed fish. So good. Would go back in a heart beat! Pricey but tasty!!

doc.title: It's not Le Jules Verne Restaurant in the Real Eiffel Tower but it's ok
doc.review: Like everything else in Vegas - it's an illusion. But it's fun! Food is American version of French, the wine and service at a good level. View of the fake lake at Bellagio is excellent. Prices are high.

doc.title: Amazing View
doc.review: We had an absolutely amazing meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in the Paris Hotel. I cannot say enough about the staff. They made our Christmas Dinner a night to remember. The view is absolutely extraordinary. The meal was a little pricey, but the view makes up for that price. Thank you for a great evening.

doc.title: Great steak
doc.review: Had an excellent meal here with champagne at a very reasonable price.

doc.title: Dining in True Elegance
doc.review: When we were business owners, we traveled extensively across the Us and Canada. In our travels we ate at some pretty fine restaurants. Spending our 37th anniversary at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant brought back wonderful memories of the sheer enjoyment of fine dining!

doc.title: Spectacular view of the Bellagio Fountains.
doc.review: Great experience with an excellent view of the Bellagio Fountains. Good food and service, a little pricey but worth the experience.

doc.title: Classy! Pricey! But well worth it!!!
doc.review: My wife and I first trip to Vegas was this past Thanksgiving (11/24/11). I pretty much planned everything and she was along for the ride. I wanted to perfect romantic resteraunt for our first night which also happened to be our thanksgiving dinner. What better place than a 5 star cuisine in Paris! We were not disappointed! Food was out of this world, the service was so helpful with not only menu choices but with what to do on our first stay in Vegas! Oh and the VIEW! Holy cow! Best view of the Bellagio Fountains Period! My only complaint was with the guests not the resteraunt. They state for dinner dress in business attire. Please dress accordingly people!!!

doc.title: One of a kind experience
doc.review: I went to Las Vegas with my fiancee to celebrate her birthday. After much researching, we decided to try the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. This was a one of a kind experience. We were seated at a table by the window...and were able to see the Bellagio fountains go off every 15 minutes which was spectacular. The food tasted amazing. If you are celebrating a special event, definitely go here!!!

doc.title: Ahh the French
doc.review: This was the best food we had in Las Vegas and the view was nice too.

doc.title: Expensive but worth every penny!
doc.review: This place has a view that is tremendous for one. It is a little tight but once you get seated wow. The food is spectacular and your waiter tends to your every need. The price is not cheap but then again you get what you pay for so be ready for awesome eats. The elevator up was wierd thoguh, it opened into the kitchen and didn't make much sense as why but oh well. this is a collared shirt place for the guys so dress apropriately and make sure to get reservations.

doc.title: Not an impressive NYE! and a positive note on tips!
doc.review: With allowances for a NYE "Gala" and a hard pressed staff we were not that impressed by the quality of food. A good ballotine of quail followed by poorly executed scallop on a sea of onions, very tough and very untidy pieces of sole and a very fatty piece of tenderloin. Desert was also nothing to delight in. The wine list has little choice of note outside France - yes I realise it's a French restaurant, but its also Las Vegas! Sevice was good and friendly but to be hnoest we wont be going abck. An upset stomach (and not booze related!) the next day did not help with the overall impression.Nice view though!ON TIPPING - We are Brits who live in the US, we understand that local waitstaff live on tips and we regularly tip 20% (when the service is good) so to see a fellow Brit loudly complain about the 18% service charge (which was explained on the booking) was not good. Please people, no matter how the food is, the waitstaff were working hard, were friendly and on NYE deserved more - we upped it to 20% !!

doc.title: If you love the Bellagio fountains- eat here.
doc.review: For our anniversary dinner we chose this restaurant b/c of the amazing views of the Fountains. But the food was equally amazing and service as well. My tip would be to get there early so you can get the best viewing table. We ate at 515 but got the see the show many times during our dinner!

doc.title: Loved this restaurant and the view is the BEST!
