doc.review: The restaurant is usually busy, the food is well above average and the staff is good. We visited last year and will return at some point! Add this to the list of "must dos" while in Vegas!

doc.title: Local's perspective
doc.review: YOU ARE PAYING FOR THE VIEW. The food is just OK The service left much to be desired. The prices are outrageous, especially for what you get. Go to Olives instead!

doc.title: Sublime
doc.review: You HAVE to book a seat as it is extremely busy.Do NOT turn up expecting to be seated as you won't be.You can sit at the bar and have bar snacks but the night we went, that was even impossible.Staff are helpful and friendly.As the place is so busy, it is also noisy but this added to the 'vibe'.Food delish - had the seafood platter for 2. Beautifully presented. Only negative - Australia does seafood better especially oysters. These were so tiny. Lobster was 'to die for'.Drink selection was excellent and prices were reasonable.We had a fantastic night and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.Would go again if we are ever in Las Vegas again.

doc.title: Fantastic experience - a wedding meal to remember!
doc.review: 12 of us ate at the Eiffel Tower for our wedding meal last September. From the moment we got there to the minute we left - everything was perfect. We requested not to be rushed knowing how large restaurants sometimes are and the timing was perfect. The booking process was smooth with great help from Annie. The food was outstanding, My husband and I had the steak and lamb and both were cooked to perfection. All our guests commented on how superb it was, some saying it was the best food they'd eaten.Pierre from Normandy greeted us on arrival and served us all the way through. He was good humoured and brought a warm atmosphere to the table. We were originally advised against speeches due to being in the main dining area but they allowed us to carry on and positioned us well so that we weren't intrusive upon other diners. We hired a small section of the bar to have canapes and mimosas on arrival, which gave us a great opportunity to admire the views of the fountains and surrounding area. We felt is was great value for 12 perfect meals and flawless service. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant and we'll happily return one day.

doc.title: Romantic Dinner / Cena Romantica
doc.review: Excelente surprise for my wife for our anniversary. I recomend that you reserve a table in front of Bellaccio Hotel and you will have a nice show each 15 minutes. The cost for two without wine more or less 120 dollars ( You can see the price on the web - http://www.eiffeltowerrestaurant.com ). Enjoy

doc.title: Nice
doc.review: There was an extremely looong line for this restaurant but it was worth it.

doc.title: What a view, what a steak
doc.review: If you can afford a $150+ per person with cocktails bill you shouldn't miss this dining experience. We had a table overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio, a shell fish appetizer that was very fresh, and I had a NY steak with bone marrow that was cooked perfectly. My wife enjoyed the sea bass and a pumpkin souffle. A great way to celebrate the anniversary of the day we met.

doc.title: Great Restaurant with Wonderful Views
doc.review: This is a great restaurant for the views of the Bellagio fountains and a great dinner. We had a window table for two that had great views of the fountains. The meal was top notch as was the wine selection. The only down side was that they seemed to have let anyone up to the bar regardless of reservation. This caused the entrance and bar to be over crowded. While we we seated at our table on time, it gave the impression that our reservation was going to be pushed to fit in everyone who walked in. When making a reservation, ask for a window table. It is worth every penny.

doc.title: The Best!!!
doc.review: If you can go to any resturant in Vegas go to this one. We had a lovely Christmas dinner here, and Lyle was very helpful when we made our reservations. Other reviews are saying it is pricey but like the old saying goes you get what you pay for. The food, atmosphere and service was the best we had in Vegas. THE BEST!!!

doc.title: Incredible Food...Comes at a Price!!
doc.review: Ate here with my wife for her 30th birthday...great atmosphere overlooking the Bellagio water show and the strip...food was fantastic and yes, VERY PRICEY...had the pumpkin souffle for dessert and it was to die for!!

doc.title: Great view ,over priced, food does not live up to the price or atmosphere!!!
doc.review: Atmosphere great! Service great!! Food very disappointing,$230 for 2 and left hungry because food was not good.we had the roasted chicken, cheeseplate, and beef wellington.

doc.title: Wonderful food and waiter, but you pay for it
doc.review: Couldn't have asked for better service, food was excellent. They even gave us a free small dessert to share with Happy Anniversary written in chocolate at the end of our meal. As with most fine dining in Vegas you pay for it. Two dishes plus two sides to share on the a la carte menu was $120 before tip.

doc.title: Fancy
doc.review: I food was okay for the price. We could of ate out four times elsewhere for the price we paid there. The server was fantastic and polite. It was a nice experience to dress up and get nice service. I don't think we will pay that much ever again just to eat.

doc.title: Experience greatness
doc.review: A bit crowded, food great, expensive (42 for two drinks) if a couple, ask for a table near the window and see the Bellagio water show every 15 minutes. Open Table Reservation sisytem great for peak times.. plan ahead..

doc.title: great spot for a romantic meal
doc.review: Stunning views, great service, good food. It was fairly expensive ($200pp with lower-priced wine), but not unreasonable considering the location. My girlfriend ordered the steak cooked "well done" (which is obviously sacrilege) but it still tasted great, and no snobbery from the staff.

doc.title: Wonderful Christmas Eve dinner
doc.review: Thank you, Lyle!After seeing Lyle's responses to other reviews, I emailed him directly for a Christmas Eve reservation for myself and my husband. He really came through...we had a wonderful window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Warm lobster salad was wonderful. Hubby had Caesar salad and really loved it, as it was very heavy on anchovies, which he loves.I had the beef Wellington, Hubby had surf and turf. Loved mine, but coveted his...next time will have that...2 amuse bouches, one with 3 pieces, great bread, and chocolates completed the meal. With wine, about $300 for two, but certainly worth it for a special meal.Thanks again, Lyle.

doc.title: Shocked by elegance and quality, but huge wine mark-ups.
doc.review: OK, this was surprisingly one of the most elegant restaurants in Las Vegas. You will want to dress up if at all possible. I expected "tourist trap," but was surprised. Expect $175/pp including tax and tip with lower cost wine. The scallop/oxtail appetizer and short rib entree were perfect. Souffle dessert (caramel) was the ideal finale. Nearly all tables have strip views. No complaints other than you probably need to go on an expense account if you plan on ordering wine; the markups were huge. Or, call and see if they have a corkage fee and bring your own. Without wine dinner was closer to $100/pp and was worth it. This restaurant could benefit from a wine pairing option with each course.

doc.title: Awesome view, average food.
doc.review: We ate here for our anniversary. It's one of those restaurants you go to for a special occasion because it's unique. When we made the reservation we said it was our anniversary and requested a table by the window so we could watch the fountains at the Bellagio. We had a great view of the fountain. I took lots of pictures and even videoed the show. Almost everyone sitting by us had their camera out during the show. So don't feel timid about using your camera. You payed for the great view. You might as well get a record of it. I had the warm foie gras and my husband had the escargots. The portions for we're small for the price. If I'm paying $28 for foie gras there should be more than a tablespoon size of it on the plate. The escargots were $18 and the portion was half the size of what you would normally get at other French restaurants. I think I wouldn't have mind if both appetizers were wonderful. They were pretty average. I had the duck as my entree and my husband had the monkfish. Again the food was average. Not bursting with flavor. We had the brussels sprouts and the spinach and mushroom gratin as side. The gratin was the best part of the meal! We had coffee and a banana and white chocolate dessert which was quite good. Overall the meal was okay, but not worth the $315 we payed for it. Like I said, we paid for the unique experience and we got a great view of the Bellagio fountains. I don't think we would return again. There are too many good restaurants in Vegas that I would rather spend my money on.

doc.title: Not so good
doc.review: We dined here to celebrate our anniversary. We had reservations and we're seated immediately. The service was very good and our waiter was a Frenchman or at least had a French accent. But the food wasn't very good. We had a crab salad appetizer and it was strangely bitter tasting. We had the monkfish(recommended by our waiter) and the cod and both were mushy and tasteless. We should have ordered the filet. Very expensive, very disappointing.

doc.title: WONDERFUL!
doc.review: Fine dining at its best. The servers are a notch above the rest. Super knowledgable, super attentive, but not too much so. The food was worth the money

doc.title: Great view and bread
doc.review: My mom and I had a great dinner with excellent service. The view of the Bellagio water show was great. It was slightly expensive though. And my filet mignon was dry when it came to my table - like it was pre-cooked and left under a heater. Mom loved her dinner of lamb chops and salad. She enjoyed her $19 glass of wine as well. Worth going back for a special occasion.

doc.title: Amazing Experience from Start to Finish!
doc.review: My partner and I were on our honeymoon in Vegas, it was also my 30th birthday and we had reserved a table online prior to our trip. We were not disappointed! The service was amazing from start to finish. We had requested a window seat and got one right in the corner overlooking the Bellagio Fountains - such a beautiful view! The menu was really extensive with excellent wine choices. My partner had duck confit with butternut squash soup poured over it for starter and Steak with marrow for mains, which he said was cooked perfectly and had a beautiful taste. I had lobster salad for starter and lamb for mains, which again was cooked to perfection and was so flavoursome! They also brought us a little complimentary shot glass of a chocolate dessert that was so light and just enough after such a big feed!The service throughout our meal was excellent and the waiters were so attentive. The whole experience was perfect and so memorable! Yes, the prices are a little on the dear side but the portion sizes were great and I felt it was worth every penny. the perfect place for those special occasions!

doc.title: For real effect and romantic evenings
doc.review: We had our after wedding dinner here - what a great location. Go up and have a look if you want to book something special

doc.title: Real Parisian experience
doc.review: Food was excellent and, in general, the service was good (although our waiter seemed a bit uninterested in us). Otherwise I would have voted 5 stars.I lived in Paris for three years and the experience was very Parisian (except for overlooking Las Vegas strip and Bellagio fountains!)

doc.title: Graduation Celebration
doc.review: Great Beef Wellington - best ever and served very appealing. We were seated at the very last table so we enjoyed the quiet and the lack of activity. I went contrarian and ordered the banana desert and it was fantastic. Seated quickly with our reservation. It was my wife's graduation celebration and I called ahead - they brought out a special plated desert. Lovely and everything I expected. NOTE: Only tables for two are along the windows.

doc.title: Can't fault this place.
doc.review: The food, the service and the views in the Eiffel Tower are the best. The value for money is outstanding. This is the second time I've had lunch here and have nothing to say but good things. The creme brulee is amazing.

doc.title: Food as wonderful as the view (and what a view it was!)
doc.review: I was a bit nervous after reading some of the comments on this site that claimed that while the view was wonderful, the food was OK. But we wanted to do something special during our trip to Vegas and after checking out a number of restaurants, we still decided to go here.All I can say is WOW!The entire staff was gracious and kind. Even though we reserved on the same day, we had wonderful window seats that overlooked the Strip, including the Bellagio fountains. Perhaps we were lucky this way becuase our reservation was a little later in the evening.We started off with an amazing celery and chive mouselline, followed by a squash and duck confit soup. The way the soup was served was so elegant yet fun. The mouselline was presented beautifully as well. And delicious all around! Then we had a warm caesar salad. It was quite good - nothing extraordinary - but they used romaine hearts which is crispier and firm. One thing though, there was nothing warm about this salad - I am not sure if the dressing was supposed to be warm. Maybe the cold lettuce cooled it down, or the hot soup we had before made this dressing feel cool. No bother. It was a good salad nonetheless.Then came the main courses - filet mignon with maitre hotel butter and codfish "en papillote". Sensual and wonderful. The wine that our waiter recommended for our contrasting dishes blended perfectly. It was truly heaven in our mouths.Then for dessert, I had the chocolate souffle. It was pretty good - although I've only had souffle one other time, so I don't have much to compare it with.Coffee was standard, unfortunately. It was well prepared, but it didn't have that rich, almost caramel-like flavour that many restaurant coffees seem to have. Also, for some reason I like to drink my coffee in those smaller, roundish cups, not those taller rectangular ones. So I was a bit disappointed when I got my coffee in this standard hotel-shaped cup.But overall, what an amazing meal ! I am still thinking about it 10 days later and we are definitely going back there the next time we are in Vegas.A few pointers:- Get ready to spend your money. You can see the cost of the menu items via their Website, but not the wine list - the Wine is expensive, really expensive.- When you arrive, the hostess might invite you to sit at the bar for a few moments - if you don't feel like drinking right there and then, you can sit on some couches nearby- During the meal, we were told that we had to order the souffle right away so that it would arrive in time for dessert (it takes a while to make!). But I didn't realize that there were other desserts to choose from. We almost felt pushed into ordering the souffle. It's not that much more expensive than the other desserts, and I understand why we had to order it when we did, but I would have preferred a better way to communicate this information... Maybe next time, I would say "OK, but what are the other desserts?"- At most restaurants, they offer you the wine list before you order your meal - but in my opinion the best way to order wine is to know what you are going to eat beforehand. If they give you the wine list first, explain that you would like to deternine what you will order to eat first before selecting the wine - but select the wine at that point so you can start drinking it!- This restaurant has a sommellier (a wine expert) who can help you choose your wine. There's no charge for his services, so if you're not sure, ask for his help!Enjoy and bon appetit!

doc.title: Fantastic Experience!
doc.review: Planned a special dinner to celebrate my Mother's birthday. It was spectacular. Did not disappoint in any way. The view, the service, and the food were all wonderful. This was the best meal and dining experience we had in Las Vegas. There were three of us and all the appetizers, entrees and dessert were delicious. Cannot wait to return! Expensive, but well worth it, especially for a special occasion.

doc.title: Amazing Views
doc.review: Most all of the tables around the outside are 2 person. we had a great view of the Bellagio Fountains and the Strip. The views are totally worth it! :)

doc.title: Great Position with great view of Strip and Bellagio fountains.
doc.review: We went for lunch, which was very well cooked, but we were still a bit hungry after we finished as the portions were quite small.

doc.title: Great view--if you get a window seat!
doc.review: This restaurant was pricey, as are all in-resort Vegas restaurants, but we went for the view. Fortunately, we got a table by the window (no guarantees, so we lucked out). The food was very good--not great. I have a "splitting" test at all restaurants, since my husband and I frequently split an entree: Do they split the food in the kitchen or make me do the work? FAIL! We ordered a $45 entree (rack of lamb) and they brought out the entree plus two empty plates. At these prices, that is just unacceptable. Our scallops appetizer was very good. The lamb was too salty, but otherwise good. It was served rare (I ordered medium) but they took it back and cooked it some more.

doc.title: Eat here!!
doc.review: From the moment we stepped from the lift I knew this was going to be a great meal with a great view!! The restaurant is in the tower at Paris. Drinks in the bar over looking the Bellagio Fountains and we ate at our table which was along the windo too! Great place to wow a loved one, lighting is dark with candles. Menu is varied and food was cooked to perfection. We had the Classique menu as there we 18 to seat. I will be back with my partner.

doc.title: Exquisite
doc.review: We enjoyed a fabulous dinner at the Eiffel Tower November 25th after getting married at the Little White Chapel. Without a doubt, the staff, service and food were exceptional. Staff were efficient, friendly, and helpful. She raved about the lamb and I really enjoyed the rib eye. Somelier was great in suggesting a wine to match our tastes and selections. Definitely recommend the souffle. Ambience, setting and view over Las Vegas Blvd, the Bellagio and the fountains were great. Definitely recommend the restaurant for an exceptional meal and special occaision. We will return.

doc.title: Amazing
doc.review: What an amazing experience this was. Great location, amazing view of Bellagio fountains, superb and plentiful food but above all else the best service I have ever received in a restaurant. We had the tasting menu - don't eat all day if you want to make it to dessert! Our waiter was called Vicenzo and quite frankly was a masterful throughout - attentive without being overbearing and hugely polite and charming. We were on the last day of our holiday and were planning on using our Thomas Cook credit card - we thought we had enough but were short and I frantically and embarrassingly had to nip downstairs to transfer money to accounts via wifi in order to pay the bill ( restricted the amount of cash on me as our last night and didn't want to risk gambling it all!). Anyway, what was hugely embarrassing was handled with care and subtlety. I'm still hugely embarrassed after such an opulent evening but would like to pass on thanks to Vicenzo for his excellent service. Dine here if you stay in Vegas and request to be looked after by Vicenzo!

doc.title: Romantic and a lovely meal
doc.review: One feels like they are a princess when visiting this restaurant, the food is wonderful and watching the Bellagio fountains from up in the tower adds to the feel of royalty

doc.title: A dining experience to cherish!
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower restaurant looking for a dining experience unique to Vegas. The atmosphere is cozy, and intimate with every seat having a great view! Our service was incredible and most importantly the food couldn't have been better. We had the ceasar salad with warm dressing, beef Wellington, rib eye, and were too full for dessert! If you're looking to really wow someone for a special occasion in Vegas this place is worth the price!

doc.title: Absolutely Wonderful!
doc.review: My boyfriend and I dined here on 11/24 for Thanksgiving. We decided to try their traditional Thanksgiving meal the chef was preparing that day. We were seated a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains... couldn't get any better than that! If you make a reservation, request a window seat facing them, it really iced the cake on this restaurant experience. The service here was outstanding! I can't rate their everyday menu but if its anything like the Thanksgiving meal they prepared, I can assure you its amazing! I'd highly recommend this restaurant!

doc.title: Impeccable
doc.review: This restaurant was better than the actual restaurant at the Eiffel Tower in Paris. We had the best table in the house and the service was amazing. Complements to the chef, the food was impeccable.

doc.title: WOW Expensive for what you got
doc.review: I wouldn't go here again. I thought it was very expensive for the two salads and a half bottle of wine and a creme brule that we shared. $130.00 OUCH. There are a lot better eating places in Vegas and this isn't one of them. The view was nice.

doc.title: If only the food was better!
doc.review: The positives first! GREAT VIEW, probably the best view of any of the Las Vegas Strip restaurants! If you get a window seat, you have the best view of the Bellagio fountains. The service is great too, very attentive and friendly servers and sommeliers. I believe, most of the times it is super packed and you probably do need a reservation. With an appetizer, entree and wine, you'll probably spend around $100 per head. That said, any meat entree I tasted, was dry, dull and uninteresting. I don't have the urge to use too much sauces that come with the dishes, but I almost had to everytime. Could that just be typical of French food? I hope not. Everything else is great and overwhelming, but the food needs some more work or the menu needs to include a better more flavorful variety.In hindsight, I would've picked a different restaurant for my mom's 60th birthday celebration.

doc.title: A meal with a view
doc.review: Almost like dining at the top of the real Eiffel Tower, this was a great spot for a delicious dinner. Unlike many options in Vegas, this is not a cheap meal, but it's worth the investment. It's also a great spot to watch the Bellagio Fountains from. After dinner, go up to the observation deck and get some great photos of Vegas at night.

doc.title: Make a meal a special treat....
doc.review: Last night in Las Vegas.another TreatGreat food, taste and presentation 3 Courses Drinks Wine and CoffeeBrilliant service.and only $170.00 for two..... a bargain.

doc.title: great view and great food
doc.review: We loved it... the price was very affordable for the top quality received...we were surprised and expected to pay more...the food was great as well.My hubby got dizzy on the ride up...but the restaurant is on the 11th floor....great view of the fountains show...I highly recommend it... :_)

doc.title: Very Good
doc.review: Spouse and I ate dinner here. The food and service was excellent and we had a very intimate booth table. I had duck cooked exactly as it should and my wife had rack of lamb also prepared as it should (medium rare). Wine list is extensive but not too many reasonably priced wines, in the say $30 to $40 range. When we made our reservation I was asked if it was for any special occasion. I indicated that it was for a birthday. The receptionist then said that we could be given a special treat ( I did not expect anything) . When we arrived for dinner at 8 o'clock, this was "treat" was mentioned again by the receptionist. When we had finished dinner and the server presented us with the bill still no special treat was offered. I mentioned this to the server. He did not know about this. BAD MARKETING. If you promise you should deliver.

doc.title: Once in a lifetime...
doc.review: We had a reservation for 5pm on a Friday night. We were seated promptly at 5pm and had a beautiful window seat, staring out at the Bellagio fountains. We ordered the tasting menu. It was a rare treat. Most of the dishes were very good. I especially enjoyed the celery soup and the squash soup. With the high prices, we were expecting just a little more oomph to some of the dishes, but we do not regret going. The experience itself was worth it. Our server was very attentive and the cocktails were fabulous. We were so full we had to pass up the final course!

doc.title: A good experience
doc.review: It was one of the neatest Vegas experiences we had. The food was wonderfuly prepared and presented. The service was not anywhere near where it needed to be for a restaurant in this price range hence the four star rating. I would still reccomend you go at least once for the experience.

doc.title: love the food
doc.review: everything was wonderful, and the staff treated us like kings

doc.title: simply the best food, service and views....
doc.review: This was my fifth time at the Eiffel tower restaurant.I know it's easy to say "I've eaten everywhere and this is the best", well of course I have not eaten everywhere, but I do get around a bit and my waistline will prove I like to eat a bit.....This restaurant is simply the best food, service and views I have ever had.You can actually buy a velvet bound recipe book on your way out, we bought it after our first time, its amazing. The views of the Bellagio fountains across the street are fantastic. Of course its on the expensive side, but you pay for quality.Try the Mojito with a hint of ginger cocktail while you are at the bar, very refreshing. TIP: If you are not sure about going in the evening, try lunch, cheaper menu, great views of the strip but still great service.

doc.title: Best thing is the view
doc.review: The only thing good at this restaurant is the view. The atmosphere is nice as well. However the food was terrible. We had the salmon and monkfish and both were very gamey tasting. Like they salted both items to cobra for lack of freshness. Also our waiter was very rude. We wanted to order salads and appetizers and one entree. The waiter told us that we weren't ordering enough and we needed to leave our table and sit at the bar. We were drinking as well zo we felt we were definitely ordering enough. Wish I could remember the waiters name but he clearly thought he was better than he was.

doc.title: Great food but very pricey!
doc.review: Great atmosphere here, my hubby and i went for my 30th. Food was fabulous and the portions huge! Glad i didnt order a starter and could not manage a dessert! Staff were attentive, although felt a little rushed at times. Overall a lovely, memorable evening and great food!

doc.title: Excellent food, view and service.
doc.review: My husband and I went for a casual lunch and ordered the signature dishes. "The Eiffel Affair" cocktail consisted of fresh raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, spritzer (I think) and vodka. It was light, refreshing and yummy. The "Foie Gras with Fig Compote" then the "Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken" followed. The main course is served with potato graten and fresh yellow and green beens. There is also a continual flow of "cheese puffs" served in lieu of bread. To finish off the meal a mini fancy chocolate is served on a cute little platter.Everything melted in your mouth and was very memorable. The price is high ($19 for the cocktail, 20-30 average for lunch entree) so go in knowing this and it will not be a surprise.

doc.title: Very Nice Experience
doc.review: We made our reservations about a week in advance. Upon exiting the elevator, we were checked in and had a drink in the lounge while waiting for our table. We had a nice table with a view of the strip. Our Captain(waiter) Marc Boutiron was excellent and made the experience very pleasurable. His knowledge of the menu and wine parings was incomparable. Our food was well prepared and the wine was excellent. We enjoyed the food and the service. I think it would enhance your experience if you asked for Marc...

doc.title: Great View average food
doc.review: The view was outstanding overlooking the Bellagio fountains and a good portion of the Vegas strip . The service was good . The wine list was huge and overpriced ( even for Vegas ). The food was average at best ...the menu had some tradition french choices that were very ordinary. If you choose this restaurant go for the view and not the cuisine

doc.title: AMAZING
doc.review: Great views and food. looks a bit pricey for america, but about the same as melbourne dinner prices. You dont have to go full out dressed up. nice shirt and pants for the guys, dress for the girls. Great little cocktail bar in the middle, and if you can time it right, AMAZING veiws of the Bellaggio fountains

doc.title: best food i have ever had
doc.review: we booked a table here for our first night in vegas as someone had recommended it and wow was it worth it! we had a great table and it was a lovely touch that someone came round and took our photo, it was a lovely keepsake. the food was out of this world and even though the bill was big it was really worth every dollar! would recommend if you want a romantic evening

doc.title: Great view, good lunch (except for the BLT)
doc.review: A Frenchmans version of a BLT includes giant slices of Avocado probaly six inches tall. Obvious the chef never ate one or he would take it off the menu. Order the French and leave the American food to American restaurants.

doc.title: AN AMAZING DINING EXPERIENCE
doc.review: Previous to visting this restaurant I had requested a window table to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday last week, had a prompt reply from Lyle saying our request had been noted, wow and the whole experience did not dissapoint!!! Thank you Lyle, the staff and ambience was just perfect for a fine dining experience the food was wonderful,however i did struggle having ordered both the Blue Cheese Souffle for starter, followed by the Chocolate Souffle for dessert!! We had a wonderful evening, if you want excellent service fab food great views book this restaurant .

doc.title: Too expensive for the food, but what a view.
doc.review: The Rainforest Cafe has better food than this place, but no place has a better romantic view than this restaurant. Most tables have a great view of the Bellagio fountains which is awesome at night and very romantic. Plan to spend at least a Ben Franklin when you go for average food.

doc.title: Great Service OK food
doc.review: The food was fine but nothing exceptional. The cost was about $300 for 2 people so won't go back again. Vegas restaurants are so pricey now, no good deals thats for sure....

doc.title: Pricey and bad service
doc.review: View - Excellent Food - Good, small portions and expensive!Service - I'm giving it an average rating because we had a grouchy waitress but throughout the meal, she didn't even smile, she must have been having a bad day. But the bus boys were awesome, very friendly and helpful. It's good for a special occasion, don't think we'd go back though.

doc.title: A bit pricey but absolutely worth it!
doc.review: Wow wow wow! Amazing service, delIcious food and the most spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains! Great cocktails too, try 'An Eiffel Affair' a large champagne cocktail with loads Of fresh strawberries, raspberries and blueberries and finished off with a berry infused vodka.

doc.title: Simply amazing
doc.review: I was on business trip to Vegas last month and my wife and I had one "date night" during my 4 days there. We chose to go the Eiffel Tower restaurant after reading several reviews on here, and we were not disappointed. From the moment we stepped on the elevator till the time we stepped off, we were continually amazed by the level of service we received. Often times when we go to an upscale restaurant, the service is a bit snobby, but not here. The food was really good, but the service and views are what will bring us back next year. Thanks Eiffel Tower restaurant for being AWESOME!!

doc.title: Good Food, Bellagio Fountain View
doc.review: Too bad it took 30 minutes to get a cocktail that cost $18. Lovely view and good service from the wait staff, slow slow Bartender...they should have had 2-3 people working the bar. We usually go to Mon Ami Gabi downstairs and love the food and sitting outside and people watching while we eat. This lovely view of the strip and the bellagio fountains makes for a fun and memorable dining experience. Great cheese buns and mise en bouche to start. I had the steak sandwich,MR, came medium...not terribly exciting but tasty...My spouse had the french onion soup and a burger, both very good.Would go back but probably downstairs to Mon Ami Gabi- I love having lunch in Paris

doc.title: Definitely created a memory!
doc.review: Spouse and I celebrated our anniversary there last night. Both of us had the tasting menu, which was excellent. We had a wonderful waiter (whom I'm sure gave us his name, but I can't remember it!) who told about every detail of what we were eating. Said the portions were small but by the third course we were both starting to get pretty full (they aren't that small at all, really). Squash soup with duck confit was amazing, albeit rich. Sea Bass was excellent (my husband was practically licking his plate); the venison chop was very tasty but even tastier was the oatmeal cake underneath it! What was IN that thing? Had two different desserts - the passion fruit sorbet (heaven in your mouth!) and the apple strudel (couldn't eat it - too full - but saved it for later - looks delicious!) All of this with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. Didn't think we'd be lucky enough to get a table with such a beautiful view but somehow (w/ OpenTable.com) our request was honored, even though it was a packed house. May have been the best meal I've ever had! Whole bill, including two glasses of wine, a drink, and a $24 photo we ordered on the side, was around $300 so not cheap, but definitely a meal that created a memory.

doc.title: View is only attraction
doc.review: We ate here for a romantic dinner. The location was awesome and the view was spectacular. It is definately somewhere to eat once. The food was just a bit overpriced for the taste. We will try another nice restaurant next time.

doc.title: lunchtime heaven
doc.review: order lamb burger scrumptious. was not expecting to dine here but i had won a $10 promo to use at paris casino and asked at guest services if i could redeem for food they said yes! glad to use my gift certificate. had one of my best meals in vegas - view of bellagio fountains awesome...

doc.title: What atmosphere and view!!
doc.review: 4 of us dined there at 5 pm this month and the sun was just setting and the Bellagio fountains were awesome from our table. Do not miss the filet mignon. Devine. This is an expensive restaurant but with it for a splurge while in Vegas

doc.title: Excellent French cuisine
doc.review: The price was a shocker, but since it was vacation we splurged and were thrilled with the uniqueness and excellence of the food. Great scenery - we requested a window seat and got it!

doc.title: Memorable Evening
doc.review: Went to Vegas in October to celebrate my 50th birthday. Decided to go to the Eiffel tower on my birthday after reading various reviews. All I can say is we weren't disappointed. From the moment the lift door opened at the kitchen entrance we received 5 star treatment. I had requested a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains which we received. The food was superb I had the Beef Wellington for main course which was excellent but looking at the table next to us someone had ordered a rack of lamb which looked amazing (defiantly going to order on my next visit.} Another important factor of the evening was the service. The waiter was always friendly and informative when offering advice on the menu and wine list . For desert I had the soufflé which is a house special it was light and a sooo chocolatey!!! To sum up the evening a special meal in a fantastic setting with superb service. A night we will never forget.

doc.title: Superb
doc.review: We visited Vegas for 5 days and went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our Anniversery. The service and food was outstanding, the table we were given was perfect overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Would highly recommend anyone visiting Vegas to book this restaurant.

doc.title: Wow! Vegas at it's best
doc.review: We spent our first night in Vegas at this amazing restaurant.From the loft ride up to to the seating area to the view from the window seat the whole experience was amazing, the staff were very helpful and the food was amazing.This is a must if visiting Vegas

doc.title: Anniversary Dinner
doc.review: Outstanding restaurant, one of the best dinners we have ever had. We arrived about 10 minutes early and checked in; we were told that our table was almost ready, so we decided to have a drink. From the moment we ordered our drink until the moment we exited the elevator, the service was fabulous. The bartender was very friendly, and even gave my wife a sample of one of their liquors. We were seated within 15 minutes at one of the nicest tables in the restaurant, at the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Our waiter, Shawn, was one of the nicest waiters we have ever encountered. He recommended the tasters menu, and we agreed it would be nice to try. We were not disappointed, it was exquisite. We would like to thank Shawn, and the rest of the staff for making our 27th wedding anniversary one of the nicest to date.

doc.title: Tres Magnifique'
doc.review: I can't believe that I have visited Vegas a zillion times, and never dined at Eiffel Tower Restaurant? I usually stay at Bellagio ....and look right across the fountains to Paris!!This time....at the suggestion of my Concierge, I booked a Special Dinner there!!We arrived to a special podium inside Paris , and were invited to board the special elevator to the restaurant. Much the same feeling as the original....the amber lights reflecting on the bronze superstructure... and then Voila', we arrived at the restaurant. The elevator arrives to an area inside the kitchen!! Quite a spectacular arrival.... Once inside the dining area...WOW, you are immersed in the gorgeous view of Las Vegas!!We had requested a Special Table along the windows closest to the Bellagio Fountains.We were not disappointed.... The view is breathtaking !! Just as we sat down, the fountains exploded with light and water..... The interior is kept quite dark, so as to showcase the incredible lights of the Las Vegas Strip! Our waiter and Sommelier were wonderful, and made us feel very special! I had read on TA., about the experiences of others, and decided to try some reviewer favorites....The wine list is extensive, and contains some wonderful selections from France.... Imagine? Our Sommelier suggested a lovely Bordeaux ...... Amazing!!We began with the warm foie gras....and the wonderful squash soup.... Both were perfect! Our waiter suggested/insisted that we try the Rack of Lamb.... with a few small sides of au gratin potatoes, and green beans. As we sat enjoying the gr8 wine, and appetizers....we were entertained by the fountain show across the street.... Breathtaking! Unlike so many Vegas eateries that are noisy and bustling.... Eiffel Tower is quiet and subdued, and calming!!The entrees arrived together, and were served with a flair..... The Rack of Lamb was outstanding, cooked perfect, and a large portion.....the sides were delicate, but adequate, and wonderful... Even the bread was perfect....We were treated to an incredible Raspberry Napolean , for dessert ...and our server surprised us with a complimentary selection of petite sweets..... As the fountains danced in the night....we finished our wonderful experience at Eiffel Tower. Absolutely a must DO, while in Vegas!! Expensive, but not any more than most of the gr8 Vegas Eateries....and the "Experience"....is Priceless!!!

doc.title: Perfect
doc.review: We went for a meal here for my Dad's 40th Birthday and it was awesome. The waiters can't do enough for you and the food was amazing. If you get a good enough table you can get the best view of the Bellagio hotel's water fountain show.

doc.title: More than we expected
doc.review: We kind of stumbled upon this restaurant, but we were glad we did. We did not have reservations but it was later in the evening. They sat us right by the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains it was perfect. I ordered up the Muscovy duck breast which was fantastic. It was not the best I have ever had but it was close. The side was unbelievable. We had the Classic Potato Gratin. Which was reasonable priced. The service was the best I had ever experienced in my life. This place is perfect!

doc.title: Amazing!!!
doc.review: While we were waiting for our lunch reservations at Mon Ami - the hostess asked us if we'd like to go see this restaurant. We immediately fell in love. We had a terrific view and the service was impeccable - thanks, John! Incredible coctails - I had the hibiscus martini. Then these yummy mini cheesy popovers. Creamy soup. I had the lobster salad. Sooooo good! Would love to go back to Vegas just to eat there again. Lunch was DIVINE.

doc.title: Excellent Food, Great View
doc.review: Food and service was excellent. We had a table facing the Bellegio, which meant a foutain show view like no other. Recommend reservations made well in advance.

doc.title: Best Food, Best View in Vegas
doc.review: We made a reservation one month ahead of time. We were greeted as we got off the elevator by a young woman who offered to take my wrap. We were about 15 minutes early for our reservation. They seated us promptly by a window with a great view of the Bellagio water show. They brought extra things to the table compliments of the chef. A celery cold soup in a tiny glass that was to die for. Then the food we had was of amazing quality and preparation. We had beef that melted in our mouths. Amazing! Then we had a souffle that was perfectly cooked. Before that, they brought out a plate with a tiny chocolate mousse compliments of the chef and after our souffle, the brought a plate of 8 tiny confections that were out of this world. Pierre was our exceptional waiter and the Manager, Jennifer came over to wish us Happy Anniversary which was written in chocolate on the chocolate mousse plate!

doc.title: C'est Magnifique
doc.review: From the greeting at the elevator to the chocolate souffle, the Eiffel Tower restaurant delivered five star service. My husband and I have been to Las Vegas numerous times and have not tried this restaurant. We chose it this night because we were attending the Barry Manilow concert. We dined on butternut squash soup with duck confit, a wonderful salad with pears and sugared nuts, lamb chops and beef wellington. Everything was prepared perfectly. We were fortunate to have a lovely table with the Bellagio fountain view also. We will definitely return on a future visit.

doc.title: Above and beyond
doc.review: Outstanding experience! We could not of asked for a more wonderfull experience. I would travel back to Vegas just for this restaurant.

doc.title: Fantastic service, view and food.
doc.review: A very nice place for a romantic dinner. Window seats are nice for a couple as it can inlcude a view of the Bellagio Fountains.

doc.title: 10 out of 10
doc.review: Everything about this place was fantastic from begining to end. The food was wonderful a little pricey but worth every penny. The service was great our server Jessica was on top of everything. The view of the fountains at bellagio were breathe taking and the stunning view of las vegas was amazing. This place is great for couples -very romantic. I will be going back here next time im in Vegas.

doc.title: Fun splurge with a view
doc.review: We arrived with no reservations and not dressed very appropriately either at the beginning of the dinner hours and waited in the bar for the restaurant to open up. It was a spur of the moment decision to eat there after walking up and down the strip all afternoon on a hot day.We were treated very well and the waiter was very solicitous. The restaurant overlooks the fountain display across the street at the Bellagio so we were treated to several of the water shows. The food is quite good and quite expensive and like most "fancy" restaurants not that plentiful, so if you are really hungry and don't expect to pay out the nose for atmosphere go somewhere else. It was our anniversary so we splurged and enjoyed ourselves.

doc.title: Elegant restaurant
doc.review: The service was 5 star and they treat all their guests with the same excellent customer service. The food wonderful and if we didn't have a show to rush off too we would have stayed and enjoyed more. The wellington and sea bass were perfection and they even treated us to a small complimentary dessert for our anniversary. The champagne list was decent , but we expected a little more considering it's Paris. Overall the food, view and service was wonderful!

doc.title: The charm of old Paris but with a smiling service!
doc.review: The evening was perfect: on time, with my wish window table facing Bellagio fountains, menu degustation (good option/ light and tasty plates), excellent service and a great Jean-François welcome. 300 us$ for 2: good value for the place, the moment and the meals. Suggestion for a good evening ending: Go to the top of the eiffel tower and enjoy the view.

doc.title: 3 things for consider before you visit.
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas requires a person to ask themselves 3 things. FIRST- Do I want to have a beautiful view of the Bellagio Water fountains for dinner? Some down the strip views as well? OK who would say no to that? Its as romantic as it is pleasing to the eye for a family. SECOND- Do you mind paying approximately 100.00 per person for 1 drink, meal and share a desert? If yes then its for you, its pricey. THIRD- are you understanding to conventional menu somewhat mixed up a little, the steak pre sliced ect. Its not your conventional food but its good, my girlfriend says its great. I say somewhere in the middle of good and great. If this is for you then book your reservation and request a Window Table!

doc.title: The view
doc.review: This eating and viewing experience is probibly the best in the city of las vegas. Lets start with the view. The tower is a half size repplica of the one in France. The resturant sits 11 stories up the tower. So the view puts you at eye level with the other surrounding hotels. But the best view is the water show accross the street at the Belaggio hotel every 30 min.Lights, lights, and more lights for the eye to see.Now the eating experience. Wonderful Flavors of appitizzors, I recomend the punch bowl of seafood. It can easly feed 4 people. Main courses include steaks,seafood, lamb, chateaubriand, Chicken, ETC. I had the ribeye it was the best I have ever ate. And desert if you can loosen your belt, Chocolate mouse is the best.

doc.title: Great food, but is it really worth $100 to $150 per PERSON ?
doc.review: I have never been to Paris France, but everyone I have met that has been there all say the same thing: Food and Wine are incredible, but the portions are tiny and the prices are very high. Well, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas appears to be mimicking the real Paris France experience when it comes to food and prices. Yes, the food and wine are excellent, but the average appetizer is $18 to $25, the average entree is $45 to $65, and that does NOT include a single side dish, which you will definitely want because the portions are indeed very small. Side dishes are $10 each and of coarse, they are definitely "single serving" in size. Don't even ask about the cost of wine. Suffice it to say that a single glass of wine is $18 to $30 and bottles easily range into the hundreds.I have been to some truly outstanding restaurants over the years, and this one is definitely up there, but I have had better experiences and better food for less money. If you decide to go here, you will need reservations and dress is, as expected, semi-formal to formal. You would be comfortable here in a jacket and tie, but since it is located in a casino on the Strip, you would also be fine in dress pants and nice shirt. The view is outstanding, located directly across the street from the Bellaggio and the Cosmopolitan. All in all, if you want a nice dining experience, I would recommend this restaurant, but be prepared to drop no less than $200 to $300 for a couple. Although very good, I have had better French dining experiences for as little as $100 a couple (try the Stella Mare in Santa Barbara CA as one example).

doc.title: Beautiful, elegant, and fabulous view
doc.review: My husband and I went to the Eiffel Tower restaurant for our 16th anniversary. This was a very beautiful and elegant place to celebrate our anniversary. We sat by the window, so we had a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains. The food was very good, and the service was top notch. This is an expensive restaurant, but if your celebrating a special occasion, this is a great place.

doc.title: Magnificent food with a view of bellagio Fountains
doc.review: Clean, great restaurant. Was able to walk up for lunch. magnificent meals, expertly prepared in the kitchen you pass by from elevator to your table. attentive staff and reasonable for the service and food

doc.title: Tres Bien, Mon Ami
doc.review: Ate dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The view of the strip (Bellagio Water Show) is fantastic. The food is elegant French. You take an elevator up to the restaurant. When the doors open, you are IN the kitchen. Pretty cool. The wait staff was excellent. Food is very french and very tasty. I had the Venison (ample portions). Cooked nicely and full of flavor. They have a great wine list. A really nice place to go for a "special" dinner. We had a large party and the service was totally acceptable.

doc.title: Lovely Breakfast's
doc.review: We visited a few times for breakfast, the food was varied and filling. You also have a chance to go up the Eiffel Tower!!

doc.title: Beautiful Views, Fabulous Food and Service
doc.review: My husband dined here for lunch and it was fabulous. Our Hostess asked if we were in town for a special occassion and I told her we were visiting on our second honeymoon. Well as any great Hostess would do, she passed this information along to our wonderful waiter. During the course of our lunch, he congratulated us several times and brought out a beautiful dessert with, written in chocolate, "Congratulations". It was so nice.The food was also delicious. I had the Club and my husband had a big Hamburger which he said was great as well. The view we spectacular too.Next time we are in town, we will dine here again.

doc.title: Great dinner, however, did not get our "bang for our buck."
doc.review: We celebrated out 10th wedding anniversary here. Perfect location and views of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip. I ordered the Filet Mignon ($49) Asparagus ($12) Potatoes AuGratin ($12) glass of wine ($18) etc. Although the food, atmosphere, etc. was great, I did not expect to spend over $200. for what we had. There are many other wonderful restaurants in Vegas that are not this pricey.

doc.title: The place with the view
doc.review: food excellent, view wonderful especially that of the bellagio fountains. Service could be a little better.

doc.title: Fabulous
doc.review: Excellent restaurant, great food, service top notch, and the view is worth the trip. Very pricy, but so is everything in Vegas. If you are looking for a great place to impress someone or splurg some of your winnings this a great place to do it. Lunch is perfect time to try some of the tasteful dishes and get a feel for return visits. The evening is bit more pricy but the food is just as elegant and the views have more of a romantic flare.Been to Paris and found the food to be just as good and in some cases better. Highly recommend this restaurant to those who can afford it.

doc.title: Exquisite........
doc.review: The entire staff was friendly and welcoming. The morning of our dinner reservation, I stopped by the kiosk to confirm our reservation. The two ladies attending the kiosk were so helpful and genuine in their conversation with us. Upon arrival, the gentleman greeted us and sent us up onto the elevator to our destination where Keith, one of the bartenders made me one of the best Bombay Sapphire martini's I've ever had. ( I knew it was going to be a good night right then!) David waited on us the entire evening with the skill of a veteran, never overbearing, but there at our side whenever we needed anything-without having to ask! As we were celebrating a 40th birthday that evening, it was a true pleasure to have been seated by the windows to observe the water show from the Bellagio across the street. The food was phenomenal, filled with flavor and you just knew it was prepared with every detail in check! A final suprise came with our desserts...David brought us a special dessert with the words 'Happy Birthday' written in chocolate around the rim of the plate. Everything was just exquisite and they accomodated every request which made for a perfect evening. Thank you Paris and all of your staff!

doc.title: christams day
doc.review: this was the nicest food we had in vagas . We booked christams day for dinner and it was mouth watering. The service the steak and fresh bread were exceptional. Best place on the strip but slighty more expensive then other places

doc.title: Creme Brulee
doc.review: I enjoyed a delicious creme brulee and coffee whilst I watched the fountains of Bellagio. The elevator opens up to the kitchen and I did think for a moment that I was on a service lift. My wife had a cosmopolitan and spoke of its tantalizing taste. Cost was reasonable considering location. If we didn't have previous dinner plans I would made reservation for that evening.

doc.title: LOUD!!!!!
doc.review: Maybe having a somewhat romantic dinner in vegas is a challenge, but when you spend $300 for dinner and you have a table of 8 near you that thinks they are at a frat party, it can be very annoying. They were yelling, singing songs, and not appropriate for this type of restaurant, and the fact that no one from mgt tried to handle the situation, was very disspointing. We sat near several parties of two that came here for a romantic dinner and all the tables near us were visibly upset as well; one actually left after about an hour. When I told the waitress how disspointed I was, she sent over a manger who apologized, but offered nothing other than if I travel back to vegas again to send him a note. I go to vegas every 10 years or so, so this was his way to not offer anything for ruining our night. I still go back to the fact that i did not see anyone address this party while they were hooting it up, and that to me is disrespectable to all the other guests who were trying to have a nice night out. If you want a view, it can work, but don't expect the ambience of a fine restaurant, and honestly you can probably spend about $200 less at another restaurant, and be able to have a conversation at your table and hear each other!

doc.title: Great view, excellent service, good food
doc.review: A must see in Vegas, good food with excellent service, got the lamb chops which were great! Romantic place for a celebration with your better half! Awesome view of the water show at the Bellagio!

doc.title: Outstanding Must go Restaurant
doc.review: I had wanted to book somewhere really special to celebrate my girlfriend’s birthday. From the moment I read the guide books I knew that the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was the place to go. I booked my table through Lyle the Manager who was very helpful with my request for a fountain view and suggested the best times for the best views throughout the evening.From the moment you step foot into the private elevator you feel special. We welcomed at the top and had a short wait for our table. As promised we had a table overlooking the strip with the Paris Balloon on one side and the Bellagio Fountains on the other.We were introduced to Jorge our server who gave us the utmost attention for the whole night.As it was a special occasion we decided we’d splash out and have a bottle of Champagne. The Wine List is extensive with a good selection of all kinds of wines with prices to suit all pockets.The Courses were well spread out with plenty of time to digest and take in the view before the next course came. I had the Marinated Quail and the Rack of Lamb which were both cooked to perfection. My GF had the marinated raw beef and the Beef Wellington which were again excellent.As we were ordering Jorge informed us that they had an array of soufflés on the menu for desert, having never had one before I decided on the Caramel Soufflé and I’m really glad that I did. We also got a complimentary desert of chocolate mouse wishing my girlfriend a happy birthdayLyle came over during the evening to introduce himself and make sure everything was as we wanted. We also had our photograph taken as a memento of the evening.I can’t praise the restaurant and staff enough in particular Jorge our server and Lyle the Manager, I’d thoroughly recommend this to anyone looking for a special meal in Las Vegas and would definitely go back next time I’m in town.

doc.title: bad experiance
doc.review: food was cold service was space and the only good thing about the evning was we left!!!

doc.title: lovely, great service
doc.review: great french food (obviously!), excellent service, nice surroundings, not too noisy, nice to get out of the crowds

doc.title: Awesome Views!!!!!!
doc.review: Magnificent views, food was okay. Would go back again just to try other food options. Be ready to spend a pretty penny. But all worth it for my bday!!1

doc.title: Bst Service Ever
doc.review: This is a pricey place but we got what we paid for. Excellent food and even better service. We awere attended to quickly for lunch and first enjoyed the specialty alcohol free drinks. The menu is varied but not extensive. We enjoyed the suggested desert and were impressed.

doc.title: Not for the weak in the pocket!
doc.review: Firstly, the ambiance is fabulous, service is beyond better than any places I have been- Food is portioned well like any upper class place should be. It's not how much u get its how wonderful the food explodes with flavor in ur mouth. I had beef Wellington and it was done perfect and had tons of flavor , came with sugar snap peas and ordered a portion of potatoe gratin - paired with the house wine- vineyard 3 perfect - in all- a place to eat great food but leave ur big plate mentality at home this is how food should be prepared .

doc.title: Beautiful meal to top off a great weekend
doc.review: We had dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant on our last night in Vegas and it was a real treat. We chose the 7 course tasting dinner with matching wines and it was heaven from start to finish. The food was glorious and the wines well matched. Our table overlooking the Bellagio fountain show was perfect and the service was outstanding.The only fault I could find was the 20 minute wait at the bar to be seated. I wouldn't have thought on a Sunday night for an 8:45pm reservation, there would have been a wait but there was. It did give us a chance to sample some martinis which were fabulous so I guess all in all, no harm no foul!!!I will definitely be back again.

doc.title: WOW
doc.review: This was grat! what I did see, I was affraid of height therefore did not venture up. my peers loved the restaurant

doc.title: great view-ok food
doc.review: The view is unbeatable. We were greeted and seated immediately on our arrival. The service couldn't have been better. The food was fine-nothing wrong with it-just not as creative as I like.

doc.title: A buffet that is worth the wait!
doc.review: The line was long, as was expected. My goodness, it was worth the wait. The variety and the quality were fabulous. Would go again in a heartbeat!

doc.title: How do you improve on perfection?
doc.review: To find this answer you need to go to the restaurant and enjoy a meal. We were there in May 2011 and we left thinking that the service, atmosphere and food couldn't be equaled at any restaurant. We were wrong, we returned in October 2011, with another couple and somehow Maria (our waitperson) and the rest of the staff exceeded all of our expectations and the memories we had from the last visit. The other couple was equally impressed and commented that from now on they would always visit the restaurant for a meal on any trip to Las Vegas. Lyle's personal attention to making sure we were happy and the entire evening went well only made the evening even more unbelievable. In May, I thought the experience was a dream, but not sure what word describes an event that beats the 'dream' hands down.

doc.title: Great food with great view!
doc.review: Outstanding food and service with a bird's eye view of the Bellagio fountains. Outstanding!

doc.title: Wow- Best meal of our honeymoon! Spectacular food and views
doc.review: This was by far the best meal -even tipping Gordon Ramsey's and BOA in LA. Having mentioned it was Honeymoon, they ensured we got a table over looking the strip and Bellagio fountains. I don't thing my review would ever do it justice, even the sitting a the bar is a joy to watch the tenders dishing up the cocktails and knowing every one off by heart, without even sneaking a peek at the menu.The service was excellent and we haven't stopped raving about the food ever since. You won't have a cheap visit but it will be worth every penny! The fois gras was excellent and my husband said the veal was the best he had tasted!Well worth a visit and when we go back this will be our first dinner reservation!!

doc.title: great food and time
doc.review: we had a great time,beautiful view and food was excellent. The service and the experience was fantastic. We thouroughly enjoyed our night .

doc.title: Better food at McDonalds
doc.review: Food was not edible. Had short ribs that were cold with a film on them. Salad was warm, iceberg lettuce would have been better than old greens. Waste of time.

doc.title: Great Views!!
doc.review: Located in the heart of the strip and elevated some 10/15 levels it gives you a great view!! Right in front of the Bellagio water fountain too, unfortunately it was undergoing repairs when were dinning. Food was really nice and prices were reasonable.

doc.title: OMG I love love love this restaurant!!
doc.review: My husband and I just spent our first anniversary in Las Vegas and we had our anniversary dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We were so impressed, I don't even know where to begin. The view was nothing short of incredible. The ambiance was perfect. I had the beef wellington and my husband had the surf and turf. We have been ranting and raving about our meals since we left. The deserts were also fantastic I had the chocolate plate which was heavenly and my hubby had the creme brulee which he describes as the best he had in Las Vegas! The servers were very attentive, but not intrusive. We enjoyed this meal so much that we are seriously considering booking our next stay at the Paris Hotel!

doc.title: An excellent choice with top quality menu items.
doc.review: Enjoyed a delicious lunch in a beautiful dining room while watching the hustle bustle of the streets below. The fountains of the Bellagio were an added bonus. My parents, celebrating 57 years of marriage, were surprised with a delicious dessert to share. A wonderful way to spend our first day in the city. The entire experience was magnificent. Thanks to Eiffel Tower Restaurant for making it a day to remember!

doc.title: An awesome experience
doc.review: I dined as a solo woman and was treated royally. The food and service were perfect. Can't wait to return. Thanks so much to Jorge and Laurent.

doc.title: Best dining experience around!
doc.review: Eiffle Tower Restaurant is the total package in fine dining....amazing service...perfectly prepared and flavorfull food...huge wine list..desserts to die for..and the view is just breathtaking! September was my second time there..can't west for my third!

doc.title: Delightful Lunch
doc.review: Spectacular view. French waiter. Would repeat for a very romantic lunch. Our seats faced the strip. Unique restaurant-- reminded me of Jules Verne in Paris. Staff was outstanding... greeted us as we stepped of the elevator with a puff pastry. Delightful. Couldn't recommend more highly.

doc.title: A wonderful celebration evening!!
doc.review: Went here for our 20th Anniversary and friends 10th Anniversary. Our hotel - the Aria - made the reservation. I contacted them seperately to ask for a table with a view and that it was 2 Anniversaries. We arrived a little early and had drinks at the bar. A shame you cannot transfer you bar bill to the table. We were seated at a lovely booth for 4 overlooking the fountains opposite. I will not recount every detail but let me just say the service, the food, our waiter - everything was just perfect. we weren't rushed, we laughed, the banter with the staff was excellent, the beef wellinginton was sublime. And we were treated to desserts as our Anniversaries. We were exceptionally well loooked after. I would certainly go back on another visit to LV.

doc.title: Delightful
doc.review: I recently had the opportunity to take 4 clients and 3 colleagues to dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. We were greeted outside of an elevator and led to a full service bar as we waited for the rest of our party. Once everyone was present, we were taken to a table for eight, next to a window overlooking the entrance to the hotel.The service was excellent, with four servers tending to our every need. We shared several appetizers, all were excellent. The entrees were too good to describe, but, even more, the side dishes were of a quality I have never had. The restaurant is a bit pricey, with a very pricy wine list, (nothing under $80), but it was the meal of a lifetime. Highly recommended.

doc.title: It was okay but not worth the price to me...
doc.review: The only rez we could obtain at the last minute on a Monday night was 9:15PM, which is a bit late for East coasters visiting Vegas so we arrived about 40 minutes early hoping to get in earlier and had wine/cocktails at the bar... 2 drinks each put us at $70-something dollars with tip. They took us a few minutes early.We were finally seated and had a cozy table with an excellent fountain view at the window. Decided to do the Chef's tasting menu. Very small plates/portions but ended up getting filled up. Most outstanding thing on the tasting menu was the chocolate souffle....With a bottle of wine (one of the least expensive bottles...) our bill was $340 for 2 of us....view was great but I think in the future I'd just stop in for an overpriced drink and call it good. The fountains are pretty but its not as nice as standing in front of them because you can't hear the accompanying music.

doc.title: Separate Bills
doc.review: We have much enjoyed the view, the food and the quality of the restaurant which is about one of the best in Vegas. The very only negative comment would be the establishment's resistence to produce separate invoices (bills). It becomes a burden for the customer to decipher the exact bill amount when all is amalgamated into one single invoice only.

doc.title: Surprisingly Authentic With excellent service
doc.review: My wife and I tried to eat at the Brasserie in Paris Paris only to learn of a 90 minute wait for a table - while wandering away we passed the elvator entrance to the Eiffer Tower Restaurant - inquired about a table and told 5 minute wait - surprised we went for it.Firstly the restaarant enjoys a great view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. We had a booth table for 3 - very comortable. Lighting, temperature and noise levels were all very comfortable.Menu is modern French with a few classics. I tried the Chicken Consomme and Rabbit. The consomme was superb, light and tasty as it should be. The rabbit was the only disappointment - part of it was some formed reconstituted meat - like a mcnugget - but there was some genuine rabbit meat as well - bit disappointing. All the other food was excellent. The Grand Marnier souffle was too eggy but still good. Wine list is superb - had a very good value Malbec from the Loire - unusual to see in the USA.Service was unobtrusive, polite and available - excellent all round.Having eaten in the Eiffel Tower in Paris this year we expected much less than we got - an enjoyable experience that was well executed - give me a real rabbit casserole and it would have been perfect - but still worth it.

doc.title: Anniversary Dinner
doc.review: My husband and I enjoyed dinner overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We had the best service we have had ever. We chose to do the 5 course for two dinner offered by the restaurant with the accompanying wine selections. The was the best meal I think either of us has ever had. Its a bit pricey but totally worth it.

doc.title: Great food and great view
doc.review: Made reservations to go at 8pm, The food was phenomenal and great service too! There is a dress code, but nothing too formal. It was a little pricer than I usually eat, but well worth it! I had a carmel souflee that was to die for!

doc.title: A beautiful view, great service and great food.
doc.review: We went here for lunch and got there kind of early and were lucky enough to get the corner seat with an outstanding view. I might recommend going on Saturday or Sunday so you can see the Bellagio fountains which start at noon on weekends vs. 3pm on weekdays. The waitstaff was very helpful, friendly and attentive. We had great food as well. I got the lamb burger which was very flavorful and juicy and my wife had the parmesan chicken which she also enjoyed.

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: We celebrated our wedding anniversary here. Our table overlooked the Bellagio Fountains. The food was fabulous and the service impeccable. Lovely for a special occasion or just to treat.

doc.title: Awsome!
doc.review: We were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary and they made it special!When we made our reservation with the attendant at the elevator entrance (she was so nice! she was from Marseille) we had mentioned that we were celebrating that eveing. When we returned later on for our 8PM reservation it felt like the whole staff knew about it. They congradulated us upon arrival, they seated us at one of their best tables, by the window in the corner (next to Bally's) overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio.The food and service was superb. I had the steak with the cabernet reduction sauce and my wife had a perfectly cooked duck breast.They even came up with a complimentary mignardise.Try it, you won't be dissapointed.

doc.title: Wonderful dinning experience in Las Vagas
doc.review: We celebrated our 20th Anniversary with dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at The Paris in Las Vegas. We enjoyed the great food, impeccable service and extraordinary view. The staff whet out of their way to make this a special occasion. With all the “Big Name” restaurants in Vegas I am sure you can spend a lot more someplace else but not experience the level of quality, ambiance, and personal attention you will receive at the Eiffel Tower at The Paris.

doc.title: Incredible Service
doc.review: We had a wonderful dinner for my husband's birthday. The service was amazing, food was excellent. But as it got later the noise level went up. And reading some of the other comments I noticed that people had made window seat reservations. Bummer! I was told I couldn't do that when I called. It is a bit pricey but I guess you are paying for incredible service, view and a world class chef. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

doc.title: So Great
doc.review: This place is amazing. It is a bit pricey. We had a window seat and enjoyed the Billagio Fountains. The Atmosphere was wonderful. The food was outstanding. We had the Lamb and Beef Wellington. We had a wonderfu bottle of wine. For dessert we could not resist the Chocolate and Lemon Souffle. This is a very romantic must in Vegas.

doc.title: If you enjoy gourmet dining, this is a must visit in Vegas.
doc.review: The problem with open forums like Trip Advisor and many other open forum is that totally unqualified people are allowed to pass judgment on things of which they have no knowledge whatsoever. Why on earth would you go to a Frech restaurant with a world class French chef and order surf and turf? You can get that at Outback Steakhouse. Want lobster? Order the Warm Maine Lobster, Michigan Creamy Corn, Smoked Bacon appitizer. It's large enough to be an entree, and it's out of this world.Want steak? Order the Individual Eiffel Tower Beef Wellington, Sautéed Snap Peas. You won't find that at Outback. Like poultry? Order the Red Wine Marinated Quail, Chorizo Brioche Pudding, Swiss Chard, Petite Frisee. Just amazing.You can spend a king's ransom on wine, or simply pair the courses by the glass. Our table faced the Bellagio and was just fantastic. The service was outstanding. Our soufle's had to be done over but it wasn't a real problem. the server brought us a complementary specialty coffe and a tasting platter of sorbets.The only negatives I have are the seating which is a little tight (but it was Saturday night) and it was a little loud (but it is Vegas). My wife and I celebrated 25 years together and having dined well from Austrailia to Europe (including Jules Verne), we were very happy that we chose the Eiffel Tower restaurant. We had no idea that Chef Jean Joho started his training at L'Auberge de L'lll our favorite restaurant in France, and that he also is the chef at Everest, our favorite restaurant in Chicago.

doc.title: Truly incredible experience, from start to finish
doc.review: I visited The Eiffel Tower Restaurant on Sunday evening Sept 18th. I had won a contest on a social network page to attend a souffle tasting and also decided to have dinner there afterward.Lyle Tolhurst, and the chef, and the entire staff were very pleasant and accommodating to our group for the tasting. The chef answered any and all questions that we had. The souffles themselves, we got to try banana, chocolate, caramel, pistachio, Grand Marnier, and strawberry (along with their sauces) were just indescribably delicious.After the tasting, my friend and I had dinner at a lovely table by the window with an incredible view of the Vegas lights and the Bellagio Fountains. The amuse was a cold corn soup that I would happily eat a gallon of. I had the Black Cod which was perfectly cooked and moist and delicious. My friend had the steak which I tried also and it was one of the best tasting steaks I have ever had, tender, juicy and cooked perfectly. We shared 2 sides, the Potato Anna gallette and the spinach. Both were very delicious. My friend remarked at the end of our trip that the spinach there may have been the best single thing she ate while in Vegas. We were too full for dessert (since we had tasted all the souffles before dinner then had dinner as well), but Lyle sent over some sorbets/gellatos for tasting and that was a perfect end to the dinner.I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant for anyone who would like a truly memorable dinner and experience. The view is incredible, the food delicious, the staff friendly and attentive, and the entire experience.....incredible!!!I think it has now become a must for us for every trip!!

doc.title: Could be better
doc.review: A couple of friends recommended us this restaurant and we had great expectations. Noisy, pricey and overrated place. Must say that the soufflés are amazing, service is good and if you seat at one of the windows tables you will have a great view for the Bellagio water show. But restaurant is so noisy that I cannot say it was a good experience.

doc.title: Over Rated
doc.review: I found the restaurant to be over priced the food was not great at all. The service was outstanding. I found the food to be flavorless. I had the Surf and Turf and for $75 the lobster tail could have been atleast 3oz lol. I could not recomend this place to any one.

doc.title: This was a perfect restaurant for a special occasion.
doc.review: We went here to celebrate our honeymoon. And watched the sunset with a perfect view of the bellagio fountains and the food was great with a nice presentation. Thr creme brule was very special also. I would highly recommend this for anyone who wants to splurge on a nice restaurant in Vegas.

doc.title: Great dinner with amazing views!
doc.review: We had a great dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. I made sure to request a table where we could see the fountains (beautiful) and pre-ordered a delicious cake for my boyfriend’s 30th birthday. The waiter made sure to acknowledge that it was his birthday when we sat down. They really went the extra mile to make us feel special for his birthday.The waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and the sommelier suggested a great bottle of wine. Our food was delicious and filling. We had to make ourselves eat the cake, which wasn’t that hard to do once we got the first bite. We also had a few small tastes of dessert, which were also good.Overall we had a wonderful time, with beautiful views and delicious food. I would highly recommend this restaurant when in fabulous Las Vegas.

doc.title: problems at first
doc.review: We booked this place month's ago to celebrate our wedding anniversary.The first thing that alarmed us were the people with no reservations asking to eat.The young girl at the elevator entrance just said no problem.We gave our name and were aked to sit at the bar .We then realised that these people who had no reservation were being given tables ahead of us.I then asked the waiter how much longer,having waited 25 minutes and running low on wine.He spoke in broken english and said you are next.Fifteen minutes later we were still sat there and getting mad.The guy then said I thought you booked a window table thats why youare still waiting.we were rude to him and a table appeared We then asked to speak to the supervisor who put everything right.The window seat became available along with attentive service.Having eaten all over the world I must say the service was the best I have ever had.We were even given a desert plate with happy anniversary on.Just goes to show that this place can be world class if they try.

doc.title: Very good food with a knockout view
doc.review: We recently went to celebrate a friend's 50th. We ordered a la carte. The best meal at our table was the birthday girl's Fillet Mignon. Superbly prepared and cooked.
