The restaurant did a good job of looking after us and arranged a celebratory crochembouche for our dessert.The food prices are OK but beware ... the wine list is pricey!The location and view as well as the intimate tables on the window make this a romantic place but it also copes well with larger groups.

doc.title: Amazing, utterly amazing!!
doc.review: If you want the best meal in Vegas with possibly the best view in Vegas and money is no object this is the place for you. We went there for our wedding anniversary and as we had pre booked a window seat our view was the Ballagio fountains. The food is presented perfectly by the most attentive servers you can imagine with no request being too much trouble. At the end of our meal we were given a free desert to share with happy anniversary piped onto the plate in chololate. Sometimes the diiference between a good restaurant and a great restaurant is the small touches. This has too be the most romantic restaurant in Las Vegas and possibly the world!!

doc.title: great food, great views
doc.review: ok, so this restaurant is pretty pricey! But the food was really good, so we will go back for sure when visiting Las Vegas! The service is great and the views are great. Very tasty, kinda expensive, but worth it. :-)

doc.title: "A" for Greeat service and appearance, food gets a "B"
doc.review: The service by the staff, the cleanliness and appearance of the restaurant was excellent. Food was a bit of a let down, not that it was bad, it was pretty good, but did not match the service and decor.

doc.title: Gorgeous view, gracious hospitality
doc.review: Looking for a special place to celebrate, I booked an early, pre-show dinner at 5:30 here for the night of my husband's 40th birthday. We were not disappointed.Early in the day, I stopped at the restaurant hoping to arrange for a special birthday desert. I spoke with restaurant supervisor Lyle Tolhurst, who couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating. He arranged for a lovely banana souffle with a lovely, hand-written "happy birthday" message on the plate, as well as an assortment of fresh berries. He also reserved us a table with a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains. Although I attempted to tip Mr. Tolhurst, he refused, saying, "It's simply hospitality, and that is my job." It was a true pleasure to encounter such gracious service.Later that evening, when we arrived, my husband was pleased and touched at the lovely table and view. The atmosphere was beautiful. Although the restaurant was quite busy, with a couple of larger wedding parties seated nearby, our table felt quiet, intimate and serene. Unfortunately, we both were feeling a bit under the weather and didn't have much of an appetite, so we didn't feel up to cocktails or wine, and we also skipped the appetizers and soup or salad. I really wish we'd been feeling better, as the menu offered so many items that we'd have loved to try.My husband ordered an entree of braised beef short ribs over noodles, which was very tender and flavorful. I had a duck breast entree, which was very good as well, if perhaps a tiny bit tough.Our waiter was gracious and attentive. He seemed a little bit unsure of himself and the menu, and we wondered if perhaps he was new at this job. At one point he came to present us the dessert menu and to ask if we wanted a souffle, in which case the kitchen would need advance time to prepare. This did sort of ruin the surprise of dessert for my husband, as I had to say to the waiter, "Could you please check up front, as I've made arrangements in advance." No real harm done. It was a mistake borne of good intentions, anyway.My husband was very pleased with his birthday desert. The souffle was light and scrumptious, and he said he'd never tasted raspberries so sweet. We couldn't have asked for a nicer evening. The sun set as we enjoyed the souffle and berries with a view of the spectacular Bellagio fountains. We headed off to our 8 PM show thoroughly satisfied with my husband's special celebration dinner.

doc.title: Spectacular view!
doc.review: This restaurant has the very best view. The light show at the Belagio is fantastic and the restaurant plays the music that is in sync with the lights. Make reservations and dress up for the best seats. We did see some guests in jeans, but guess they didn't have reservationsas their seats were further from view. Staff is the best and very friendly. Prices are high, so plan for it ahead of time. Quality of the food was good, but not the best place for steak.

doc.title: Fabulous!
doc.review: Excellent service, outstanding menu and delicious food. The view is an added bonus.

doc.title: Good food, Great view.
doc.review: We went for dinner, we ordered the tasting menu, a better value then the a la carte menu I think. OUt of the 5 dishes, 2 were great, 2 were good, 1 was odd. This is not a cheap restaurant, our bill was almost $400 for 2 people, we expected that. I wish the service would have been better, and more attention to detail. We were served bread upon being seated, the bread was cold. I don't mean room temp,I mean out of refrigerator COLD! $400 for a meal and you dont have a bread warmer! Come on! Our waiter was OK. , just not real friendly. My suggestion would be to there for cocktails ( try the Eiffel Affair, the best cocktail I've had in years) and enjoy the view that way

doc.title: Great place to eat
doc.review: I ordered the bone marrow steak and it was awesome. The service was great and we got right in even without a reservation. The lady doing the elevator and seating needs to take a chill pill and relax. I will eat here again.

doc.title: An absolute must!!
doc.review: My Husband and I were wed on Sept 10 and chose Eiffel Tower for our dinner together that evening. We had made reservations for 7pm but unfortunately ran very late, got there around 7:30. We were attending a show at 9 and didn't want to feel rushed for dinner so we went to tell the mait'r d to take us off the list. Jennifer, who I believe is a manager, was who we talked to and she convinced us to stay and assured us we could still enjoy dinner. She got us seated promptly and worked with the chefs and our server to ensure we would get done on time. Our meal was superb!!! Our server gave us great, prompt attention, and we never felt rushed. The food was delectable. I had veal, paired with a tantalizing pinot noir, and my husband had the monk lionfish. I can't use enough pretty words to describe how great our experience and food was. They even gave us a free desert since we were just married- very nice touch.The restaurant is pricey, of course, but it is worth every penny and then some! I can't wait to go back!

doc.title: Amazing Restaurant!
doc.review: We loved everything about the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We called at about 3pm for a reservation on a Sunday afternoon and got in at 5:30. Had a window seat with an incredible view of the strip and the fountains in front of the Bellagio. Our waitress was very accommodating. She made us feel important, and appreciated our patronage. Everything was wonderful, from the pear martini, the appetizers, the bread, the entrees (the salmon is quite possibly the best I've ever had), to the chocolate plate for dessert. The meal was pricey, but we knew that going in and the food, ambience and service did not disappoint.

doc.title: Incredible view,service and food!
doc.review: We are not the type of people to spend a lot of money on meals. It was our anniversary and am so glad we spent the money. Everything was perfect. Our table overlooked the Bellagio fountains and were there at dusk. I had a filet mignon that was perfect. My husband had the braised beef, which was perfect also. They gave us a special little dessert with Happy Anniversary written in chocolate on the plate. It was a perfect meal!!!

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a MUST when in Vegas
doc.review: Although the restaurant is pricey - the food, service and spectacular view cannot be beat. We've been here two years in a row and both times were fabulous. If you visit the Paris Hotel's site - you can see a virtual tour of the restaurant. We went in the evening - just about sunset - and were treated to the fountain show at the Bellagio (across the street) and to the sight of the sun setting and lights of the city coming on. Wow! I ordered the Beef Wellington and my husband had the surf and turf - both were fabulous. Note that the menu changes and if you want to check it out before you go - see the website. You need a reservation - so don't forget. And if you like chocolate - order the Godiva Chocolate Martini - mmmm. (And I'm not a big drinker so that says something.) Make sure this is on your list of places to see while in Vegas and don't forget your camera! (One note: The restrooms are attended so take a dollar or two for tipping.)

doc.title: Fantastic Ambiance!
doc.review: Four generations of my family dined here over Memorial Day weekend and we were not disappointed. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. We chose to dine during brunch since we had children in our party, but would highly recommend the restaurant for a romantic dinner without children as well. The view of the Bellagio fountains are wonderful. We were seated at a window table and were able to enjoy the fountains throughout our meal. The eggs benedict were perfectly done and my grandmother stated that the chicken sandwich is one of the best she has had in her life. The blue cheese souffle was rich and creamy and the coffee was brewed perfectly. The apple cinnamon dessert was fantastic. I can't wait to dine here again in a more intimate setting with just my husband, a bottle of wine and a delicious meal.

doc.title: Fabulous view and food
doc.review: Make sure you arrive early and request a window seat, since the view is wonderful. The restaurant overlooks the fountains and has a great view of the city. The food was wonderful and the service excellent. I would highly reccomend taking the time and money to eat here.

doc.title: Close to Perfection - Oui, Oui
doc.review: Being Chicagoland inhabitants, my husband and I are very familiar with the "Lettuce Entertain You" family of restaurants. To date myself, I when to grad school at Northwestern U. when "Fritz, That's It" had the dream salad bar.So, a number of years ago, on one of our frequent trips to Las Vegas (we are the nervous owners of a condo-hotel unit there), we excitedly went to our first dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. It was basically a disaster - the food was so-so, expensive, and the service was horrible. We were largely ignored, due to some important dude's large party.Still having faith in LEY, we tried again a year ago (in July), for my husband's birthday. I noted our earlier disaster when making the reservations. That time, the meal was fantastic, and the service impeccable.Our most recent visit was on August 20, to celebrate our anniversary. Entry to the restaurant is through an exclusive elevator, which opens in the busy, but organized, kitchen. Located on the 11th floor, it's a compact, dark space, that overlooks the fountains of the Bellaigio Hotel (thank you, Steve Wynn). Ask for a window table, though the booths are very comfortable. We chose the Tasting Menu, along with the wine pairing. It's quite expensive (but it was a special occasion), but if you can swing it ($400 or so for a couple), do it! The chef put together a memorable meal, along with memorable wines. And the service is extremely profession, yet friendly. A wonderful experience.

doc.title: Amazing Experience and great food!
doc.review: The place is very nice, dim lights, chic waiters...the view is gorgeous; at the top of the Eiffel tower sighting the Bellagio Show. The menu is not extravagant neither are the prices (I was suprised of both!) I had a filet mignon, a gratin dauphinois and for desert a meringue with champagne and mango. It was simply delicious: the meat was perfectly cooked, perfectly spiced and the size of it was good; as for the gratin, the gratin was delicious as well and the desert was just perfect: refreshing, sweet but not too much. One recommandation though: You do want to sit in front of the glaces so you can enjoy the romantic view and show during diner and so you have to arm yourself with patience because you'll usually have to wait a lot of time before you get your table. (app. 40 minutes.)-->totally wirth it though!

doc.title: Incredible Experience
doc.review: My wife and I recently visited the Eiffel Tower restaurant to celebrate our 10th anniversary. After reading several reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to email the restaurant Supervisor (Lyle Tolhurst) to request a window seat with a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. Upon arrival, we were greated by the hostess who congratulated us on our anniversary. We were then promptly seated at the corner table which in my opinion, is the best seat in the house. The table was beautifully decorated with rose pedals and as I looked around, I noticed it was the only table decorated like this (very nice touch).I ordered the New York steak and my wife had the fillet. They were both cooked to perfection and we agree that they were two of the best steaks we have eaten. At the end of our meal, our waiter brought us a complimentary chocolate mousse with "Happy 10th Anniversary" written on the plate with drizzled chocolate. The staff did a great job of being very attentive without hovering around our table. Lyle even came to our table to introduce himself and to ensure that everything was to our satisfaction. This is one restaurant that knows the meaning of great service.If you are in Las Vegas and were only going out to dinner once, I would high recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.Lyle, thank you again for not only meeting my expectations, but surpassing them.

doc.title: Great Service, good food, amazing dessert
doc.review: My husband booked this dinner a couple months before our arrival, requested a window seat... was really excited as we waited at the bar had a great view of the strip and the fountains however when we were seated we were one row away from window seats in a comfortable booth on the other side so not the best view and could only see the fountains when the large ones went off. Our service was outstanding, very quick but not overwhelmingly so. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary we splurged on a glass of wine that is the same price as a bottle yikes! had appetizers main and dessert. For the appetizers we both got different salads, I had a the crab and my hubby had the tomato salad both were good, not the most amazing but good. For main I ordered the duck breast and hubby had beef wellington. We choose not to get sides as we wanted dessert and his came with vegetables and mine with rice. My duck was awful, I have had duck multiple times and this was extremely tough and chewy I was very disappointed and was contemplating sending it back as it was a $36 duck breast... however the waiter was on his toes and noticed from a far that I was not happy with my meal and came up and asked what was wrong and offered to bring me something else, he even pointed out meals that would not take very long as husband was already eating and very much enjoying his beef wellington so I decided to get the filet mignon. It came out quick was just a piece of meat but was very tasty. I was disappointed as you can get steak anywhere and was looking forward to something different.After dinner they brought out a plate that had 'happy anniversary' written in chocolate and a sampler of amazing amazing chocolate mousse. We pre ordered a chocolate souffle and added a creme brulee.... words cannot even describe how happy my mouth was... the best best dessert I have ever had. And HUGE portions.... because of my unsatisfyed duck issue they paid for our souffle. The service was good, the food was good, dessert was out of this world, service was good and in certain spots awesome view. I did feel the prices were higher than needed. I have been to many fine dining restaurants and this was by far the most unreasonable.

doc.title: Romantic
doc.review: Would suggest this restaurant to anyone planning on visiting Las Vegas!!!! We'll worth the money!!!!

doc.title: A VERY NICE RESTAURANT--VERY GOOD FOOD,SERVICE,AMBIANCE
doc.review: We chose to make our reservation for noon and were given a window seating that was just a tremendously beautiful view of the strip, the Bellagio and thoroughly enjoyable. The staff welcomed us and the manager even came over to greet people personally at their individual tables. We ordered the three course special and when we both finished with the basil ice cream immediately we complimented the food. We recommend this place highly. The meal ran about $30+ each plus the drink. I think it was well worth it. We tipped the good service accordingly.

doc.title: Wonderful dining experience
doc.review: Loved our dinner at this restaurant. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and could not have been happier! The food was perfect, the view was amazing and the service impeccable. The manager stopped by to wish us a happy anniversary and thank us for choosing, out of all the restaurants we could have gone to, the Eiffel Tower. In this day and age, that level of customer service just blew us away. The waiter was very accommodating and very knowledgeable about the wine list. The chef sent over a special little anniversary sweet before the most amazing chocolate souffle came out. If you go to this restaurant, no matter how full from dinner you are, you HAVE to get the chocolate souffle. Has to be one of the best things I ever ate in my whole life! Thank you Eiffel Tower Restaurant for making our special night so memorable.

doc.title: I actually expected better
doc.review: We ate here for lunch on a previous LV visit so I was looking forward to dinner on our recent visit. I chose the Tasting Menu my husband the Monk fish wrapped in bacon. Waitress brought out a wonderful taste of cold corn soup. I think that was my favorite. My tasting menu was good..a lobster appetiser, veal, there were several courses so I couldn't remember them all but I guess it was forgetable..not great, not bad...except my husband's Monk fish. Luckily he likes salty food because I took one bite and almost gagged it was so salty. I could never have eaten it personally. Waitress boasted of best souffle's in the world..well, overstated, but I had the lemon and it was very good. Service was excellent but tables next to the glass as so close and cramped, I kept bumping into the poor guy next to me. Also be prepared, they require a credit card to charge you 50.00 in case you don't show up for your reservation.

doc.title: What a great lunch!
doc.review: Lunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was amazing! My friend and I made reservations for a Sunday lunch - when we walked in, we were seated right at the window facing the Bellagio. We were able to watch the fountain show the entire time with perfect view. Not only so, the food was amazingly delicious! My friend ordered french toast and it was made just right. The portions were pretty big too as she couldn't finish. I ordered the chicken was mouth-watering as well!The ambiance was great - perfect for a nice romantic lunch for the couples or just if you want the view of the strip during the day or night!

doc.title: Sat for 1.5 hours and never got our food....
doc.review: We went on our first night in Vegas for my girlfriend's 30th birthday...our reservation was for 8 PM. We were initially sat towards the back despite reservations weeks in advance... there were tables directly by the window open. We asked our waiter to be moved and he said we would have to go back to the hostess stand without any inquiry himself. We then waited 30 more minutes at the bar (and had a very nice bartender)....when we finally got a table we waited for half an hour and only had a few pieces of bread! The waiter then took our order for appetizers and our main course. We got our appetizer half an hour later. It was around 9:30 pm when we decided to just ask for the bill and leave. The waiter wondered why we were leaving before our main course...He seemed surprised that we wouldn't wait 2 hours for our meal!! There were no apologies and seemingly no care from management. The restaurant and service was absolutely pathetic...the appetizer itself was nothing to write home about--dried pieces of lobster on a cold salad.

doc.title: Amazing meal and amazing view.
doc.review: Ate lunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The meal, service, atmosphere and view were amazing. We were there during restaurant week and took advantage of the offered dining deal. Even at that it was on the higher end side for a meal but well worth it if you can afford it. On their drink menu is a selection called the Eiffel Affair it is made with champagne, blueberry vodka, berries and a few other goodies. They were $18 each but so good we each had 2. I highly recommend it.

doc.title: Gorgeous setting and lovely food
doc.review: Visited this restaurant with a party of 8 including bride and groom for their wedding night dinner.From the minute we entered the restaurant i was blwn away it has a very cosy feel to it and amazing views over looking The Bellagio fountains.The matr'e D was very professional asking how the ceremony went etc... and was very attentive to the bride and groom. We had a great sommelier who recommended some delicious wines and the food was so good i can't wait to go back!!This restaurant is a must if you want a nice dining experience in Vegas and not just the 24hr cafe food.

doc.title: Amazing Food and Fabulous Service
doc.review: We had dinner at the Eiffel Tower with our family (13 of us). The service was amazing and the food was fabulous. We all ordered different items from the menu and everyone was very happy with their selection. The desserts ...scrumptious. And the view...beautiful...seeing the Bellagio fountains over dinner...wow! It is a bit pricey...but worth it!

doc.title: Much too expensive
doc.review: This is a very nice restaurant with pretty good food. The view from some tables is spectacular, but the table my wife and I had was not one of them.The entrees are expensive and are ala carte. After a couple of side dishes , a couple of drinks and no dessert the meal comes out $120 pp befor tip. That's outrageous. We are paying for the view which we didn't really get. I would only recommend this place to a friend celebrating an event who doesn't mind paying through the nose and is guaranteed a choice table.

doc.title: Meh, overpriced and not what I thought.
doc.review: After reading the reviews before we went to Vegas, and we stayed in Paris, we wanted to try The Eiffel Tower,Now first I will stay, I do not normally go to these type of restaurants, they're just not me, they tend to be to stuffy for me.The portions are small and overpriced for what you get, and the food was good, but if I'm paying $64.00 for steak and lobster I expect to receive more food and no side dish was included. The lobster was soo small, it was compariable to 1 jumbo shrimp, not worth the price.Our bill was just under $200.00 and for that price, it was not worth it to me. You seem to pay more for the service for the food.

doc.title: Great food and great view
doc.review: I love this restaurant, it so fancy and very inviting, the food was just phenomenal. The staff was very accommodating and even though we didn't have reservation we still got seated right away. The food was soo worth the money, it was a little pricey but after tasting the food, you wouldn't even worry about the price. The view was priceless specially at night, the view of the glistening lights of the strip while watching the water show of the Bellagio, it was just romantic yet glamorous. Overall, I recommend this restaurant specially if you are looking for a fine dining, romantic setting, great view of the strip, this is the restaurant for you.

doc.title: Best experience in Vegas
doc.review: My husband and I ate here our first night in Vegas and what a way to kick off our stay. Let me preface by saying my husband complains about EVERYTHING everytime we go out to eat - he is not easy to please. By the time we finished our meal, he said he was glad to have paid the $60 for each plate. He got the rack of lamb with tomato paste and egg plant, and I had the seared veal. Both were AMAZING, but his was like baby making for your mouth, it was SOOOO good! The service was not bad, but failed to knock my socks off, but the view and food made up for it all. Also, we did not have reservations on a busy Sunday night, and we were seated right away.

doc.title: Good food, great service
doc.review: This restaurant is great we phones and booked at 1pm for dinner at 8.15pm we arrived late 9.30 and were seated immediately food was great in my opinion slightly over priced you do get an excellent meal it is just lacking in size for my liking, the service was great. The females at the front desk could have put on a smile and acknowledges our arrival instead of talking to each other before sorting us out, another thing would be they have the bus tables set throughout the restaurant literally 2mrters from our table it was very loud and not very astheticly pleasing.

doc.title: I Felt Like Royalty.
doc.review: Bending over backwards doesn't even describe how the staff treats you at this establishment. We celebrated our 30th anniversary dinner here and were treated to appetizers and a dessert, on the house. Seated at the window, we had a marvelous view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The food........was most delectable! Thank you everyone for making our meal and evening so very memorable. We look forward to returning.

doc.title: Beautiful dinner
doc.review: Although I can't fault the restaurant ambiance, view, food and the choice of wine, it was very expensive so if you want budget this is not for you! Next time though I would just go to the French Bistro restaurant on the ground floor.

doc.title: Recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant
doc.review: A special place to dine in Las Vegas. The food, setting, staff are all excellent. I had the snapper and green beans. They were very good. It is expensive, but it is worth the cost. I had the chocolate dessert plate. It was worth the $12.00! Go and enjoy yourself. You must dress-up.

doc.title: View to die for! But a cost that might kill ya. lol
doc.review: Great Great food, The view is of the Belagio hotel with the water show every 30mins or so. We received a table right against the window! And its a half table so your facing the view not each other. Wish is nice. No neck issues.the bill is very expensive. But it was worth it. We didnt feel cheated. In fact given other places prices for the same food it was a good deal. It will be a while before we go back, but it was a great trip!

doc.title: A most memorable meal, and beautiful experience!
doc.review: I have been looking forward to writing this review. I was fortunate to have enough Amex rewards points to order a $200 gift card for LYE restaurants prior to coming. Because I had “friended” the Eiffel Tower on face book, I had seen the manager mention that you should email him for a reservation. I did just that about a month before. I told him we would be celebrating a special anniversary and hoped we could get a table at the window. We arrived at the elevator at our reservation time of 6:30. (We had 9:30 tickets for Jersey Boys). We were taken up and I immediately asked the hostess for Lyle Tolhurst, the manager I had emailed. He greeted us warmly and took us to the best table in the house, in the corner facing the fountains. The table was covered in rose petals. (the only table decorated like that). I was so taken by this wonderful table and treatment I tried to tip Lyle for taking care of us. He put the money back in my hand and said, this is just the service we provide. I almost fell off my chair.We ordered the Blue Cheese Soufflé Pudding, Olive Oil Poached Halibut for my wife, Sautéed Veal Medallions’ for me and a side of mushroom spaetzle. We also ordered a Chocolate Soufflé for desert. We were immediately brought a basket of fresh baked bread and butter and an amuse bousche. The amuse was a trifecta of bites of heaven. I can’t remember what they were, only that they were delicious. Our main courses were fantastically luscious. The spaetzle was amazing. During the entire meal we were treated to the Bellagio Fountains show. After the main course they brought the delicious soufflé. Then they brought us a complementary little espresso glass filled with a chocolate mousse. After that, they brought a tray of profiteroles complements of the chef. It was an amazingly perfect dinner. One note. This is one of the few places that holds to its dress code; Collars and nice slacks for men. One guy came in a t-shirt and they gave him something else to wear. This is unlike Fluer that said they had a dress code but had people eating in shorts.

doc.title: It was ok....
doc.review: Let me start off by saying we did not eat here for dinner. We did have lunch and my expectations were very high. Ive read so much about this restaurant that I expected it to be my favorite french restaurant. We had an amuse bouche of Asparagus Flan. Absolutely spectacular. My hubby got the steak sandwich (which was also excellent, I wished I would have ordered the same) I got the crab french toast which was where the meal went wrong. The toast was stuffed with a very heavy mixture of crab and mayonaise. The bread was very heavy, greasy and in conjunction with the crab mixture it just wasn't at all what I expected or very palate pleasing. Then we ordered dessert which was the apple strudel and it wasn't a bad dessert but it wasn't what you would expect from a restaurant with this kind of stellar reputation. Our server was excellent but the experience was inconsistent. The distance between the highs and the lows were too great for me to give the review I had been hoping to give.

doc.title: Excellent.
doc.review: I came here with my wife and this is one place you must come to with ur other half. We came here for lunch, our reservation was for 14:30 which was more or less that last slot for lunch service. The service is 100% fantastic. The waiter was very softly spoken and was very good at making suggestions. I went for the steak and the waiter informed me that the particular steak was over $25 dollars more expensive in the dinner menu so i was right to go for lunch!The meal was 3 course, had some lovely onion soup, the waiter provided us with a small tub of asparagus and cream - dont know the exact name but tastes brilliant!.When serving wine, they bring the glass and a small glass bottles which contained one measurement of wine which was very posh (im not posh so i felt very royal!)When we booked our reservation the night before downstairs at the eiffel tower casino, the gentlemen simply took our names and our desired time and gave us a card. We mentioned that we were vacationing the States for our honeymoon so when we were contemplating desserts, the waiter surprised us with a lovely ice cream dessert with chocolate engraved 'Happy Birthday' but was promptly replaced with Happy Honeymoon.The waiter also happily took our camera and took pictures of me and my wife and looked at his watch and asked us to look outside and saw the Bellagio water fountain display - viewing it from the top of the restaurant is the best!All in all, lovely food, great environment and very nice staff. Excellent!

doc.title: Simply Amazing! Stunning!
doc.review: My husband and I visited Las Vegas for our 8 Year Wedding Anniversary. I wanted to surprise my husband with dinner so I emailed Lyle, the manager of the restaurant asking for him to reserve the best seat in the house for us. Lyle most definitely did! We showed up to the restaurant about 15 minutes early and were treated like royalty from the minute we stepped off the elevator! The service was remarkable, the food was outstanding, the view was breath taking and the atmosphere was very romantic. The entire experience left my husband and I speechless. It's great to be treated like VIP once in awhile! Lyle and his staff go above and beyond! We will definitely visit this restaurant every time we are in Vegas. Thanks again Lyle, it was great to meet you!

doc.title: Excellent
doc.review: We wanted to visit this restaraunt after visiting one in the original Eiffel Tower :)) To make it easier we decided to go during lunch hours. That way we did not have to worry about formal wear, and maybe a little cheaper than dinner. The overall experience was wonderful! Every single person that met us was pleasant and nice. We were seated at the second best table there (the first one was already taken), and we got to enjoy the day view of the bellagio and their fountains. The food was faaantastic!! The desert (creme brulee) was out of this world..The only thing I felt a little bit out of place, maybe because of too much attention (yes that exists), or maybe it was our waiter (a snobby young man). You will spend more than if you grab something at a cafe, food stand, or buffet, BUT you have to come here.

doc.title: The best meal I've ever eaten
doc.review: We did the chef's menu with the accompanying wines and it was out of this world. Great service, impossibly nice view, and perfect for a romantic dinner. Will definitely go back the next time we're in Vegas.

doc.title: If you do one thing in Vegas - do this !!
doc.review: This is a MUST DO experience. A table by the window - sunset view - incredible service and food -fountain show.The degustation menu with matching wines is out of this world. And pay for the extras.From the minute you step out of the lift into the kitchen area (and view the expertise on display) and turn right into the restaurant you know this is a special experience. Menus are online so you can plan your $$ in advance and it is worth splurging.Best staff - best service - best food.Worth dressing up for.World Class.

doc.title: The wedding breakfast!
doc.review: We'd got married earlier that evening, and we'd booked for five at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We got there as the sun was going down, and a few minutes after we'd got settled with drinks, the Bellagio fountains went off - we had a ringside view! Although the somellier was helpful (and neither obtrusive nor obnoxious), I picked the wine at random (based on it being from an "Anderson" vineyard - the wife's new surname!), and was rewarded with a beautiful and mature burgundy (well, Napa version) that went very well indeed with the steaks (bloody), and that didn't break the bank.The food was delicious, the service was excellent, the whole experience was excellent. A perfect restaurant for a special occassion. Would I go back? Definitely.

doc.title: Amazing and wonderful
doc.review: My Husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for our anniversary and choose to do one special night here. I'm so happy with this choice that we made. The service here is AMAZING. I was so impressed with our waiter. It was so nice to be treated with respect (My husband and I sometimes have a hard time finding this. We are in our mid 20's but look like we just got out of high school). I had the Salmon which was excellent. Moist rich flavors, seasoned to perfection. My husband had the Wellington. Was cooked perfect, Pastry flaky buy not falling off meat. For the quality of the restaurant I feel the prices are very reasonable. We are going next month and will be going again. Worth ever penny!

doc.title: Thank you Lyle
doc.review: For making my wifes 50th birthday a night to remember. The whole dining experience from the moment you enter the lift to paying the bill is out of this world. We eventually arrived in Vegas after two and a half days travelling due to US(eless) Airways cancelling both our flights so by the time we finally got to the restaurant we were all shattered but after our evening we were back in holiday mode again. Everything about this restaurant, the food, service, view really is first class but it was the small personal touches provided by Lyle that set it apart from anywhere else we dined at in Vegas. Some people have complained about the prices but the menus are all on line so you know exactly what sort of cost your evening is going to be before you go. Although I have thanked Lyle personally by e-mail I would like to take this opportunity to once again say thanks to him and all the staff for a fantastic evening and banishing my US Air blues.

doc.title: Pricey but worthwhile!!!
doc.review: You definitely get a ritzy upscale experience at this French gem in the Eiffel Tower of Paris Las Vegas. The service is fantastic, and we were on our honeymoon so they even threw in a special treat at the end. We got a wonderful spot overlooking the Bellagio fountain and the shows were amazing everytime. We went for the set menu, which was an awessome deal considering you get to try five amazing courses that you probably wouldn't know to order otherwise. A wonderful sophisticated Vegas experience. You have to dress nice and bring a camera with great night-shot mode for the fountain shows!!! Loved it!!

doc.title: A Magnificent Meal Overlooking the Strip
doc.review: My husband and I called in to this restaurant for lunch as we were passing, we did not have a reservation and were not really dressed for the occassion however the staff were very friendly and could not have been more welcoming. We had a fabulous table overlooking the strip and the meal was beautiful. Well worth a visit.

doc.title: Awesome food and wonderful view
doc.review: I can't say enough about the Eiffel Tower Restaurant At Paris Las Vegas! The food was fabulous, the view was breathtaking but most important, the service was out of this world! My husband and I wanted to bring my parents for a special anniversary meal, one that they would really remember. I had called Lyle Tolhurst (the manager of the Eiffel Tower Restaurant) and asked for a table for 4 by a window, if possible. He was so accomodating. He personally checked on us several times during the evening. His staff was the best we had ever experienced in Las Vegas-- and we have been coming to Vegas for about 10 years atleast once or twice a year. I would highly recommend this restaurant. In fact, will probably go there again this September when we go to Vegas.

doc.title: Excellent in Every Way
doc.review: We stumbled upon the fabulous Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas by accident. We were having a frustrating morning of site seeing. A long week of vacationing in multiple locales was finally taking its toll on us. Spotting the Eiffel Tower after exiting the Bellagio, we said "If they have a restaurant, let's go to the Eiffel Tower for lunch. We never got to do that in France." We usually try to consider TripAdvisor and friends’ recommendations. This time we just lucked out!Arriving in nice shorts and t-shirts, we inquired if we were dressed acceptably. At lunch time, this was not an issue; the atmosphere was classy and casual at the same time. We were cheerfully welcomed and seated by a window overlooking Caesars Palace and Bellagio with good views of The Strip and the Bellagio lagoon.For starters, our friendly waiter brought out a complimentary taste of thick mushroom soup and some yummy puffed treats. For lunch I had the Chicken Paillard and my other half had the Aged Parmesan Crusted Chicken. Both dishes were delicious and came with starches and vegetables. To say these were excellent would be an understatement.While the hotel and restaurant were Las Vegas' rendition of Paris, the meal couldn't have been more French or delicious. The environment and service were excellent. The prices, for all we enjoyed, were especially reasonable. I highly recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and look forward to a return visit next time I am in Las Vegas.

doc.title: High-class restaurant
doc.review: I celebrated my 50th birthday here after seeing Celine Dion in concert. We have never seen such an extensive wine list and we live in France !!!!!!!!excellent food, excellent wine, excellent service, excellent viewthe tables for two by the window are really cute.you really feel as if you are in Paris

doc.title: All in all an excellent dining experience
doc.review: My wife picked this one. And she picked it at the right time too. Our reservations were for 7:15 pm. We got there at 7 pm and they seated us (wife, 10 year old son, and I). The sun was going down but blocked by one of the hotels. We had a window seating. We could see the fountains at the Bellagio which went off every half hour; City Centre was to the left (lots of glass and lights!).Food was very Frenchy. My wife and I loved our entrees. My son, could only have a salad which was also probably the best salad I have had in a while. And then desert: Napolean and Creme Brulee. Nice way to end a fine meal. (Wine was supreme. Waiter suggested both wine and entrees. And he, the waiter, was very helpful and indeed splendid.)

doc.title: A romantic honeymoon dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Paris, LV
doc.review: My wife and I were celebrating our honeymoon with a week's stay at Paris in Las Vegas in mid-July 2011. We had made a reservation for the Eiffel Tower Restaurant several months in advance after noticing on their website that they were recommended. I had gotten some mixed reviews from some people who had eaten there so we weren't quite sure what we had in store.Our reservation was for 8:30 PM and when we arrived about 15 minutes early, I asked the hostess if it would be possible to get a table by the front window which overlooks the beautiful Bellagio Fountains. I mentioned it was our honeymoon and she said it may take a bit more time than our reservation time but she'd do her best.We ventured to the bar and ordered a couple drinks. Let me preface this by saying we knew this night would probably be on the pricey side, which was totally OK and it started here at the bar. My wife ordered a Cosmopolitan and I got a Gin and Tonic. Cost for two drinks? $28 Now I'm not cheap but needless to say, we savored these drinks until the hostess approached us and very politely said our table was ready.We followed her to the absolutely best table in the house! Directly in front of the Bellagio Fountains and an unbelievable view of the strip. Vegas at night is amazing and the view from our table was outstanding.The waiter was very pleasant and very attentive. The menu is a mix of classic french entrees, seafood and steak. All items are a la carte. I ordered the fillet minion ($49) and my wife ordered the sirloin steak with some sort of reduced wine sauce ($49). We each ordered a side of potatoes ($9 per side). The meal was accompnied by another server which offered us several fresh breads to chose from and a huge patty of creamy butter.The meal was absolutely delicious. Both of our steaks were done to perfection. Honestly, I've never had a better fillet. My wife's steak was fantastic and I asked the waiter what the sauce was and again he was very polite and explained exacly what the chef had done to create it.Before we had ordered our dinner, the waiter had asked us if we wanted to order the souffle for dessert since it took 45 minutes to prepare. We ordered it and when it arrived, he poured a small cup of molten chocolate directly into the center. My wife loves chocolate, so she was in heaven. Again, delicious.The waiter also came back with a small cup of chocolate mousse and two little spoons. There was a piece of chocolate with the words "best wishes" or "happiness" (I can't recall) written in French placed on top. We were told it was compliments of the chef in celebration of our honeymoon. Very nice touch indeed.So the entire evening (with tip) was around $250 but it was the highlight of our stay in Las Vegas. We saw the fountains go off numerous times, took a ton of pictures and were treated with the utmost in personalized service. A really romantic way to spend the evening.Highly recommended.

doc.title: Wonderful view and the food to match
doc.review: First I would suggest to valet your car as the self park at Paris is quite a long walk. Your significant other will appreciate it especially if they are wearing heels.We were a few minutes late for our reservation, which wasn't a problem and they had our table waiting for us. I did email Lyle, the restaurant has a facebook page, to mention it was our 10th anniversary.Waiter was very good and attentive, without being overbearing. One thing I did notice when we sat down the red plates had a significant amount of dust on it, enough that I was able to see it and comment to my wife about it. Just a minor detail.All food was well seasoned and cooked as requested. We shared and escargot, both had lamb and shared sides of potatoes and a spinach mushroom dish. We ordered a chocolate and pistachio souffle as well, both were good. I would recommend the chocolate over the pistachio, they were both warm, light and fluffy. We were also treated to a little anniversary dessert, another nice touch which wasn't expected. We were very full and satisfied by the end of the meal.Lyle was great and I noticed he was very professional and took the time to talk to every table in the restaurant. This is a nice touch and makes every table feel special. Little things like this make you want to return again. The great views don't hurt either.Overall a great dining experience.

doc.title: Very Disappointed
doc.review: My wife and I renewed our vows and took our family with us, totallying four people. Thereafter, we were going to dine at the Eiffel Tower. We called a week prior to let them know and asked to be placed by the window. When we arrived they did not have any notes about our special day nor the sitting. So we got setting away from the window. Strike one. The wait staff was very slow to get to us. We had to flag someone down. It took 20 minutes to get our drink orders and another 20 to get our dinner orders. The food was only so-so, but for the roasted chicken, which was very good. The meal was very expensive and not at all worth what we paid for. It was also very loud and we could not hear oursevels without yelling. Very disappointed.

doc.title: Amazing view, great food.
doc.review: Went to the Eiffel tower July 20th for dinner. This was our big fancy night out in Vegas and it did not disappoint. In particular the rack of lamb was amazing and the pistachio soufflé was out of this world.This restaurant is made by the view, ask for a window table for a great view of the Bellagio fountains, its like they are putting on a private show for you.Can’t recommend highly enough. I will be back.

doc.title: The evening was unforgettable, in every good way possible!
doc.review: From my first correspondence via email with Lyle Tolhurst, the manager, to the last sweet bite of dessert, the experience at the Eiffel Tower restaurant was fantastic. I was impressed with so many things. The food was fabulous (the foie gras with cherries was so good I wished that I had ordered 4 servings of just that). Our group of four had fish, lamb, filet and steak, and every bite was great. The sides we ordered were just the right amount. We shared Potatoes Anna and creamed spinach and mushrooms, both excellent. The dessert I shared was the chocolate plate, the best variety of completely scrumptious desserts I've ever had. The chocolate souffle was praised by those who ate that. The view from our window table was incredible, with the sun setting and then the lights of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains entertaining us every 15 minutes. But even better than both the food and view was the superb service. We were treated like queens by everyone. Lyle made us feel really special and our server, Ron, was attentive and fun, as was everyone we encountered at the restaurant. Every year when I go to Las Vegas I include one elegant dinner and from now on that will always be the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Lyle promised to try to impress and he far exceeded my expectations. I can't praise this restaurant too much; don't miss it!

doc.title: Gorgeous View with Good Food, but Expensive Prices
doc.review: First off, I'm not big on Las Vegas for reasons that most Californians can understand. (i.e indoor smoking, 24 hour ringing from the slot machines, and BRIGHT neon lights). On the same token, I'm also the type of person that can find fun things to do or good eats in almost any place in the world, which leads me to this restaurant. We had a late lunch here and were lucky enough to get a table by the window to see the dancing water fountain at the Bellagio across the way. You could even hear the classical music from where we were sitting. It was almost like we were away from the dizziness of Sin City, except we were still there. I had the parmesan crusted chicken, which was just ok for the expensive price, but she had the classic hamburger that was almost amazing. (yes, "almost" because the bun was just ok, but the juiciness and the tenderness of the meat made up for it) We also shared the creme brulee which was mouth-washing deliciousness! All in all, it was a good experience for me and my date. Although this was one of those places where you go once in a while just to get away from the craziness.

doc.title: Wonderful!
doc.review: My fiance proposed here so it will always be a special place for us. We had a window table with amazing views of the Bellagio fountains. The food was delicious (we can definitely recommend the individual beef wellingtons - yum!) and plentiful. After reading some reviews on here we were expecting minute portions but this wasnt the case at all. The dessert of chocolate souffle was absolutely devine, I wish I was eating one right now. The wine menu was massive, we had a very nice californian red for about $140 but there was cheaper and much MUCH more expensive options if you wanted to splurge. The Eiffel Tower restaurant isnt cheap but this is a special place, go for a special occasion or to treat yourselves you won't be disappointed.

doc.title: Wow-Wow-Wo!
doc.review: 22nd Anniversary, requested in advance, and received a romantic window table over looking the famed fountains. Reserved by phone, the assistant offered rose pedals on the table, and we ordered additional roses, and a professional photograph, plus the restaurant gave us a beautiful Happy Anniversary desert. Our food was awesome, the drinks were superb,all we can say is they delivered on every promise, this was the perfect romantic, special occasion restaurant, thank you Eiffel Tower.

doc.title: Wonderful and Romantic experience
doc.review: I knew that I wanted to "Wow" my husband for our anniversary and that is exactly what I told Lyle (I believe he is the manager) when I emailed him. Lyle was wonderful at setting up the reservation, even though I changed my mind a couple of times. He assured me we would have a wonderful experience. What a wonderful time we had! We were treated like VIPs…from the moment we walked in, until the last little crumb was eaten we were wowed! The rose petals on the table, the complimentary appetizers, and the surprise anniversary dessert was all amazing! The restaurant itself is beautiful with the whole front windowed facing the Bellagio fountains. It is high enough up that the view was spectacular. The fountain show was awesome from our window seats. Our waiter Ron was so good that he made sure we got what we wanted before we even knew we wanted it! My DH loved his char broiled filet mignon, and my roasted free range chicken was very good. We shared a Caesar salad as well as sides of asparagus and potato gratin. The asparagus melted in our mouths. After our beautiful surprise dessert Ron came by with a tray of chocolates. I chose one, then DH choose two, so I said it wasn’t fair, I wanted two as well..lol…! The price for this wonderful and romantic experience was only $180, and that is including a generous tip.I would definately recommend this restaurant for anyone who wants to have an evening of romance.

doc.title: Great for a special occasion.
doc.review: We dined here for a birthday dinner. It's not cheap but the service and food are exceptional and the views stunning.

doc.title: A must treatl in Las Vegas
doc.review: You're greeted at the top of the lift by the kitchen staff and a little nibble.The views of the strip are amazing from the restaurant.The food is incredible with lots of authentic French choices on the menu. Service is what you would expect from such a highly regarded restaurant. This is fine dining at it's best.

doc.title: MAGNIFIQUE!
doc.review: Dined with my spouse and another couple on a weekday evening. First impressive feature is a hostess greeting diners and escorting them via private elevator to the restaurant ... and the next wow-factor is every table rewards with a sweeping view of The Strip/Ballagio Fountains. The service staff is not only extremely professional but friendly and very well acquainted with the extensive menu. Timing was perfect ... from the cocktail orders taken immediately, starters and entrees, right on to the [fabulous] souffle desserts. The food was expertly prepared, absolutely delicious and beautifully presented. We are eagerly awaiting our next visit to this magnificent restaurant. Viva Eiffel Tower!

doc.title: Amazing service, amazing food, amazing view. Class act!
doc.review: We were celebrating our 20th anniversary, it was a new pick for us, actually a surprise for my partner. We went to the top of the Eiiffel Tour and then stopped at the bar on the 11th floor and had a cocktail, then I sprung it on him that this was for dinner too. Excellent food, pricey yes, but well worth it. Great view of the fountains at the Bellagio also. We were treated with alot of dignity also, we were congradulated many times by different people working there for our 20 year achievement and we are a same sex couple, it did not make a bit of difference to anyone. Very special evening, out waitress was Maria, superb service. She has been there for 5 years. That is a testament to this restaurant. Go, Enjoy! Bring your credit card, it's pricey but sooooo good.

doc.title: Fabulous wedding meal
doc.review: We were getting married in Las Vegas and wanted somewhere really special for the two of us to have our wedding meal. Haing visited Vegas on several occassionsand trying out many restaurants, we started looking at menus online and tried to decide where would suit us best!We'd never eaten at the Eiffel tower restaurant before, but after looking at menus we decided it seemed perfect for our special day. I originally tried to book using the online system but it wanted me to call up ad pay a deposit over the phone. As we were from the UK this was a bit of a problem and so I emailed the restaurant directly to see if they could help. The manager Lyle got back to me within a day saying that he'd reserved us a beautiful table for 8pm and that unless anything changed, just to turn up on the day.On the evening of our wedding we got a taxi to the Pari hotel and made our way to the Eiffel tower restaurant. It was really nice walking through the hotel in our wedding outfits as lots of people congratulated us etc. Once we got to the restaurant we were congratualted by the staff downstairs and taken up to the restaurant in a lift. Once in the restaurant we were asked if we wanted a drink at the bar first and so we went and had a glass of pre-dinner champagne. We were then shown to our table and as we were walking there we passed some tables in the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and I was thinking to myself that it would be amazing if we could have one of those tables! Anyway the table we were shown to far exceeded our expextations! It was the corner table overlooking the fountains! It was decorated with rose petals and was just beautiful!Our somalier introduced himself and guided us through the extensive menu. He helped us pick out a bottle of red that was special to us because of where it was from. The wine is on the expensive side but for a special occassion and in such a wonderful setting, we didn't mind. Our waiter was wonderful and had just the right level of attentiveness without being intrusive. Firstly we were given an amuse bouche of asparagus mousse which was light and got the taste buds going! I had the cheese souffle to start and it was literally one of the best things I've ever tasted! I can't think what my husband ordered now, but he was equally impressed with watever it was! For my main course I had a vegetarian crepe which was wonderful but very filling and my husband ordered the beef wellington which was out of this world. We barely had room for dessert but orderd a caramel souffle to share, which was perfect. After we had finished that, the waiter bought out a chocolate mousse with congratulations on it, which wasa lovely touch.It is worth noting that when you first emerge from the lift you get to see the open kitchen, I think this is always agood sign! We truly did have the most wonderful meal we've ever had here and we've had many great meals in Vegas and throughout the world. At first we wondered whether we'd be paying for the setting and novelty and thought that the food might just be 'so so' as is the case with so many restaurants. But this couldn't be further from the truth. The food was probably the best we've ever eaten, the service impecciable and the ambience spot on.I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough and we will definately be returning when we visit Vegas in March.

doc.title: Amazing view, service should be better given the prices
doc.review: We booked via OpenTable, but then afterwards realized we had forgotten to indicate in the booking that our friends had just gotten engaged, so I called the restaurant to tell them that, thinking they would maybe make a little card for when we arrived, sign the dessert, or something, as fancy restaurants tend to do. So I called, and the response was "Is there anything else I can help you with?". Am I overly-sensitive, or is that simply rude? I had expected "Oh that's great, I'll note that in here" or at least some acknowledgement of what I had said. In reflection, I'm guessing the women I spoke to on the phone ended up being our maitre d' (more on her soon).We had booked on July 25th for 6:30pm, which was pretty perfect given that it meant we were early enough to get a seat by the windows, giving us an amazing view over the Bellagio fountains, with the sun setting behind the mountains in the distance. Unfortunately despite the fact that we arrived bang on time, we didn't get to sit down for quite a while. In fact the whole arrival process was confusing. Firstly we walked up to the elevator that says "Eiffel Tower Restaurant" and pressed the button, but it didn't respond. Eventually we discovered another elevator on the other side which was manned. We hopped in, but just as the doors were closing another party hopped in. When the doors opened, that group was warmly welcomed and taken off somewhere. We sort of just stood there, seemingly in the middle of the kitchen, not sure where we were going, with staff milling all about. Finally we worked out that the restaurant was around to the left, probably about where the first (unmanned/unavailable) elevator was. So maybe it was out of order? Anyway so the party ahead of us finally moved out of the way, I approach the maitre d', or I should say maitre d's, since there were 3 people standing there, none of which seemed to be able to help us. The "other two" pointed at the third one, who was typically vegas: young, female, bright dress, busty, busy, and not very interested in helping us :-o. In fact she ignored us completely, staring at her screen, which was ok for a while, but eventually I started to get annoyed at which point I said hello, and she literally "showed me the hand" for a little while, and then asked my name, without even looking up from the screen, so I guess it must have been quite a movie she had playing down there ;-). She then asked me to wait to the side, without any apology, no indication as to why our table wasn't ready (it was now about 6:40), and no indication as to how long it would be.So we stood to the side and chatted, which was fine, really, but after about 10 minutes of watching several other parties get seated instantly, my wife got sick of it and prodded me to go forward, which I did. Same drill - without looking up, she asks "Name?". Now - I don't know about you, but when I am the ONLY PARTY waiting for a table at a place where I am about to drop $800, then I expect the maitre d' to at least be aware of who we are and why we are waiting, but she apparently wasn't able to keep track of that. Upon being given our name, she said the table wasn't ready yet. No explanation as to why, or how long, and now I'm getting a bit upset, so I asked her if perhaps she could be so kind as to tell us how much longer it would be, given we had booked a table, and she said "They're just putting the silverware out now", which actually didn't answer my question, but at least it gave us an idea, and sure enough we were seated shortly afterwards, I guess around 7pm, half an hour after our booked time. At this point I'm ready to give the place 1 star, and honestly if we'd gotten a bad table at this point, we would have left, but happily our table is right by the windows with an AMAZING view, so I start to cheer up a lot.Our waiter was a very likeable fellow and the wine list was incredibly extensive, so I started to cheer up even more. We ordered some bubbly water. As others here have noted, you can expect wines at this restaurant to cost about 4x what they cost retail (+ tip = 5x), which is undeniably very expensive, on the other hand they are cellaring a massive range of bottles in the middle of Las Vegas. I was disappointed to see that they only had two Australian reds on the menu, neither of which I had ever heard of (and I'm a bit of an expert on Australian reds), but that was more or less expected, and they had enough American and French bottles in price ranges to satisfy pretty much anyone (at least anyone with enough money to book at this restaurant at all).They had a set menu with 6 small dishes for $98 + matching wines for $70 which was (as usual for such things) a great value compared to a la carte, and I would definitely have gone for that, however one in our party really didn't want to, and unfortunately the restaurant requires everyone at the table to order that menu, so it wasn't possible for us. We'd already polished off a bottle of Champagne in the room before we left, so we got straight into it. We ordered appetizers with a bottle of Chardonnay and mains with a bottle of red. I was asked to confirm the 4-digit numbers to the left of the wines, which is undoubtedly an efficient way to do it, however in the real Eiffel Tower I think the waiters would rather serve Fish and Chips than do it that way - it infers that the waiter doesn't really know the wine list, and reminded me of a Chinese restaurant - "Number 4 with chicken" ;-).We were asked by a pretty young lady whether we wanted out photos taken, which we declined. We were served bread by a very nice older woman. Although I personally thought my bread was really tough (definitely not freshly baked), the others seemed to like theirs, and mine was tasty enough.The waiter came with both the white and the reds, confirmed both bottles, and then opened the white and poured it for me to taste. After I indicated it was OK, he poured for everyone else, however he then did something I have never seen before in any restaurant - he immediately poured the red, and asked me to taste it. Personally, I don't really want to mix the white and red like that, however I guess it could be argued that it gives the red time to breathe. The red was OK, so he then poured it, too, and we now had both white and red glasses - a bit weird, but not really a problem.Our appetizers arrived. I had the crab salad, which really was excellent - I loved it, the sun was setting, and everyone seemed to like their food and we were having a great time.We were asked whether we wanted to order soufflé (which as everyone knows takes time and needs to be ordered in advance), which we did - we ordered two of them for the four of us, figuring we could order the other two deserts later.For the main I had tenderloin which I had ordered medium but to me it was medium-well, but maybe I'm just cursed since I had the same thing a couple of nights before and this time decided not to worry about it. We had each ordered sides, which was a mistake since 3 of us ordered the same side and they were huge and most of it ended up going back to the kitchen.At this point we were pretty tipsy, and I guess time just flew by, since seemingly out of nowhere, the soufflés arrived, were served with great flair, and then the guy serving them (not our waiter) disappeared into thin air. Now I found this quite annoying, since we had planned on ordering both dessert wine and a couple more desserts. Luckily our waiter turned up fairly quickly, and we ordered some desert wine however we decided not to wait around for more desserts since the soufflés looked pretty huge, none of us are big eaters, and we didn't want to wait around.I tip 25% for great service however on balance I thought the service was really not up to scratch and only left 15%, which still ended up adding up to $850, so that gives you an idea of the prices. I think the atmosphere here is hard to beat, however the service really needs to be better, especially the maitre d', who frankly shouldn't even be working at a TGI Friday's, let alone here.

doc.title: Upscale, fab food and great view of Bellagio Fountains
doc.review: I had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in June, 2011. The food was fabulous and our waiter, Lee Marker, Captain. was Outstanding!!!! He was more than personable and since we had a time limit because we were off the see "O" at the Bellagio, he made sure we got our order in and placed out dessert order so that everything came out perfect. I would definitely have dinner there again and if you go, ask for Lee - He was great!!!!! We had the corner table and probably one of the best views of the Bellagio fountains - my friend had never been to Vegas before and she was blown away by the restaurant and the fountains!Cudos to both!!!!!

doc.title: Amazing Views and Delicious Food
doc.review: After a shaky start as they messed up our reservation and we had to wait nearly an hour for a table to become available. This is a great restaurant with a very romantic atmosphere, the views over the strip and The Bellagio were stunning, and the food was delicious. It a fairly expensive, but worth every penny.

doc.title: A wonderful experience
doc.review: I and three other friends dined at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on top of theParis Hotel in Las Vegas, NV.Fabulous service, and fabulous food - put those together with thefabulous view --- it was an evening to remember.

doc.title: Awesome views, the rest Ho-Hum + indigestion
doc.review: This restaurant has the most fabulous and romantic view of the Bellagio fountain show. However, the food compared to the many French restaurants in the city, did nothing to impress me. I also did not feel too well after eating there. Perhaps it was not Meg Ryan's train scene from French Kiss, but my stomach was not happy. As far as service, I made reservations far in advance on July 4th, so that we could have a fantastic view of the fireworks. I was coaxed into changing my reservation as the person booking our table stated they were going to do fireworks on July 3rd this year 2010. And guess what? There were no fireworks that night of course! NO apologies were offered, and certainly no classy way of resolution was demonstrated. From the food to the service, this is more of a Paris wannabes kind of experience, unless you factor in the snob factor you hear about, yet no one speaks French or has anything to stick their nose in the air about as far as I can tell. If you want fine French food, I would try another route. If you just want a few drinks with a view in a romantic setting, this could work. Oh, and don't forget the proton pump inhibitors.

doc.title: Great French food with wonderful view of Strip
doc.review: Could not fault the food and service. Only disappointment was that our table was not on window of restaurant for best view of "strip". As we booked over 6 months in advance this was sad, however, the fact we were a table of five may have been the reason. Would highly recommend for a special occasion.

doc.title: Very expensive, but worth it.
doc.review: I took my wife here for our 20th wedding anniversary dinner. I'd made reservations months in advance, and requested they put us at a table that would overlook the fountains at Bellagio, across the street.They did that, putting us at the second best table, in my opinion, in the restaurant: right next to the window, and only one seat from the corner table (the best seat, I think). THAT seat was taken up by a couple who were enjoying their first dinner together as husband and wife, still dressed in tux and wedding dress, so we didn't mind being down one table, at all.The service was outstanding, and the wine list was extensive (and expensive). In fact, the entire menu was $$$$, but we ate there expecting that. It's not every day you celebrate 20 years of wedded bliss, and I went all-out. It was certainly the most expensive meal I've ever eaten, but I'm not complaining.I had the Beef Wellington, which melted in my mouth, and my wife had the rabbit. Her's wasn't as good as mine, but was tasty. We had some side items to go with our meal, all of which were at least good, some better than others. We had two appetizers, because we couldn't decide which we wanted: warm duck foie gras or a salad with several exotic animal bits in it, including "sweetbreads" (brains). The duck liver was the better of the two, but we ate all of it :)We had a $65 bottle of wine to go with our meal, based on the recommendation of the staff, and were very happy with the choices they offered us. Dessert was a souffle that was extremely good, as well.The best part of the meal was the location and the service (and my Wellington), and we enjoyed a wonderful time with an exquisite view of the strip and the fountains across the street. I would certainly eat there again, but only for an equally special occasion.

doc.title: Outstanding Romantic ambiance and great tasting food
doc.review: Upon ascending the elevator from the Paris Hotel into the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, you are greeted by a hostess in an elegant evening gown. This lets you what kind of atmosphere you are in store for. The view upon entering the restaurant is fantastic overlooking the Strip, and specifically the Bellagio fountains. The service is first class and the food is terrific. Of course this all comes at a price that is expected, but not outrageous. My wife and I each had a salad, an entree, we split dessert and each had a glass of wine and coffee. This cost with tip and tax, just over $200. The manager came over to introduce himself to us and asked if there was anything he could do for us to make our experience even better. His name was Lyle. This restaurant is an experience not to be missed.

doc.title: Best venue and meal for my partners 30th birthday!
doc.review: Booked a table here for the actual evening of my partners 30th birthday and specifically requested a good table with a view of the fountains! Well,,,,,, our table seemed to be the best in the house! directly overlooking the Bellagio fountain show, was amazing. You get out the elevator and walk straight into the kitchen where you are greeted which was a lovely touch. We arrived a little too early so had to sit at the bar and order a glass of wine whilst looking out over to the strip - no great hardship..! ;-)We were sat up there as day turned to night and it was beautiful. Dont agree with any of the comments about it being snobby, i am far from being a snob but if your going to a fine dining restaurant - make an effort!! simple!The food was beautiful and between our starter and main we had a complimentary cold soup served which was amazing - i could of eaten a whole bowl! Also, at the end of the meal my partner received a complimentary happy birthday dessert which was a wonderful touch.It wasnt cheap, but if you were paying just for the view you could complain, but as it had the best view and romantic atmosphere, topped with the amazing food and service it was worth every penny and highly reccomended for a special occassion ( we had a 26yr anniversary couple one side of us and newlywed bride and groom the other)

doc.title: Most expensive restaurant I have ever been to, but nice
doc.review: I have been to many expensive restaurants in my life, but this one was the most expensive. The food, service and view were all good, but the prices were outrageous. It is definitely a tourist trap. We had a meal the next night in a very fancy restaurant downtown and the meal was just as good and the price was 1/2 of what we paid at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. That being said, it was still a good experience, but just be prepared to pay for it.

doc.title: Nice view, good food but snobby and expensive
doc.review: It is a very nice restaurant and the food was good, but very expensive. The wine list is extensive but very expensive, too. There is a real air of snobbishness there. We have dined in very nice restaurants in the past, but we felt a little like we were being "forced" to chose an expensive wine or menu item as it was "highly recommended" (like a bottle of wine for over $1,000). Our server was knowledgeable but a bit pushy and had a "know it all" attitude about the food, wine, and just about everything else. We asked him to take some pictures for us and he even made adjustments to the settings on our camera because he apparently knew all about photography, too - but the pictures he took turned out blurry and are useless to us. Our better pictures are those we took ourselves. The view was beautiful and it was a nice place to dine, but I think the whole "Eiffel Tower" thing has gone to their heads - this isn't France, after all! And just because a couple decides to dine at the nice restaurant doesn't mean that money is no object.

doc.title: Very Stuffy and too Expensive!
doc.review: I had called the restaurant directly to book our reservation. We were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary and wanted somewhere nice for dinner. I wish that when I made our reservation that they would have told me about the mandatory dress code. My husband had shorts on with a collared shirt and close toed sandals. They require long pants and socks. They way they treat you when you are not dressed correctly is kind of rude. It made us feel very out of place. Living in napa we are used to nice restaurants and have never been treated that way anywhere before. We ended up having to go back to the hotel so my husband could change and an $10 cab ride later, we arrived back at the restaurant. We also brought our own wine which in Napa is not frowned upon...we we were not allowed to bring it in with us.. they made us check it with them and pick it back up when we left. By the way..we had the wine with us the first time we showed up and nothing was said to us about it or we would have left it at our hotel when my husband had to go back to change. At this point I really felt like just saying we wanted to cancel our reservation, but was scared they would charge me since I had to hold the reservation with a credit card. They redeemed themselves a little when we were able to sit at a table facing the bellagio fountains. The waiter was extremely friendly. The food was very good but totally over priced. We got the blue cheese souffle, cream of artichoke soup to start. We both got beef wellington as an entree and we got a caramel souffle for dessert. They did also bring us a small dessert that said happy anniversary, that was nice. With a bottle of wine 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and a dessert, our bill was $500 after leaving a tip. Before we planned our trip to Vegas we contemplated just staying home and going to the French Laundry as ouur anniversary present. For how much we spent at Eiffel tower restaurant we could have.

doc.title: super food, super view, super prices
doc.review: After reading other reviews that the food here matched the views, we reserved for our last night in Vegas. We had a table for two overlooking the Bellagio fountains and timed it so we were able to see day turn to night and the Strip come to life. The service was impeccable-Pierre was delightful and knew how to be professional without being stuffy. The wine list is over the top ridiculous--not a lot of French wine under $500 and many in four and five figures (!) That said, we chose a very nice St. Estephe that was more than we would normally pay, but didn't break the bank. Our dinner was spectacular, from the chilled asparagus cream soup amuse bouche, to the foie gras appetizer, the lamb and veal entrees, and the amazing chocolate souffle for dessert. There was also a small plate after dessert containing chocolates, fruit candy slices, almond cookies and caramels. This is a very, very expensive restaurant, but it was well worth the cost for an amazing experience. Job well done!

doc.title: Amazing anniversary meal
doc.review: I wanted somewhere special for dinner on our fifth wedding anniversary, and special it was!! We had decided we would like to have dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and I had read some pretty good reviews. I made the booking through Open Table, months and months in advance, as this was our first time to Las Vegas and our anniversary, I didn’t want to leave it to chance that we could just turn up and get a table. I mentioned in the comments that it would be our anniversary and would love one of the window tables with a view of the fountains. From the moment you walk up to the elevator to head up the restaurant, the staff are welcoming and friendly. We were a little bit early so had a drink at the bar before being taken to our table. It was a great seat, a lovely half circle table right by the window, we were not directly in front of the Bellagio Fountains, just off to the side, but it gave us a great view down the strip and of the Paris Balloon. Our waiter was truly the best waiter we have ever had, he was polite, friendly, and knowledgeable. He welcomed us and wished us a happy anniversary straight away. The food was wonderful, best piece of Filet Mignon I have ever had, pretty much melted in your mouth. Before dessert our waiter brought out a lovely little anniversary treat for us! I had ordered a soufflé for my dessert - chocolate – the waiter brings it out and then pours warm chocolate sauce on it at the table. I was pretty good!! The waiter will also arrange your tickets if you are wanting to go up to the viewing part of the tower. All in all, it was an amazing meal and experience, I highly recommend it if you are wanting to have a special meal while in Las Vegas. Will definitely go back on out next trip to Las Vegas.

doc.title: Great experience
doc.review: Was this a pricey meal...YES! Was it worth it....YES! I thought the service was a bit slow, however, the meal was very good which made up for the long wait.
