The view was perfect, the atmosphere was energetic and it was fun watching the staff hustle about. The most enjoyable part of the meal was the dessert...the chocolate souffle. OMG...OMG...OMG!!! it was so delicious.

doc.title: Far exceeded expectations!
doc.review: We made a reservation for Eiffel Tower for our anniversary since we were staying at Paris (as we had before) but never had eaten at the restaurant before, thinking it would be too touristy and low quality. We usually chose to eat at other restaurants in Las Vegas, such as Mix, Il Mulino, Aureole to name a few. In the afternoon we took the elevator up to check out the restaurant and the menu and get the layout of the restaurant and were very pleasantly surprised on all counts. The day manager described the dishes very appealingly and enthusiastically (we are foodies!), the wine list looked very interesting and the view looked really good too. So we went back down the elevator and confirmed our reservation. Dinner that night was wonderful. Our server, Maria, was very professional, efficient, knowledgable, unobtrusive but helpful and friendly. The wine flowed, even the server bringing breads came at all the right times. Our meals were just delicious. We had rack of lamb that was cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly and duck breast that just melted in your mouth. The sides were very good also, we had a Luberon red wine that was very good (reasonably priced) and we ordered souffle for dessert that was just scrumptious. Lyle from Management stopped by our table and was so personable and welcoming, we felt like we'd always known him - it was a really nice touch. This is definitely our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas now because of the quality and service of the meal, the delicious food itself plus the view of the fountains at Bellagio. We know we will return here again.

doc.title: Great view, super service, high cost
doc.review: Never go with a large family group........ Good location, exclusive, quite expensive

doc.title: FURIOUS!
doc.review: We planned our visit here weeks before our holiday and had emailed the restaurant to request a good table. We were so excited as it was our one year anniversary celebration. We had both spent a lot of time getting ready to go. We went to the lift and were escroted up with other guests. The hostess then escorted us and another group of people around the corner and handed my husband and another man the most vile dinner jackets I had ever seen and said they couldnt come in unless they put them on as they werent wearing shirts with a collar, they both looked smart but for some reason this wasnt good enough. My husband was agreeable to this although he wasnt happy and put it on and it was 2 sizes too big, they had no other sizes available and expected him to sit through the meal looking ridiculous. The other man had to go and buy a shirt from one of the shops in the hotel. I just thought the way we were treated was disgusting so just cancelled the reservation and left without so much as an apology for their mistake. Looking at the booking confirmation it says formal attire is recommended (not essential) and he was dressed smart, just not in a collared shirt as he is 22 after all. The whole thing was so disappointing, i wouldnt recommend this restaurant to anyone as the service was appauling.

doc.title: perfection!
doc.review: The service from start to finish was faultless. We sat at a window table overlooking the Strip and fountains-beautiful! Everything we chose to eat and drink was fabulous, presentation was superb. I had a glass of wine that was perhaps $12, not the ridiculous amount quoted by someone previously in TA.. The service as I said was excellent-attentive but unobtrusive. It was an evening to remember. Very expensive but worth it for the experience. Our best meal ever!

doc.title: The best meal we had in Vegas
doc.review: My boyfriend made reservations here for a nice dinner to help celebrate our friends wedding in Vegas. We decided it would be nice to go on a double date with the new couple on our last night in Las Vegas. Immediately upon entering the restaurant I was impressed with the views and the staff! While we weren't seated close to a window to see the Bellagio fountains, we still got great view of the hotels on the other side of the strip. I can't imagine what the view must have been like seated close to the windows!Right away our server (I wish I could remember his name!) greeted us and offered us a wine list while we looked over the menus. He asked what the occasion was and we told him it was our friends wedding. He was absolutely fantastic!! He answered any questions we had about the menu and kept a close eye on our drinks at all times. I never had to wait for my drink to be refilled. The wine list here is quite large (and marked up, but that was to be expected). My boyfriend and I both ordered the filet mignon with red wine sauce and it was perfect! There was not one problem with anything that was brought out to us. We also both ordered desserts and they were both better than what I was expecting (I believe the wedding couple had Crème Brulee and we had White Chocolate Banana Elysèe) and the happy new couple received a complimentary dessert from the chef congratulating them on their wedding. The whole atmosphere and dining experience were truly unforgettable. The wait staff did such an amazing job and made us feel welcome and comfortable. Yes, the whole meal was pricey, but we knew that when we were making the reservations. It was all well worth it. We will be back to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant the next time we are in Vegas!

doc.title: Our new Vegas "tradition"
doc.review: This was our second trip to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We went for lunch. The menu was lighter and less pricey than dinner. The daytime view was just as beautiful. Although the fountains weren't running, they often do daily repairs and test runs during the early afternoon. The service was outstanding without being "stuffy". The food was carefully prepared and quite delicious. Appetizers and entrees are generously proportioned. our only regret is skipping dessert. We can't wait to return!

doc.title: By far the best restaurant and views we had in Vegas
doc.review: We loved this restaurant, requested a window seat - we saw the Bellagio fountain shows and all the lights of the strip right in front of us - we enjoyed the views and food much more than Top of the World at Stratosphere - there is a restaurant photographer who will take your picture for $25 and give you the hard copy - but the waiters are more than happy to take your picture for free with your own camera ;)

doc.title: Just because its fancy, doesn't mean its good
doc.review: I was very disappointed with my dining experience. We made a reservation (and had to leave our credit card # with them to secure it). When we arrived a little early, there were several open tables. We were seated next to the outside wall so we would have a semi-good view of the Bellagio fountains and a limited view of the Strip. It was cool being able to watch the fountains, but not as fun as we could not hear the music. I ordered the filet mignon. My husband ordered prime rib and lobster. We had to order veggies al a carte (green beans almondine and potatoes al gratin). We expected to be blown away, given that the prices are exorbitant. The filet tasted good, but nothing to write home about. The green beans were soggy (not crisp), the almondine sauce was runny. The potatoes au gratin was served in a small pan - so small that we barely could get a serving each AND they didn't taste that great, either. I was so disappointed. I could have gotten a better meal at Luby's! Save your money on this one. The view isn't that great and the food isn't anything to write home about.

doc.title: One of the best!
doc.review: For service, quality and value for money this restaurant can't be beat. Yes, it is expensive, but unlike most French restaurants the portions are large and satisfying. Everything on the menu is wonderful, but the appetizer blue cheese souffle and the dessert souffles are unusually moist, airy and delicious. I describe the pistaccio soufle as being like what psiaccio ice cream would be like if ice cream were served hot.The wait staff was attentive to the point that I suspected they were using telapathy. And the view, ovelooking the Strip, Bellagio Fountains and facing the sunset was like a photograph advertising a perfect evening in Vegas.

doc.title: Wonderful meal and outstanding views!
doc.review: My wife and I went to the Eiffel Tower restaurant on June 6 with some Brazilian friends we met last September in Provence. It seemed appropriate to have a French meal with them since we first met them there. The Eiffel Tower restaurant gave us a meal to remember!We had reservations for 8:00pm and were escorted up to the restaurant in the private elevator inside the Paris casino. Even though it was a Monday night, the place was packed! Nevertheless, we were immediately shown to our table which had a good view of the Bellagio fountains even though the table itself was not right at the window. Immediately upon seating our server, David, came over and asked us if we wanted a cocktail. He also brought the wine list and our menus. I ordered a bottle of champagne and that came up quickly too.We enjoyed our champagne and although David checked with us a couple of times, we never felt rushed to order our meal. We finally did order, and our friend Jose made sure he told David that he did not like garlic at all. Jose ordered some fish, and from the menu description it did not seem that there was any garlic, and off David went.After our first course had arrived, (I had the cold foie gras which was outstanding), David returned to inform Jose that he had checked with the chef and although there was no garlic in the sauce, it seemed that there was a touch of it in the marinade so David recommended another one of the two remaining fish dishes. Jose ordered one of those. I thought that was very conscientious of our server to double check on that.I ordered the rack of lamb which was prepared perfectly and was quite enjoyable. Our friend Jose thought his fish was great and his wife Ana said her steak was the best she had had in Las Vegas. My wife had steak as well and it was wonderful.The desserts were incredible. I had a three-dimensional experience of perfectly ripened and sliced bananas to form a tower filled with dark chocolate and buttressed by white chocolate. It was outrageously good!During our dinner, the water show at the Bellagio produced some ooohs and ahhs, but at our table it was the dinner that got all the accolades.

doc.title: Good food but overpriced
doc.review: The food was way overpriced. They offer a view of the fountains at the Bellagio, but what they don't say is that you have to get lucky enough to be seated at a table that you can see them. They are not visible from the entire restaurant. The one thing I did not like is that you have to cancel your reservations within 4 hours of your time. This is a little crazy because if you have something that keeps you from being on time, it usually does not give you four hours notice!! The dress code says business casual, but it is much more formal than that and so we felt out of place. Our meal was $194 and we all had appetizers and tea. But, if you don't mind paying a few hundres dollars for small dishes, this is the place!! The staff was pretty friendly but were are pretty stiff. For all I know, this could be what they promote to be their style. It was ok, but not really what is advertised.

doc.title: Great anniversary dinner
doc.review: My husband made reservations for our 5th wedding anniversary for Sat. June 11. Knowing that Sat. nights can be busy we were very pleasantly surprised to be seated in the #1 table of the restaurant overlooking the Bellagio fountains, and the Paris balloon. Our wait staff were incredible, neat to have a waiter that spoke French! Great food, I had the filet mignon w/ red wine sauce, my husband had the salmon and both were delicious. Nice to have the manager, Lyle, greet us and wish us a Happy Anniversary! Made it very memorable...Thank you!

doc.title: Great flavor, excellent setting
doc.review: We went there last night for our 25th wedding anniversary. Great call. All the way from the entrance through the kitchen to the service to the setting (seated next to window overlooking the Bellagio water show), everything was top notch. Ordered the cream of artichoke soup and smoked salmon appetizer, tenderloin and veal cutlets. Awesome flavor and our waiter was very attentive without being obtrusive. Pricey, yes, but worth it for a special occasion. Thumbs up!

doc.title: Simply the best meal I have ever had - period.
doc.review: When you walk into the Eiffel Tower, you expect it to be special, and it is. The service is impecable and friendly, not an easy combination. The food is fresh and thoughtfully prepared and delicious. I had the chef's tasting menu with the wine pairing. The food and wine complimented each other perfectly and the portions were spot on to be able to finish them all. As a single diner, I am sometimes not treated with much respect but here, I was given the same attention as larger parties, something important to me as a traveler. As the dessert with the 5 chocolate imterpretations, unbelievable. I will be back.

doc.title: Excellent
doc.review: Great view, food and service. Do not miss the Raspberry Souffle; it could not be better.

doc.title: PIERRE AND THAT VIEW !
doc.review: Sat. Oct. 2nd: Celebrating our Anniversary in Vegas it was difficult selecting a Restaurant. So I chose 2!! Cut Steakhouse was wonderful ,but Eiffel Tower surpassed it mainly because of the View and easier on the wallet. A table facing the Bellagio Fountain Water Show can't be beat! It's so easy to settle in and relax then enjoy a wonderful leisurely meal. Good wine, wonderful service and a view of the Strip/ Water Show. Perfect to relax and unwind. Our added Bonus was Pierre, our charming server. His french accent just added to the ambience ! Five grain ciabbatta and sourdough rolls wonderful. I had Surf and Turf and Tom enjoyed a perfectly prepared Strip Steak with a bottle of very good, yet affordable Wine..shared au gratin potatoes and preordered Caramel Souffle for dessert. Surprise Chocolate Mousse for Anniversary.Pierre was at our beck and call. Unobtrusive yet he does cater to you ! Our plan is to celebrate our Anniversary here every year we can get to Vegas and one day hope for a corner table which sure looked like the best one in the place! As we were settling up our bill and readying to leave, an attractive blonde with what looked like her also attractive mother sat at the table next to us. So, alas, Pierre was leaning in to welcome and assist them with meal suggestions and spreading that French Charm at their table. They were in for a treat! Our 65th Anniversary Celebration was perfect in every way. Hugs and kisses to everyone who works there especially Pierre and the Chef !

doc.title: If you only going to one Restaurant in Vegas make it this one!!!!!!!!!!
doc.review: The view is amazing, but that is a given. Forget the view, the food, serves, cleanness and friendliness, and value was 5 stars all round. This is the best meal in Vegas hands down. We ate at several restaurants in Vegas that were $$$$ a person and nothing compared.

doc.title: Ambiance-A! Food-B-
doc.review: After much consideration and reviews I decided to book this for our anniversary. I am glad I did, but I do want to review the restaurant as a whole and share what I thought was good, and what was bad. The most amazing thing about this restaurant and really the only reason I would consider going back was the view. We had the best seat in the house on the corner. Direct view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip. It made for amazing ambiance, and you really get to take in the beauty of Vegas at night. I have eaten at Mix and the view from you table is much better at the ETR, then Mix. The service was also outstanding and I really appreciated the Sommelier visiting us right as we were sat, as ordering a bottle is the first thing we usually do. All night long, we really had top notch service, as good if not better then any other high end restaurant we have eaten at. The down side to the evenging was overall the food. It is not that it was bad because it wasn't, it is just that it wasn't great and I have had much better gastric experiences in Vegas. We had the Blue Cheese Souffle which actually was really good, and the chocolate souffle was pretty good (not the best we have ever had) but pretty good. For dinner I had the lamb and I imagine if Lamb is your thing, this was probably pretty good. It was cooked perfectly. I personally didn't like it and neither did my wife. Apparantly it is a best seller so again if you like lamb, it is probably your thing. My wife had the surf and turf and it was far from impressive in my book and hers. I have had better steaks for less than $15, and the lobster just wasn't that great either. Overall both of our meals were bad but for the price they don't match. One other side note, the restaurant was noisy, which didn't bother us a whole lot, but it was by no means a quiet evening dinner. If you want great food, I would say look elsewehere, if you want a memorable view/romantic evening, then give it a shot. Our tab was about $500 with wine, tip, food, and I had roses at the table. Of course depending on your wine preference your tab can get pretty high up there. You can get by on food for around $200.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant - A ---- MAZING!!!!
doc.review: My husband and I ate here last weekend for our birthday. It was the best restaurant experience that I have EVER had. Both the food and atmosphere were wonderful. My husband had lamb chops, and I had braised ribs. The potatoes were to die for! Sure the cost is a little more expensive than your average restaurant but that sums it up, The Eiffel Tower is not an average restaurant. I can't say enough good things! We had a perfect view of the Bellagio water fountains as well. It was a birthday that both of us will never forget. Thank you Eiffel Tower for such a great night and meal!

doc.title: BEST RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS HANDS DOWN!!! (NOT FOR CHILDREN)
doc.review: I will try to sum it up by keeping it short and sweet.First: You go up the "Eiffel Tower" in Paris Hotel and the you walk right into the spotless kitchen with dozens of busy chefs working on the meals- that place was really clean!The View: Someone meets you to take you to a table that overlooks Las Vegas and some colorful water works below- sunset was gorgeous.The food: I am the pickiest eater ever and find a flaw to everything- but I coudln't find one here! everything from the crunchy ceaser salad, chilled shrimp and pea soup,prime rib meal, and real Paris chocalate dessart- was impeccable!The service: our waiter was polite, fast, and attentive- just a tad talkative though but very nice.. Overall: BEST PART? it was a Romantic atmosphere with no screaming children ruining the best night of my life with my husband. Lights dimmed, great view, slight sound of piano playing, and great service.. This was the best expierience I've ever had in a restaurant..

doc.title: Great Restaurant
doc.review: The service was excellent. Our Captain, Steven Barcelo, made our dining experience all the more wonderful with his insightful recommendations regarding the menu and wine list. We will certainly ask for him again when we next dine here.

doc.title: Best lambchops I have had in years
doc.review: My husband and I try to eat well when we are on vacation, and were reccommended to come to the Effiel Tower restaurant. We couldn't have been happier. The views were wonderful, the food was amazing, and the service was perfect. We made reservations at 6 for a 7:45 dinner. We were seated right away, and were never rushed nor ignored. We will go back there for the tasting menu next time we are in Vegas. I can't say enough about how great this place is, from the fact that you couldn't drink a 1/4 of water without it being refilled, to the guy who scraps the crumbs off the table. I never felt like they were intruding, they were very careful to make sure we were happy. The food was fantastic, my lambchops were exactly how I ordered them (rare) and the desert was perfect. It is spendy, but it was worth it.

doc.title: Incredible Dinner!!!
doc.review: After having an unpleasant brunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant last year, we decided to try it for dinner. Boy, am I glad we did. The service, food and ambience are all impeccable! We arrived for our reservation, and the lovely, young hostess brought us to a window table in a very tight corner... so we asked if we could wait for a better table. It was not an issue at all, so we proceeded to the bar to have a glass of champagne. A minute later the hostess came and said the best seat in the house was available... the opposite corner table with an amazing strip view. I know that I can be a pain, but the table was too romantic for me, and the doll of a hostess said a middle table would be available soon. It was worth the wait for this great table.Of course, I had to tip the patient hostess for all the trouble. She was so obliging. The server turned out to be another outstanding service person. He was so smooth in his delivery on every level.Onto the food! This restaurant serves some of the best cuisine we have ever experienced. The cauliflower amuse bouche was a great start, but the bleu cheese souffle appetizer was amazing! The seared foie gras with pears was melt in your mouth delicious, as well.The rack of lamb was perfectly cooked and sooo tender and the glazed turnips were a beautiful addition to these wonderful tasting dish.How can you even describe the gratin of potatoes... how about out of this world! Creamy, cheesy, and sinful.The brussels sprouts with bacon were perfectly cooked and tasted great, but then again not really special. I thought it might be something healthy with all the rich food. Like bacon is healthy.The crowning glory of this sumptuous meal was the incredible pistachio souffle. Light and airy, with a fabulous sauce, it is a must order if you love pistachios.We are heading to Vegas again in June, and already have an Opentable booking for this excellent restaurant. Can't wait to try the slow poached lobster !

doc.title: Perfect anniversary dinner...
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the Eiffel Tower restaurant on May 10th (Paris 18_10 - I think we sat next to you!). I can't say enough about the attention we were shown. Lyle is wonderful - I communicated with him through email making our reservations before our trip to Las Vegas and he came by our table to introduce himself and welcome us. All of our servers were absolutely wonderfully attentive and friendly. We had a lovely table by the window with a view of the Bellagio fountains, which was a treat to see from the 11th floor! The sunset behind Bellagio was beautiful as it lit the mountains. Oh yes, and then there is the food! We started with a glass of champagne (very nice) and had a very good bottle of wine. We went with the tasting menu and are we ever happy that we did! Every course was delicious and beautifully presented. We ordered dessert - I had the chocolate souffle which was, I think, the best chocolate dessert I have ever had! My husband ordered the Napoleon which was delicious. But before they brought our desserts, they treated us to a chocolate mousse on a plate that read "Happy Anniversary" along with a sampling of sorbets (7 of them I believe). Such a treat! It is expensive - but this is a wonderful place for a special occasion and we will not hesitate to return when we go back to Las Vegas! We look forward to it!

doc.title: Average Food and a Tourist Trap - Avoid
doc.review: Had a meal here after getting married in Vegas. After reading the reviews I was looking forward to some top quality french food, but was left disappointed. I have eaten in many French restaurants in the UK and in France and the food here was poor in comparison. Essentially you pay for the view and the food is an American/Vegas version of a french restaurant. Not authentic.4 of us all opted for the tasting menu and with a bottle of cheap ($140) champagne. the bill came to over $600. I don't mind paying this much for a fancy meal, but it was not value for money and the courses ranged from OK to pretty awful. I gave a decent tip, but clearly not enough as when I arrived home I found that they took an extra $10 from my card above what I have on the receipt!? I find this unacceptable and feel I have been ripped off.Overall I would not recommend this place at all and if you are visiting from overseas, I would suggest paying by cash to avoid them overcharging your card (and only finding out when you return home).

doc.title: Amazing anniversary experience
doc.review: What a special anniversary. We ate here on May 10, and had the most breathtaking view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Service was top-notch and I can't say enough about the food. I had the sea bass which was perfectly cooked and my husband raved about his beef wellington. I also have to say, the creamed spinach with mushrooms was unbelievable, I may never be able to eat that again, because nothing will ever match up. They really helped make our anniversary special, and we would definitely return when we're in Vegas.

doc.title: Great dessert
doc.review: My wife and I went here for dessert before seeing a show. The restaurant is very nice and romantic. The views are awesome. Service is top notch. We both ordered the chocolate souffles and I had a cup of coffee. We both agreed that these were the best souffles either of us have ever had in our life. The entrees other diners were eating looked good too. Only negative about this place is the cost. For two souflees and one coffee $45 with tax and tip. It was a great once in a lifetime experience though and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone celebrating a special occasion.

doc.title: The place to splurge.
doc.review: If you are looking to have a romantic dinner for a special occasion nothing could be more perfect than dining in the Eiffel Tower restaurant. I booked a table facing the Bellagio water fountains far in advance using www.opentable.com. I was seated right away and presented with the extensive wine list. As an amateur wine enthusiast I did my best to pick out a desirable bottle without having to re-mortgage my house. The staff was helpful and friendly, never having a lengthly pause without some sort of attention. It is exceptional cuisine and service with an equally exceptional bill. Splurge on this memorable dining experience should you have the funds to do so.

doc.title: Fantastic meal!
doc.review: I took my staff and husband to this wonderful restaurant last weekend. Everything was wonderful. I had the veal which was outstanding! Wine was great. View excellent.Waiter was attentive but not over the top. Really enjoyed the whole experience.

doc.title: "It was perfection"
doc.review: This adventure began when Lyle, the restaurant's general manager, offered to be of help with a dinner I was planning for two nephews and a niece at this restaurant. I corresponded with Lyle concerning this particular dinner, and he was helpful -- turns out that timing matters with this restaurant, and he suggested the seating time (6:45) that would give "the kids" the greatest variety of visual treats through the glass windows, as well as a splendid meal. This was my report to Lyle following the meal last week: "I wanted to send my thanks for hosting my nephews and niece at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant last week. "They loved it ! "They had looked at the menu ahead of time and Tom and Kim were excited because it was so unique and offered such culinary adventure. Paul, who is older and less adventuresome with food, initially feared there was nothing on the menu he could eat (because nothing looked familiar -- he's had only "steak-house food" experiences. As he says, "I'm a meat and potatoes man.)" "He eventually order the halibut and a napoleon -- and loved it! Really, how can you not like good food imaginatively and impeccably prepared. He is proud he ate every morsel, and enjoyed it immensely. You provided him a unique moment in his limited experience with fine cuisine. "Tom and Kim, considerably more familiar with a wide range of food and food preparation and presentation, were more at ease with the menu. If they could afford it, they would seek out this class of cuisine often and would love it. (They did take a photo of every dish to send to their Aunt Kathy (me). "The whole evening was more than they had hoped. The seating was perfect, the wait staff were kind and attentive, the food was splendid beyond expectation, they loved the sunset and the onset of Las Vegas lights at night. And when the wind-restricted Bellagio fountains finally came on during their dessert, they were in heaven. "Thank you for stopping by their table. They were surprised and pleased, and you made them feel quite special. "I thought Kim gave the most astute compliment. She told me "I put myself through college as a waitress. I know what it takes and how hard it is to bring everything together and to create a perfect dining experience. This was perfection." "Thank you, Lyle! Kathleen McElroy

doc.title: Wonderful Experience
doc.review: My husband and I came here for our one year anniversary, and it was absolutely wonderful. From the moment we arrived, the staff was helpful. They even spent some time with us, helping us with our wine choices because we had recently turned 21. They sat us at windows facing the Bellagio fountains, and we got to see the sunset and the fountain show from up high. The food was wonderful too - I got the Surf and Turf meal, and it was delicious!

doc.title: WOW! Perfect! A must eat!
doc.review: I ca't write enough wonderful things about our experience here last Saturday. From the minute we arrived all the staff was courteous and friendly and we were treated like royalty. The waiters were not over stressed by too many tables and could really focus on us, a great advantage compared to other places. Our entire meal was so incredible I cannot wait to go back! It will be one of my first stops on my (many)future trips I know I will take to Vegas. Also, the manager was so friendly and courteous and stopped by our table to chat which was nice also. Loved it!

doc.title: Good food, good service, nice view, expensive
doc.review: Our meal for two cost cost just over $200 (steaks, one wine, two beers, good tip). The food and service were both very good. The waiters appear to have a small area to cover and are very attentive. The atmosphere in restaurant itself is very nice. The view, watching the lights on the strip come on at dusk was also very nice. It was nice to experience once. (I've used the word "nice" here several times - as opposed to "wonderful" or "great". I guess that sums up my overall experience). In the interest of full disclosure (and for the other guys out there), I would guess that my wife was more impressed and would probably give them a higher rating than I have.

doc.title: A room with a view.
doc.review: We had lunch at this restaurant. We had a great view of Bellagio fountains and some of the strip. The elevator door opened into the kitchen of the restaurant and we were offered a cheese pastry..very tasty. The waiter was excellent and the food looked and tasted very good. The cheese rolls were great.I recommend this for a special lunch.

doc.title: Romantic splurge
doc.review: This restaurant is perfect for a romantic dinner. The view is incredible and the service is first class. It IS very expensive so you’ll definitely want to make sure to budget for it. We spent $200 on dinner (pre-tip) with no alcoholic beverages. They will also take a photo of you in front of the Paris balloon for $24 (photo is 5x7). With so many fine dining choices in Las Vegas, I don’t know if I would eat here again. But the food and service were great and I think everyone should try it at least once. The restaurant does offer a lower priced lunch menu as well.

doc.title: expensive, but good for the view and atmosphere
doc.review: A good view of the strip, and a nice place to eat for a treat, romantic or business.Food was of excellent quality, service too, but the wine was extortionate, which spoilt it a little bit.The short rib fell apart, and the lamb was perfection. Dont be fooled into thinking they will be small portions, as we had two courses, and could not eat anything else for dessert.

doc.title: Frequent traveler's top 5 favorite restaurant
doc.review: Pretty much my sole entertainment when traveling almost every week is fine dining. I measure not only the obvious things apparent to a standard diner, but the subtle things that turn a fine restaurant into an outstanding experience. For this alone the Eiffel Tower restaurant would earn this review. The food is excellent, always well prepared with presentation to match. However there is more, the VIEW. If you ask for a window seat, you overlook Las Vegas blvd, and directly across the street are the Bellagio fountains. Not at the street level view, but from 4 stories up. The location is just far enough away to see the entire panorama in one view. On special occasions you can ask for the corner table and then it turns spectacular. Some might see the price and say it is too much, but they miss the point that this is entertainment with some of the best dishes you will find anywhere. When you get off the elevator the kitchen is right in front of you for full viewing. Only a very self assured Chef would do this, and he has every reason to be so confident. It has been my experience that service is a reflection of the manager's values. Lyle, the manager, visits every table and is constantly monitoring for quality. Management by walking around is the best kind and he verifies that the service is subtle and timely, something very difficult to achieve. No I don't own stock, they earned this review.Richard Oertlerichard_oertle @hotmail.com

doc.title: Most enjoyable
doc.review: I wanted to have a great dinner for my beautiful wife and something to remember when in vegas...We came for the ACM awards show, but ended up raving about the dinner here more than that show even when we got home! Thank you guy's so much for treating us like we were a king and queen, we will certainly be back to eat every time we come to vegas...and don't forget the wine list and somellier was spectacular..especially since there was wine from Walla Walla!!...Loved every bit of...thanks to all of you!...Great Job and Cheers!!!Jeremy PettyWalla Walla,Washington

doc.title: Amazing Lunch value
doc.review: Many of the reviews for this restaurant talk about dinner. But the best value in town is the amazing lunch. Two of us were lucky to get a view table - best view in Vegas. The Bellagio fountains were going and the service was impeccable. The coffee is excellent and the refills kept coming. I chose the chop chop chicken salad and it was very light tasting yet filling. This will be a must stop on every future Vegas trip. Much better value and choices on the lunch menu than dinner but the same great view!

doc.title: Excellent food, romantic dinner
doc.review: We were in Vegas for my boyfriend's birthday so I made reservations here for the night of his birthday. The food was amazing. We must have ordered the right things off the menu. The service was very good. The waiter even brought my boyfriend a free dessert complete with "happy birthday" written in chocolate on the plate. I had requested a table by the windows overlooking the Bellagio fountain which beautiful. We even paid the extra money to buy the picture they took of us at our table with the Paris balloon and Bellagio sign in the window background. It was a very delicious and romantic dinner.

doc.title: Great experience, very expensive
doc.review: We had a great night out at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. We thought we'd splurge and have a fancy night out. The food was delicious, the waiters were slightly pretentious, but I guess it was part of the atmosphere? The atmosphere was great, we had a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. I do think our experience would have been better if we had been seated next to a window (we were in the middle of the restaurant). Over all I think it was a great experience, but it was very expensive.

doc.title: I expected the prices for food, not the wine
doc.review: Dined with three others. On the plus side, great view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. Freshly prepared and beautifully plated and presented French dishes. Only the freshest and most tasty items were served.The minuses. Our table overlooked the roofing job partially completed to the north, including the Porta-Johns. The least expensive glass of wine was $42.00. I opted for another beverage as my company was not picking up the tab. In closing, it was well worth the experience for the food which was reasonable for quality and quantity. Service and staff were impeccable and gracious.

doc.title: Most Romantic Anniversary Dinner EVER!
doc.review: My husband surprised me with dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant while in Las Vegas celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. There aren't enough wonderful adjectives to describe the experience! The setting is so romantic! We had a beautiful window table facing the fountain show at the Bellagio and the greater Strip view. On our table were the most beautiful roses and rose petals and fabulous red Eiffel Tower plates. The service was extraordinary and we did not want for a thing! The blue cheese souffle starter was amazing, as was our entire meal! We also appreciated the expertise of the restaurant's sommelier who assisted us in selecting the perfect bottle of wine to accompany our meal. We had pre-ordered a caramel souffle to share for dessert and while I went to the ladies's room, apparently the manager came over and apologized to my husband for the delay and provided the souffle and a delicious sorbet selection to us complimentary! Honestly we were enjoying ourselves so much, we hadn't even noticed the dessert was late! That is the kind of attention and service you can expect at this fine restaurant. It is worth every penny! We will make this a regular part of our Las Vegas itinerary from now on! Go and have the best dining experience!

doc.title: Breathtaking View
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was one of the best places we have ever eaten. We had a table at the windows in the corner and watched the fountains at the Bellagio directly across the street come up at night, plus had a panaromic view of the Strip with all its lights. The service was first class, food wonderful and great ambiance. We wanted to dine at a romantic restaurant at our stay this time in Las Vegas and this was perfect. Highly recommend even though its pricey, but so many places are now on the Strip, but this view is worth it.

doc.title: Good french restaurant in Vegas
doc.review: We arrived there dressed very casual... We have been looked from up to down and after 5 seconds hesitation, the lady let us go! She should have been more discret. We had to waited 10 minutes without any reservation on a friday night.Inside the restaurant the stafft is attentive and gives excellent advice. The food is very good, french style, but american portions!The drinks are expensive and not at the expected level, except the good french Champagne (can't remember which one it was, but there is only one by the glass).The view is AWESOME! We were seated at the window and had the chance to have the view on the Bellagio show! I will go again there for a romantic dinner in Las vegas.

doc.title: Dinner in Paris Paris
doc.review: I went on my own for dinner at the Paris Paris Eiffel tower restaurant. I arrived at 10 PM and get a nice table facing the Bellagio. Just for the view the restaurant worth it.I took a classical new york strip steak. It's was ok. I can not say that the food was exceptional but the view was... so all in all it's a good choice.I didn't try the dessert but they seems to have very nice soufflet.

doc.title: Perfect Anniversary Dinner!!!
doc.review: We made reservations before we arrived in vegas. My husand told them it was our anniversary. They had rose petals sprinkled on the table along with a dozen roses waiting for me. Very romantic atmosphere. Beautiful view overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. All of the food was very good. We had Cauliflour Mousse, Scallops for the appetizer. My husband had the Sea Bass and I had the Veal Medallions. They brought us a complimentary dessert for our anniversary. This is definetely an anniversary to remember. On the pricier side but well worth the expense.

doc.title: Romantic in Vegas? Eiffel Tower Restaurant helped me pull it off
doc.review: I went to Vegas with my girlfriend at the time (more on that later) with the intention of proposing. I didn't want to do it in a public place like the restaurant (though others might like this idea very much), but wanted to have a fantastic meal before we did.When I called to make the reservation several weeks in advance, I mentioned my intentions to the hostess and requested a window seat. While one could not be guaranteed for me, they did say that they would put rose petals down and see what they could do.When we arrived, we asked again for a window seat and were told it would be a few minutes (we were early for our reservation). It was well worth the wait, as we ended up with the best table possible in the house. It was right on the corner, overlooking the bellagio fountains. We saw several shows and were completely enamored with the sight.The food was excellent as well, though on the expensive side as you would expect in Vegas. I had the beef wellington which was one of the best I've ever had, only topped by that served by Gibbys in Old Montreal. Service was also outstanding, our waiter was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. Food arrived quickly as well. After the dinner, we returned to our suite and I proposed - she said yes! Will definitely always remember our dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

doc.title: Wonderful from the moment we sat down.
doc.review: My boyfriend flew me from Houston to visit him for the weekend. We topped off our last night together at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We had a table for 2 with a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. The meals were costly but delicious. I had the Fricasse of Escargot...Sweet Breads...Fennel...Farm Raised Poached Egg...Pinot Noir Jus. for an appetizer. The main entree was a Char Broiled Filet mignon with the Bearnaise Sauce. The accompaniment was a small plate of Galette of Potato Anna. All dishes were cooked to perfection. We ordered a Chocolate Souffle to share when they took our cocktail order. It was chocolate perfection. I honestly can't remember what my boyfriend ordered as this was almost a month ago but he did say it was delicious.

doc.title: Our most amazing dining experience EVER!
doc.review: I am pleased to be able to share our experiences with readers to balance the negative review I have just read. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and this was known only by the representative taking our booking as far as we knew. To our surprise we were seated at a gorgeous table in the corner of the restaurant with the most amazing view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain with red rose petals adorning our table when we were seated. The service and food was perfect. We have eaten in Paris and the French influence in the food was obvious and of high quality. I did eat the blue cheese soufflé and I am so pleased I did not read the review above before I dined as I may not have ordered it. Mine was so lovely and an appropriate size for an appetizer. The staff had impeccable timing, we never felt rushed or in need of any greater service. Our waiter had a good knowledge of the wines and listened to our likes and dislikes before recommending a wine that he felt would suit us, he was right of course and even presented us with the label from the bottle in a card as a memory of our anniversary. We were also presented with a complimentary chocolate mousse to share with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate around the plate. This is a restaurant that will give you not only gorgeous food to enjoy a culinary experience, it will also give you a wonderful evening where you are treated so beautifully and appropriately you will leave having experienced the whole package. Thank you to everyone involved on our dinner for making this a wonderful event to celebrate 25 years of marriage.

doc.title: Mrs. Campbell should be proud of the sauces
doc.review: Although the setting is fabulous--the Bellagio view is facilitated by those clever semi-circular tables--and sommelier Devin Zendel was spot-on helpful, our food this night was not I think Chef's best. The "small" blue cheese souffle was the size of a small hat, stringy with cheese, and accompanied by a salty-as-the-ocean salad. The bread was hard, thick and cold, the "baguette" unlike anything I've experienced in France. The sturgeon was presented within (neither on top or below) a sauce that tasted for all the world like Campbell's Cream of Mushroom, and, more surprisingly, with McCormick French Onion Dip sprinkled on top. The fish was soggy, but who wouldn't be soggy if bathed in soup and topped with dip mix? Perhaps the fish was perfectly OK before cooking. My dinner partner's scallop appetizer was too salty, but also lightly dusted with McCormick's. The "medium-rare" lamb was OK, but the taste reminded us, somehow, of gyros. Finally, the desert souffle was beautiful, but too sweet and heavy compared to Le Cirque's (across the street), Commander's Palace, or that little all-souffle place on Rue du Mont Thabor in Paris. More like bread pudding than souffle. To sum up, it's as if the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was taken down, reassembled in Las Vegas, and run by people who were neither French nor had found the operating manual for the kitchen.

doc.title: Excellent Choice
doc.review: Recently I took a friend to dinner to celebrate a major birthday at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.. After reading some negative reviews I hesitated, but I was happy to find the negative reviews were unfounded. The wait staff was efficient and friendly, the food was delicious, and the view of the Bellagio fountains at our windowside table, as requested ,was spectacular. It was expensive, but so are all the other fine restaurants on the strip. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

doc.title: Pleasantly surprised!
doc.review: We dined at the Eiffel Tower for lunch and weren't sure what to expect in terms of the food. However, both our meals were very good! The view was amazing - we were seated at a half moon table facing the Bellagio. The service was excellent. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and we will go back in the future.

doc.title: Extremely romantic
doc.review: Great ambiance and view. Had a table right next to the glass to be able to see the Bellagio water shows. Excellent service. Food was expensive but pretty good. We had filet mignon and Beef Wellington, both on the pricier side at ~$50. Had a very nice dessert just to be able to stay longer. Make a reservation several days in advance if you want a prime time. We were able to get 6:15 or 8:30 dinner reservations the day before we wanted to go - chose 8:30.

doc.title: Wow Oh Wow
doc.review: I love the romantic feel and look of this place - dark, small and cozy. I definitely would return for the views and to try for dishes. The Blue Cheese Soufflé Pudding was heaven on earth! I enjoyed the Char Broiled Filet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce, I was able to cut it with my fork it was so tender. My husband had the Rack of Lamb and enjoyed every bite. Service was well-timed and friendly. It was my husbands birthday and they presented him with dessert on a special Happy Birthday plate. This was by far the best place I have ever been in my life.

doc.title: Incredible view and food
doc.review: When we arrived, I was initially frustrated with the view. The new big buildings block the view of the mountains. The view of the water show at the Bellagio, was an unexpected treat. The food was another surpise. I am vegetarian, and there was only one option on the menu for me. I was amazed at how good it was. There were an endless series of flavors that flowed through each bite. It was like a fine wine with an amazing complexity.We had window seats at the front corner of the room. These tables seat 2, both facing the window at a 45 degree angle. This makes for a very romantic experience. It also keeps it quiet. We lost track of time and had an excellent evening. When we left, I noticed the restaurant is rather loud everywhere else.

doc.title: Romantic venue
doc.review: Had a really nice meal here. There are lots of choices in Vegas at all different price points, but the ambiance here cannot be beat. Pretty half moon tables against windows afford a generous view of the Bellagio fountains. The noise level is a little higher than you might expect, it might be the acoustics. And the photographer circulating to hawk pictures was cheesy. But service was good and food tasty.

doc.title: A decent meal in a great setting
doc.review: We had a window table facing the famous Bellagio fountain and that made the evening. Food and wine was fine but did not rock my boat. Service was excellent. This is a good place to eat if you are celebrating. We paid around 275 dollars for a big meal for two including drinks and a rather pricy wine (there are much cheaper choices).

doc.title: Your palate will thank you
doc.review: Our dining experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas was truly an exceptional one. From the moment we walked in, we were wowed by the atmosphere and breathtaking view. We were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary and had made reservations requesting a spectacular view of the Bellagio Fountains. It was granted. Our waiter, Valentino, was exceptional in every way from recommending wine, to accomodating my husband's shellfish allergies, to main course and dessert. He made sure we knew that the table was ours for the night letting us know there was no rush in celebrating our anniversary. The supevisor, Lyle, came over to congratulate us and to thank us for sharing our special event . The food was outstanding. I had the lobster salad and Beef Wellington (mouth waters just typing it) and my husband had the New York Strip along with sides of potato au gratin and creamed spinach. The souffle was superb, another great suggestion by Valentino. My husband who is one of the pickest eaters in the world, couldn't stop thanking me for selecting the Eiffel Tower. Truly the highlight of our week-long anniversary celebration in Vegas. People talk about the price, but you absolutely get what you pay for here. A romantic evening and phenomenally palate pleasing food at the Eiffel Tower.... priceless.

doc.title: Eiffel Tower - As good as it gets for a romantic evening
doc.review: One of the best dining dining experiences we have ever had. The view of the Bellagio water fountain combined with the superior food, wine and service was magnificent. This is the place to go for a romantic evening in Vegas.When making a reservation, ask for a window table for the best view of the water fountain light show. Be sure to dine when the sun is down to get the full effect.

doc.title: Good view, good atmosphere, extensive wine list
doc.review: We ate here for my birthday. We wanted a nicer restaurant and one with a view. Because I have food allergies, we needed a place that could accommodate that. This restaurant respected and accommodated my food allergies well.The restaurant has a nice bar area set apart from the tables. We had requested a table at the window so we could see the Bellagio fountains. The restaurant met our request, but unfortunately it was a windy night and the Bellagio cancelled their fountain performances. The restaurant atmosphere was enjoyable regardless.We had a wonderful half bottle of wine. It was L'Ecole No 41, which is a cabernet sauvignon from Washington state and not like any I had tasted before. (I am not a wine coinesseur by any means though.) For food, the chef specially prepared a lobster appetizer I could eat without allergens and I simply had the roast chicken for my main meal. The chef also made me a baked potato specially given my allergies. The chicken was very good. My companion had the monkfish dish and brussel sprout side. He thought it was really good. Regretfully, we could not eat dessert because I was allergic to everything. But, the table next to us got the souffle and it looked great.The service at our table was wonderful. Attentive, but not overly so. And, the waiter took my food allergies seriously and did his best to create a nice meal for me.The food and wine was quite pricey. But, I guess you pay for the view and atmosphere as well.

doc.title: very poor service
doc.review: The waiter was so busy at lunch he barely had time to listen to our order. When he did take the order he got it so totally wrong that I didn't even get a lunch. Stay away from such overpriced terrible service unless they decide to give their waiters enough time for the paying customers or get rid of waiters who won't take the time, don't know which this was but it was apparent the moment he came to our table.

doc.title: Brilliant Food
doc.review: I booked this restaurant for our evenng meal following our wedding at the Bellagio, based on the reviews on Trip Advisor.We were not dissappointed, we had a great meal, all of us had the tasting menu. It didnt looked like much when it came out, but by the end of it we were all fit to pop!The bill was as expected which was pricey, but a good time was had by all, the service was fab! and the view of the fountains was lovely!

doc.title: Tasty and reasonable
doc.review: Lovely restaurant for leisurely lunch. View of Bellagio fountains. A little expensive but not outlandishly. Seafood salad entree, plus coffee, tax and tip came to 40 bucks. Lovely patient and helpful service.

doc.title: Great view, great service.....OK food, insanely expensive wine
doc.review: If you're looking for an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains and the surrounding Vegas strip, this is the place! This restaurant is inside the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Casino. Ambiance and service was top-notch.As for the actual food / wine, we were given the wine list and 98% of the wines were over $100 a bottle. I was hard-pressed to find a wine between $50 and $80. I ordered a new appetizer for the restaurant (escargot, sweet breads, and poached egg); an interesting combination, but very poorly executed by the chef. I'll leave out the details, but having had escargot and sweet breads in other top-end restaurants, this was the very poorly done for a high-end restaurant. My friend had the scallops and although they were cooked well, they tasted bland. It needs a better sauce to spice it up a little. The manager did remove my appetizer from the bill and the waiter was very apologetic. For my entree I had the lamb dish, which was good, but I've had better. My friend had the Fillet Mignon, which was also good. We skipped dessert. Bill came to $230 for two people! Definitely not worth it. If you want to enjoy the view, have a drink at the bar.

doc.title: Pricey
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower for a birthday dinner, 14 ladies. We knew the food would be pricey and it was. The food was good but not really outstanding. The service was very good. The view from my room was better than the view we had from our table. Because the tables are jammed together, it is very noisey so if you have alot of people eating together, you cannot hear one another. Beware that they do not give separate checks. For 14 people at a table this is a nightmare. They basically brought the check and said "have at it". The waiter offered no help in sorting out who owed what. This situation is never good and made what would have been at least a pleasant birthday dinner end on a bad note. For the money you pay to eat here the least they could do is separate the check. Because of this alone, I would not eat here again. I am sure you can get good food at a better price somewhere else. I think that they wanted to see a group women wrestle over the check. I am suprised that they didn't have a mud ring in the middle of the restaurant for the entertainment!

doc.title: A bit pricey, but still fantastic!
doc.review: My partner took me here for a romantic dinner, after our dinner plans for my birthday the year before went to pot, he planned and booked everything in advance. When we arrived, there was a bunch of roses waiting for me on the table, and we were seated by the window so we could watch the bellagio fountains. I had some fantastic cocktails, accompanied by my Vennison main, it was the first time i tried vennison and it did not dissapoint. after dinner they took a romantic picture of us infront of the balloon, i know all these extras bumped our bill up, and were optional, but they made the experience. I forgot to say they brought me out a chocolate cake for pudding, with "happy birthday" written on it10/10

doc.title: Amazing Experience !
doc.review: Prior to our vacation to Las Vegas I did some research on restaurants in Las Vegas, I wanted to find a restaurant with a romantic setting, great views and superb food. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was my choice and I was so happy it was. From the moment we got on the elevator we were impressed, the elevator opens up basically in front of the kitchen staff, the kitchen is very impressive and so clean. As you walk past the kitchen you enter the dining room, the atmosphere was very charming and romantic. Our table was ready as I made the reservation a couple weeks before. I had requested a window seat with a view of the bellagio fountains, and that is exactly what we had ! Amazinf view of the Las vegas strip as well, we just sat and enjoyed this whole experience for some time. Our waiter was excellent, we did not feel rushed in any way, we relaxed with a drink as we looked through the menu, there are many choices, but we decided on the tasting menu. Each course was excellent and came in a timely fashion, our waiter even asked if we wanted to take a break between courses to relax, so in no way were they trying to turn tables fast like some of the reviews I have read on here, we could of stayed all nite and we almost did. The Tasting menu gives you many different types of foods that you would otherwise not have the opportunity to try had you order just one entree, it is a bit on the pricey side, but what do you expect when you dine at an establishment of this caliber. From a delicate mushroom appetizer to Beef Tenderloin medallions, Sea bass was one of the entrees, i am sure a fish lover would enjoy this, we are not as it was a bit to fishy for our tastes, to end it though the desert that was so amazing ! The portions are of good size and with the tasting menu be prepared for alot of food. I am not a wine drinker, but my wife enjoyed a high end red wine which she loved, mind you at 22.00 a glass. The heineken was cold, and at 6.00 it was comparable to anywhere else in vegas. We were so happy we decided on going to the Eiffel tower, yes it is very expensive, roughly 100 per person for the tasting menu, plus drinks, but we would not hesitate to return as it is one of our favorite memories of our recent Vegas vacation !

doc.title: Nice place to eat, surpisingly good
doc.review: We had a birthday celebration at this restaurant and they cleared a private area for everyone fitting in about 18 people. The menu was a fixed course but it had a choice for everyone and all the food was fantastic. I had the filet which cooking that many for that many people would seem like a problem but everyone's came out perfect. The staff were great and super accommodating for everything and of course as said the food was top notch. I think the food was better then most had in the real Paris.

doc.title: Best food and best view on the Strip
doc.review: A wonderful meal for my 40th birthday! We went in the evning to catch the Bellagio fountians after dark - what a view!The food was superb, the service was excellent and the price wasnt cheap - but not ridiculous either.We went on to see Cher at Ceasars Palace and the staff were very consious we had a show to go to, so the service was at the right pace to get us out on time, without feeling hurried.

doc.title: Excellent, not the expected tourist trap
doc.review: I booked this restaurant for my wife's birthday, and largely because my first choice, Alex, was not open on that day. I was a bit reluctant to book it because I thought it might be like the real Eiffel Tower restaurant, Jules Verne, used to be; decent, but far over priced due to its setting.I was very pleasantly surprised. The setting is indeed quite spectacular, and we had a table right at the window over looking the Bellagio fountains. So, point one for sitting us there without having to ask (when I made the reservation, I told them it was my wife's birthday). The view at night is stunning when the water show is happening or when it isn't.Overall, the food was excellent and in a few cases, amazing--what you would nearly demand from a restaurant in this price range. Any restaurant in this price range needs to have some items in the spectacular range. Here, the bleu cheese souffle fit that bill as well as the pheasant breast. All items were very high quality. Though bleu cheese souffle sounds a bit odd, I can promise you it is not quite what you might think and out of this world.Service was great through out. The kind of service that does not intrude, makes things happen and lets you concentrate on your dinner partner, the food and the setting.Yes, the price is expensive--likely $250 to $400 per couple realistically--but they deliver, and do not just rely on the location and setting.Not the top in Las Vegas, but very solid.

doc.title: Expensive, but a great experience
doc.review: Was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, especially about leaving hungry. Not a chance! Food was excellent. Portions were large, especially the sides which could easily feed 2. I had the rack of lamb. Superb (and very good sized). My wife had the sea bass. Also excellent. Potatoes au gratin were very good. Creamed spinach was unbelievable. Bread was great. Service was very attentive but appropriate. The view of the Bellagio fountains was fantastic (duh). Wine was overpriced but in sum, this is a great place for a special meal.

doc.title: Nice View, Decent Food, So-So Service
doc.review: Went for lunch because my son HAD to eat in the Eiffel Tower, and the dinner prices were out of our league. The hostess was lovely and seated us with a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains. Unfortunately the waiter was not so lovely - service was slow and inattentive, almost as if he was annoyed to have to bother with us. Food was fine. We had finger sandwiches and an interesting crab sandwich that was baked in french toast like a Monte Cristo. Would have tried dessert, but the service was so slow I couldn't bear to sit and wait anymore, so we left. It was an experience, but I won't be going there again.

doc.title: The Absolute Best Dining Experience Of My Lifetime
doc.review: We were seated immediately at a window table with a spectacular view of the water show at the Bellagio across the street. Our waiter listened to our tastes in wine and made a perfect recommendation. We chose the tasting menu and every course was delicious beyond belief. Food, service and ambiance all exceeded expectations. I can't think of a single thing that could have been handled differently that would have made the experience more pleasant. We will definitely be coming back.

doc.title: Possibly the best meal I've ever had......
doc.review: The restaurant is fabulous, try and get a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains the view is amazing. Our waiter, Joshua, showed us to our table and was polite and attentive without being overbearing. The menu is excellent, a good choice but not to much to have you changing your mind every 10 seconds. Between us we had scallops, veal, filet mignon, souffle and apple strudel. The food was outstanding, beautifully cooked and presented, probably the best steak I've ever had. The wine list is quite comprehensive although beware, the prices are steep (a half bottle was £46). Remember though if this is a special meal it's well worth pushing the boat out as you will not regret eating here. Getting a window table may be easier if it's someones birthday (if you get my drift).

doc.title: Paying for the bellogio view that's all
doc.review: I'm used to fine dinning regularly but this place was way over priced ($40 for a chicken breast with no sides not even rice) I usually will spend 100-150 on a dinner for two but I usually leave full and amazed at by the great food. Here I spent 200 and left hungry so if you just want the status of saying u ate ther or just a view of the fountain show then eat at this place otherwise go across the street (where u can still see the fountain)

doc.title: Fabulous View and Great Food.
doc.review: We arrived about an hour early so we checked in (we had a reservation for 7:30) and sat at the bar and had a drink. We were seated in about 20 minutes which was great.Atmosphere: The restaurant is gorgeous. We had once of the best seats in the house. It was a table for two that was seated at the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. It was fantastic. Very Romantic.Food: Very very good. We didn’t stuff ourselves as we had to sit through a show after (nothing worse than being full and sleepy!) I ordered the Surf and Turf which was a tenderloin cooked perfectly with a topping of crab. It was drizzled in mustard sauce which was excellent. I think it was the best I ate the whole trip. I ordered a side of Galette Potato Anna which is sliced roasted potatoes which were good. My Partner orders the Sea Bass. He said it was good, but my steak was better. As it was my Birthday they brought me out a plate with chocolate decoration and Sorbet (I can’t eat cream) which was awesome. Service: The service was excellent. Never had to wait for anything. All questions were answered and they made sure that they asked about allergies and if it was a special occasion, etc.All in all. A great meal. I would recommend.

doc.title: Fabulous hotel and great for a special after wedding meal
doc.review: We had searched the web sites for a place for a meal after our wedding at the little church of the west. Selected the Eiffel tower and it was wow. Erica was extremely helpful in organising the meal and accommodating all our varied requirements. The setting was stunning and the food the nicest of all the hotels we tried in Vegas. Highly recommended

doc.title: Outstanding
doc.review: We had the pleasure of eating at the Effel Tower Restaurant on a Saturday evening. The view was fantastic and the staff did a wonderful job. I felt that considering the venue the menu was a good value.

doc.title: Perfect for a nice romantic dinner
doc.review: My husband and I went to this restaurant for a lovely romantic dinner. It was my husband's first time in Vegas, and for myself I had always wanted to try the restaurant. We went in Oct 2010. This was our big dinner out for the trip. We had reservations for 5pm. Since they open at 5pm for dinner, we pretty much had a choice of tables to sit. We sat at one of the tables for 2 right along the windows facing the strip. It was so magnificent!! Especially when the Bellagio fountains danced and when the sun went down and the lights of the strip came on. Our entrees were amazingly delicious!! My husband had the beef wellington and I had the rack of lamb. Savory with each and every bite. Our waiter was Mike and he was hands down the best waiter we had the entire trip. Extremely attentive with excellent recommendations on wine and side dishes. He even took a nice picture of us with the Paris balloon outside behind us. Yes, the meal was expensive!! But we got what we paid for, and it was perfect for that special dinner. The ambience was so romantic. I am still remembering that lamb.......... STILL!

doc.title: Great Lunch and even better view
doc.review: Enjoyed a 12:30 lunch at Eiffel Tower Resturant and had a great experience. All of food was great and the customer service was top notch. Our view was overlooking the Ballagio fountains and it was amazing. The fountains do not start running until later in the day, however, if you are there during that time period it would be a great place to watch the fountain show. Will return again on my next trip.

doc.title: Great Food, Great View, so busy....
doc.review: As with any wonderful place there's the good and the not so good. The food at the Eiffel Tower was very good. We had the pate and it was wonderful and luxurious. Two in our group had the Crusted Salmon and it was outstanding! I had Sea Bass and it also was wonderful. We shared the chocolate plate with a variety of small chocolate desserts and we all enjoyed it. Unfortunately, we were unable to sit at the window, but we enjoyed the view none the less. The only complaint was, due to it's popularity it was a little like being at Disney World.....nonstop motion. We were seated a little further than center of the restaurant and between the waiters rushing around and people being seated, it was not as pleasant as it could have been. The other concern was our waiter's reaction to my gluten issues. I had emailed the restaurant in advance and was told that there was no problem. The waiters are informed and can recommend GF items and they also know which items can be modified. Our waiter didn't want to be bothered. His comment was that almost everything has gluten. When I asked about two specific items he said yes they are gf. I hate to make an issue in a restaurant and I know that most restaurant food has gluten. But nowadays, even the simplest restaurants can accomodate gluten issues if they are willing. I would expect The Eiffel Tower restaurant to be at least as accomodating as any other restaurant and that wasn't the case.Overall, we enjoyed the food and view, but once is probably enough.

doc.title: Great but Expensive Meal
doc.review: We went here to celebrate my birthday and retirement. As a special occasion restaurant it can't be beat. We were seated as requested in our reservation at a table with a view of the foundations across the street. Also, we at the north end of the restaurant away from several large parties so it was quiet and intimate. Service was fantastic and the whole evening was very nicely paced. Food was great, I haven't had a beef wellington as good in years. My wife's veal was excellent as well. The wine list is long but very expensive but there are some decent values by their standards to be found in the wines listed from WA or OR. So if you are celebrating a special event and you cost is not an problem then this is the place for you. We both said we would love to go back sometime but it will have to be something very special we are celebrating.

doc.title: Excellent but Expensive
doc.review: We started off with a Kir Royale, which was excellent. For appetizer we had the blue cheese souffle pudding which was incredible. Light and delicious, on a small salad with walnuts and pecans. Our entree was a sizable portion of perfectly cooked, lightly crusted, roasted salmon in a pinot noir sauce, accompanied by a side order of nicely prepared creamed spinach. (One portion is enough for two.) The 2008 King Estate Pinot Noir we ordered was a perfect match to our dinner. The wine list is extensive, but reflects high markups. Unfortunately we were unable to order dessert because were already satiated. If you go request a table overlooking the Bellagio for a great view of its fountains.

doc.title: Outstanding
doc.review: Service is excellent; view of the Bellagio Fountains is fantastic; food iss brilliant; wine menu is extensive. All in all, this is an expensive dinning experience, but very well worth it! Off the menu I suggest:1. Black Pepper Marinated Raw Beef, Mustard Aïoli, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Parmesan2. Herb Crusted Lake Superior Whitefish, Flageolet Beans, Riesling Herb BrothYum!

doc.title: Amazing Views and Food
doc.review: On a recent trip to Vegas to celebrate my partners birthday we had the pleasure of eating at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, with views over looking the Bellagio fountains, great food and great service I could not fault the experience and would be happy to recommend the venue to anyone looking for somewhere special to spend an evening.

doc.title: great romantic spot easy on the pocket and wonderful
doc.review: Not the best value out there but amazing foods and amazing service defo one of the best out there sat in a lovly corner nice and private had a totally awesome time really enjoyed the hospitality...Thanks

doc.title: Not Worth it - OK food and poor service
doc.review: My husband and I ate dinner at this restaurant a few months ago when we were in Las Vegas and were very disappointed. Although it has good overall ratings on tripadvisor, we did not have a good meal experience.One positive note was the view. I have to give the restaurant credit for having a nice atmosphere and great view. However, although we had reservations and there were many empty tables, we were told we could not have a window seat. We had a nice view, but not nearly as nice as if we'd been seated at the window. When we were finished with our dinner, there were still empty seats by the window that had been empty when we arrived. Therefore, It was puzzling that we were refused a window seat.The food was decent, but not great. This might have been alright, if it wasn't so expensive. I had Filet Mignon which, although it was very tender, was quite bland. It had so little flavor that it seemed a waste of such a tender piece of meat. My husband had a steak which also just had an okay flavor.For us, the worst part of our meal was the service. Our waiter was not rude, but provided service that was slow and indifferent. Our water and iced tea glasses were often left empty. It seemed like our waiter would disappear for periods of time so twice we had to ask other waiters for help. Our waiter didn't seem to care when we indicated we were not happy with our steaks.We left this restaurant very disappointed. Based on other's reviews, we had planned to eat here as the highlight of our meals in Las Vegas during this visit. It was the most expensive restaurant we ate at during our trip, yet it was the least enjoyable meal experience. So for us, this restaurant was definitely not worth it.To give Paris it's due, we did eat at Mon Ami Gabi and enjoyed it very much. I'd just suggest heading there instead of the Eiffel Tower.

doc.title: just go!
doc.review: We had the best night ever here. I emailed them before we went with a few requests all of which were seen to. The staff were top drawer, the view of the fountains amazing and the food exquisite. It is expensive but it is an experience.

doc.title: Exceptional!
doc.review: Okay, it's not as "hoity-toity" as some of the five-star and five-diamond places on the strip, but I'll tell you something. The food and service are excellent. The view is superb (you can watch the water show across the street at Bellagio from the window tables). The prices are less than half of what you'd pay at one of the snootier places, and it would not be as good as it was at Eiffel Tower. We had a great time, and the food was hearty and tasty. The service was not as impeccable as at the shi-shi places (you didn't have five people hovering over your every whim), but it was nearly perfect, and we had a much better time than at Joel Robuchon. The drinks were better. The food was better. The view and surroundings were better. We just had a much better overall enjoyment. We ate a lot more food, and the bill was half what it was at the other place. I'll let the photos speak for themselves.

doc.title: The best meal I've EVER had !
doc.review: Just returned from a 3 night trip to Las Vegas and I had to write this review about the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris Hotel. You have to take a private express elevator which simulates going through the Eiffel Tower and when the elevator doors open, you step into the kitchen of the restaurant. Very cool! The bar is very modern and sleek and the view is SPECTACULAR! Try to get a table near the window so that you can see the Bellagio Hotel's fountain show. Our waiter was very informative and recommended several dishes to us which were outstanding. I had the Autumn Salad (which I'm trying to replicate at home), the Baked Cod and Pistachio Souffle for dessert. Everyone in our party claimed that their meal was the best ever! Highly recommend to anyone traveling to Vegas...

doc.title: WOW - Eiffel Tower at Paris Las Vegas
doc.review: Recently spent several days with my husband in Las Vegas, and our one big splurge was dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. It was an evening dinner and the sight was magnificant with all the strip lit up. The food was very good, but beware it is very expensive. Two cocktails at the bar, were $22 before tip. Steaks for two with potatoes and a vegetable for one ,including dessert for two was $190. We did not have any additional drinks or appetizers. I will say the portions are very large, and can easily be split. It is a wonderful experience, and even if you do it only once for the memory, well worth it.

doc.title: Fantastique!
doc.review: I have had the luxury of dining here on 4 occasions. Every occasion has been above par with great service, food, views and drinks. If you are looking for an elegant, out of this world experience, an extensive wine list, a versatile menu, servers that know what they are talking about and will cater to your every need then look no further.The Creme Brulee is magnificent! Merci Bien Paris for a wonderful experience!

doc.title: Expensive and a bit rushed
doc.review: This is an in demand spot that requires a reservation. If you want a good table you have to be 2 people and ask for the tables with a view. It is a cool place and worth trying. A few things...wine list is extensive and pricey. Food portions are large...I found the service rushes..it was obvious they were trying to get in as many turns as possible...if you want a leisurely dinner with your honey...go someplace else...

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: I had a wonderful meal at the eiffel tower restaurant. Me and my girlfriend went on our anniversary and were given fantastic seats. The place was very busy when we went however the service was still very good. The food was excellent, I really enjoyed the duck. Next time I plan to try the tasting menu. Very large wine selection.

doc.title: A perfect night out - perfect food, service and atmosphere - excellent!
doc.review: This was a marvellous restaurant for dinner.
