The chef here is from the Alsace region of France and tends to lean towards what we call 'proper' French food. :-) i.e. Lots of perfectly cooked meat and lovely heavy rich French sauces. The food was superb. My husband had the blue cheese souffle - to die for. I had steak with a red wine reduction sauce. Yes, a bit boring but I felt like it and I have my steak well done, but it was the most tender steak I've had in a while. Also the sauce was excellent, and the sauce that came with my husbands dish even better - a pinot reduction. OMG. We finished with a PROPER souffle each. Light as air and puffy - very delicate and delicious. We didn't come away feeling ill but nicely comfortable. The service was second to none - you don't find service like that very often. Friendly server, knowlegable, accomodating, relaxing and superb skills. Beautiful service. We got a lovely table that looked right over to Bellagio and the fountains, so they played all night. Also they have a fabulous singer there called Sarah who sounds like Norah Jones and suited the restaurant perfectly. I usually hate that sort of thing, but it added to the evening. I can't rate this highly enough. It was a brilliant experience and worth getting the premier tickets for the Eiffel Tower lift after your meal and going to see Vegas at night - excellent. We would highly recommend this restaurant.

doc.title: best in Vegas
doc.review: Just returned from 4 nights in Las Vegas and have to say, most Vegas restaurants are a little overrated, however Eiffel Tower is the "REAL DEAL". The view is the best Las Vegas has to offer, I was very pleased with the prices and selections of wine offered. The Lamb, smoked salmon and and foie gras were really perfectly executed, and the souffles were a perfect ending. The menu has something for everyone and not over the top. Truelly recommend.

doc.title: Best meal in Vegas
doc.review: If you want one "special meal" during your Vegas vacation this is the place to go. You probably need to book but it is well worth doing. The food is quite simply fantastic with service to match. If you have a view of Bellagio fountains, as we did, it makes the evening even more special. Can't wait for our next Vegas trip to visit here again.

doc.title: Fabuloute Experience!
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for essentially a post-wedding dinner with a couple friends and my new husband.The wait staff was superb, the food was delicious, they even brought us a few extras for being there on our wedding day.All in all, I'd highly recommend the place.The only 'con' was that we were told you could see the Bellagio fountains from 'anywhere in the restaurant' which was technically true, but the view wasn't very good unless you were close to the windows.

doc.title: Excellent
doc.review: We celebrated our 30 th anniversary. it was worth every penny. great view and wonderful service. great spot for a special occasion.

doc.title: Very nice
doc.review: This review probably won't add much to what other reviewers have already said, but I thought I should share anyway. I also wanted to give people an idea of the prices before you go there.It is very expensive, and to be honest I'm not sure if the price reflects the quality of the food. I just found the food to be ok, nothing special.I proposed to my girlfriend in the restaurant and had requested a table with a good view of the Bellagio fountains. When we arrived we were given a table which was facing the south of the strip, with a slight view of the fountains. Having said that they did say they would give us the next available table if we wanted to wait.If you order steak (for $50) you just get steak! Nothing extra. And there is ONE vegetarian main on the menu, although you could have a selection of starters as a main.Cocktails start at $18-20 each.When I tried to book the table for the engagement they tried to sell me a ridiculously overpriced package starting at $500, where you have a standard meal but they just chuck in a few roses and a trip to see the top of the tower! If you are planning to propose I really wouldn't recommend paying for this package!I'll end on a good note... our waiter Pierre was superb. He was funny and so helpful. I was planning the standard engagement ring in the champagne glass proposal, but Pierre got us a special (free) cake with a sugary "cage" over the ring.So I would say it's a nice restaurant, but I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever been to. Perhaps one of the Bellagio restaurants or Tao at the Venetian might be nicer.

doc.title: Excellent food and view!
doc.review: Great food and great service at this restaurant! I had the rack of lamb and my wife had the veal medallions and both were wonderful. We had a window table on the North side of the restaurant with a great view of the strip. We have nothing but very positive things to say about this restaurant in all respects and yes, it is expensive so be forewarned.

doc.title: Good but not great!
doc.review: My boyfriend and I like to partake in a nice dinner almost everywhere we travel and occassionally at home. We are no strangers to elegant meals. While the food was great, the service was lacking. I booked well in advance and requested a window table overlooking the fountains since we were celebrated my boyfriends birthday. The table we were escorted to was in the corner with more of a view of Bally's than that Bellagio which was disappointing. After dinner we were too full for dessert (which almost never happens), our wine was done and the table was cleared. With no wine left and telling the waiter we were not partaking in dessert, it took him 30 minutes to get the bill to us. Now, had our wine not been finished, we wouldn't have minded waiting while we were sipping and conversing but the table was clear, no water, no wine, nothing. It truly made an unforgettable experience one I'd care to forget. We probably won't be returning....

doc.title: Awesome Experience and Great Food!
doc.review: We at dinner at 6:45pm this past Friday night before a 9pm show at the Venetian. At first we were seated away from the window view, but when we asked for a window view they were very nice and found one immediately. It was a busy night and there were only two reservations available when we booked the previous evening. Be sure to book a reservation in advance and they will require a credit card to reserve.We both had terrific dishes. The menu was al a carte. We each had a cesar salad for starter. Then we had a beef filet wrapped with sauteed mushrooms inside a crust entree which was very delicious. Also had a filet mignon entree which was very delicious and well portioned. We each had a side of potatoes (each cooked different). One side for both would have been plenty. The meal with gratuity was $180.Early on we told our waiter we were kinda tight on time and he was awesome and the food was timely. We were able to make it across to the Bellagio were we stayed, changed to more relaxed clothes and made it to the Venetian for a comedy show at 9p with David Spade. Awesome restaurant with awesome view, staff and atmosphere.

doc.title: Not Cheap, So Sample First
doc.review: This is a great restaurant and an even grater experience but you will leave there without some of your retirement portfolio.So why not go have a drink at the bar before you make reservations for Dinner!!!!!!!Yes I know there is a big tuff looking man guarding the elevator that you must use to go up to the restaurant but he is really very nice. Just tell him you are going up for a glass of wine at the bar. Many people seated at the bar are waiting for tables but there are no rules. The wine will not be cheap either but you can look at the place, a menu, the view............. and decide if it is for you.We decided it was and love the place.

doc.title: Was excited and rewarded!!
doc.review: We spent our last night in Vegas in this restaurant and had a very nice evening. When the elevator doors open you are at the froint of the kitchen and walk around to the front of the restaurant. We were quickly escorted to our amazing front row seats directly in front of the Bellagio fountain show! The waiter was excellent and offered very nice tips for the menu and wine selection. We didn't find anythingon the wine list so the manager came over and asked if we wanted to try something off the menu. We selected an 07 Beaujolais and were very impressed!! When dining we tend to try degustation or tasting menus as they give us an idea of the chefs in the restaurants. This was no different 6 courses, but we were pressed for time and needed to be done in 90 minutes, the waiter assured me he has done this tasting in 45 minutes before. We were sold! The food was better than average but I wouldn't say I had to have anything on that menu again but the soup! Corn soup with clams, delicious, a 5 star item on a 3.5 star menu. Our final meat course was not spiced properly or at all for that matter. Cooked perfectly with no spice, not even salt or pepper.The dessert is my wifes favourite thing and she wanted the creme brulee but was disappointed when the top came soggy and not crusty as it should, with caramelized sugar. The waiter finally talked her into another one and it was much better.The atmosphere is impeccable, with music playing in the background and fountains displaying in front, service was first class all the way.

doc.title: Wow...great food, great service, great view
doc.review: Yes, it was expensive, but french cuisine usually is... and how often can you eat in the Eiffel Tower with a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains? Our food was excellent, and the waiter wasn't snobby like you find in some French places. There is a dress code, so guys need to bring a collared shirt, slacks, and close-toed shoes. If you want a primo table, make your reservation for 6. We got the best table in the place.

doc.title: The Best...But Most Expensive Meal Ever
doc.review: My wife and I were at the Eiffel Tower rest. on Sept 2, 2010. We had made reservations, and upon arrival we asked the hostess if we could possibly get seats overlooking the Belliago. We waited at the bar until she came and got us, and we were seated overlooking the fountains. An amazing view. Our waiter was excellent, always ensuring that our glasses were full. I ordered the pistachio souffle while my wife ordered the chocolate. As previously mentioned, you order these desserts first. They are delicious and well worth the price and I do not normally eat desserts.We ordered the lobster cake appetizer which was great. For the main course my wife ordered the sword fish and I ordered the lamb....both were amazing. Very tasty. We ordered the mushroom and spinach sides and that was good as well.For drinks we got a half bottle of red wine...but later ordered another half bottle. The wine ended up being around 100 dollars, but it was good. I believe it was the swanson merlot from napa valley.Our total bill was around 330 dollars. It was the most expensive meal I have ever had, but it was the most delicious and fulfilling. You only live once right. If you can afford it, you should definately check out this restaurant.

doc.title: Incredibly romantic!
doc.review: My husband took me to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Las Vegas last week and it was incredibly romantic! I didn't want the night to end! The food, view, and entire experience was wonderful!

doc.title: perfect food with a view to match
doc.review: My husband and I ate at this restaurant during a holiday to celebrate his 50th birthday. We booked in advance requesting a view overlooking the fountains and we were not dissapointed. The food was excellent and service was very good. Yes it is expensive but we also dined at Bartalotta at Wynn and we both thought the Eiffel Towere was much better and may be even a little cheaper than bartalotto. My husband even got a little personalised dessert so they obviously remember those little extras that make an evening special. The icing on the cake was the couple next to us getting engaged - so romantic.

doc.title: Great Food, Great View, Great Night
doc.review: My wife and I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for her birthday last October and had a great night. We sat right by the window, with a breathtaking view of the Bellagio fountains and strip below. You could not ask for a better view in Vegas! The food is expensive, but it is good, just not great. Really though you go here for the view and atmosphere more than the food, and on that note the restaurant delivers!

doc.title: Not perfect
doc.review: This place is sold as a romantic place to dine on the strip, with amazing views of the Bellagio fountains, and that's exactly why I booked a table for our last night in Vegas, for a very special occasion. What they didn't tell me was that they allowed in families who were going to be right next to you to spoil your romantic evening. We had the delights of a baby, who screamed throughout our meal, parked in a stroller the size of the Bellagio. Now we realized that they were making a heck more money out of this family than out of us- they were all on bottles of cahmpagne followed by wine- but I just wish you were told this up front. As it stood, I could have had more romance dining at Denny's, and I wouldn't have paid $360 for it. The meal itself was ok- we had the tasting menu with wines- but the service was poor, with some wines being served after the courses. I undertipped but still felt the pain of parting with a lot of money for a less than perfect evening.

doc.title: Not a tourist trap as I expected.
doc.review: Lovely restaurant with a spectacular view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. The food perfectly done and presented beautifully. There were some delectable menu choices making us take more time deciding. Great wine list.

doc.title: Meal service and view was out of this world
doc.review: We were heading to the airport and called to see if they will seat 10 people, they were great at having us, offered us Black pants to replace our shorts, and made us feel very welcome. They provided excellent service and were willing to make changes to the menu. The dinner was the best we had in a while. The service and food was out of this world..... A must visit.

doc.title: Amazing View, Terrible Food
doc.review: We went here on a special occasion and will never go back. I ordered either an organic chicken or a free ranged chicken and I threw up as well as my family. We were sick the rest of the night. The manager didn't even try to do any thing about it. The sight from the top is amazing, though. That was the best part of the whole night. The restaurant is a little pricy. I will not go back.

doc.title: Magnificant Experience
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at this hotel in 2005 so we returned for our 25th anniversary in August 2010. This restaurant can't be beat for service and food quality/presentation. The staff is fantastic and the food quality is superior. Both dining experiences were a wonderful memory and we highly recommend this restaurant for your dining pleasure. It is very expensive but well worth it!

doc.title: Absolutley divine...didn't want to meal to be over!
doc.review: This was the best restaurant I ate at while in Vegas. We sat at the window on a 2 top with sweeping views of the fountains, Eiffel Tower and LV Blvd. If you go with a larger group you do not get a window table, they are all 2 tops. When we got off the elevator, there were 2 samples waiting for us. A cheese canape and a salmon bite. We started our meal with an "amuse bouche" of pistachio souffle and cheese puffs. Wow! I had the french petite four sandwiches (lunch). Each bite was sublime. Served with homemade fingerling potato chips. If I squinted my eyes and daydreamed just bit I could imagine being at a cafe in the 6th with my loved one having a romantic date. *Sigh*

doc.title: very good food but a bit expensive especially the tomato salad
doc.review: I wanted to have a very romantic anniversary dinner with my fiance in vegas so i thought this place would be perfect. We had reservations for a Tuesday night at 8. We got seated immediately. We got a table next to the window overlooking the Bellagio fountains.We ordered a tomato salad which was one of the worst salads I ever had. It's a few sliced tomatoes with a slice of cheese. That was $18.My fiance and I got a couple of filet mignon's medium well. I had to send my back once and my fiance had to send hers back twice because it was too pink inside. The steak was delicious though. We also had some excellent potatoes au gratin.Because it was our anniversary, our server gave us some free chocolate mousse and it said "Happy Anniversary" on the plate. We also ordered a rasberry napoleon which had too much rasberries for our taste. We also had a few chocolates for free at the end of the meal.It was a very romantic environment especially with the fountains, but we wished we could have heard the music to the fountains. There was a bit too much noise from the servers with the dishes.We got a formal picture in front of the fountains and in front of the Paris balloon.I would go back but on a very special occasion. I feel that I could have gotten the same quality meal for half the price somewhere else.

doc.title: Dont waste your money there is better in Las vegas
doc.review: Booked 15 july for my 50th bithday i was so shocked at the dress code anything goes !!! my wife and i waite 30 mins to be seated and there was a gut in shorts and a guns and roses tee shirt with flipflops eating at the table beside us, wine 18 $a glass ???? had the blue cheese suofle it was ok nothing special then had the beef wellington sent it back it was inedible too much fennel overpowering did not even bother with sweet, this place stinks of b***********t the food is overpriced and just not worth it, even heard a waiter say " have to turn these tables around quick they have overbooked again!!!! they rely on people booking to see the belagio fountains while eating ( so what) it free anyway they also keep taking people up in the lift who have no reservation tell them it will only be 30 mins max and point them to the bar to wait, whilst paying for overpriced drinks, if you want good value and a good meal book the Stratosphe (top of the world) or Gaalaghers at new york new york at the end of the strip.DONT WASTE YOUR MONEYON THIS PLACE!!!!!!

doc.title: Eiffel Tower Restaurant - C'est magnifique!"
doc.review: We did not stay at the Paris Hotel, but we decided to walk through it just to check it out on the afternoon of July 4th. We noticed the reservations desk for the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and inquired as to any availability that evening for dinner as it was our anniversary. The Hostess was very pleasant and, as luck would have it, someone must have canceled so we reserved a sitting for 8:00pm! Upon our arrival, we were a tad early and they were running late on their reservations - no worries. We absorbed the view of the Vegas Strip from the lounge and relaxed with a drink. We were seated approximately 30 minutes later to a FABULOUS table at the window which overlooked the Bellagio water show and shortly thereafter Caesar's fireworks show! We couldn't have planned it better if we tried!! We had wonderful service from our server, Jorge "George" (many thanks) and the food was out of this world! My Beef Wellington was to die for! If you ever get the chance, splurge and have dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Chef and his staff did an outstanding job and I hope we come back again SOON!

doc.title: Incredible. The highlight of our honeymoon.
doc.review: This really was incredible. We still regularly talk about how great it was. I had made a booking in advance, told them it was our honeymoon, asked for a view and also ordered the red roses that they offer on the booking site. After getting a disappointing view in the Hancock Tower restaurant in Chicago I was all prepared to give the MaitreD a big tip in order to get a good table. We desperately wanted a good view of the Bellagio. We went for our meal at 7pm (on a week night in June) and i started saying to the person that it was our honeymoon and we were hoping for a good view. They said 'of course no problem' and took us to what must have been one of the best three tables in the restaurant. Incredible vista of the Bellagio and it's fountains. Tom introduced himself as our head waiter and all night we were extremely well looked after by Tom and one other waiter who was also very friendly. Then came Lyle! Lyle was the supervisor and introduced himself asking if there was anything we needed. We got chatting and he ended up giving us his business card saying if we need anything at all just let him know. Maybe he does that with everyone, i dont know and i dont care. He was great and made us feel like we were special customers. Hey if they make everyone feel like that then thats great! The meal was incredible and managed to stretch it out for over two hours to watch the fountains in daylight and night time after the sun went down. They didnt rush us or anything. It was an amazing meal and a night we will remember for a long time.

doc.title: Overpriced and we got seated 35 minutes after our reservation
doc.review: We had reservations for 9:00PM on July 4th to celebrate my sister's 40th birthday. The overall ambiance of the place is great, but the place was very warm when we got off of the elevator to get to the restaurant. We arrived 10 minutes early for our reservation. After waiting 15 minutes we were told by the hostess that the party at our table was done dining and had paid their bill, but wasn't leaving for some reason. This went on for a half hour. We wanted to watch the fireworks and had a great table reserved for the occasion but neither the hostess nor the server mentioned to the previous party that the table was spoken for. This was AFTER the previous party had gotten up to leave only to sit back down once the fireworks started. We were just about ready to leave when they finally let us have our table after the fireworks were over. Splendid. Our party of 6 was very displeased and we almost walked knowing that all we were going to hear was a weak apology after another. Our waiter then sensed we were displeased when the whole table ordered nothing but water and salads. I was not going to give them any extra business. We had the reservations for over 2 months and told them it was for a special occasion. Two people in our party got apps and 2 got dessert. My "tomato" salad was just that. One slice of tomato with some buffalo mozzarella on top with some leaves of lettuce all for the unbelievable price of $18. EIGHTEEN dollars for one slice of tomato for a tomato salad. My 2 buddies spring salads were a few leaves of lettuce with one small carrot and some oil and vinegar. These were only $15 a piece. Wendy's makes a better salad for $5. Our waiter knew we weren't going to rack up a big bill which we intended to do. We had plans for 2 bottles of bubbly and everyone was going to order one of their $45-$60 entrees. I am glad we didn't since the salads were completely unimpressive and tremendously overpriced. Our bill for 5 salads, 2 apps and 2 desserts was $183 which included the 18% tip. I would not recommend this place unless someone else is paying. I will not go back.

doc.title: Better than I was expecting
doc.review: My wife and I ate here on a trip to Vegas. We were just walking by and decided to stop for lunch. My wife had the Ocean salad and I had a steak both were very good. My wife thinks that this is the best place she ate at in Vegas. I had other meals that I liked more.The view is very nice as well.

doc.title: Amazing meal!
doc.review: Was here with associates for a conference. My boss made reservations for 5 with table along window. It was amazing view of the fountains below. All night long thru our meal, we watched the light and water show.Did have a little disappointment when the bottle of wine ordered... 2007 was delivered as a 2008. After that drama... we got back to a lovely dinner.The whole table went with the set menu... think this was about $89 each and we added the cheese course. Unbelievable value for the price! At first, with the little taste, bite size courses coming out, I thought I was going to have to make a run to Mickey D's... but then the courses kept coming and coming and by the end of the meal... We had to be rolled out... Lots of delicious food!I will be back!Keith

doc.title: Outstanding Service
doc.review: I called the restaurant after reading other rave reviews, to celebrate our 20th anniversary dinner. And I was not disappointed. My husband is vegetarian, and I wanted something special other than the usual veggie pasta that restaurants usually dish out for him. I called on the Manager early afternoon and told him our requirement. He spoke to the Executive Chef and she blew our mind away - Quinoa like we've never tasted in our lives - off the menu. And we got a table by the window overlooking the fountains and it put the romance back into our lives. It's that extra mile that made our evening truly memorable. Worth every penny spent. Thank you ever so much.The Ratnams - Oakton, VA

doc.title: Magnifique
doc.review: An exceptional venue to ask someone to marry you! We had an 8:45 dinner reservation and the restaurant placed us at the perfect table for me to propose to my girlfriend. We overlooked the Bellagio fountains and had the Paris balloon as a backdrop. The staff was more than accomodating and very, very polite. Each request I asked for was done, including the waiter taking pics to record the event. The food, although pricey, was exquisitely delicious, but to celebrate an occassion of this nature was perfect. From the prompt sitting, the no-rush atmosphere to the table setting and view, our special moment was perfect. To the staff at the restaurant, my/our sincere gratitude for making this night so special to us! Paul L and Judy G

doc.title: Exceptional Food, Service, and Atmosphere
doc.review: My wife and I had dinner for our 18th anniversary. We couldn't be more pleased with the restaurant. Make sure you dine after sunset to take full advantage of the view. Many of the reviews have state that the food is overpriced. While it is expensive, it is worth the cost for a special occasion. We will dine here again.

doc.title: A Taste of Paris in Las Vegas
doc.review: Wonderful. Delicious food. Fantatstic service. Perfect for a special occasion. Fun time. Ask for a table overlooking the strip, you will have a great view of the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: Outstanding
doc.review: My wife and recently went to Las Vegas, and having 2 kids in sports that travel for tournaments, we don't treat ourselves very often and decided to by going to dinner here. It was fantastic. The service was amazing. Our glasses of water were never empty. The service was very attentive, but almost ghost like. They were there all the time, but not intrusive. The food was also amazing. I am not a fan of lentils, but the lentil soup with hame was out of this world and has made me re-think the whole lentil thing.The view, overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains was truly awe inspiring. By far, one of the best nights and meals I have ever had.

doc.title: Bad Service ...big dissapointment
doc.review: We went for dinner after a show ,on our recent trip to Vegas.We did not have to make a reservation which suited us as we were unsure about what time our show would finsih it.We arrived at 10.30pm and were rushed through our entire meal by the wait staff .The restaurant should not have accepted our party of 5 unless they were prepared to allow us to enjoy our meal within an acceptable timeframe.The first no no for me was when the waiter corrected the pronounciation of a particular wine to my friend - I mean really ! There was absolutely no need to embarrass my friend like that ! Secondly ,after each person was finished their starter ,no sooner had someone placed their knife and fork down did the waiter take the plate from under them even though the rest of us were still eating which I found very rude.Throughtout the main course ,the waiter asked us 5 times if everything was ok which i found very annoying .We were sat at a bad table (even though we asked to be seated in a different spot ) so one of our diners had a steel frame of the tower as her view.Our table was right beside the spot where the waiters congregate and have the cuttery ,spare plates etc so during our meal as the end of night approached all we could hear was the clunking of cuttlery and alot of chat from the wait staff which was very offputting .When arranging the money for the bill ,the waiter was standing directly behind me and no sooner had I closed the envelope ,did he swoop in and grab the envelope/wallet of cash ....which was atrocious !Food was nice although very rich for my pallet .Value for money was ok but service was extremely poor and I think the overall experience was dissapointing .I would never darken their door again !

doc.title: SLOW SERVICE
doc.review: The service in this restaurant was very slow. We were seated promptly but after that, we waited 10 minutes just to get menus, and that was after we aked for them twice. Afterwards the waiter did not show to ask for drinks for another 5 minutes. We had to ask for bread to come 4 times, then the bread finally arrived about 25 minutes after we were seated. The place was very crowded, but I assume it is crowded every night so there is no excuse. The food was average. Do not order the filet mignon. You can get better piece of meat at outback steakhouse. I am only giving 2 stars because of the setting and view. Spend your money in antother restaurant.

doc.title: Beautiful views...Great service and food!!
doc.review: We went here for our anniversary dinner and It was so worth the cost. The views are awesome of the strip and the bellagio fountains. I had the surf and turf and I could literally cut the steak with my fork. My wife had the salmon and it was very good also. They even gave us a complimentary chocolate mousse since it was our anniversary. The service was second to none!! You will be very pleased with this restaurant!

doc.title: Spectacular View with Overpriced Dishes
doc.review: Having seen pictures from inside the restaurant, we knew the view would be amazing. How often do you get to watch the Bellagio water fountain show from that angle? We were mesmerized by the water fountain show and that's about it. We made reservations for 9:30PM and were seated right away at a table with a window. The menu seemed promising with the delectable descriptions. We were excited to try a variety of dishes. There was also a prefixed menu for $89 and wine pairings for an additional $69. After looking at the prefixed menu, we were more interested in trying dishes ala carte. We decided to try the New York Strip with Bone Marrow, Sauteed Swordfish, Escargot appetizer, Crispy Pommes Dauphines, and Asparagus. We also ordered of bottle of sparkling wine to go with dinner. The NY Strip was okay, but I think we could have gotten the same dish elsewhere. The Swordfish was a huge disappointment. Our Pommes Dauphines came out cold and the Asparagus were just fine. The best part of the meal was the dessert. We ordered the chocolate plate which was delicious. We should have had dessert and champagne! For $250.00 this meal was definitely a disappointment in regards to food. However the view was spectacular and the service was good. We received many recommendations from the servers which were very helpful. Would I return? Most likely not. It's not worth the money. We could have had a better meal elsewhere, but we wouldn't have had the view. Then again you can't hear the music from way up there. It was worth doing once, but that's about it.

doc.title: We went for our 25th wedding annivesary...
doc.review: We went for our 25th wedding annivesary which was very fitting seen as we spent our honeymoon in Paris France.The view over the Bellagio fountains was lovely but service over the top with what we are comfortable with. The food was okay but you are paying for the view. Would we go again no but would we recommend it for a special occasion yes certainly, but be prepared to pay big bucks.

doc.title: One place not to miss
doc.review: We ate at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on the 26th of April for our 36 wedding anniversary and could not have found a better place to eat. The staff was first rate and the food was great. I am a meat and potato's eater and was wondering how I would like the food. The steak was cooked to order and could be cut with a fork. I had arranged to the roses at the table for my when I made the reservation and every thing was perfect as were seated at our table. I have also requested a window table for the wife to watch the B - fountains and we were seated at a window table. The fountains were not operating due to the wind but the view from the table was great.

doc.title: Absolutely lovely.
doc.review: A French wine-maker friend recommended this restaurant for lunch, and my husband and I were very happy with the outcome. We had an 11 am reservation and were seated at a window table with a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains. Champagne cocktail, Bloody Mary, appies, crab "sandwich" (more like a soufle), and eggs bene were all wonderful. We were also provided a little amuse to start and lovely little puffs of herbed bread. Great service, food, and atmosphere. Absolutely lovely.

doc.title: A little over kill....
doc.review: Nice atmosphere and the food was decent but a little over the top....seemed very old fashioned and in need of a face lift.

doc.title: 5 Star, excellent food, wine and atmosphere
doc.review: After a memorable day of activities including a morning helicopter flight with a landing in the grand canyon for a champagne breakfast, the Stratosphere and shopping at Caesars Palace we decided to top the day of with a meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant with our two children. We booked ahead to ensure that they had a seat for us as we wanted to see the Bellagio fountains at sunset while we had dinner. We decided on the tasting menu (degustation) with matching wines. We opted out of the cheese platter on the waiters recommendation but did add the chocolate soufflé. The children were well accommodated. The view was fantastic and service first class. The food was unbelievable. As with everything in the US it was big. A typical degsutation in Australia will give you six small servers, however each of the 'tastings' were a meal in themselves. The wine matching was perfect and we were really looked after and made to feel very special. It toped off a great day.

doc.title: Good atmosphere and good food
doc.review: We went there a day after our wedding, and they gave us a complimentary dessert. That's very nice of them. My husband tried Wellington Beef and I tried a dish with rabbit meat. They were both interesting. And the souffle was great. We enjoyed the atmosphere too though a bit noisy. We had a good view of Bellagio fountain, and also were able to talk comfortably because it's not super quiet. The restaurant was stuffed while we were there. Good atmosphere for us.

doc.title: Great Experience
doc.review: The only thing I would recommend is to make reservations. My wife and I didn't have them, so we ended up eating at the bar, which turn out to be a great experience. The bar serive was beyond great.....I would go back there just for drinks. The food was incredible......I had the filet mignon and my wife had the rabbit. If you like French cuisine, you'll love this place.

doc.title: Served Up A Perfect Time
doc.review: Is this the best French restaurant in Vegas? Probably not. Is it a very good one, mais oui!My family and I went to this restaurant after my wife and I renewed our wedding vows. So the occaision was centered on romance and celebration. I notified reservation staff about this and they did a very good job making sure the experience was marvelous. Ambience and view are not to be rivaled on the strip. The service was attentive and skilled. The food was skillfull prepared and presented. The fois gras was excellent, the wine list superb, and the sauces on target.

doc.title: Poor value!
doc.review: We booked a table for my wifes 40th Birthday whilst in Vegas.I tried to get a table by the window weeks in advance and paid extra for petals and a rose on the table.We were met by the Maitre'd and a waitress showed us to our table... not by the window and unable to see the fountains when seated.I had a glass of wine for 17 dollars! and my wife had a Perrier water.We were given menus and some bread and butter.I ordered Seabass and my wife had the Pappilotte of black cod.When it came it was tiny portions and my wifes was in a plastic bag of which they cut off the top.We shared a small potato Dauphinoise dish. The bill for no more than the above was 132 Dollars!!We ate again the same night.

doc.title: Great View but a cold restaurant but very good food
doc.review: First let me start by saying the views are breathtaking. myself and my girlfriend went here for her birthday on the 24th of march the restayrant was very cold or it might have been we where tired from the flight from dublin. the starter of prawn and mango salad is fantatic and the fillet mignon is so tender it melts in your mouth all the staff where great and got the perfect cake for my girlfriend witch i booked 2 months before. the price is a little steep it was 280 dollers for 2 startes 2 mains the cake and 2 glaees for wine but hey it was a once in alifetime... so go on and spoil yourself.

doc.title: Lovely Restaurant w/a view
doc.review: Had brunch at Eiffel Tower (had dinner on previous trip). Great wayto see (not hear) the fountains from Bellagio. Service was super, and food was well prepared. A bit pricey but elegant- a splurge for a special occassion

doc.title: One time experience
doc.review: As the heading states, this is a one time experience and never again. We made reservations two weeks prior to our trip and we had a great view of the Fountain at the Bellagio (shows every 15 minutes in the evenings). The food, pricey, portions were small, and our server had a fake french accent. How do I know? well, I have friends who have french accents, and this one was VERY rehearsed. Still, he get an A for effort. If you are gonna go it'll be about $100 per couple, not including alcohol. It's a one time experience and I'm glad we did it. You'll need to find something more to eat soon after you leave.

doc.title: Much ado about nothing - Very expensive, very small portions, nice view
doc.review: It has all the flavor of a 5-star restaurant. It has a stellar wait staff. It has prices that are close to wallet-rape for food that is not on par with other high-end restaurants in the city. It does have a magnificent view of the Bellagio and the city, but we were sat next to huge cross beams and most of our view was blocked. Go to Nero's at Caesar's or try Kokomos at The Mirage. Better food, better prices.

doc.title: great view, high price, and simply okay food
doc.review: This is the second time my wife and I have gone to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Our first was a year ago and after that visit we felt the food and atmosphere was excellent. Unfortunately, it was the first high end restaurant we went to on the strip and had nothing to compare it to. This visit the food proved to be bland and uninspiring, the server was often nowhere to be found, and the prices seemed even more extravagant for the portion sizes. For me, I am willing to go to a high price restaurant in Vegas to eat food I could not get anywhere else in an environment like no other. The Eiffel Tower with its great view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip makes it the most romantic restaurant on the strip. However, that’s probably the only reason why you would want to go there. How is the food? Well my wife got the salad for $16 which consisted of a small head of romaine with a light dressing and a large poppy seed "crouton". Romaine for $16? This compared to Michael Mina's (similar classed restaurant at the Bellagio) where a $16 salad gets you a large portion of field greens, high quality blue cheese, walnuts and pear shavings. I ordered the lamb which basically was two lamp chops that were encrusted with something that had no flavor. It was so bad I had to peal it off the meat. It tasted like something I could get for half the price at restaurant back home. All I am saying, if you are going to spend $200 for a dinner for two, there are much better restaurants on the strip. If you want a great view, go visit the bar at the Eiffel Tower and eat somewhere else.

doc.title: Great view - mediocre food
doc.review: Save yourself some money and take the ride to the top of the eiffel tower and don't bother eating here. For the price of the food, there are many much, much better restaurants in LV that offer fine dining. Nothing about the food was horrible - the steak was good, etc. - but it just wasn't that impressive. Whatever you do, don't order the chicken. (One of the few cheaper things on the menu) It had hardly any flavor, I've made better chicken after coming home from a day of work. The whole place is about the view and the feeling of eating at a fancy expensive restaurant --- great if you are into appearances, not great if you want a nice meal.

doc.title: Awesome food! Great view!!!
doc.review: The best dining experience my fiance and I have ever had! Many other fancy restaurants the food is good because its "fancy". The food here was absolutly amazing! Elevator guy was very pleasent, waiter was fantastic, sommelier was ready to answer any questions. Spectacular views of the fountains at Bellagio. Highly Recommended!!!

doc.title: Great ambience, food and views
doc.review: This is a great place for a nice meal out. It's not the kind of place you would call into just because you were hungry.We booked in advance for 4 people, which meant we had to leave credit card details so they could charge us if we didn't turn up. Upon booking we were asked if it was a special occasion.You go up in an elevator to the restaurant and are greeted and taken to your table. We were given a table which was semi-circular so that we could all be facing the beautiful views of the Bellagio fountains.The food is expensive, but delicious, and you would probably only go here as a one off.It is traditional French cuisine as you would expect. I really wanted to visit the restaurant itself, but wasn't keen on the idea of the French food (stupid I know given that it's an Eiffel Tower restaurant!), but it was easy to find something I liked. I had foie gras ($25) to start, followed by fillet mignon with your choice of sauce ($47) with asparagus and potato gratin.Starters include soups, snails, lobster, salads etc.Mains include various cuts of steak, fish dishes, beef wellington, lamb and vegetarian options.There is also an extensive wine list. The atmosphere is elegant and quiet so you can eat in peace. It would be perfect for a romantic meal, but also nice to dine as a group as well.The service was also good; the waiter was on hand to answer any queries you may have and make suggestions. My friend's steak was not cooked as requested, but the waiter was extremely apologetic and helpful in fetching a new one.I would definitely recommend dining here if you don't mind paying for a nice meal in a beautiful restaurant.

doc.title: Love this place!
doc.review: We went back to this restaurant for our Christmas day evening dinner. It was a lovely meal. We all opted for NY steak with sides and it was delicious. Our desserts were fabulous too.We asked to sit in the banquette seating and got our requested seats with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains and strip. It is not cheap, but it is a special place to go for a night out. Book to get the best seating.The service was faultless.

doc.title: Can't beat the view, food or service, but lunch selection was sparse
doc.review: Four stars is right on for this restaurant. It is swank and the view of the Bellagio Fountains is spectacular, however, their menu outside of their prime dinner time (don't open for dinner till five and I was hungry at 1:30) is sparse at best. That being said, the chicken panino I had was fantastic. Every single bite as tasty as the last and the dish came out sooo hot! The best part of the restaurant was the bar area and the bar tender Carson. He was a really good conversationalist and gave me plenty of things to see in Vegas that I might have not seen otherwise. He also recommended my sandwich after listening to my preferences for food. He also makes a mean lemonade too! I would definitely try to come back here to eat during dinner as their menu looked fantastic and the view at night has to be even more impressive

doc.title: Not Worth it!
doc.review: February 01, 2010 - Doesn't like it - If you are seeking a fine dining experience, then my advice is to stay far away from this restaurant. I took my husband and two friends to dinner at the The Eiffel Tower Restaurant on Jan 29, 2010. Our expectation was to enjoy a gourmet meal with excellent service and a romantic ambiance. These expectations were not met, in any respect. A few observation on our experience:1) The hostess desk is confused. There were a hoard of people attempting to check in, and there was no clear process. The hostesses were not friendly or knowledgeable. The entry was crowded and and shared a noisy space with the bar. It felt more like we were walking into the all you can eat buffet, rather than a fine dining restaurant. The clientelle was also a bit surprising, many were dressed very casually (jeans, etc), definitely setting a different tone than I expected.2) Once we were seated, we waited a good 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged our table. It was only when I returned to the hostess stand (and yes, that is what it is), was I able to get a waiter to help us.3) The waiter was another story... he was casual and interruptive, often commenting on our private conversation at the table. When asked what he recommended from the menu, he preceeded to list about 20 items. Frankly, it would have been easier to ask him what he didn't recommend. His knowledge of the dishes was lacking, and his style was casual and messy.4) We enjoy good wine, and eagerly reviewed the wine list with the help of the sommelier. However, I find it insulting that when asked for some guidance and suggestion, his first suggestion to my husband, and rather loudly to the table, was a $900 bottle of cab. Now I love a good wine, but I find thatt approach very tacky, and unprofessional. We ultimately chose a $200+ bottle, which semed to please him, until we ordered a $150 bottle later - at which time we defintely were given a cold shoulder by the sommelier. Mind you the mark up on these wines is tremendous, but that is to be expected. What is not to be expected is the poor service that accompanied it. 5) The food - It was good, but certainly not exceptional. The filet mignon was $50+, without any sides. The waiter delivered it all wrong, and the steaks were all mixed up... how hard is it to get an order for 4 correct? The sides were average... nothing to wow you. Over all, lacked originality and style. I have had the items on that menu at many average restaurants around the country, at a far lower price point.6) The ambience is very iffy. If you get a table for 2 at the window, you may be very good, but you will be very crowded as the tables are very close. We, on the other hand, were sitting in the middle of the resaurant, where they somehow believe it is a good idea to put the bussing trays next to the dining tables. So as you eat you get to hear crach, crash, crash of silverware and dirty plates hitting the bussing tray, and enjoy that lovely view. This seemed to be the case for many tables in the resaurant.So-- in the end we paid around $900 for a meal for 4, including 2 bottle of good but not exceptional wine. It was not a good experience, except for the company we shared which was great. I am amazed this place survives - and can only believe that it is due to location and tourist hype. It is NOT worth it!So many truly gourmet resaurants in Vegas... avoid this place. If yo must go up the Tower, have a drink, enjoy the view and leave... Bon appetite!

doc.title: Bring your Amex...and the camera !!
doc.review: Had dinner with my wife before seeing a Cirque show (Love). Made reservations earlier in the day by phone which was easy. They gave us a great table in front of the fountains. The Veal Medallions were spectacular but a bit pricey. I ordered the Pommes Dauphines and they were the bomb! Very flavorful and crispy. Be careful when ordering as the waiter may ask "And what kind of salad would you like"? My wife didn't know that it was extra, thinking it came with her salmon...a $17 mistake! The two of us ran up a $175 tab..2 martinis and the sea scallops, but since this was a special night out, it could have been way worse. The food was one of the best meals I've had, and other than the salad, the portions were more than expected. The view and the atmosphere was top notch!

doc.title: Sweet!!!!!!!!
doc.review: Went to have a nice dinner. Got more than asked. I went with my wife and friend and his wife. Made a reservation earlly in the day. Got there a little early, told them we were there from our wedding anniversary and seated next to the window facing the Bellagio right away before our reservation time. Food was great, service was awesome. Paid left a good tip, and the server chased us down through the kitchen to thank us. Great Place will go again.

doc.title: Recommended!
doc.review: Do you want elegant atmosphere overlooking the lights and fountains on the Strip? Do you like good food? Do you want to have a memorable dinner in an unusual place with great ambiance? OK. This is it.

doc.title: Been there twice, great atmosphere, beware with cocktails
doc.review: Great place to have lunch and enjoy a chilled A/C while taking a break from the walking and outside heat during summer. The food is above average but expensive per se. Have in mind you are also paying for the location and the outstanding view of the Bellagio fountains show right in front of view and from above, just make sure you ask for a table to the Bellagio, otherwise its not worth staying there. Altough the service is great, the waiter tends to be pushy regarding the meals, kind of force you to eat french way making you order all the entrées and having the 18 dollar peach cocktails (which is so bad that I couldnt finish even in the martini glass they served, you can actually see our 2 drinks half full in picture 3). The main dish is always great and the crème bûrlée is real french grade quality, just skip the entré and the pushy cocktails and you will be fine with a much less expensive bill.

doc.title: Romantic but expensive.
doc.review: The view is the best thing about this restaurant. You get a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains. They food was good but not worth the price. I had the filet minion and asparagus and my husband and the new york strip with a crab cake and asparagus and we had water to drink and the bill came to $128 dollars and that didn't include the tip and we only had water to drink! I enjoyed dinner... it was the perfect atmosphere for our anniversary dinner.

doc.title: Not worth the fuss but the food was good
doc.review: I'll start with the positives, which started when we were finally seated. The waiter was attentive, although the bar couldn't make a virgin mojoto, and was very patient with my grandmother who is elderly and a bit demanding. When the food came, it was wonderful. The price was comparative to lunch at other places, and the food was amble and fresh.The bad? Even though I had booked and you leave your credit card details so if your a no show they charge, but we were made to wait 20 minutes for a "great table with a view" only for another table to be moved into it and we got left with a normal table - not worth the 20 minute wait and definately not the great table they had promised.So I'm stuck with this one, a great meal, but with a frustrating start and empty promises, not sure I would recommend it to others.

doc.title: Not really worth the $$
doc.review: My boyfriend and I had to wait a few minutes for a table, so we sat at the bar. I had a glass of red wine, he had a highball. The drink bill....$30!!! Our dinner was okay, nothing spectacular by any means. Bill was $140.00 before we tipped. We didn't even have dessert or additional drinks.

doc.title: The Best View on The Vegas Strip while Dining
doc.review: Can it get any better then this?? WOW.. And a great meal also. I would send my worst enemy there to enjoy the view and meals. Michael Manis NY NY

doc.title: Fantastic
doc.review: We stayed at The Bellagio for our honeymoon in November and decided to try out the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. It far exceeded our expecations. The hostess staff were very welcoming and our waitress was helpful, professional and fun. The wine list was impressive- a bit pricey- but our waitress helped us find a half bottle of cabernet for $76 that we really enjoyed. The food was delicious- started with squash and a piece of bread, we both then ordered the filet which was cooked to perfection. We also each ordered a potato side dish that were very good. They knew we were on our honeymoon and brought us a chocolate mousse on the house that was heavenly. We ended with their apple dessert with cinnamon ice cream- the best dessert ever! The tables are a little cramped as people mentioned, but I didn't mind having to snuggle up to my new husband and look out our window view at the fountains bursting in front of The Bellagio! I would go back - it's expensive, but worth the experience.

doc.title: Good for a change of pace
doc.review: Had just went up in the Eiffel tower and decided to eat at their restaurant since it was not busy. Kind of expensive for lunch. I had a chicken and herb cheese sandwich, which was good. Hubby had the seafood salad, which he said was really good too. Had a window seat which was nice. Although in this case, I think once was enough for me.

doc.title: Exceeds any hype
doc.review: Before going there I was more than a bit suspicious. I mean really, a restaurant in a replica of the Eiffel Tower. How good could it really be, especially when the restaurant at the REAL Eiffel Tower has bad food and horrible service. But after sitting down to eat I was impressed. The menu options were great. The prices weren't excessive and the wine list was amazing. It was nice, too, that they had wine by the glass list that changed nightly and included some of their best wines; perfect for those of us who might not want to drop $300 on a bottle of wine (or $19,000, the most expensive bottle!). The food tasted great from salad to souffle and the service was also top notch. They also had a live piano player and chanteuse that sounded good. The only down side was the "professional" picture they took of us, which didn't turn out well. Even that, though, they didn't charge us for when they saw that it didn't turn out.

doc.title: Great Anniv with Oscar!
doc.review: I have read reviews here prior to going to the restaurant for our first year anniversary dinner. Most of them had a great time with Oscar so we also asked for Oscar. Lucky thing is he was working that night and a perfect table was waiting for us in his section. I must admit it's a bit pricey but it was very much worth every penny. We had valentine's dinner on top of stratosphere but the food wasn't as tasty as here and we paid even more in stratosphere (not worth it). Try all of Oscar's recommendations and you'll never go wrong. Reservation is a MUST to get the best experience ever. Thank you Oscar. By the way, he is the Captain waiter/server.

doc.title: Splurge for a special occasion
doc.review: My boyfriend and I dined here on a Saturday night. I made the reservations about a month in advance, and you have to give them a credit card number to hold your reservation. If you don't show up for your reservation, you will each be charged a "no show" fee, so be forewarned. Our reservation was for 8:45pm. We were greeted by the hostesses, all very nice and friendly (I know some of the previous reviewers haven't been so kind). We were given a top notch table for two, right by the window, positioned center stage for the fountains across the street at the Bellagio. We each had a celebratory cocktail ($18 each) and then we each proceeded to have an appetizer, our entree, we shared a side of potatoes, and we split the chocolate dessert. The food was very good, and I would say we had more than enough to eat. I had the rack of lamb, my boyfriend the salmon. The waiter was consistent, but rather business-like. He could have warmed up a little bit and offered more of a personal touch. Our total tab came to $240.00, including a generous tip. I think this is a good location for a special occasion. I don't know if I would go back the next time I'm in Las Vegas, since I like to try new places, and there are so many others to choose from in Vegas, but I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant to anyone.

doc.title: go if you like to be crammed in like sheep
doc.review: this place is over rated1.we booked a table for 7.45pm and turned up on time but was then told we will let you know when a table become available2.tables are very very small,so small that your side plate is in the middle of the table because if you put it next to your dinner plate it will fall on the floor and smash.3.food was ok to good but not outstanding4.wine is that overpriced its near to the point of insulting5.service was ok6.restaurant was very noisy to the point you have to repeat yourself all the timewould not go again or recommend this either

doc.title: You msut not miss this!
doc.review: We went for lunch on a whim., thinking that it had to have great views but don't expect much for the food. Boy, were we wrong! The food and service was exemplary. Try the Foie Gras...it's divine. The little cheese puffs that are offered in lieu of bread were wonderful...don't be bashful, ask for more! The views of the fountains at Bellagio were spectacular. I'm sorry we didn't save this one for dinner. Yes, it's expensive but worth every delicious morsel. Bon Appetit!

doc.title: Worth every Penny...
doc.review: Don't listen to the scathing negative reviews of this restaurant. I have a feeling those people would be difficult to please under the best circumstances. I am an average person with experience both high end and casual and I absolutely loved my Eiffel Tower experience. We were seated promptly for our 7:45pm reservation at an amazing table offering a perfect view off the Fountains at Bellagio. I don't think there is a better mealtime view of the strip anywhere in Vegas. The view alone is worth it! We ordered freely, trying to let go of the prices and just enjoy the evening, and even in doing so we still only spent a little over $250 for two. Rack of Lamb, Salmon, Scallops to start, Martinis, a side dish each and an incredible melt in your mouth raspberry souffle. The service was fantastic and the atmosphere was unbeatable. Go ahead and treat yourself. it's worth it.

doc.title: Go Up for Dessert and a Drink
doc.review: You're paying for the view of the Bellagio fountains, which is amazing. Oh, and the food and bar area are high class as well, and the service was excellent (even if you're not ordering a full meal, which we appreciated). Go at night, have dessert there instead of wherever you went for dinner, enjoy a drink with the view of the fountains just across the street and bustling action on the Strip below. It is an experience. Can't say much for the dinner as we didn't eat a full meal there, so take that for what it's worth.

doc.title: Outstanding View - went for Brunch
doc.review: My sister and I went for the Sunday Brunch to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. On our way to the restaurant we passed many long long line-ups for other restaurants for their Sunday brunch. We were extremely worried that we would also wind up in a long line up. We arrived at the elevator to take us up to the restaurant and were greated by a very friendly host who took us up personally and showed us the kitchen. For 2 people dining they have dining at the window. We were over-looking the Bellagio fountains and were surprised when they were putting on a show during our brunch - what a nice surprise. The champagne and OJ were overpriced - $28 a glass (very tiny glass) so I was disappointed with that. The food was excellent; I had a cheese souffle and my sister had a salmon egg dish. Both were not filling but very lovely. We would definitely go back there for dinner.

doc.title: Great food coupled with amazing views
doc.review: We were on honeymoon in Vegas, so this restaurant was a must for us. We had a reservation before we arrived, but really wanted a window table. The staff were very accommodating and let us have a drink at the bar until one became available. It was worth the wait as we were able to watch the Bellagio fountains while we were eating. The food was brilliant; I had a steak that was cooked to perfection. The staff also sent out a special dessert course for us as we were on honeymoon with a message of congratulations written on it. A very romantic experience.

doc.title: Absolutely an AMAZING place to dine!
doc.review: We did lunch here at 2pm. It was absolutely fabulous!! The selection of food was great as well as the quality of the food! The service was amazing, our servers name was Maurizo. He was amazing and went above and beyond. The view is spectacular especially of the Bellagio Fountain show! This is definitely a MUST DO on your trip to Sin City!

doc.title: Worthwhile Splurge
doc.review: We had lunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We had a window table overlooking the Bellagio fountain. The restaurant was not busy, so it was quiet and enjoyable. The staff was friendly and professional. The four of us each had a different entree, which were beautifully presented. I had the seafood salad, and the lobster, shrimp and crab were delicious. We all enjoyed sharing four different desserts, too. This was such a great place that we came back for dinner on our last evening in Las Vegas. Oh, don't miss the restroom!!

doc.title: Special
doc.review: This restaurant is truly special. Go nicely dressed and really make the effort here. An upmarket place to eat with a lot of character, great views of the strip and the fountains at Bellagio.

doc.title: Perfection
doc.review: One of the best meals I’ve had in Vegas. We had a beautiful table by the window overlooking the Bellagio Fountains (make your reservations closer to 6pm – you’ll have a better chance to get the window because they won’t hold them – we got there at 6:15pm) which didn’t hurt the experience AT ALL, but really the food was superb. Service was gracious and the staff in general were very attentive, which is a must in my book. Our waiter Noah (pronounced NO-WAY, he’s from Mexico) recommended the Bleu Cheese Soufflé as a starter - which was delicate and delicious. Seriously, we’re foodies and this was the bomb. We also had the warm shrimp app, but the soufflé was the best. We each started with a Sweet Pea Amuse Bouche (single bite- sized hors d’oevre) which was light and very tasty. My husband had the Roast Duck, and I ordered the New York steak with the Cabernet Reduction – both were mouth watering and cooked to perfection. I wasn’t expecting the steak to be that good, but it was. Only critique here is I wish they offered a smaller portion for the ladies – say 6oz instead of 8oz., or better yet, 5oz. My husband couldn’t stop commenting on the duck – he was very happy!Another thing about this restaurant – the portion sizes are petite (or what they used to be before the restaurant industry started feeding Americans in troughs) which is perfect when you’re eating more than one course, and even with the more manageable portion sizes, we were still too full for dessert.I think I should mention we started with a Chocolate Martini a piece – which really was like having a dessert before dinner. But I don’t regret it – they were best chocolate martini’s we’ve ever had, and I only wish we’d had them after dinner. A note about the breads they serve with dinner – this is not the place to come if you’re watching your carbs. The breads were very French and very perfect. Bread happens to be my weakness, but I have to tell you – a perfect baguette is harder than it sounds. It has to taste like something, along with having just the right crunchy-on-the-outside-light-and-airy-on-the-inside thing going. We could have had just the bread and maybe a hunk of cheese and a couple of glasses of wine a piece and that would have satisfied us – the bread was that good. We ordered a second basket because my husband loves bread even more than I do.Definitely worth a stop here for a special occasion, or if you’re just interested in having a superior meal. (The General Manager of the restaurant made a point of checking in and stopping by every seated table and invited us to call him the next time we were in town -very nice touch).Two Appetizers, two Entrees, two Side Dishes – Spinach and the Potato Au Gratin, two Cocktails and a glass of Zinfandel came to just over $200. Definitely worth it and we will absolutely dine there again.

doc.title: Wonderful
doc.review: We ate at the restaraunt on 6th September following our wedding, it was great food, and a fabulous view of the Bellagio fountains.

doc.title: tres romantique and excellent food
doc.review: We went there for the view over the Bellagio fountains across the Strip, which was beautiful - we expected a romantic atmosphere for our anniversary, but some of the reviews suugested that there would be a compromise on the quality of the food, but the menu selections were exquisite, the veal medallions unmatched. We loved the whole evening, staff was great, and we can't wait to go back! Memorable meal worth the price

doc.title: Always excellent food!
doc.review: Since we discovered this restaurant, my husband and I try to eat here at least once each trip to Las Vegas. The atmosphere is very nice with a wonderful view of the strip and the water fountains of the Bellagio. The hostesses are not always warm and friendly but the table service is always excellent. Reservations are recommended. If you are lucky you get a window seat, but even the seats the furthest back in the restaurant are pleasant. It is not a cheap restaurant, but every meal we have had has been tasty. The filet mignon and the chocolate souffle are our favourites here. If you are celebrating a special occassion and tell them when you make your reservation, they will sometimes do something a little special for you-we were celebrating our anniversary on our last visit and they placed rose petals all over our table.I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant.

doc.title: Best view, Romantic.......PERFECT!
doc.review: To start, the view, there is not a better view of the Bellagio fountains in Vegas. At the top of the Eiffel Tower, your too high, at water level your too low. The restaurant view is perfect. You take the private elevator to the restaurant, walk through the kitchen and there it is….full view of the Bellagio. Great entrance way. You sit down and if your lucky enough (which we were) you sit at the window so that both you and your date and or group have full view of the strip. Your waiter comes by (I cant remember our waiters name, however he was so precise and knowledgeable of the whole menu) and explains the menu and drink specials. Our appetizer was the tomato mozzarella dish which was so tasty. The “special juice” they pour over it dissolves in the mozzarella giving it an amazing taste. I had the beef wellington which was cooked to perfection and my girl friend had the surf and turf. The wellington was so good my gf wanted to come again and order that. Her surf and turf was very good however not the best crab we have ever had. For deserts, their soufflés are unbelievable. Many different flavors any would be great.All in all, (with a Lettuce Entertain You gift card $50) the meal cost roughly $200.00 including tip. It may be a splurge however with a bottle of wine, appetizer, and two great entrees we thought it was well worth the amount. Plus the view adds so much. Would definitely recommend for a one night splurge in Vegas for a romantic evening before or after one of the great shows.

doc.title: Great view, food was so-so
doc.review: Had lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We arrived about a half hour early and they were able to sit us immediately. We had a table for two right by the Bellagio fountain show. The tables by the window are set so that you each can comfortably watch the show. The view was the best part of lunch. We each had chicken that was deep fried and seemed very oily. Our plates had a small pool of oil on them. I'm no French cuisine connoisseur, so maybe it was supposed to be oily. I cannot stand paying $5.50 for a soft drink. Service was good. There were several patrons that did not follow the dress code, so it apparently is not a huge issue.I booked here for a romantic lunch with my wife. In the end, the view was excellent, but the food was not worth it.

doc.title: Terrible Service spoilt a Honeymooners night
doc.review: Whilst on our honeymoon from oversears we were intrigued to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. After been given an afternoon inspection of the restuarant by a friendly attentant with great expectations for a fine night we decided to arrange a booking for that evening. On arriving at our booking time we were asked by our maitre de to sit at the bar with a promise that a table would become available shortly. After ordering a drink from a very rude and surly barman -Fifteen minutes transpired and no table was available, I asked the maitre de as to the status. She responded with a insincere smile that a table would be available shortly. A further fifteen minutes later (total 30 mins) no table was available for our party - even though to the naked eye there were plenty of seats unoccupied. Further enquries provided the same response that a table would be available shortly. After this - we gave up. To wait 30 minutes for a table despite booking a table was totally unacceptable. This restaurant needs to pick up its act at the front end....very dissatisfied.

doc.title: Add us to the disappointed side...
doc.review: The negatives completely outweigh the positives of this restaurant. We went to ET restaurant not expecting to be "wowed" by the food, but we didn't expect it to be so average either. We had a 6-course chef's tasting menu for $89 pp. Of them, only the Les Amuses Bouche, the roasted leg of lamb entrée, and our desserts (a classic Creme Brulee and a White Chocolate Banana Elysee, were enjoyable. The remaining dishes, vichyssoise, lobster appetizer, red snapper, all missed the mark by a wide margin. The room itself is much too crowded. Every inch of space is used and diners at adjacted tables along the window are almost literally back-to-back. Servers constantly struggling to get by one another in the narrow aisle are a significant distraction. Our primary waiter, however, was quite good, and his wine pairing for the lamb was excellent. Dinner for two, two cocktails, two glasses of wine and tip put us over $300. Definitely not worth it.

doc.title: Most romantic dinner and interesting experience of our lives!
doc.review: My finance' and I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris on June 16th, 2009.This is our first trip to Vegas and it was our 3rd night in town. What an lovely experience.We read all about it here on TA and was intrigued. We were helped by the comments here on what to order and to expect. We love fine food and just know what we like when we taste it. We have eaten at a few French restaurants before and knew basically what to expect.We were greeted warmly at the elevators and taken by the kitchen. We were seated at a side by side table for 2 facing the window over looking the Belaggio fountains. Our reservation was at 7:30 and so it did get dark enough for us to enjoy the view at night.Our server was Oscar and I will just say it now, He made the experience so special for us.He was kind and patient and by end of the evening he felt like an old friend.He brought us little cheese puffs to start with that were very good. Then a starter before a starter he called a something? bouche. Those of you that are fine food experts will know what I mean. 3 little tiny dishes on a pretty rectangular plate that is to tease and open up the palate. ( See I was listening Oscar! :) One was a English pea custard, one something with lamb and another salmon. All were very unusual, but surprisingly good. My finance' has never agreed to try salmon or lamb before and he did,(for Oscar!). In the name of this fine dining once in a life time experience!Then time to order, for an appetizer the bleu cheese pudding souffle. As others have said here, it was unusual, but SO rich, SO creamy and very tasty! We shared this dish together. There was also crusty french bread available all evening.We had already decided our entrees before arriving. He ordered the Beef Wellington and I ordered a chicken dish. NO, NO, NO. Oscar said I could not come there and just order chicken, as chicken is just chicken and what can you really do with a chicken? (or something like that.) He talked me into quail. Yes, I who have had quails as pets ate a quail.(I have also had chickens as pets so????) The quail was very good. The sauce that was made with a veal reduction really made it. As you probably know quail is very small, in the name again, of the experience, I ordered it and enjoyed it. I cut it in small pieces and really savored and enjoyed it.It came with a cabbage salad like side dish that also was very good.My finance' absolutely raved about the Beef Wellington. And I tasted it also and it was so good. If you like your meat well done, they are very accommodating about this. Oscar said, that they would cook it as long as they usually do and serve it. Then the diner cuts into it, if it is still to pink then he will take it back to be cooked some more. He did not have to do this. It was perfect! We shared the au gratin potatoes that were good and filling but nothing to rave about.For dessert we ordered the chocolate souffle. I am a chocolate lover and never had one so this was a must for me. If you want souffle it must be ordered at the beginning of the meal so it can be baked the proper amount of time and to be done when we are finished with our entree'. It was superb in every way. So rich and warm and chocolatey. So good. So good.When we thought we were done, Oscar brought out another little complimentary chocolate mousse -type dessert with a french inscription on it. He said from the chef, to help celebrate such a special occasion.We had a half bottle of wine, recommended by Oscar, as we do not know about wine so much. It was perfect! So if you are a little apprehensive about wine, or a dining experience such as this, don't be. The entire staff are there to help and serve you and always made us feel nothing short of royalty.We also had our picture taken by Oscar with our camera. We were asked about the professional one, but had brought our camera per advise from the TA site.He worked with our camera to get the best shots and to have the fountain in the background. They turned out very good. Also, the manager came out and chatted with us about our experience and we were happy to tell him how perfect it had been!What a perfect evening. What a night. What a dinner. What you won't believe? Our bill?Just $171!! For all of this!We highly recommend this wonderful establishment!Warm hellos and wishes to Oscar and good luck on his road races and marathons.With all the little bits of foods and courses, I did not leave hungry.I

doc.title: Perfect for a special occassion
doc.review: We went here for our anniversary and it lived up to its billing. Great views, of the strip and the Bellagio fountains - even if you are seated a the far extremes of the restaurant windows. Food was very good and portions were fair... service was top notch too. Spent about $25 per plate. The drinks at the bar, althought pricey, were really well done with first class bartenders.

doc.title: Great view, small restaurant, good food
doc.review: We had a special dinner at this restaurant and were able to get a table viewing the Belligio fountains. Food was typical for a high end restaurant. Cant say that the food was out of this world but it was good. Service was good and typical Very costly but the experience is worth it if you can afford the price.

doc.title: Great service and food
doc.review: We really enjoyed our meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in August 2008. The service is best we found in Las Vegas. The view is spectular. The food was very good, I particulary enjoyed the blue cheese souffle and the duck three ways. The best meal we had in Vegas.

doc.title: Nice lunch, great view of Bellagio fountains
doc.review: Stopped by Paris just to check out the hotel/casino and found ourselves lured upstairs for lunch at the Eiffel Tower. Had a great window view of the Bellagio Fountains, a nice French lunch and great waitstaff. I could tell they really took pride in the job they did and in the restaurant. Food was very good at lunch, was told it was superb in the evening.

doc.title: Best view, Romantic.......PERFECT!
doc.review: To start, the view, there is not a better view of the Bellagio fountains in Vegas. At the top of the Eiffel Tower, your too high, at water level your too low. The restaurant view is perfect. You take the private elevator to the restaurant, walk through the kitchen and there it is….full view of the Bellagio. Great entrance way. You sit down and if your lucky enough (which we were) you sit at the window so that both you and your date and or group have full view of the strip. Your waiter comes by (I cant remember our waiters name, however he was so precise and knowledgeable of the whole menu) and explains the menu and drink specials. Our appetizer was the tomato mozzarella dish which was so tasty. The “special juice” they pour over it dissolves in the mozzarella giving it an amazing taste. I had the beef wellington which was cooked to perfection and my girl friend had the surf and turf. The wellington was so good my gf wanted to come again and order that. Her surf and turf was very good however not the best crab we have ever had. For deserts, their soufflés are unbelievable. Many different flavors any would be great.All in all, (with a Lettuce Entertain You gift card $50) the meal cost roughly $200.00 including tip. It may be a splurge however with a bottle of wine, appetizer, and two great entrees we thought it was well worth the amount. Plus the view adds so much. Would definitely recommend for a one night splurge in Vegas for a romantic evening before or after one of the great shows.

doc.title: Great view, food was so-so
doc.review: Had lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We arrived about a half hour early and they were able to sit us immediately. We had a table for two right by the Bellagio fountain show.
