The tables by the window are set so that you each can comfortably watch the show. The view was the best part of lunch. We each had chicken that was deep fried and seemed very oily. Our plates had a small pool of oil on them. I'm no French cuisine connoisseur, so maybe it was supposed to be oily. I cannot stand paying $5.50 for a soft drink. Service was good. There were several patrons that did not follow the dress code, so it apparently is not a huge issue.I booked here for a romantic lunch with my wife. In the end, the view was excellent, but the food was not worth it.

doc.title: Terrible Service spoilt a Honeymooners night
doc.review: Whilst on our honeymoon from oversears we were intrigued to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. After been given an afternoon inspection of the restuarant by a friendly attentant with great expectations for a fine night we decided to arrange a booking for that evening. On arriving at our booking time we were asked by our maitre de to sit at the bar with a promise that a table would become available shortly. After ordering a drink from a very rude and surly barman -Fifteen minutes transpired and no table was available, I asked the maitre de as to the status. She responded with a insincere smile that a table would be available shortly. A further fifteen minutes later (total 30 mins) no table was available for our party - even though to the naked eye there were plenty of seats unoccupied. Further enquries provided the same response that a table would be available shortly. After this - we gave up. To wait 30 minutes for a table despite booking a table was totally unacceptable. This restaurant needs to pick up its act at the front end....very dissatisfied.

doc.review: The negatives completely outweigh the positives of this restaurant. We went to ET restaurant not expecting to be "wowed" by the food, but we didn't expect it to be so average either. We had a 6-course chef's tasting menu for $89 pp. Of them, only the Les Amuses Bouche, the roasted leg of lamb entrée, and our desserts (a classic Creme Brulee and a White Chocolate Banana Elysee, were enjoyable. The remaining dishes, vichyssoise, lobster appetizer, red snapper, all missed the mark by a wide margin. The room itself is much too crowded. Every inch of space is used and diners at adjacted tables along the window are almost literally back-to-back. Servers constantly struggling to get by one another in the narrow aisle are a significant distraction. Our primary waiter, however, was quite good, and his wine pairing for the lamb was excellent. Dinner for two, two cocktails, two glasses of wine and tip put us over $300. Definitely not worth it.

doc.title: Most romantic dinner and interesting experience of our lives!
doc.review: My finance' and I went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at the Paris on June 16th, 2009.This is our first trip to Vegas and it was our 3rd night in town. What an lovely experience.We read all about it here on TA and was intrigued. We were helped by the comments here on what to order and to expect. We love fine food and just know what we like when we taste it. We have eaten at a few French restaurants before and knew basically what to expect.We were greeted warmly at the elevators and taken by the kitchen. We were seated at a side by side table for 2 facing the window over looking the Belaggio fountains. Our reservation was at 7:30 and so it did get dark enough for us to enjoy the view at night.Our server was Oscar and I will just say it now, He made the experience so special for us.He was kind and patient and by end of the evening he felt like an old friend.He brought us little cheese puffs to start with that were very good. Then a starter before a starter he called a something? bouche. Those of you that are fine food experts will know what I mean. 3 little tiny dishes on a pretty rectangular plate that is to tease and open up the palate. ( See I was listening Oscar! :) One was a English pea custard, one something with lamb and another salmon. All were very unusual, but surprisingly good. My finance' has never agreed to try salmon or lamb before and he did,(for Oscar!). In the name of this fine dining once in a life time experience!Then time to order, for an appetizer the bleu cheese pudding souffle. As others have said here, it was unusual, but SO rich, SO creamy and very tasty! We shared this dish together. There was also crusty french bread available all evening.We had already decided our entrees before arriving. He ordered the Beef Wellington and I ordered a chicken dish. NO, NO, NO. Oscar said I could not come there and just order chicken, as chicken is just chicken and what can you really do with a chicken? (or something like that.) He talked me into quail. Yes, I who have had quails as pets ate a quail.(I have also had chickens as pets so????) The quail was very good. The sauce that was made with a veal reduction really made it. As you probably know quail is very small, in the name again, of the experience, I ordered it and enjoyed it. I cut it in small pieces and really savored and enjoyed it.It came with a cabbage salad like side dish that also was very good.My finance' absolutely raved about the Beef Wellington. And I tasted it also and it was so good. If you like your meat well done, they are very accommodating about this. Oscar said, that they would cook it as long as they usually do and serve it. Then the diner cuts into it, if it is still to pink then he will take it back to be cooked some more. He did not have to do this. It was perfect! We shared the au gratin potatoes that were good and filling but nothing to rave about.For dessert we ordered the chocolate souffle. I am a chocolate lover and never had one so this was a must for me. If you want souffle it must be ordered at the beginning of the meal so it can be baked the proper amount of time and to be done when we are finished with our entree'. It was superb in every way. So rich and warm and chocolatey. So good. So good.When we thought we were done, Oscar brought out another little complimentary chocolate mousse -type dessert with a french inscription on it. He said from the chef, to help celebrate such a special occasion.We had a half bottle of wine, recommended by Oscar, as we do not know about wine so much. It was perfect! So if you are a little apprehensive about wine, or a dining experience such as this, don't be. The entire staff are there to help and serve you and always made us feel nothing short of royalty.We also had our picture taken by Oscar with our camera. We were asked about the professional one, but had brought our camera per advise from the TA site.He worked with our camera to get the best shots and to have the fountain in the background. They turned out very good. Also, the manager came out and chatted with us about our experience and we were happy to tell him how perfect it had been!What a perfect evening. What a night. What a dinner. What you won't believe? Our bill?Just $171!! For all of this!We highly recommend this wonderful establishment!Warm hellos and wishes to Oscar and good luck on his road races and marathons.With all the little bits of foods and courses, I did not leave hungry.I

doc.title: Perfect for a special occassion
doc.review: We went here for our anniversary and it lived up to its billing. Great views, of the strip and the Bellagio fountains - even if you are seated a the far extremes of the restaurant windows. Food was very good and portions were fair... service was top notch too. Spent about $25 per plate. The drinks at the bar, althought pricey, were really well done with first class bartenders.

doc.title: Great view, small restaurant, good food
doc.review: We had a special dinner at this restaurant and were able to get a table viewing the Belligio fountains. Food was typical for a high end restaurant. Cant say that the food was out of this world but it was good. Service was good and typical Very costly but the experience is worth it if you can afford the price.

doc.title: Great service and food
doc.review: We really enjoyed our meal at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in August 2008. The service is best we found in Las Vegas. The view is spectular. The food was very good, I particulary enjoyed the blue cheese souffle and the duck three ways. The best meal we had in Vegas.

doc.title: Nice lunch, great view of Bellagio fountains
doc.review: Stopped by Paris just to check out the hotel/casino and found ourselves lured upstairs for lunch at the Eiffel Tower. Had a great window view of the Bellagio Fountains, a nice French lunch and great waitstaff. I could tell they really took pride in the job they did and in the restaurant. Food was very good at lunch, was told it was superb in the evening.

doc.title: Perfect for Romantic Date, Delicious Food, beautiful view!
doc.review: I have nothing but praises for this place! We made reservations ahead of time and requested a table beside the window. They were more than happy to accomodate our requests. The view from our table was breathtaking. We watched the fountains go off several times during the course of our meal. I got the bleu cheese souffle to start with. Sounds wierd but it was absolutely delicious. My husband had scallops, also very yummy. For my meal I had sea bass and my husband had duck. We were both very pleased. The dessert was the best part! You must go to this place just for the souffles!They have several different flavors. Our waiter was very nice and offered to take pictures for us. You just can't go to Vegas without eating here!

doc.title: A fantastic 10th wedding anniversary meal
doc.review: After spending the day at the Grand Canyon I wanted to make sure that the evening of our anniversary was special and after a lot of research I decided on the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and wasn't disappointed. We were met at the elevator by a very friendly greeter who already knew it was our anniversary which I thought showed a lot of professionalism.After a short wait at the bar we were seated in a window seat with the dozen red roses I had ordered waiting at the table. They unfortunately had run out of the blue cheese souffle ( it was around 10.45pm) and so I had the roasted foie gras which was excellent and my wife had the camembert with almonds which she also really enjoyed. The view of the bellagio fountains was beautiful and at no point did we feel rushed during the meal.Our server, a french chap who was apparently celebrating his 40th anniversary soon and had married his wife just across the road made us feel hugely welcome, took a real interest in us, and was more than happy to take some pictures.Our main courses of rack of lamb and the vegetarian option (can't remember exact meal) were also very well prepared, and we shared a chocolate souffle for desert ( Please note these take 1/2hr to prepare so you need to order at the start of the meal). To finish the meal we were presented with a complimentary desert wishing us a happy anniversary which was very thoughtful and a lovely touch.All in all with a decent bottle of wine ($65) and the roses ($55) the bill came to $280.00 before tip and whilst this is a lot of money I felt that the sense of occasion and surroundings for a special evening warranted it. Highly recommended.

doc.title: Oasis of tranquility in a city of chaos
doc.review: We stayed at the Paris Hotel and decided to try the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for a nice lunch.We decided the dinner menu was too expensive. However, you can get a fabulous lunch menu with the same great view, service, and attention to detail at a decent price.We made reservations on a Sunday for lunch on Monday. Reservations are a snap. You can call, or just make them at the elevator for the Eiffel Tower.The lunch menu has all the wine selection as dinner. The menu is mostly sandwiches and salads.The wait staff was very helpful. I don't claim to be overly sophisticated when it comes to fine French dining. If I didn't know the proper etiquette or what food was placed in front of me, I asked. The waiter did not seem annoyed in the least, and was both patient and helpful.I ordered the lamb burger. When I was asked how I wanted it prepared, I told the waiter I had never had lamb before, and asked what he recommended. I took his advice, and my meal was wonderful. The lamb was served with potatoe chips. At first I thought that was weird until I realized they weren't from a bag. They were FRESH.The lunch lasted about an hour and a half. This isn't a restaurant for those in a hurry. The food is timely, but not rushed. The portions are not huge, but rich and surprisingly filling. The ambience and view from the restaurant was breathtaking. After a morning of chaos walking down the Strip, I thought I had died and gone to heaven.Lunch, including wine and dessert was $88. This did not include tip.

doc.title: A truly dreadful experience!
doc.review: I visited this restaurant as a single traveller at Easter. Charming man on the lift door(Kevin?) said it was no problem that I didn't have a reservation. Arrived at the restaurant and was greeted? by 2 surly hostesses who, without even looking up at me, told me a table would be an hour. I said I would wait at the bar. After more than an hour I approached the hostesses again only to be told that they had looked for me at the bar but didn't recognise me as I had removed my cardigan!! I neither saw or heard them look for me at a small bar area. Was lead to worse table totally on my own, boxed in with glass and could only observe all other diners enjoying themselves in the main dining area. Had to wait 25 mins for a glass of wine. Food was cold when it arrived. This is the first time in my life I have not left a tip. I was made to feel like a second class citizen. Complained and the manager was mortified. He asked me to return for lunch the next day but I was so humiliated i declined. An awful way to treat a paying customer.

doc.title: The perfect way to start married life
doc.review: We celebrated our wedding reception at the Eiffel Tower restaurant and had the tasting menu. Everything was beautifully cooked and presented. The service was impeccable and although the restaurant was really busy, we never felt rushed or like things were too hectic. We were really impressed with the prices of wine compared to other restaurants- yes there are some very expensive bottles of wine but in contrast to some lower end restaurants they were of excellent quality. We will definitely be returning when we next go to Vegas!

doc.title: Perfect for a romantic dinner
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at Paris Las Vegas halfway through our week stay in Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. It was mid-week, so I thought reservations wouldn't be too difficult, but to my surprise they actually had only one spot open during supper which was at 8:30 pm (we were looking for 8 pm anyways, so it wasn't too bad). So word of advise: if you are trying to take someone to a surprise dinner, reserve at least a day or two in advance as this place is quite popular!Once we arrived there was a private elevator that takes you up to the restaurant. When at the top we were greeted by a friendly host who guided us by the kitchen and to the main restaurant area. We were a bit early so they gave us a nice seat in the bar area to have a drink. Even though we had yet to get to our seats, we could already see the great view of the Bellagio fountains from the bar. The bar waitress was very nice and extremely pleasant. Within minutes our table was ready and we were taken to a table right in front of the window overlooking the strip/bellagio fountains. The scenery alone was worth going!The food itself was all really good. I ordered the rack of lamb and it was probably the best I have ever had. We also started with a raw beef appetizer which was amazing and through the meal a server would offer us baguette and other buns throughout each course. For dessert we shared a chocolate souffle which was amazing. At the end since they knew it was our anniversary they even presented us with a special custard/pudding to share which was a nice touch.Overall it was a great experience. The food prices were a bit high, but keep in mind you are paying for a unique experience. Also the service was great, I have read previous reviews that complained about the speed, but keep in mind this isn't Applebee's. Everything is prepared from scratch and is a fine dinning experience. With the great view I don't know why anyone would be in a rush to leave. If you are simply looking for any place to eat, this place may not be your best bet, but if you are looking for a unique and romantic environment, it's gotta be one of the best options in Vegas!

doc.title: Very Nice Dinner
doc.review: Had dinner here based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. Was not disappointed. They seated us quickly inspite of the fact we were 20 minutes late due to traffic on the strip. View of Bellagio fountains was great and we enjoyed this very much during dinner. Service was excellent. Very attentive and quick. Food was very good but perhaps not quiet as good as the prices might suggest (although this was my conclusion on all Las Vegas strip restaurants).

doc.title: Good food, but not great value
doc.review: We had the tasting menu with the wine pairing - very nice food and a very attentive waiter. The view of the Bellagio fountains is also very good, but the experience is diluted somewhat by the fact you can't hear the music. We'll try Picasso next time.

doc.title: Great wiew but high price, slow service and mediocre food equal poor value.
doc.review: So much wasted potential. Best restaurant view in Vegas but experience is almost completely ruined by agonizingly slow service and mediocre food. Seated 30 minutes late on a Sunday night, then it was another 60 minutes before the main course arrived and then another 20 minutes before dessert. 2 full hours for soup/dinner/dessert is unacceptable. On top of that, the food was OK at best and certainly not close to dazzling French as one would hope. Kitchen staff should all be fired and a team with some cooking and timing talent should be hired. As everyone else said, go for the view only and expect to be gouged for the pleasure of watching the Bellagio fountain shows. There are many other better dining choices in Vegas that will leave you broke but at least satisfied.

doc.title: What a view . . . and the food isn't bad either.
doc.review: Eiffel Tower is selling you a view . . . and they deliver. The food is quite good, although a bit pricey. Still, weighing everything, it is a great experience all the way around. Remember that they make money by turning the tables over as often as possible, so don't expect to linger once you're done. If romance is your thing, book your reservations after the sun goes down. The Bellagio fountain show is SPECTACULAR at night!

doc.title: Great view and very romantic
doc.review: We went here for our wedding night and we were not disappointed. The waiter was very attentive and we were never without. Thanks Tom! We ordered the blue cheese pudding for appetizer. My wife ordered the lamb and I had the beef wellington. For dessert we had the brandy souffle. Everything was delicious. Ask to sit by the windows for a view of the Bellagio fountain show. With two glasses of champagne and 20 % tip the bill was $200.00 and worth every penny.

doc.title: Great food with a view!
doc.review: I ate at Eiffel Tower on 4/28/09 and was pleasantly surprised. Usually when eating alone, I get placed in the corner of the back of the room. I was very happy to get seated right by the window facing the Bellagio fountains. Service was very nice. The chef altered one of his dishes to accommodate a food allergy. The food was excellent. I had the petit gris escargot and the beef wellington. All was excellent.

doc.title: Good But Grossly Over Priced
doc.review: The food and service were good the only real complaint is the price. When I pay $46 for a steak I expect a complete meal when you have to pay $8 for potatoes you end up feeling like you are being taken advantage of.

doc.title: A Delicious Treat
doc.review: I chose this restaurant for a special dinner with my husband as he had proposed to me at the Eiffel Tower in Paris the year before. I made a reservation online and requested a table overlooking for fountains. I was pleasantly surprised to see that our request was granted. The table is placed against the window with two chairs side-by-side sharing the view. I appreciated the intimate set up. Our waiter was wonderful – helpful in selecting items and not at all intimidating. We started with a blue cheese soufflé appetizer that literally melted in my mouth. I chose the duck and husband had the rabbit. Both were excellent and of good proportion. We had also ordered a side of au gratin potatoes and didn’t really need them. For dessert we shared a Grand Marnier soufflé and it was very tasty. Throughout dinner we were able to watch the beautiful Bellagio water show every twenty minutes or so. It was a spectacular view. It was a very special dinner.

doc.title: great view and romantic
doc.review: this is a great vegas restaurant, o f course the prices are a lil high you are paying for the view and service. you overlook the fountain show at belligo. it is amazing to see the show from this " up top angle every 15 minutes". The food was good, the portions were a lil small for me(I'm a normal size guy). but usually french restaurants have smaller portions. You have to order the souffle(spelling??) it was the best i ever had. of course arrive early cause you have to get thru casino crowd and parking, then wait to take elevator up to reastaurant, which depending on traffic can take awhile. For three adults , with appetitzers, cocktails, a bottle of wine , entrees, and souffle for dessert and tip for $300

doc.title: Great Meal, but at a Cost
doc.review: Great service, great food, great view but...We don't like to complain but we ordered an excellent steak but were shocked to find that a $48.00 steak didn't come with vegetables or potatoes, both of which were another $8.00.I would recommend this restaurant but advise people to take their wallets.

doc.title: Great night.....
doc.review: Service very good and atmosphere in this restaurant was very enjoyable.The food and value for money considering the view was first class.A great evening was had.

doc.title: Pricey, but great food
doc.review: I had pre-booked this restaurant for the first night of our honeymoon and it lived up to all of our expectations. When making the reservation I had let them know that it was our honeymoon so they arranged a table for us with a great view. The food was great - I can particularly recommend the Creme Brulee dessert :-) - and the service was also excellent. I'd definitely go back, but because of the price it would only be for a special occassion.

doc.title: Nice fine dining with a great view
doc.review: If fine dining is your thing - or you just want to experience it one night in Vegas for a special occasion - then I would recommend the Eiffel Tower. What your going to get for your money is a beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountains (ask for this in your reservation though), a very polite staff prepared with knowledge of the wines and food served, and a creatively prepared dish. What your also going to get is a pretty hefty check, and most likely a rumbling stomach 2 hours later, since we all know fine dining is notorious for having small servings. When I made the reservation, they offer a photo taken for 26 dollars. I only did this since it was my husband's 30th, and I figured they wouldn't use my camera if they specifically offer a paid photo service. Kinda sucked when I saw the couple next to me getting their picture being taken by the waiter with their own digital camera.

doc.title: Expensive, but good food and nice view of Bellagio Fountain show.
doc.review: Dinner for two was $240.00 with tip. We split an appetizer, had two dinners, dessert, two mixed drinks and a half bottle of a moderately priced wine. The food was very good, service excellent and great atmosphere looking out over the strip and fountain show across the street. We also ate at the Stratosphere, I prefer that view better and it wasnt' quite as pricy. At either place you are paying for the view and atmosphere.

doc.title: As close to Paris as you can get in the us
doc.review: Having spent our honeymoon in Paris and having neither the time or funds due to the exchange rate, to return for our 15th aniversary we thought we'd try Vegas. The restaurant gave us a night view of a city glittering like Paris, complete with an amazing view of the Bellagio water ballet, gracious "take all the time you want" European style service. The venison with chestnuts was excellent. Knowing it was our anniversary, as fine restaurants do, the brought us a special dessert. Like all Vegas resorts it's impossible to avoid going near or throught the casino on your way to the restaurant elevator. But that was quickly oveshadowed by the rest of our experience. And we were able to get gift cards in advance with . credit card points that paid for our dinner

doc.title: Great Experience
doc.review: My wife and I visited Las Vegas for her 30th birthday. We dined at a few finer restaurants on the strip, but I have to say the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was overall the best. The hostesses were very courteous and chatty. We were able to get a table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. We arrived at 5:30 on a Thursday. There was a lot of people there, but it wasn't what I would call 'busy,' which made it very easy to get any table we wanted. If you plan on getting a good view of the fountains, I recommend reserving your table before 6:30-7pm. Anyways, our waiter, I think his name was Igor, was very good. He was conversational, but didn't talk too much so my wife and I could enjoy each others company and the fountain show. We aren't big on appetizers, and at a restaurant like this where some servers almost expect you to order a 4-course meal (See my less than stellar review of The Mix at Mandalay Bay), the waiter was not pushy about adding things to the bill. The food was great. We ordered the 'Eiffel Tower Chocolate Plate' for dessert. It was amazing. If you love chocolate, you have to order this. At the end of our meal Igor brought out a small 'happy birthday' dessert for my wife. It was much appreciated. The best thing, however, about our experience was a short conversation we had with someone I believe was a manager, as we were waiting for our elevator. She asked us "what do you think it means to provide good service." I was blown away. This restaurant actually cares about improving customer service, with ACTUAL customer feedback. You know how in most restaurants, you get the lame manager that comes around and asks every table, as if they care, "how is everything?" You say "great" and they keep walking. The fact that this particular manager asked a carefully crafted question in order to get feedback that will help them serve people better tells me this restaurant is always going to be one of the premier spots to dine on the strip.First-class, First-rate restaurant. Highly recommend.

doc.title: Great Restaurant...
doc.review: My wife and I liked the Eiffel Tower Restaurant a lot. However, we were not blown away. We would prefer Morton's Steak House over this any day. The food was great, the view was great, and the restaurant gave us a free dessert for our anniversary that was done up very well. The only thing we didn't like about it, was that it was not intimate. The environment was pretty loud for a place like this. Most everyone was dressed very well, but you did have those who walked came in wearing clothes that I would say are not appropriate for this restaurant. I believe they had a dress code, but it wasn't enforced. We did enjoy this, but it could have been better.

doc.title: Great Place but very Exspensive
doc.review: My Partner and myself dinned at the Effiel tower a few months ago we had a 8pm Reservation but on the day change it to a 6pm slot so we could see KA we are not fine dinning people but were having a date night whilst we visited Vegas with my farther. We arrived and were taken up in the lift straight way we then went though to the kitchen which was loverly and the chefs were all really nice through too the main dinning room were we were then introduced to the lady who would take us to our table. My partner asked her for a window table and she took us to this great table a little out of the way to the side with a fabulous view of the fountain. To be honest the whole night is a bit of a blur as my partner proposed to me. I remember the food and wine were very good but very expensive but if your going to splurge do it the waiters were awesome we didn't really notice the noise because we were a bit stunned but the evening was just fantastic we will be going back when we come back on our honeymoon.

doc.title: Noisy but romantic...
doc.review: Reservation at 0800pm on March 7th, arrived on time and didn't sit and wait long before they seat us. Had a great window view of the Bellagio (just what we ask for on Open Table when reserving). It was a very busy night! Our waiter was very nice but only see him a few times throughout our dinner. We ordered escargot and foie gras with fig compote for appetizers..it was great! It was my first time trying foie gras, it was different but good. My husband had the rack of lamb, which was awesome. My venison loin was pretty good even though we had better. The pistachio souffle was awesome! I also had their pear martini, which I really enjoyed (18 bucks for the drink though!) My husband was already drunk by the time we had dinner so he didn't order any cocktails (he spent many hours at the casino...hehehe). So for 1 drink, 2 appetizers, 2 veggie sides, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert, $210, not bad I thought. It was a wonderful birthday dinner, even though they didn't give me a special bday plate for my dessert. Oh well, still had a great time. If you have the moola, this restaurant will be a great experience!

doc.title: Great food and the best service
doc.review: My boyfriend and ate here Sunday March 1st, 2009. BEAUTIFUL view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip, very romantic place. Make reservations, it is a little pricey but definitely worth it. We had the best service at this fine dining restaurant, it was the best dinner I have had in Las Vegas. Ask for a table near the window so you can enjoy the scenery. Our server was AWESOME, he gave great recommendations and was so pleasantly refreshing!!

doc.title: Great View, Great Food, and Romantic Experience
doc.review: My girlfriend and I made reservations to eat at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant over Valentines weekend. We made the reservations the day of. And of course, as fate would have it, we were running behind and late. This is not very uncommon for us, so fortunately I had saved the reservation card and I called the hostess to let her know we would be 20 minutes late. I had requested a window seat and by this point figured that was out of the question. But, to my surprise, when we arrived the hostess took note of my request and found a perfect spot for us to view the Strip as well as the fountains at the Bellagio!The food was excellent. I had the Filet Mignon and my gf had the Veal Medallions. We shared a few sides and had several mixed drinks. Our bill was just under $200.00.The service was GREAT! Our waitress was very attentive and even volunteered to take a few snapshots for us.I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting a romantic evening, good food, and a great view.

doc.title: Faux Tower
doc.review: Good service and food. It is not 1 star Michelin but neither are the prices. For Vegas Tour Eiffel is a value . A con is getting seated. A reservation for a window table is treated as a request. I had to fight hard to get the window. A window table in Jules Verne at the real Eiffel Tower is very hard to get but they do honor that reservation. Some places, like both Eiffel Tower restaurants are simply not worth the price without the view.

doc.title: Amazing meal on our wedding night
doc.review: Yes, it is very expensive ($380 inc champagne and tip) however worth it. Fantastic view. If you go you must reserve a window table. They are for 2 people only and face the fountains that go off every 15 mins at night. Wonderful service, ambiance and food. Starters quite small although main courses really quite big (Beef wellington and salmon) We spent 3 hours here in our wedding attire and were never rushed. NB it did become a bit cold towards the end of the night (air con) Wonderful end to our wonderful wedding day. If you want a special meal for a special occasion, dont worry about the money and book this restaurant!

doc.title: Good and not as good
doc.review: I went with a group of 7 on Saturday night before the Super Bowl. I'll break my review up into categories to hopefully answer specific questions about the place. Food: 4 Stars. The food was very good. I didn't consider it to be memorable; not one of those meals with a "wow factor" but very good nonetheless. The menu is very diverse and even if one isn't into French food I think you'd be able to find something.Service: 5 Stars. Fast, attentive, and friendly. No complaints at all. Value: 3 Stars. It's expensive but I don't think that is news to anyone. I'd consider there to be a 20-25% markup from a similar restaurant that isn't in Vegas or in a faux Eiffel Tower. Is it worth it in light of the superior service and view? Probably yes IMO but I could see how some might be put off. Atmosphere: 3.5 Stars. The restaurant was a lot busier than I expected. There are a lot of tables and quite a bit of activity going on everywhere. It's really an impressive operation; they serve a lot of tables in a fast and efficient manner. What's good about the place is the view; regardless of where your table is you'll have a great view of the Strip. What's not as good is those coming in looking for a quiet, romantic, leisurely meal will probably be a bit dissapointed. Then again, we were there at 8 on a Saturday night so maybe other times are a bit more subdued. The beautiful decor and great view scream "quiet and romantic" but the atmosphere is more along the lines of "elegant, well-attended dinner party"All in all a great restaurant; I'm glad we had opportunity to try it. I'd recommend it to friends with the above caveats.

doc.title: Le Tour Eiffel
doc.review: Food good. SErvice very good, Front desk, horrible. For me the view is the real extra. If can't get a window table I don't go. Getting it is usually too much of a hassel. So you see my review is mixed just like life..The real Jules Verne at the real top of the Eiffel has an incredible view that is almost worth the price. The food there is better than good and the price is about 3 times as much as Vegas. However, you get to remember and talk about it for the rest of your life. What a deal

doc.title: Eiffel Tower restaurant, expensive, but worth it!
doc.review: Las Vegas: The Eiffel Tower restaurant, Las Vegas, "expensive but worth it"Date: January 12th 2008Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Montréal, CanadaMy husband and I travelled to Las Vegas for a few days to celebrate my birthday and to see shows. He had mentionned upon making reservations that it was my birthday. We had a wonderful table with a view on the Fountains at the Bellagio, the Paris Hotel being just the other side of the street from them. Food and service were expensive but wonderful, and I received a Chocolate Mousse for desert in a nice plate with Happy Birthday. Everything we took was very good. The only thing that surprised us a bit, our maternal tongue being French, is that in a French restaurant, in the Paris Hotel, so many French mistakes were made on the menu! The chef should take 5 minutes and read everything over! The restrooms were perfect.

doc.title: Gorgeous Food with Gorgeous View
doc.review: We saved going out for dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for our last night in Vegas. I booked the dinner weeks in advance and had requested a table with a view and mentioned to the staff that we were going to be celebrating our recent wedding. Although they were not able to guarantee a table with a view they said that they would try. And my goodness we got THE BEST table. Right infront of the Bellagio Fountains- it was ridiculously romantic. Also, they had sprinkled rose petals on the table to make it even more intimate.Now onto the food. DIVINE. We both had the Beef Wellington which was perfectly cooked with a rich red wine gravy. Its the exact type of food you want to eat when you go out- something that tastes so good you know you could never make it yourself! For desert we shared the pistaschio souffle which we ended up getting free as they said they had kept us waiting for it for too long. To be honest we never noticed! We were too busy watching the fountains!Any way, I agree that it is a bit pricey, but this is the kind of place you really should go to for a special occasion.

doc.title: We had our wedding reception there!! Absolutley Amazing!!!!
doc.review: It was the most amazing meal of our lives. 8 course exquisite French Cuisine. Service was impeccable!! We were treated like absolute royalty! Now I know what its like to be Britney for the day! The waiter explained what every course was and was so wonderful about everything.

doc.title: Yum! Yum!
doc.review: Great location. Great service. Great views. Great drinks.This was the best place we ate during our trip to Vegas. I could not recommend this more.

doc.title: Mixed Opinion
doc.review: We nearly didn't actually eat. I arrived on time for a reservation made weeks before, half an hour passed and we were still not seated, we were about to leave when the matrie'd came over to seat us and then she had the audacity to hang around for a tip, ill give her one "if people book a table for 7.45, then damn well seat them at 7.45 and not 8.20".The server was excellent, very patient, in fact he was the best thing about the place. My husband and i had the chef's tasting menu. 6 courses, all well spaced out, portions average, everything explained when it was bought. I'll be honest never eaten french food before and can't say i cared for it, the first 3 courses all tasted the same to me, like they had the same common ingredient, something vinegar like (i didn't much care for it).Dessert was excellent, we had creme brule and souffle, you had to order at the start which was OK as we were having the set menu, but even people ordering normally we asked to order a dessert at the start if they wanted one - who knows at that stage...View excellent, service very good, food i don't know, neither of us were amazed by it and i thought i should be for the $270 it came to. Wine was $16 a glass, i nearly fell off my chair.I suppose i expect that the food should have been better for the price.I would not go back, i'd eat somewhere else next time as i didnt feel it was worth the money.

doc.title: I felt like I was in Paris!
doc.review: Wow, as soon as we stepped off of the elevator, we were right there in the kitchen, having a yummy sample offered to us. The view is spectacular and it overlooks the Bellagio hotel. We had one of the best servers I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. I didn't catch his name, but he actually immigrated over from the south of France 4 years ago. It was too surreal, dining on fine french cuisine with a server with a french accent! We ate during lunchtime, and I had the chicken sandwich. Very rich, and very good. My husband had the parmesan chicken filet. The best part was before we left we were offered some chocolate ganache coated with powdered sugar. To die for!!!

doc.title: Wonderful experience!
doc.review: First let me say that if you are going to eat at a restaurant like the Eiffel Tower be prepared to spend the money. For two people you should expect to spend at least $200. We had dinner at the restaurant back in late September. We had a Window seat looking at the Bellagio fountains across the street. The window table was a bit smaller than interior tables but the view was absolutely worth it. Our waiter took a while to stop by initially but through the rest of the dinner he did an excellent job. The food and wine were fantastic and we never felt forced ordering. Overall, it was a delightful dinner that took about 2 hours which I feel was appropriate to space out the courses. I highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic and relaxing dinner.

doc.title: Perfect Dinner and View
doc.review: This was our best dining experience in Las vegas. We made reservations that same day and got a great table overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. We were promptly seated. Wait staff was suberb- friendly, helpful and accomodating. The menu is not very extensive, but diverse for a French restaraunt. The decor and furnishings were elegant. Price was reasonable for an upscale restaraunt in Vegas. Server was especially likable, fun and unpretencious. We will return next time we're in Vegas.

doc.title: Look elsewhere for a fine dining experience
doc.review: We were just on our 8th yearly trip to Las Vegas and decided to try Eiffel Tower Restaurant for the first time. Have had many excellent dining experiences in Las Vegas - but this was not one of them. While food was fine with respect to taste and presentation the greatest problem was the environment. You are packed tightly into this space and this was by far the noisiest restaurant we have ever experienced. We could not hold a normal conversation and left early since members of our group were uncomfortable due to the noise. We were surprised when our server openly indicated that the restaurant was always very loud - and that it could get much worse than that night (hard to imagine). In addition, the traffic of people moving by the table was constant (this was the case for most of the tables due to the design of the restaurant). If you wish to enjoy fine dining where the food AND the environment warrant the high expense then look elsewhere in Las Vegas - there are many other options where you won’t be disappointed. If you are convinced that you want to try the food at Eiffel Tower Restaurant – then see if you can get take-out and sit out on Las Vegas Blvd near the Bellagio Fountains – you are likely to enjoy it more than sitting in the restaurant.

doc.title: Great experience
doc.review: Food was excellent. I had the pheasant and my wife had the veal. Shared the souffle which was outstanding (but it did take a while).Service was great. Never felt rushed. Waitress was constantly stopping by to check on us.Window view of the fountains was the best in Vegas.Very romantic, but it was noisy (can''t blame the restaurant - just the customers).It was worth the price.

doc.title: Good food, nice view ... I'm still hungry though
doc.review: No real complaints about the restaurant. We had an incredible view of the Bellagio fountains, the food was very good, and the setting was romantic. Don't expect large portions or moderate prices. Oh, by the way, $6.50 for coffee is a little steep in my opinion and so is the $15 Caesar salad.Overall, the experience was worth it. I was a little annoyed that the dress code was not enforced ... I saw people wearing jeans.Give it a try ... but be prepared to shell out more than $200. I guess that's not over the top for French food ...

doc.title: Wonderful wedding dinner
doc.review: We arrived at the restaurant at 9.45 PM, entered, like everyone, by the kitchen, which was a first very good impression, and were seated right away, just next to the windows, with a magnificent view on the Bellagio fountains. We never got the feeling we had to hurry up (maybe because it was late).We got married the day before and wanted to celebrate it. Said it to the waitress, who was very nice.We took a bottle of champagne for the meal. The entrées were excellent. When finished, we received a small, delicious chocolate mousse for celebrating the wedding. Then had the chocolate plate (chocolate sorbet, banana stick, chocolate cake...): excellent.It wasn't cheap, but was certainly worth the romantic and gastronomic experience.What a wedding memory!

doc.title: Perfect Romantic Spot
doc.review: Everyone in Vegas should go to the Eiffel Tower restaurant at least once. I took my fiance there for his birthday and they gave him a special birthday desert. You also can not beat the views. The restaurant overlooks the Billagio water show which makes the restaurant even more romantic - my fiance actually proposed to me in the restaurant! The food wasnt the best I have had at restaurants like this, but it was still really good. The service was a little slow and our waiter wasnt very friendly - but I did notice that other tables were getting good service.

doc.title: Perfect spot for a date...
doc.review: Perfect spot for a date. And The Presidental Suite!!!!!!! :)

doc.title: Brilliant restaurant, food and service!
doc.review: Brilliant restaurant, food and service!

doc.title: Still Salivating
doc.review: My husband and I just came back from our Vegas trip and count this as one of the highlights.We reserved a window seat for 2 with a view of the Bellagio Fountains for 7:15 on a Wednesday night via open table (accessible from their website - you will need a credit card to reserve). The sunset view was magnificent and the fountain show really added to the romantic experience. We were taken to the restaurant from a specialty elevator that arrives in the kitchen. We were escorted to the table on arrival and greeted by our waiter and sommelier, both friendly and knowledgeable. They have an enormous selection of French wine and even had several bottles from St. Emilion, our favorite region. There is plenty of American wine on the menu as well for those that prefer it, but our area is sadly lacking in French importers and distributors so we took advantage of the selection and overpaid for a bottle from Château Figeac.My husband started with the cold foie gras with duck prosciutto and fig compote while I opted for the almond dusted sea scallops with potato galette and tarragon. After an in depth discussion with our server, he chose the roasted rack of lamb with tarragon jus over the rabbit loin, and I passed on the veal medallions in favor of the duck two ways with wild rice, braised turnips, and sauce aigre doux. Duck leg fried in duck fat with medium-rare, crispy duck breast - my mouth waters even now as I am writing about it! We made the mistake of ordering sauteed mushrooms and garlic spinach - they were delicious, but we could not manage more than a couple of bites as the appetizer and dinner portions were so generous. Of course, that did not stop us from ordering the chocolate souffle or sampling from the array of petit fours that came with the bill. The ticket came to just under $300 with tip and we felt the 2-hour experience was well worth the price. Since the file size is too large, we posted photos of the food and the view on fredphoto.net. The service was impeccable and we found the entire atmosphere romantic, but keep in mind that this is a European set up and thus tables are much closer together than the typical American may be used to. You can have a quiet conversation amidst the din of the restaurant, but you will be seated nearly back-to-back with another patron if you have a window seat. Circular platform booths are also available but the view is not as spectacular. We generally like to pick different places each time we eat in Vegas, but it would be hard to resist the temptation to dine here again. The wine, the food, the service - all were a foodie 5 star.

doc.title: Best view on the strip, very good food
doc.review: Best view on the strip, very good food

doc.title: Awsome!
doc.review: I made a reservation weeks before my 40th Birthday and I mentioned this when I made the reservation. Upon arrival I was greeted with Happy Birthday and we've got a very nice table with an anmazing view! The waiter was absolutely outstanding. I would say this was the best service what I have gotten in the United States. Very courteous. Just great. The food was even more excellent. Absolutely nothing to complain. And enough not like most upper class restaurants where you usually leave hungry after a nice meal...Finally the dessert: You must try the souflle'. Its heavenly! They are known for the best souffle' in town but YOU MUST try it. I could come back just for the dessert only :-)Because it was my Birthday, I received a little extra dessert with a nice Birthday decoration. Very thoughtful.Everything was just perfect. Okay it is pretty expensive, but the the view and the ambience are worth it. You should go there if you want to treat yourself or if you want something for a special occasion. I would defenetely go there again...

doc.title: Best Meal I have ever had!
doc.review: The service was great, the view was sensational, the atmosphere was intimate and romantic and the food was the best I have ever had. It was on the higher side of pricing but I didn’t feel it was unreasonable.

doc.title: They were great !!!
doc.review: We selected this restaurant for a special dinner in Las Vegas. I chose it because of the views mainly....and decent reviews. I had an awesome experience!!! Our special guest who does not walk well was accommodated nicely. My daughter who is a vegan was also accommodated with a fabulous well prepared dish that was beautifully presented. Our server Maria, a helper Tony , and the chef all worked to make this a fun evening. It was expensive..... however, I felt that it was a great meal and evening. I would go back again !!

doc.title: yumm!
doc.review: food great! Service awesome! Can't go wrong on any meal! is very expensive but worth it I cant' believe its not rated higher!

doc.title: Still a wonderful place!
doc.review: Since we were staying at the Paris Hotel, my wife and I decided to revisit the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Our first dinner there a year ago was very good.Upon arriving, we were told that we were to wait for one of their better tables to open up, because "people with reservations get the better tables. " We sat at the bar with some champagne when the hostess came over, put our champagne on a tray and escorted us over to our beautiful view of Bally's?!!!!! Once I saw the "view" I told the hostess that we would rather wait for a better table. She said we could wait. In a weird move, she then handed us back our champagne and bolted back to the front desk. Kind of an awkward moment. When we walked back past the hostess desk, I mentioned to her that "I don't think that was really one of your 'better' tables." She said, I'm sorry you don't think so, we think it is! Kind of a little inappropriate attitude in my opinion. Afterall, service is all about making the customer happy!We were shortly thereafter, seated at a beautiful table overlooking the Fountains of the Bellagio. Our waiter deserves special note as one of the finest waiters we have ever had the pleasure to serve us. His name is David Brouillet. David quickly had us forget the opening awkward moment with the hostess. He made the night. His service, recommendations, attitude, personality and professionalism were superb. Just an absolute joy to have had him as our waiter.The food at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is very good. It is not over the top good like some other high end restaurants, but very good food and wonderful view make it a great choice of restaurant.I had a phenomenal cream of asparagus soup! This soup was over-the-top good! As entrees, I had the Chilean sea bass served with olive oil, garlic and spinach (which I thought was very good), my wife had filet mignon with sauce bearnaise (also very good). We also shared a decadent potata au gratin (too good!) We had a wonderful grand marnier souffle as dessert.We were treated to a chocalate mousse to celebrate a special event. And then we were treated to an assortment of homemade candies that were to die for (and I'm not a big candy eater!)The Sommelier (John(?) from Buffalo listened to my requests and recommended an incredible wine from Chateauneuf-de-Pape. (2005 - Telegraph). This wine was incredible! (we are members of 5 Napa wine clubs drink lots of wine). Great recommendation and interesting facts about the wine and the region. Well done!One negative...a bathroom attendant! I never like seeing an attendant in a bathroom. Feeling the need to pay (tip) to go to the bathroom irks me. I wound up standing in a puddle of urine which had not been mopped up only to feel the need to tip the attendant after being handed a paper towel! What purpose does a bathroom attendant serve? To hand me a towel and collect a couple of bucks for handing it to me! I will eat at the Eiffel Tower restaurant again. I will request David Brouillet as our "captain/"

doc.title: Excellant Meal
doc.review: Our group of nine arrived at 6:30 and we were immediately whisked up the elevator to the restaurant last Thursday. We were escorted to our table where our waiters introduced themselves to us and were very imformative. They helped out with the wine choices, made entree and appetizer suggestions and told us about the dessert souffles. The group decided to order individual items as oppossed to the fixed menu thereby trying a good variety of items. As a group we had the following appetizers: cheese souffle, aspargus soup, beef tartar and salads.Our entrees consisted of: beef wellington, surf/turf, ahi tuna and ribeye steak. The sides were: mashed/scalloped potato, mushrooms, spinach and aspargus. There was not one complaint out of the nine, everyone raved how much they enjoyed their delicious meal. The event was a great success. In the end, we were all a bit full and turned down desserts but our waiter came out with two trays of minitures to try which were delectable!A perfect end to a perfect meal. This was perfection.

doc.title: A bit disappointing
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant has the perfect location on the strip, but in order to appreciate the view you need to have a table for two near the window. Our party of 6 enjoyed only the view of top of the buildings across the street - :( couldn't see Bellagio Fountains. The arrival on the elevator is a bit different delivering you into the "kitchen"? The hostesses are extremely friendly and accommodating. They definitely DO NOT enforce any kind of dress code. We had the men in our group wear the suggested jacket only to find others wearing jeans and tennis shoes. It takes away from the "fanciness" of the place.Our waiter although nice was lacking personality and friendliness. I found the menu to be a bit over priced, especially after my meal. This is where I found the problem: the food for most of our group arrived lukewarm, which to me is the ultimate sin!!! My red snapper was just ok and a bit salty. It sat on a bed of greens with onions which tasted like basic sauteed spinach. The potatoes gratin were EXTREMELY salty -- I informed the server which he graciously informed me he would tell the Chef and take off the bill. He may have told the Chef but it was definitely on the bill. The side dishes were not impressive asparagus, mushrooms, potatoes (and again cold). We ordered a raspberry souffle, we got the wrong one too, we ate it as it takes 1/2 hr to prepare another one.All in all it was just an OK meal and based on our experience and for the price I don't think I would recommend it nor return. Maybe others have had better luck, unfortunately for us (and them too) it did not leave us saying "oh la la".

doc.title: Food average, view awesome
doc.review: At first glance the restaurant looked very nice. The view to the fountains was incredible. However, the "dress code" they supposedly have is not enforced. Some people were wearing casual clothes. We also made our reservation month in advance, but had to wait nearly an hour past our reservation time to be seated. Once seated it took 30 min to get our order in, but once we started eating the staff were quick to stick their hands in front of our faces to take plates off the table even when we werent done with the food. It was evident that the staff were more concerned with how fast they could get us out of there. To make matters worse the food was mediocre, as my girlfriend commented on how the scallops tasted like "something you could find at McDonalds"!!!... since all you could taste was the grease. The other entrees were not impressive at all for $50/plate. Everything was over seasoned. Best of all they forgot some of our order, yet kept it on the bill. Thankfully, it was removed.As for the horderve when you reach the top of the elevator as some people have mentioned... Im still waiting for mine..

doc.title: Check your bill carefully
doc.review: We visited at 9:30pm following a show and although the restaurant was busy we did not have to wait. The view of the fountains of the Bellagio across the street provided a continuously entertaining sight. Service was prompt and friendly but we felt we were being rushed along; it was not a relaxing evening. Our party selected a variety of appetizers and entrees and we ordered several different souffles which we were asked about at the beginning of the meal (with no indication of price) and we were not given any information about the other desserts available. We therefore ended up being asked to make hasty choices for our desserts.The appetizers, entrees and souffles were all very ordinary in quality, not at all what I had expected for a restaurant that our friend had recommended (but she does unfortunately live in a town that has little choice of good quality restaurants). In our experience it's unusual to have a dinner where all the courses turn out to be unexciting but that was our experience. Our bill, about $100. each, contained a charge for wine that two of us had already paid for at the bar. We did not notice this at the time and paid the full bill; when we spoke to a manager later and asked for a correction she basically said too bad, she couldn't (or wouldn't) do anything about it. Since the staff knew the bar bill had already been paid we all felt this was probably not an accident and rather a deliberate effort to overcharge.Overall, I don't have good memories of our evening at this restaurant and needless to say would not return. Our dining experiences at other Las Vegas restaurants (for example, in the Venetian hotel) have been very enjoyable.

doc.title: Very Disapointing
doc.review: booked 2 months ahead of time, checked website and double checked before visit, about dress code, nothing was mentioned about it, so when we turned up, I was turned away for not wearing long pants, now I dont have a problem wearing long pants, but when no dress code is mentioned, I do have a problem. I was turned away. Even on my comfirmation it did not mention a dress code, they had nothing to say about that!!! Then had a rude litte bell boy at the Taxi Stand, NEVER AGIAIN WILL I SET FOOT IN PARIS. There are plenty of restuarants and Hotels in Vegas, that are happy to take my dollars!

doc.title: very nice lunch
doc.review: What a nice and unexpected touch-being escorted up an elevator to be let out in the middle of the working kitchen and to be given a small salmon appetizer--I was sold. Big cushy semi circle booths so all people in your party can see the view--fantastic service--lobster bisque was delicious as was steak sandwich--the cream breule for dessert was one of the best we have ever had--65 dollars without alcohol--very enjoyable afternoon

doc.title: Fabuloous lunch with a view!
doc.review: Just returned from a 3 night stay in Vegas and visited the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for the first time. It was fabulous - from the food to the service to the view. The restaurant on the 11th floor of the tower, looks out on the Bellagio fountains. You step off the elevator and are greeted in the kitchen with a small hor deuvre served from a silver platter. Everyone greeted you with a smile while being shown to your table. The lunch steak sandwich was the best I have ever had and not badly priced at $15. The portion, served with a small salad and homemade potato chips, was large and could easily be shared. Creme brulee for dessert topped of the experience. Will definitely go back and experience dinner at this place. If you don't want to spend the $ for lunch or dinner, at least have a cocktail in the bar while watching the Bellagio fountains!

doc.title: Fantastic evening
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for my 40th Birthday (March 18th). We arrived a little too early, so weren't expecting our table to be ready and were directed to the bar where we enjoyed a cocktail. At our booked time the hostess showed us to our table - we got a window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains - it was a fabulous view!The waiting staff were very attentive and the sommelier was extremely helpful. I had warm shrimp salad to start and my husband had foie gras, we both had venison for entree and souffles for desert. The souffles are amazing!!! This was a birthday treat and I didn't see how much the bill was, so can't comment on value for money - but overall with the view, the service and the food it was a very special evening.Just a couple of comments - we were given a wine list and asked to chose our wine and then we were given a menu, whereas in England we are used to selecting our food and then chosing our wine to compliment our meal - I thought this was slightly odd. Also, I thought I had read somewhere that gentlemen are expected to wear a jacket/business casual attire, so was slightly disappointed that there were people dressed casually in jeans and t-shirts. Neither of these points distracted from a wonderful evening.

doc.title: Would think twice
doc.review: We stopped by for lunch. First I must say that the views were wonderful. We were lucky and sat right by the window and could see the water show at Bellagio and it was spectacular. Service was also very very good. But lunch was very bad. I could hardly eat my lunch it was dripping in grease. The waiter was distressed that we were not eating but it was positively gross. Alsom If you are lactose intolerent this is a tuff place to eat because they want to put cheese on everything! Just think twice before you go. Our bill was $80 for lunch which did not include anything other then an appetizer, 2 lunches and 2 sodas (that is right not even a realy drink on that bill).

doc.title: A Fabulous Evening...
doc.review: We were in LV for my Wife's 40th and I had arranged a table at The Eiffel Tower Restuarant based on reviews on TA. I felt that the ambience and location were important for such an occassion. I'd pre booked Champagne and Flowers with the restuarant, all by email. We were sat at the bar whilst our table was readied, and the waitress discreetly confirmed the champagne and flowers were ready. As soon as we were seated (wonderful toable with a view of Bellagio fountains) the waiter appared with the champagne. We had some pre-appitizers and wonderful bread before our starters of Crab salad for me and scallops for my wife. Both beautifully presented and very tasty. We both had steak for main, my wife having filet mignon and myself Beef Wellington. The Gran Marnier Souffle for dessert was out of this world! Overall, the service and the food were world class - I cannot recommend enough.

doc.title: Romantic Afternoon
doc.review: An unexpectedly delightful and delicious lunch. Great views of the strip and the surrounding area (some mountain views in the distance) with the best view of the Bellagio and their fountains. A "surprise" mini-appetizer greeting at elevator followed later in the meal with an intermezzo of custard, gratis of the Chef. Appetizer (Blue Cheese Souffle with Arugula salad) excellent. Lunch crepes and chopped salad, delicious. Fantastic Dark Chocolate Cake beyond words and Triple Fruit Souffle Dessert, outstanding. Accommodating service. Great drinks. Romantic afternoon experience for two...highly recommended. On our "to do again" list, ( next time for dinner).(P.S. Bellagio fountain show begins at 3 pm so book lunch late if possible or dinner to view from table).

doc.title: Not Worth the Visit
doc.review: We went to the Eiffell Tower on a Wed evening with a 7:15 reservations. We were greeted at the elevator and brought to the hostess stand where we were told our table would be a bit and were directed to the bar. We each got a drink and were brought to our table about 30 mins later. We were in no rush so the window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains was great. Our server seemed busy and didn't even acknowledge us for a good 10 mins. When he did arrive he seemed a bit brash. He was very hurried the entire meal and not attentive whatsoever. The sommelier was helpful but chose a wine a bit too light for our palates almost "playing it safe". Our dinners were acceptable for the standards I had put upon the restaurant. I ordered the foie gras which was cooked perfectly but overwhlemed by the fig "compote" sauce. My husband ordered the beef carpaccio which was average. We split the greens with beets which was totally opposite and very lackluster in flavor. I ordered the "surf and turf" if that's what it should be called. It was a petit filet cooked to my medium asking temp and topped off with lump crab meat and again overwhelmed by the sauce. My husband ordered the beef wellington which was consumed by the pastry which became soggy. We didn't order sides as there were none that were very appealing. By this time we skipped dessert and ordered cocktails, I a B-52 on the rocks and my husband a tocai and espresso which was brought out cold and a tuaca instead. We had to flag down our server to correct the mistake who said he brought the correct drink, but then returned knowing he didn't. My husband and I both work at 5 star establishments and I don't think this was worth the visit. There are many other great choices and I wish I had crossed this off the list. Worth having a drink at the bar, but then MOVE ON. It's a definite tourist trap and doesn't appreciate fine food!

doc.title: Worth Every Penny
doc.review: While we were in Las Vegas, eating at the Eiffel Tower was a must. We ended up deciding to go for lunch. There were four of us, on a Wendsay afternoon, and there was no wait at all (We didn't have any reservations). The waiter was excellent, the food and appetizers were wonderful, and the view was magnificent. While it was to windy to see the Bellagio's fountians, we enjoied the view nonetheless. If you are planning a trip to Las Vegas, and want a good meal, then the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a must.

doc.title: Yum Yum Yum! Great food, cocktails and atmosphere!
doc.review: On our first night in town we headed here for drinks and the food looked so good we stayed for the meal!The drinks were so yummy I think we could have just sat at our candle lit table and sipped them all night. The atmosphere is lovely and the staff was very attentive. We suggest asking the staff what they recommend as they are very professional and know their stuff!The food is kind of spendy but not by Vegas standards..

doc.title: A Fabulous Evening...
doc.review: We were in LV for my Wife's 40th and I had arranged a table at The Eiffel Tower Restuarant based on reviews on TA. I felt that the ambience and location were important for such an occassion. I'd pre booked Champagne and Flowers with the restuarant, all by email. We were sat at the bar whilst our table was readied, and the waitress discreetly confirmed the champagne and flowers were ready. As soon as we were seated (wonderful toable with a view of Bellagio fountains) the waiter appared with the champagne. We had some pre-appitizers and wonderful bread before our starters of Crab salad for me and scallops for my wife. Both beautifully presented and very tasty. We both had steak for main, my wife having filet mignon and myself Beef Wellington. The Gran Marnier Souffle for dessert was out of this world! Overall, the service and the food were world class - I cannot recommend enough.

doc.title: Romantic Afternoon
doc.review: An unexpectedly delightful and delicious lunch. Great views of the strip and the surrounding area (some mountain views in the distance) with the best view of the Bellagio and their fountains. A "surprise" mini-appetizer greeting at elevator followed later in the meal with an intermezzo of custard, gratis of the Chef. Appetizer (Blue Cheese Souffle with Arugula salad) excellent. Lunch crepes and chopped salad, delicious. Fantastic Dark Chocolate Cake beyond words and Triple Fruit Souffle Dessert, outstanding. Accommodating service. Great drinks. Romantic afternoon experience for two...highly recommended. On our "to do again" list, ( next time for dinner).(P.S. Bellagio fountain show begins at 3 pm so book lunch late if possible or dinner to view from table).

doc.title: Not Worth the Visit
doc.review: We went to the Eiffell Tower on a Wed evening with a 7:15 reservations. We were greeted at the elevator and brought to the hostess stand where we were told our table would be a bit and were directed to the bar. We each got a drink and were brought to our table about 30 mins later. We were in no rush so the window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains was great. Our server seemed busy and didn't even acknowledge us for a good 10 mins. When he did arrive he seemed a bit brash. He was very hurried the entire meal and not attentive whatsoever. The sommelier was helpful but chose a wine a bit too light for our palates almost "playing it safe". Our dinners were acceptable for the standards I had put upon the restaurant. I ordered the foie gras which was cooked perfectly but overwhlemed by the fig "compote" sauce. My husband ordered the beef carpaccio which was average. We split the greens with beets which was totally opposite and very lackluster in flavor. I ordered the "surf and turf" if that's what it should be called. It was a petit filet cooked to my medium asking temp and topped off with lump crab meat and again overwhelmed by the sauce. My husband ordered the beef wellington which was consumed by the pastry which became soggy. We didn't order sides as there were none that were very appealing. By this time we skipped dessert and ordered cocktails, I a B-52 on the rocks and my husband a tocai and espresso which was brought out cold and a tuaca instead. We had to flag down our server to correct the mistake who said he brought the correct drink, but then returned knowing he didn't. My husband and I both work at 5 star establishments and I don't think this was worth the visit. There are many other great choices and I wish I had crossed this off the list. Worth having a drink at the bar, but then MOVE ON. It's a definite tourist trap and doesn't appreciate fine food!

doc.title: Worth Every Penny
doc.review: While we were in Las Vegas, eating at the Eiffel Tower was a must. We ended up deciding to go for lunch. There were four of us, on a Wendsay afternoon, and there was no wait at all (We didn't have any reservations). The waiter was excellent, the food and appetizers were wonderful, and the view was magnificent. While it was to windy to see the Bellagio's fountians, we enjoied the view nonetheless. If you are planning a trip to Las Vegas, and want a good meal, then the Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a must.

doc.title: Yum Yum Yum! Great food, cocktails and atmosphere!
doc.review: On our first night in town we headed here for drinks and the food looked so good we stayed for the meal!The drinks were so yummy I think we could have just sat at our candle lit table and sipped them all night. The atmosphere is lovely and the staff was very attentive. We suggest asking the staff what they recommend as they are very professional and know their stuff!The food is kind of spendy but not by Vegas standards..

doc.title: Boor at next table ruined our evening
doc.review: My wife and I ate here December 16, 2007. The view was incredible, our waiter was very attentive and the food was excellent. However, our evening and those at the tables near ours were ruined by the boor at the next table who insisted on shouting everything he had to say. He had a high opinion of himself as evidenced by all his witty stories about his sales prowess. His stories were peppered with profanity.Our waiter was aware of the problem as he apologized to me during our meal. Unfortunately, the management did nothing about this man's loutish behavior. I spoke to our waiter after our meal to emphasize how disappointed we were management had not intervened. He told me the restaurant's manager said there was nothing he could do about the problem. I asked to speak to the manager. I told him how disappointed we were. He said he was not aware of the problem. Either he or the waiter was lying.Needless to say we were disappointed an otherwise fine evening was ruined.

doc.title: Great view bland food
doc.review: Like the tittle states the view was amazing the food was just so so. For $50 I expect lamb chops to have flavor to them.

doc.title: Magical Experience
doc.review: We had reservations, they were ready for us when we arrived. We were celebrating so we got a great table by the window. The veiw was amazing! We were able to watch the Bellagio show every 15 minutes. The service was fabulous! The waiter even brought over a shaw for me when he noticed I was cold. All of our needs were anticipated. Dessert was the best part.

doc.title: Not as good as before
doc.review: This was my 4th. time at this restaurant, the food was great as always, but the prices keep going higher and the restaurant is not what you expect to be. On my other visits they were really strict with attire and this time there were people wearing t-shirts and sneakers, it seems they all care for the money and that's a shame 'cause you're paying for a luxury restaurant that's not anymore. Food was great and service too, just dissapointed for the atmosphere that looks cheap.

doc.title: Boor at next table ruined our evening
doc.review: My wife and I ate here December 16, 2007. The view was incredible, our waiter was very attentive and the food was excellent. However, our evening and those at the tables near ours were ruined by the boor at the next table who insisted on shouting everything he had to say. He had a high opinion of himself as evidenced by all his witty stories about his sales prowess. His stories were peppered with profanity.Our waiter was aware of the problem as he apologized to me during our meal. Unfortunately, the management did nothing about this man's loutish behavior. I spoke to our waiter after our meal to emphasize how disappointed we were management had not intervened. He told me the restaurant's manager said there was nothing he could do about the problem. I asked to speak to the manager. I told him how disappointed we were. He said he was not aware of the problem. Either he or the waiter was lying.Needless to say we were disappointed an otherwise fine evening was ruined.

doc.review: Like the tittle states the view was amazing the food was just so so. For $50 I expect lamb chops to have flavor to them.

We were able to watch the Bellagio show every 15 minutes. The service was fabulous! The waiter even brought over a shaw for me when he noticed I was cold. All of our needs were anticipated. Dessert was the best part.

On my other visits they were really strict with attire and this time there were people wearing t-shirts and sneakers, it seems they all care for the money and that's a shame 'cause you're paying for a luxury restaurant that's not anymore. Food was great and service too, just dissapointed for the atmosphere that looks cheap.

However, our evening and those at the tables near ours were ruined by the boor at the next table who insisted on shouting everything he had to say. He had a high opinion of himself as evidenced by all his witty stories about his sales prowess. His stories were peppered with profanity.Our waiter was aware of the problem as he apologized to me during our meal. Unfortunately, the management did nothing about this man's loutish behavior. I asked to speak to the manager. I told him how disappointed we were. He said he was not aware of the problem. Either he or the waiter was lying.Needless to say we were disappointed an otherwise fine evening was ruined.

doc.review: Like the tittle states the view was amazing the food was just so so. For $50 I expect lamb chops to have flavor to them.

doc.title: Magical Experience
doc.review: We had reservations, they were ready for us when we arrived. We were celebrating so we got a great table by the window. The veiw was amazing! We were able to watch the Bellagio show every 15 minutes. The service was fabulous! The waiter even brought over a shaw for me when he noticed I was cold. All of our needs were anticipated. Dessert was the best part.
