doc.review: This was my 4th. time at this restaurant, the food was great as always, but the prices keep going higher and the restaurant is not what you expect to be. On my other visits they were really strict with attire and this time there were people wearing t-shirts and sneakers, it seems they all care for the money and that's a shame 'cause you're paying for a luxury restaurant that's not anymore. Food was great and service too, just dissapointed for the atmosphere that looks cheap.

doc.title: Best Birthday Dinner Ever!
doc.review: We were just here on November 25th. We ordered the Le Menu and the wine pairing. The food was absolutely amazing and too die for. The wine was perfect and incredible. The views of the Bellagio fountains was nice, but not the main reason we went there. We prepared ourself in advance for the large dinner bill, so we were not shocked. Our waiter was very pleasant and explained each course as needed. I don't know how I will top this birthday dinner any time in the near future.

doc.title: Nice view, bland food
doc.review: I do not understand all the glowing reviews. The restaurant is mediocre at best and all you are paying for is the location view. I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. While we were waiting for our table a lady asked if we would like a drink. My girlfriend said she would like a water. It never came, and the server continued to ask/bring drinks for other waiting customers while she passed us over. Not a big deal, but it seemed intentional and started things out on the wrong foot.The view was excellent and the service was good. That's where it ends. I had the lamb chops which were very bland. My girlfriend had the chicken which was also bland and had skin on, which she had to cut off. We also had mashed potatoes and spinach, both of which had little flavor. The mashed potatoes had no texture or flavor, and if I didn't know better I would say they were of the instant variety out of a box. The bill ended up being $150, which I don't mind paying for a quality meal. The food at the Paris buffet is far, far better.

doc.title: Chef needs a holiday
doc.review: Venue itself is nice. Great views for looking at while you have your meal. Service is ok.My experience with the food was not a good one. I had lunch there with others and they all agree it was just ok. I am not a food critic at all nor am I a picky eater, but I ended up sending my seafood salad back as the shrimp and crab I had did not taste good and when I smelt it, it sent alarm bells off in my head. I understand we are in the middle of the Nevada dessert but I can buy frozen seafood from the super market that taste and smelt better than that! The chef said he did not find anything wrong with the smell of it though!! Unbelievable ! I would have had trouble feeding it to my cat! He obviously has had some nasel surgery in the last few weeks if he thought that it was acceptable. I was offered other food but declined as if the chef could not pick a problem with what I already sent back to the kitchen, I was not going to trust anything else. Not to mention this was the most expensive lunch dish, yet still just a salad.Very poor quality control. Would have sooner eaten a big mac , and I am not a fan of McDonalds! Would definitely not give them repeat business. Truly not a good French restauraunt as the name and written information would suggest. I hope I am not running to the bathroom all night!

doc.title: Amazing Experience
doc.review: Had dinner 10/13/07. Amazing view and atmosphere as I stepped off the elevator into the dining room. Had a wonder table with view. Started with the Peppered Raw Beef with Capers. It was sooo tasty. I ordered the Beef Wellington and Potatoes Gratin, husband ordered the surf and turf (filet with crab meat). Both entrees were delicious. Grand Marnier Souffle for dessert and they brought out a complimentary chocolate mousse as it was our anniversary. Highly recommend eating here. Everything was above my expectations.

doc.title: A fantastic evening
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our wedding here on 1/10/07 as a party of 7. The service was accommodating and attentive but never overpowering and the food and wine of excellent quality. The view was spectacular and was the perfect setting in which to celebrate our marriage. All 7 of us couldn't speak highly enough of the restaurant and would thoroughly recommend it.

doc.title: Great food, FABULOUS service!
doc.review: My fiance and I went here on 9/7/07, 8:30pm res. While on time, the place was packed and we were asked to wait at the bar. $24 for 2 cocktails...I can see why our table "wasn't ready". Meanwhile, everyone (elevator operator, maitre'd, and hostesses) was very polite and went out of their way to escort us around the greeting and bar areas. Once seated, we were greeted by one of the best waiters I have ever encountered, Daniel. If you get him serving your table, consider yourselves lucky. He was extremely polite and well-spoken and plesantly described in detail almost everything that came to our table. I'm not usually one for extra attention, but he was just SO good. While it is a fast paced environment, we never felt hurried and all the servers were very polite. We ordered the tasting menu, which started arriving shortly after ordering. It was all very tasty and high quality. A top 10 meal for me. Unfortunately, right after the meal began my fiance began having severe indigestion. This had been an ongoing problem throughout the trip, so I don't blame ETR's food. We got through the halibut together when she couldn't go any further. This is where this place really shined for us. This was my first trip to Vegas so my fiance wouldn't have us leaving early. Not only did they offer to bag all of my fiances remaining courses (which of course would have been somewhat ridiclous, but it was nice of them to offer), but when we asked them to stop bringing her dishes, they did so graciously and...when the bill came, her food was no where to be seen. We didn't even ask and I was actually expecting to at least pay for something! Additionally, while my fiance was feeling ill the manager came over to check on her numerous times and even went to check on her in the bathroom! Way above and beyond! And the whole time their concern was so sincere and consistent. I really just can't say enough about our experience at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Oh yeah, and the view is amazing. Most couples are seated along the windows, so that's a great plus. I would definitely return, but probably not for a while with all of the options in Vegas.

doc.title: Fabulous culinary experience
doc.review: Do the tasting menu with the wines, if you can afford. Don't do if you regularly eat McDonalds, Kraft mac'n'cheese, micro-meals, and boxed wine.....it'll ruin your palate. Seriously though, for those of you that enjoy wine and food together, do try! Be prepared to throw down some cash. Try to get a spin on the wheel of fortune $5 slot first.

doc.title: Not quite what I expected...
doc.review: We visited the restaurant on 9/28/07. We reserved a table at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant 2 weeks in advance asking for a spectacular table to celebrate an anniversary. The table was spectacular and the food was very good. The service was a bit spotty only because so many levels of waiters served the table. We chose the Tasting Menu - a very good deal for the price. Much of the food needed an explanation and only occasionally did the waiter/waitress provide it. Overall the food and service was good. We won't be going back because the atmosphere did not live up to the multi-star rating. Our expectations of the restaurant ambiance were very high, since we had called the restaurant to change our reservations and overheard the maitre de offering a jacket to a guest. We assumed this meant "jacket required" and all that implies. It didn't. As Vegas veterans, we understand that the old Vegas, where very expensive meals required nice dress and provided an elegant setting are not always the norm! . In an effort to cater to tourist who want to eat in shorts, tennis shoes, jeans and fanny packs, the Eiffel Tower Restaurant feels terribly overpriced and awkward. Go if you don't mind paying at least 300 for a meal with a great view and don't forget your fanny pack!! Finally, a word to the wise, a Martini and Bloody Mary at the bar cost 28.00 - a bit steep for two drinks that were only so-so and a bartender who didn't seem to like his job...

doc.title: Delicious food - great selection
doc.review: We ate here on our last night having only booked a table the night before. We were very happy with the menu choices and the waiting staff are very friendly and helpful. The desserts especially are amazing. My husband chose the Eiffel Tower Chocolate plate - we could have shared it as there were 9 mini deserts on the plate... The view from the restaurant on all sides is great too. Admittedly the prices aren’t cheap, but the food was delicious and along with the atmosphere and views worth it in our opinion for a special occasion.

doc.title: Great View and Great Food
doc.review: My wife and I enjoyed an anniversary dinner at the restaurant on September 5th, 2007. We made our reservations a few months in advance using Opentable.com and requested a table by the windows to enjoy the Belligio fountains. We had many excellent restaurants in LV to choose from and we both agree we chose wisely. Over the course of a two hour meal we enjoyed excellent food, excellent service, and an excellent view of the fountains (as requested), the mountains and the strip. Service was always available but never intrusive and we enjoyed the quiet atmosphere which allowed us to converse with little effort. Be sure to try the rasperry napolean for dessert!!Total bill was around $180. I would rate the restaurant and reserving through [--] as excellent.

doc.title: Great Meal! Not Cheap.
doc.review: I ate at the Eiffel Tower back in Feb. and thought the atmosphere and food was fantastic. A friend of mine with poor taste wanted his filet cooked further and they graciously accomidated his request and also brought a fresh side of potatoes. The prices are high but the portions and quality were outstanding..

doc.title: Excellent atmosphere, service, and food
doc.review: My husband and I enjoyed our experience at the Eiffel Tower restaurant very much. The view from the restaurant is absolutely incredible and we were seated facing the Bellagio and were able to watch the fountain show all through our meal. The wait staff is what I would expect from a fine dining restaurant. They were very attentive and provided us with excellent service. I am always surprised to hear people complain about service at these places when I know firsthand that the wait staff are very good and I have to wonder if these people are just rude people who treat waiters badly. We both ordered the blue cheese souffle for appetizers and it was excellent, light as a cloud. Husband ordered the beef Wellington and I ordered the vegetarian crepe. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they had a mini vegetarian section on the menu with a lovely French dish. A few more vegetarian appetizers would be nice though! Our entrees were very tasty and were surprisingly large portion sizes. I had the banana souffle for dessert, my husband had the apple strudel and we also had the cheese plate. The cheese plate would be better if we could pick our own cheeses from a selection but my souffle was absolutely heavenly. Our lovely waiter added chocolate sauce and vanilla creme to mine since I couldn't decide between the chocolate and banana souffles. We had a very romantic meal and paid approximetely $200 for it without any alcohol since we don't drink. Come eat here if you are looking for a posh, romantic meal. Don't bring your kids though, it's not a kid environment.

doc.title: Appalling experience......
doc.review: 8/12/07 8:15pm reservation booked a month in advance........seated well past 8:30pm.This establishment exists on tourism dollars only. They are not interested in repeat customers. From the maitre d' to the manager. No one is interested in whether you are satisfied with the food or service. Their main interest seems to be how many tables they can turn around as fast as possible. Waiters rushing you to order, trying to get you to place a dessert order with your dinner order. Slamming dishes and drawers and swiping dishes off the table as they sprint by.We ordered a bottle of our favorite wine and the wine steward poured us each a glass and then took the bottle half way across the room and put it in a ice bucket where we didn't have access to it. We had to ask the waiter to get OUR wine and had to insist that he leave it on our table so that we could insure WE were the only diners getting to enjoy it. (it was not a cheap bottle of wine by any means) He seemed upset that we wanted the wine we were paying for. This restaurant is just another ridiculous "tourist trap". If you have ever dined at Morton's, Smith and Wollensky and the like.....you will NOT enjoy the Eiffel experience.

doc.title: Biggest Rip-off in Vegas....
doc.review: Very disappointed and we wish we would have saved our money and time on 7/27/07!! The "French bread" was terrible it was a type of roll that tasted like cheez-it's inside. The food took 45 minutes to come out and the manager came over to apologize but didn't offer anything. My filet mignon was very well done when I ordered medium and it came with "barely there" sides. My husband said it was the worst burger he has ever had and they did not come over one time to ask how our food tasted. I had mentioned to them it was my husband birthday when I made the reservation but they did nothing. Terrible food and terrible service....

doc.title: We Went Back For a Second Time
doc.review: Our first experience at this restaurant wasn't great because of the service. This time, it was exceptional. Ask to be seated in Jorge's section which overlooks the Bellagio Fountains. His service is very attentive and professional. The food was terrific, try the rare beef appetizer, the surf and turf main and don't forget the souffles. The souffles here are expectional. Reserve for late dinner so that you can see the strip lit up at night. The dining room is very well laid out so that every table has great views of the strip and far enough apart that every diner will feel they have lots of space and privacy. A very very special night was had by our group of five. Congrats to the restaurant staff!

doc.title: Delicious! Well Worth it!
doc.review: We ate here on July 18, 2007 and had the most superb meal and experience. Thanks to the most wonderful hostess who was enchanted with our 8 1/2 y.o. daugher, we had the best table in the restaurant. We were there at 4pm to book our reservations, and the day hostess was so enchanted with our daughter she took us up to the kitchen and restaurant for a tour, and saved a 3 table that had great views of the mountains, Bellagion light shows, and everything. It was fabulous. The entire experience was postive our all 3 of us. The food superb, and the entire food server 'team'-all the extras meants alot and you have to save room for dessert. Our bill for the 3 of us was $200.00, but hey, we won't be doing it again anytime soon,and the entire meal was worth every penny!

doc.title: Great service and great food!
doc.review: My husband and I ate dinner here on 7/7 and found it to be a really enjoyable experience. I was nervous because the reviews seemed mixed, but everything was great! We had a 6:00 reservation, but we were running late (long, irrelevant story!), so we called at 5:50 to tell them we would be there about 10-15 minutes late. They were very kind about it when we finally arrived and immediately showed us to a table - a great couples table overlooking the Bellagio fountains! We had 7:30 tickets to "O" at Bellagio (see review for that as well!) and as we were running late, we immediately told our waiter. He was not at all fussy about it, just told us he'd get us out of there in time. So we ordered quickly, and the food was brought out in great time. It wasn't the leisurely, slow meal we had hoped for, but still great timing considering our situation. We both had the filet mignon as our main course, which was quite tasty. We even had time to enjoy a wonderful souffle - definitely get the chocolate souffle here! So good! I would also recommend a port with the souffle. We asked the waiter to pick for us, and he picked a great one! Again - we thoroughly enjoyed our experience and arrived at the show just in time! My husband and I are 26/24 respectively and just normal, middle class people, so I was concerned about the reviews I read about stuffy waiters and staff - but that was not our experience! Try this place out if you want a nice, romantic dinner that is unique to the strip because of the cool Bellagio view!

doc.title: way over priced, not that great
doc.review: I really cannot believe this place is getting such great reviews. We spent over 500.00 and both had the chef's menus. The food was really terrible, and I like French food. I was so disappointed.There are so many great restaurants in Vegas and I really feel like I made a bad decision. Never again!! What a ripoff.

doc.title: Great Restaurant with a Great View
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated my birthday at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in July, 2007. The food was very good. My huband ordered the Roasted Rack of Lamb w/Tarragon Jus and I had the Baked Atlantic Salmon w/ Champagne, Ginger and Brown Butter, with asparagus sprinkled with parmesan cheese and potatoes au gratin. We accompanied our meal with two glasses of fine wine and we had the Grand Marnier souffle and two coffees for dessert, all for under $200 including tip. We did not want to spend our whole budget in one restaurant, plus we had made reservations in various restaurants throughout our stay. The "Sampler Menu" must be ordered by two people and you must like to eat meat as well. I do not eat meat so this would not have worked for me. Table 56 is the nicest table in our opinion, the Bellagio Fountains have spectacular performances throughout your meal, it is an added touch. Enjoy!

doc.title: Go all out and try the tasting menu.
doc.review: My dining companion and I decided to go all out and order the seven course tasting menu with wine pairings. We were not disappointed. Don't make the mistake in thinking that seven courses are way too much to eat. Each course is a smaller version of their regular entree items and the dinner is well paced by the attentive wait staff. The wine pairings were outstanding as expected. Very nice room with terrific views of the Strip and Bellagio fountains. Yes, it is expensive. Over $400 for the two of us, but the casino was comping the dinner. Highly recommended!

doc.title: Excellent fine dining
doc.review: The wife and I had the opporunity to dine here recently. The food wasfantastic. The service was fine, no complaints there. The view was beautiful, we were able to see the fountain show from the Bellagio throughout dinner.

doc.title: Nice, but overpriced
doc.review: We knew this was going to be an expensive night out, but since we were celebrating my mom's 75th birthday, we wanted it to be special. They gave us a nice corner booth, but I would have preferred a better view of the Bellagio fountains. It was very hot in the restaurant. My husband and my dad had to take off their sportcoats to cool down. The food quality was excellent, but the fish dishes are way overpriced. The filet mignon was awesome, and was a large portion. Two of us had fish entrees which were good, but not worth what we paid ($35 for halibut). If I ever go back I would definitely order the filet mignon or the veal, since those were much better values for the price.The souffle for dessert was great, and they brought another dessert on the house for my mom's birthday. Service was inpeccable!

doc.title: Got $$$?
doc.review: Dined there this past weekend and had a delicious meal. I got the filet mingon with mashed pottoes and my girlfriend got the veal, both were excellent. The souffle was good, but not the greatest ever. The service was great from the moment we stepped in and since we had reservations (through [--]) and arrived a little bit early, we were seated right away. As requested, we were seated at a table next to the window with a great view of the Bellagio. Our waiter was fantastic and made our meal even better with his personality.I'm not really used to spending an upwards of $75 a head at dinner, but in no way do I feel ripped off or taken advantage of. Going into dinner I knew it would be expensive. I think people who complain fail to realize that with the price of the food (while it tasted great, the portions were a little small) you are also paying for the atmosphere and location in which this restaurant is one of a kind.

doc.title: Wondeful!
doc.review: My wife and I looked at many restaurants on the internet, in Vegas. We wanted something special and got it! We made a reservation online several weeks before we left home. I made a note on the reservation that it was our 10th wedding anniversary and asked for a window seat if possible. Most tables by the window are actually for couples but there were several that weren't. When you step out of the elevator, the first thing you see is the kitchen. A nice touch actually because you can see the food being prepared very professionally. We checked in and were shown our table almost immediately. Nice tableby the window, as requested. Almost opposite the fountains of Bellagio. Unfortunately we picked the wrong night! No fountains because of the high winds, so that was a shame. Mostly waiters but we were served by a very polite and knowledgeable waitress. There was a choice of the chef's menu at $98 each or your own choice from the menu. The Chef's menu looked great actually but I don't think my wife could have eaten it all! So we chose from the usual menu. What can I say? The food was amazing! Very professionally served and presented and tasted just wonderful. The waitress was always on hand if we needed her but never 'in your face.'Here's the extra nice touch...she asked if we were celebrating anything and I told her it was our anniversary. A little while later,we were presented with an amazing desert, compliments of her and her team, on a special anniversary plate, on the house! An amazing experience and just about the best restaurant we have ever been to.Our meals came to almost $100 each, including drinks. Could be a lot more if you have the wine but my wife doesn't drink and I can't finish a bottle on my own! Very reasonable prices for the best restaurant on the strip! We highly recommend the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.

doc.title: Meal with a view
doc.review: Our meal at the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Casino recently was excellent. The service was great and the view of the Bellagio fountains was gorgeous. A great experience. We chose the prix fixe meal and we were delighted with the food and especially the souffle for dessert.

doc.title: Perfect setting, service but expensve for what you get
doc.review: My biggest complaint, no cork fee allowed, and they sell a 45 dollar bottle of wine for 120.00. If you are not concerned about pricing then this is a good choice. Great environment. Two people and a bottle of wine and tip you are at $450.00 easy.

doc.title: Not So Magnifique
doc.review: We made reservations a week before for Saturday night prime reservation (use tabletop.com) having looked over the menu first so it was not a surprise how expensive the meal was.We were staying at the Bellagio so it was a quick walk across the street up to the elevator for the 11th floor (I think) restaurant.Perhaps because our party consisted of 3 middle-aged ladies we were shuffled off to the bar where we had to wait 20 minutes for our confirmed res. The Kir Royal hit the spot but at $20 a pop I was stunned when the bartendered grabbed our glasses and ordered us to pay up before we went to our table. Tres rude.Our table for three was lovely looking out to the fountains at Bellagio but our waiter was a bit put out to have to service us. The prix fixe menu was $98 per person which seemed high but I think you might want to consider it as the a la carte bill came out to more than that with a lot less food. The food was very good - we all had the filet mignon and each had a veggie side (at 8.95 a dish!!). The escargots app was a little different - served over risotto with yummy mushrooms but the merlot house wine was so awful we left it ($10.00 for a 1/3 filled glass !!) The waiter didn't like that we refused the Grand Marinier souffle he was hawking during the meal (the chef had to know right then so they could get them started) we had read they were $24.95 a pop so we decided to go elsewhere for desert.There was a problem with the bill where the waiter had undercharged us by over $100 dollars and when we pointed this out to him he was PUT OUT and never once thanked us for picking up his mistake. I wish we would have left him in the bag for the $100 but my friends are much nice than me! Although being abused by waiters is authentically Parisian we don't ever intend to go back to Paris, Las Vegas

doc.title: Best meal on the west side of the Atlantic
doc.review: Service without peer. A 'just-so' bar that makes great drinks well. Stunning views of the strip and the hills. Not trendy, but classic, with attentive and courteous staff who exceed expectations at every turn, and food preparation and presentation that is second to none. For two, with a classic bottle of the Loire Valley's best wine from a great vintage, we paid US$ 300, including the tip. We will do it again when we return.

doc.title: Pay for the ride up the tower for the view-then dine ELSEWHERE
doc.review: We "dined" at this restaurant this past Saturday (Feb. 3rd)This was our second time. Last time was expensive, but the service, the food, the view all well worth it. We couldn't wait to return.What a dissapointment! The whole atmosphere is different now.For one thing it is very, loud with nonstop clanging dishes like a Denny's or a truckstop diner. When we were finally sat (yes, we did have reservations) we realized why. They have bus stations set up in full view of the diners inches from your table! They proceed to rattle silver and stack dirty dishes right beside you.We actually asked to move when we realized this was also to be an employee gathering spot. Our new table was only slighty better. I tried to focus on the beautiful view outside instead of paying attention when they scraped plates of leftover food into the bus tub beside me. Our waiter continually addressed us in Spanish, not sure why- though we both do have dark hair? Then he proceeded to reach directly in front of my face to grab a plate he wanted. He knew this is rude, he apologized for his reach but did it anyway . Then later did it again to get salt and pepper shaker off table.They sure seem in a hurry now to turn those tables.Food was very good. We had the salmon, 2 different ways. I didn't order much else, I was kind of sorry we didn't just leave, and at this point I only half joking told my husband "with this place if mine isn't enough I guess it will be okay just to grab what I want off of your plate!, it won't matterNothing spectacular, and for these prices it should be.Do yourself a favor read all of these reviews before you eat here.I don't think they care if you return or not. We wont- not ever!Can highly reccommend "Jasmine" across the street at Bellagio. Great food, beautiful view of fountains,beautiful restaurant, quiet romantic setting. Not cheap. But you will not feel taken advantage of .

doc.title: Good view, mediocre food
doc.review: We visited this restaurant on Jan 15th. As we had been in Paris a year earlier, it was an easy choice. Paris it is not. Most of the two person tables have a view of the Bellagio fountain light show. I am jaded, but it was a great distraction - and we needed some distraction.We both ordered the "tasting menu" from the waiter was distracted hoping to be discovered by some talent scout. He did nothing to make our meal memorable. He was a thorough non-entity. At least in Paris, waiters are said to be surl (I have never had surly), but good. Sub-waiters bring you your food as quickly as possible. Never the same person. No chance for human interaction, efficient, but sterile.The food. There were two seafood courses. Whoever was doing the cooking was either falling asleep or left the food on to smoke. Both the scallops and the sea bass were beyond overcooked. The chef also created a fig dish that was simply a well-executed unbalanced dish. We love figs, this was bad. When all hope was vanishing, the venison course arrived and was marvelous (we are not particularly venison eaters, but this was great). The dessert that was heavily pushed and "their specialty" by now we were dubious was the souffles. I ordered Grand Marnier and my bride a pistachio - each was heavenly.Would we go back - never. If you would like a dinner of venison and souffle, give it a try. Do not expect service good or bad, the food come and the plates go, but the staff personalities were left at the door.

doc.title: Great Service, Good food, Noisy
doc.review: This restaurant has great service, and we had a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountains, so the view was spectacular. My husband and I ordered the Filet Mignon. The steak was good but not the best I ever had. The sides were ok (spinach and Au gratin potatoes). The restaurant was loud. It was a nice experience, but I would choose another restaurant when I go back.

doc.title: Best place for celebratory dinner
doc.review: This is our favorite place to dine in Vegas. The combination of excellent food, service, atmosphere, and views make dining at the Eiffel Tower a memorable experience. To be able to sit for a wonderful meal and watch the strip below and the fountains at Bellagio is breathtaking and truly a treasure. We have very fond memories of this place and highly recommend it!

doc.title: Perfect!!!
doc.review: I took my girlfriend for a surprise birthday weekend to Las Vegas and was looking for something special for dinner. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was PERFECT! Yes, it is going to cost you more then TGI Fridays but come on... this is Las Vegas - spend a few bucks and have a wonderful evening.I let the reservation desk know that we were celebrating a birthday and I was assured that we would have a wonderful table. The small romantic table over-looking the strip and Belliago fountains was excellent. The service was second to none. The food was amazing. The chef invited us into the kitchen for a wonderful birthday photo with him. Made for a very memorable evening.If you are looking for cheap Las Vegas dining this is not the place. But, if you are looking for Las Vegas sophisticated cuisine and an extensive wine list with impeccible service this is the place. Make reservations and plan for a fantastic evening of food, wine and service. WORTH EVERY PENNY.

doc.title: Fantabulous!
doc.review: We dined at this restaurant to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday. It was splendid! They did everything to make this occasion one of the most spectacular and enjoyable meals ever. The food...oh my god...is out of this world! Every bite was brilliant. The waiter knew what to suggest and the chef complimented everything to our taste. The atmosphere, the entire staff and the food are the best in Las Vegas. It was a phenomenal dining and celebratory experience. ...Bravo.

doc.title: Memorable Experience
doc.review: Dined at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant on December 9th to celebrate my companions birthday. The food was excellent and the service impeccable. I had made reservations in advance and informed the Maitre'D of the celebration. They insured that we had a table with an excellent view of the Bellagio Fountain Show and provided my companion a complimentary dessert to wish her a Happy Birthday. As an aside, the reservatioins were made through a link on the Eiffel Tower Restaurant site that provides an option to order flowers delivered at the restaurant. The flowers were waiting (a beautiful arrangement) on the table upon our arrival and managed to bring a tear to the lady's eyes. The meal was excellent (I had the Filet Mignon and she the Rack of Lamb) and prepared just as we had ordered. We both had the Cream of Sorrel soup and were pleasantly surprised (it was a new dish for the both of us). As with all restaurants of this caliber, the prices are high. However, they were not as high as I had expected (or budgeted) and (in my opinion) well worth the experience. I especially appreciated the fact that (unlike so many other restaurants and/or venues in Vegas) there was no photographer at the door or walking around taking pictures. Their policy is, if you want pictures you'll have to bring your own camera and take them yourself. All in all, a memorable birthday and dining experience and well worth another trip.

doc.title: Foodie Heaven - Tourists, hit the buffet instead!
doc.review: I warn you before reading this: If you think the Vegas buffets represent fine dining, or you seek out the 'best deal' opportunities, then DO NOT bother with this restaurant! If, however, you are a "foodie", part of that small percent of the travelling public that appreciates food as love, and presentation and service as high art, then you are in for a treat.I cannot believe I dismissed this restaurant for so long based on location. You know the old axiom- restaurants with a view charge you for just that and provide food out of mere obligation. That's why I steer clear of the highrise dining establishments In most cities.One exception of course would be Everest, in Chicago. And it was to my surprise to discover that this establishment, like Everest is a product of Chef Joho and Letuce Entertain You.Well, suffice to say, they did not disapoint. From the time our party of three was seated at a table that provided what can only be described as an overwhelming view of The Bellagio Fountains, until we finished our final desert treat several HOURS later, this experience was one to remember.The staff was top notch. The menu was esceptional. The food was divine. The wine was superior. The experience was as good as it gets.In searching my mind for a single drawback, I must stretch. And it goes back to my original disclaimer. There is a large portion of the clientelle that doesn't get it. So, if the thought of a leisurely meal, where neither the passage of time, nor the elevation of your final tab is of concern, then this IS the place for you. However, if dinner is something you want to Grab before hitting the slots, or cashing on on free show ticket you received with your package deal, do both yourself and the true foodies who should be at this establishment a favor and hit the buffett instead.In summary, I cannot give a higher endorsement to ANY restaurant I have ever been to in my life- IF you are the right person. IF you are a foodie like me, then stop looking- you have found what you are after.Enjoy!

doc.title: Nice View, over priced food, but good.
doc.review: First thing is when the waiter asks if you want tap or bottled water say tap!!! It cost 8 bucks to get a bottle of water. The salads cost 17 bucks, a glass of wine is 12 bucks. Ice tea was 7 bucks and not bad, served in a real nice bottle. I had the ribeye steak and it was good, but I have had better at Houstons in Pasadena and Boston. My wife had a chicken brest that was just so-so. The view was great, we saw theree Bellagio water shows from the the table, it was great. The bottom line is that we will not go there again, we spent $180 bucks and You can do much better.

doc.title: stunning views
doc.review: Slight chaos in holding area waiting for our table. Had a top martini while waiting though. Excellent table with stunning views over the Bellagio fountains. The food was Nouvelle cuisine meets American portions. Very enjoyable food. Amazing wine list. Somewhat expensive but the view was priceless.

doc.title: Just OK
doc.review: Great view. Ok Food. Weak Service.

doc.title: Awesomely Fantastic!!!!
doc.review: If you want to experience the most incredible service, meal and ambiance then make it a priority to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant! My husband and I had our reception dinner there on Oct 28, 2006 and it is an experience I will never forget! The staff is impeccable and the cuisine is to die for!

doc.title: Nice not great, expensive service so-so, but then you are at the Eiffel Tower.
doc.review: We went and the food was O.K.The foie gras was extremely expensive $ 25 for an appetizer, and it was not good at all, extremelly creamy and with no taste.Rib Eye was good.We waited a lot for desserts. The Souffle was good.

doc.title: Beautiful view
doc.review: Very beautiful view.We had made resv 3 months prior and asked for a specific table but the hostess (really rude ) said our request could not be honored because management had given our table to a high roller? Very very expensive menu. We had a very good meal and at least we got seated by the window. Great for a special night!

doc.title: For something special
doc.review: My husband and I were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. It was our last night in Vegas, our kids were with a babysitter and we wanted to do something special. This was one of the best restaurant experiences we have ever had. The view was amazing - watching the Bellagio fountains every 15 minutues. The food, service everything was great. We would especially recommend the souffles - to die for!!! It's not cheap but heh there's not many restaurants in Vegas that offer that view and great food. They gave us a complimentary dessert for our anniversary - much appreciated. A tiny criticism - the meals came really quickly (probably abit too quickly), they want you in and out in a reasonable time frame. We were never put under obvious pressure - it was subtle. At the end of the day it didn't worry us because we wanted to stroll the strip etc but if you want to sit for a while you may be quietly encouraged not to.

doc.title: Excellent
doc.review: We went to the Eiffel Tower restaurant for our wedding anniversary with some trepidation hoping that we had made a good choice.On arrival we were greeted and whisked up to the restaurant with a short wait while our table was prepared, once ready we were seated which gave us a great view of the Bellagio fountains. To start I chose the duck followed by the lamb and mashed potato. My wife had the Camembert and followed it with organic chicken and we ordered a raspberry souffle to finish and it was at this point I was glad my wife was full so I didn't have to share.Service was fantastic and I couldn't find any fault with this restaurant. We paid just over $300 for our meal including taxes and a bottle of Champagne.

doc.title: Wow! What an experience!
doc.review: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is one restaurant where I'm glad I splurged and spent as much money as I did for a phenomenal meal...My girlfriend and I decided to splurge and try their tasting menu - $98/person for a 7-course meal. It's more than we've ever spent on a fine meal, but to be able to try a little bit of everything and enjoy it all made it so much more rewarding. Not to mention that we were also seated at a corner window table, overlooking the Bellagio (and the fountains) and the northern half of The Strip. The service was phenomenal as well, as our server, Maria, was very friendly and knowledgeable. It's definitely the type of place to save for a special occasion, as this was one time I had no problem spending almost $300 (including a bottle of wine as well as tax, but before gratuity) on a meal because it was totally worth every penny...We had very high expectations for this meal and were thrilled that it exceeded our expectations!!!

doc.title: Very Romantic, Breathtaking View!
doc.review: My husband I had delicious salads. He ordered clams for an appetizer and loved them. We both ordered a vegetarian dish, which was just OK. But who cares? The real story is the view. We had a small table in the corner overlooking the Bellagio fountains, which was so amazing! All night long we were giddy with joy. The view, the service, the ambiance. Such a treat! See photos: Table With A View, Paris Balloon

doc.title: Delightful experience
doc.review: Great food, Fun view of the Belaggio fountains, good service, and worth the trip. This is one of the few quiet spots that you can enjoy the food and view simultaneously.

doc.title: C'est fantastique!
doc.review: We went to this restaurant for my husbands birthday in Jun 2006, it was fantastic! We had the Grand Seafood Platter for two, including Lobster, Shrimp, Crab, Oysters and Clams which was huge! The main course of Surf and Turf, Beef Tenderloin with Lump Crab Crust, was also very good. For dessert we had the Eiffel Tower Soufflés (I had the Grand Marnier and my husband had the chocolate), these had to be ordered at the start of the meal to allow the appropriate cooking time and were absolutely to die for!!!With front view seats for the Bellagio fountain spectacular this really was the perfect setting for a special occasion, they even wrote Happy Birthday on my husbands dessert plate. The service was great, very attentive. The wine list was very good. This was an expensive meal but definitely worth the cost - all in all a fantastic experience.

doc.title: Nothing comes close.
doc.review: Not only is the restaurant situated in the Eiffel tower replica at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas which has exceptional views of the Strip it also has the best food. If you make your reservations early enough you can get a window seat and watch the fountains at Bellagio, it so such a beautiful view. The food is second to none and the service is always great.Keep in mind this is not a cheap restaurant by any means, proper dress attire is a must and all meals are served a la carte.

doc.title: Amazing, Just Amazing
doc.review: Took my wife to the Eiffel Tower resturant for our anniversary. Let me tell you, in one word, AMAZING. Booked reservations online a month prior, and called to confirm 4 days in advance to make sure nothing was amiss. Arrived to Paris by limo and walked inside to private elevator/reservations desk. Lady at desk was very friendly. Went up the elevator and was greeted by a hostess who walked you to the lounge and bar area. We arrived 10 minutes prior to our reservation time, so we had a cocktail. Then our hostess came over, wished us Happy Anniversary and proceeded to escort us to our table. It was the Best Table in the House!!! They sat us at the front Corner Table with breathtaking views of the strip and of the Lake infront of the Bellagio. The water show every few minutes was a joy to behold while drinking our wine. The Waiter was outstanding, and the Food was Top Notch. From the Main Lobster appetizer until the final sip of after dinner coffee, the entire experience was picture perfect. Though we have never stayed at the Paris Hotel and Casino (generally Venetian, Bellagio or Mandalay Bay), due to the service we experienced at this resturant, our next stay (in a few months) will be at Paris, and of course Diner at the Eiffel Tower!!!

doc.title: Great view - skip the food, go for a cocktail!
doc.review: The view from the restaurant is truly amazing. About 5 years ago, a few of us went up for cocktails before going out to dinner at another restaurant. GREAT atmosphere to order a small apetizer at the bar and enjoy a cocktail with an outstanding view.A year later, I surprised my husband with dinner reservations there for our anniversary. The view...again, outstanding. But, the food was very average. Not worth the price with all the other great chefs/restaurant choices in Vegas.So...I recommend just going up for some cocktails, and then go eat elsewhere.

doc.title: Outstanding Evening
doc.review: This is one of the outstanding Las Vegas dining experiences. Food, service and the view were all outstanding. While it was very busy, the staff were attentive with their team service. We will definitely return.

doc.title: Try to find Brett if you ike wine bargains
doc.review: Dinner was great.Even better, one of the sommelliers, Brett, guided us thru the wine list. Brett suggested a zin to start (only $69) that I never would have picked but which was very nice. I have since picked it up locally at about $9/bottle. But you are eating at the Eiffel tower.Next we moved on to one of their proprietor's reserve cabs. Very nice and also affordable. Again a wine I would not have picked.During dinner, one of other guests was unhappy with the white wine by the glass. Brett replaced it with a pinot gris that was a real hit. No charge.At this point we were putty in his hands. He recommended a very nice desert wine. It was probably the best choice of the night. My only regret is that when we went to search him out to say thanks, he had gone home for an emergency. Dinner was great. Including the escargot on white corn appetizer.Bring nice people, find Brett, have a great time.

doc.title: Not as good as it used to be
doc.review: When I dined there in 2003, it was "Excellent". Now the food was above average. Prices have gone up 20-23%, quality has gone down. I feel that it no longer is worth the price, $90+ pps. $14 (3/4 glass)for a inexpensive glass of wine. It is poured in a oversized wine glass, but still not a full serving for even a normal glass.Great view and good service. The same view can be had the the lounge next door to the restaurant.

doc.title: Nothing comes close.
doc.review: Not only is the restaurant situated in the Eiffel tower replica at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas which has exceptional views of the Strip it also has the best food. If you make your reservations early enough you can get a window seat and watch the fountains at Bellagio, it so such a beautiful view. The food is second to none and the service is always great.Keep in mind this is not a cheap restaurant by any means, proper dress attire is a must and all meals are served a la carte.

Lady at desk was very friendly. Went up the elevator and was greeted by a hostess who walked you to the lounge and bar area. We arrived 10 minutes prior to our reservation time, so we had a cocktail. Then our hostess came over, wished us Happy Anniversary and proceeded to escort us to our table. It was the Best Table in the House!!! They sat us at the front Corner Table with breathtaking views of the strip and of the Lake infront of the Bellagio. The water show every few minutes was a joy to behold while drinking our wine. The Waiter was outstanding, and the Food was Top Notch. From the Main Lobster appetizer until the final sip of after dinner coffee, the entire experience was picture perfect. Though we have never stayed at the Paris Hotel and Casino (generally Venetian, Bellagio or Mandalay Bay), due to the service we experienced at this resturant, our next stay (in a few months) will be at Paris, and of course Diner at the Eiffel Tower!!!

GREAT atmosphere to order a small apetizer at the bar and enjoy a cocktail with an outstanding view.A year later, I surprised my husband with dinner reservations there for our anniversary. The view...again, outstanding. But, the food was very average. Not worth the price with all the other great chefs/restaurant choices in Vegas.So...I recommend just going up for some cocktails, and then go eat elsewhere.

doc.review: This is one of the outstanding Las Vegas dining experiences. Food, service and the view were all outstanding. While it was very busy, the staff were attentive with their team service. We will definitely return.

But you are eating at the Eiffel tower.Next we moved on to one of their proprietor's reserve cabs. Very nice and also affordable. Again a wine I would not have picked.During dinner, one of other guests was unhappy with the white wine by the glass. Brett replaced it with a pinot gris that was a real hit. No charge.At this point we were putty in his hands. He recommended a very nice desert wine. It was probably the best choice of the night. My only regret is that when we went to search him out to say thanks, he had gone home for an emergency. Dinner was great. Including the escargot on white corn appetizer.Bring nice people, find Brett, have a great time.

doc.title: Not as good as it used to be
doc.review: When I dined there in 2003, it was "Excellent". Now the food was above average. Prices have gone up 20-23%, quality has gone down. I feel that it no longer is worth the price, $90+ pps. $14 (3/4 glass)for a inexpensive glass of wine. It is poured in a oversized wine glass, but still not a full serving for even a normal glass.Great view and good service. The same view can be had the the lounge next door to the restaurant.

doc.title: Expensive and I have had better in Miami for less
doc.review: Was looking forward to dining at Eiffel Tower in Las Vegas because I had read about their lobster thermidor ($49). Was disappointed with the food and their prices. Miami has much better cuisine for less the price!

doc.title: Food "no"; view "yes"
doc.review: We dined at the Eiffel Tower in November 2005. Prior to dinner, we had drinks at the bar. The view is lovely, looking out over the Bellagio and the water show on its lake. We were seated for dinner on time, with 100% attention to our request for a table with a view. After this point, I cannot recommend this restaurant. My husband and I both agreed that the waiter and waitstaff were decidedly uninterested. My meal (sea bass) was badly flavored; in fact, I ate only half of it and I typically clean my plate. In fairness, I have to say that my husband enjoyed his salmon. I, however, would NOT go back. After dinner, we went to Mon Ami Gabi downstairs in Paris Hotel for a drink and we both wished that we had eaten there -- it looked absolutely charming.

doc.title: Expensive, great food but worth it?
doc.review: Easy way to do this is pros and consProsGreat food Great wine listGreat serviceGreat experienceConsBig time expensive - 4 people plus wine $550 plus tipSome staff too full of themselvesOnly people who get the good views are the couples on the front row - all other tables are restricted and in some cases very restricted.

doc.title: Vacation Highlight
doc.review: I can't believe there is only 1 review of this restaurant. We had to make a last minute decision about dinner last Saturday and we chose this restaurant based on it's location. The restaurant sits many floors up directly accross from the Bellogio. The water show can be veiwed throughout dinner. The food was exceptional and the service 5 star. I would expect that based on the price and they didn't dissappoint. My husband and I both had the tasting menu. I had several glasses of wine throughout the courses reccomended by our server to compliment the food. WOW. The food was very fresh, very flavorful. The whole experience was so much fun and very romantic. The price? $300.00 That includes 3 glasses of wine, 3 beer's, tax and gratuity. This dinner was worth every penny and a highlight of our trip. The authentic french chocolate souffle at the end of the meal was to die for. Oh, and I asked about attire (my husband is SO not pretentious). They said jeans and a nice dress shirt were fine, which made him happy. We would return there for dinner.

doc.title: Great service and ambience
doc.review: My husband and I went for an anniversary dinner. Cocktails were $12-14 dollars. Not bad for the ambience and view. Appetizers, drinks and dinner were $150 for the two of us. Skip dessert- they bring you a tray of sweets. I told the waiter how much I love chocolate and he emptied the tray on our plate. I asked where the ladies room was- the waiter escorted me there and opened the door for me! Service was excellent- the view priceless. Many restaurants on the strip were more expensive- without the view or service! If you're trying to save money- play the penny slots downstairs, have a couple free glasses of wine, eat lots of the bread and skip dessert and coffee. After dinner go watch the fountains and have your dessert at the Bellagio.

doc.title: Perfect Special Occasion Restaurant
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our 25th Anniversary here. The food was outstanding, sevice magnificent, and our table had a view of the water show at Bellagio. They went out of their way to make our dinner here a memorable event. The price was a little more than we usually spend on special occasion dinners, but I think being married for 25 yrs justified the price. We would definately return on another special occasion.

doc.title: Very romantic and memorable
doc.review: I ate here with my wife on her birthday. We were asked to wait at the bar as we arrived 10 minutes early. Two cocktails $25 +tip. Soon after, we were seated directly in front of the window (only tables for two are against the windows, larger tables are set back abit). We had an amazing view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. Very memorable and breathtaking. Yes, you are paying for the view. Of course you are, But the food and service were also excellent. Appetizers, as in most higher end restaurants are too small and way overpriced. Entrees portions were larger and our choices were delicious. Complaints? not many, only minor.. they never offered more coffee and when my wife left for the restroom, her napkin was left just as she left it. Like I said minor complaints. The verdict...2 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 side dishes (potatos/spinach), 1 glass of wine, 1 cappucino, 1 coffee...= $200+tip. This restaurant is great for memorable occasions which you don't want to forget. I reccommend it!

doc.title: Expensive and I have had better in Miami for less
doc.review: Was looking forward to dining at Eiffel Tower in Las Vegas because I had read about their lobster thermidor ($49). Was disappointed with the food and their prices. Miami has much better cuisine for less the price!

We were seated for dinner on time, with 100% attention to our request for a table with a view. After this point, I cannot recommend this restaurant. My husband and I both agreed that the waiter and waitstaff were decidedly uninterested. My meal (sea bass) was badly flavored; in fact, I ate only half of it and I typically clean my plate. In fairness, I have to say that my husband enjoyed his salmon. I, however, would NOT go back. After dinner, we went to Mon Ami Gabi downstairs in Paris Hotel for a drink and we both wished that we had eaten there -- it looked absolutely charming.

The authentic french chocolate souffle at the end of the meal was to die for. Oh, and I asked about attire (my husband is SO not pretentious). They said jeans and a nice dress shirt were fine, which made him happy. We would return there for dinner.

doc.title: Great service and ambience
doc.review: My husband and I went for an anniversary dinner. Cocktails were $12-14 dollars. Not bad for the ambience and view. Appetizers, drinks and dinner were $150 for the two of us. Skip dessert- they bring you a tray of sweets. I told the waiter how much I love chocolate and he emptied the tray on our plate. I asked where the ladies room was- the waiter escorted me there and opened the door for me! Service was excellent- the view priceless. Many restaurants on the strip were more expensive- without the view or service! If you're trying to save money- play the penny slots downstairs, have a couple free glasses of wine, eat lots of the bread and skip dessert and coffee. After dinner go watch the fountains and have your dessert at the Bellagio.

doc.title: Perfect Special Occasion Restaurant
doc.review: My husband and I celebrated our 25th Anniversary here. The food was outstanding, sevice magnificent, and our table had a view of the water show at Bellagio. They went out of their way to make our dinner here a memorable event. The price was a little more than we usually spend on special occasion dinners, but I think being married for 25 yrs justified the price. We would definately return on another special occasion.

doc.title: Very romantic and memorable
doc.review: I ate here with my wife on her birthday. We were asked to wait at the bar as we arrived 10 minutes early. Two cocktails $25 +tip. Soon after, we were seated directly in front of the window (only tables for two are against the windows, larger tables are set back abit). We had an amazing view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. Very memorable and breathtaking. Yes, you are paying for the view. Of course you are, But the food and service were also excellent. Appetizers, as in most higher end restaurants are too small and way overpriced. Entrees portions were larger and our choices were delicious. Complaints? not many, only minor.. they never offered more coffee and when my wife left for the restroom, her napkin was left just as she left it. Like I said minor complaints. The verdict...2 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 side dishes (potatos/spinach), 1 glass of wine, 1 cappucino, 1 coffee...= $200+tip. This restaurant is great for memorable occasions which you don't want to forget. I reccommend it!

doc.title: top drawer
doc.review: best french food my wife or i have ever had, and we've dined in the best of the big cities. cannot say enough about this place. very pricey but if you have a sophisticated palate, possibly the best meal you'll ever have.

doc.title: Wonderful view, o.k. food, overpriced........
doc.review: In my opinion, you are paying for the view at this restaraunt, not the food. for the two of us, it was around $110. IT was paybe a $50 diner. Food was just o.k. There are a lot betterp laces in Vegas at this price range.

doc.title: As good as a top rated NYC restaurant
doc.review: Our dinner was exceptional. Perfect service, diverse menu, lovely views, and most importantly, the food was great! May be a bit pricey, but we saw that everywhere we dined in Vegas. I would assume most of that food is coming a far way to be on those plates.Our whole experience was perfect, and we even got to watch the fountain show at the Bellagio.There was a table next to us that did not fair as well. They struggled to find anything on the menu they wanted, and the woman in the end was not happy with her food. The waiter immediately wanted to take the plate away and get her anything off the menu she wanted, on the house. She refused, I thought she was crazy. But the waiter was great, "we don't want you to have a bad experience. We don't want you to sit there and eat something you don't like." But she still would have none of it. In the end they looked very unhappy when they left. But I think it said a lot of the staff and management about how hard they tried to accomodate.But our foie gras, escargots, rack of lamb, filet mignon with foie gras and sizable chocolate souffle just rocked. Yes I was that happy! Last bit, the sommelier was very helpful and checked on us through the meal to make sure all was well with our wine.

doc.title: Wonderful romantic meal
doc.review: In Vegas for my 40th birthday this past weekend we decided to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant based on personal recommendations and reviews on sites like this. After reading some of the comments on the quality of the food, I was hesitant to spend the money, but we opted to go for it for the romantic ambience and the amazing view of the of the Bellagio fountains. We were not disappointed. In fact, I would say the food was fabulous. We both had a delectable meal with top notch service. From the bread, to appetizer, main course and desserts, everything was flawless, and we've eaten at some of the best restaurants in NYC. Our waiter, Charles, was classy, attentive and knowledgable. Our view was absolutely spectacular - the fountains at night are a sight to behold. Even without hearing the music, it was magical. The prices are steep, it was the most expensive meal we've ever had in 15 years together. But also, now, one of the most memorable. I would highly recommend it based on the food, view and ambience - the combination would be difficult to find elsewhere on the strip. For a very special occasion or to really impress someone special, splurge - you'll be happy you did!

doc.title: "wedding special"
doc.review: My husband and i had a fabulous meal here after we got married in vegas,they reserved the best table in the house as they knew it was an xtra special occasion.It was the best meal we have ever had,fois gras,veal and filet mignion followed by souffle and washed down with josef perrier champagne!mmm i can taste it all now,the views are spectacular and the service 2nd to non.Definatley worth the bucks.We hope to return one day.Well worth pushing the boat out for!
